Had a wonderful lunch here on Anniversary trip!  Decent prices and we split some small plates.  Classy atmosphere but appropriate for kids and families or post-work drink.

This place makes me happy.
I'm always impressed with the food quality and social atmosphere.

Just AMAZING! You have to try the famous Alligator bites. Also, have the rabbit bites. It's a unique taste but delicious. The sides we ordered were outstanding, we had the Mac and cheese along with the double baked potato. Stop by and try it so worth! It was such a nice place that I would have thought bread would have been complimentary.

Everything was delicious and service was exceptional. A must try in NOLA. We had the following and enjoyed all:

-Brisket & Grits (great portion, soft, smokey and had a great bark)
-Fried Alligator (best I ever had & I've grown up in the south with alligator being easily accessible)
-Pork Ribs (soft fall off the bone)
-Rabbit Stew & Dumplings (NOT GAMEY, creamy and flavorful with soft pillows of dumplings.)
-Mac n cheese (garlic-y, cheesey, warm heaven)

Very good Cajun food. Great and pretty fast service. I got the catfish. It was a little too spicy for me but I guess that's cajun. Just wish they served more rice to help with the spice. Overall the food was very good.
I really liked this place, too. But since Yelp is being a weenie about what and how much you write, I'm just going to write whatever.

Really great food! 

We started with the fried alligator, which was covered in mint and a spicy mayo kind of sauce. And also the ribs with pickled watermelon, and the crawfish pastry. 

We ordered two sides of mac and cheese it is very creamy and smoky and and also the smothered greens, these have pork so i didn't eat them. I had the gulf fish, it was excellent! Definitely much lighter compared to everything else. Finally the fried poster and bacon sandwhich. It was huge! My friends split it and could barely finish. 

We also had a bottle of the rosé which is the price of a glass times 5 (it's not written on the menu)

I'm just taking a star off because of the wait. Great service, but it seemed scattered and people walking on the street drunk were trying to sit at the table that was being readied for us. Also our busboy was really chatty (in a funny way) but totally unprofessional.

Had an Awesome Birthday Dinner 7/2 At Cochon! First time here and it is a cool place to hang and eat! Where do I begin?! The Grilled Oysters are AMAZING!!!! The Catfish Courtbullion was so Good felt like a good home cooked meal, I also enjoyed the dressing! I read other reviews about the alligator, felt it was tough, but seasoned very well! I highly recommend everyone eat here! We will definitely be back soon!

Being born and raised in New Orleans, I am shameful of saying that this year was the first time I ever ate at Cochon, and I wished I would have eaten here sooner. This food here is simply amazing. Flavorful and welled seasoned, perfectly cooked and very nicely presented are just some of the few things I can say about the food at this place. 

My party started off with an order of fried liver for our appetizer. While the portion is extremely small, 3 pieces of liver on 3 pieces of bread, it was extremely delicious. The liver itself was extremely crispy, and the addition of jelly really added some flavor to it. For entree, we had the Louisiana Cochon, braised pork cheeks, and smoked pork ribs. The Louisiana Cochon was so soft and so juicy that it just melted in your mouth, and the chicharron gave the dish a little crunchiness to it. The braised pork cheeks, surprisingly, was not as soft as the Louisiana cochon, and the portion was quite small for an entree. However, the eggplant was delicious as it was grilled and flavorful. The smoked pork ribs was my favorite entree as it was the most flavorful dish we had. Very well marinated, good portion of meat, and spicy yet sweet. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place for any out-of-town visitors out there. Great atmosphere, great food, and reasonable pricing. A must check-out place for this city.

The food here is off the charts!!! The best crawfish pie I've ever had along with fried alligator and mac n cheese casserole (yes they're appetizers but made a great meal). 
Love the setting of the restaurant and the staff are all great and very helpful in recommending something you've never had. This meal made my whole trip to New Orleans.

Dropped in for the evening while in town for work. Downtown NO a part of town I've never been so I was excited about trying something different. This place had great ambiance and attentive hosts. The wait service were a bit slow and I felt forgot about a few times but I was being entertained by the chef as they prepared food. They have Chef side seating (not the most comfortable place to sit) that really makes you hungry! Great food and very interesting menu. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is in town and would like to try a place with class and a hometown/eccentric menu. I will be back!
Impeccable service. Each bite is full of flavor. Tried allegator, boudin, gumbo, short ribs, max cheese casserole, fried liver. Great Red smoker in the back.

This place is definitely worth the hype. I took off a star for service. Our waitresses were inattentive and took so long for simple requests such as rolls and sauce. We were drawn by the number of Yelp reviews.

We ordered the smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle, fried boudin with pickled peppers, pork cheeks with grilled squash and english peas, boucherie plate, and the oyster and bacon sandwich. The smoked ribs were lathered with spicy and smokey barbecue sauce and they were tender. The fried boudin balls were smaller than expected but they were so flavorful. The pork cheeks were absolutely divine! There was a pea purée in addition to the grilled squash and English peas and it was silky smooth. The whole plate was delicious. The boucherie plate had some kind of overly spicy mustard; the meats and headcheese tasted very homemade and paired well. The oysters on the oyster and bacon sandwich were fried to perfection. We're not normally huge fans of oysters but we're fans of these! Yummmmm! This was a great way to end our time here in NOLA.

Amazing! The cocktails are great, and the food is even better. I started with the word-fired oysters. They were large in size and tasted like buffalo oysters- delicious. I also had the fried boudin, which I was told is a New Orleans classic. It did not disappoint. It looks like a hush puppy, but on the inside has tender and delicious pork. The smoked pork ribs fell right off the bone, and were tender and juicy. They provided hot hand towels if you needed them. The last small dish I had was a crawfish soufflé of some sort.. I cannot recall its exact name, but it was wonderful. 

Katie was an amazing server, and all of the staff there are welcoming, knowledgable, and friendly. I cannot wait to go back and try everything!

Delicious cocktails.
Best Mac n Cheese I've ever had. 
Charcuterie plate was heavenly.

Try the rabbit and dumplings, anything with oysters, boudin, and anything with pig meat!

Service was attentive and friendly, even in the middle of the dinner craziness.
The whole restaurant has a comfortable, confident vibe. 

Must for foodies or anyone eating their way through NOLA!

Came with a large group of friends and everybody loved their meals. Their cocktails were amazing and very reasonably priced! I split the Mac and cheese, boudin, and ham hock with a friend. We loved the mac and cheese and the ham hock but we weren't too crazy about the boudin.

Tapas style food in a trendy, upscale restaurant.  The food was savory and delicious.  However, the POOR SERVICE definitely left a sour impression.  

Walked in for a table of two and was seated rather immediately in the side room.  Our waitress appeared nice in the beginning when asking us what we wanted to order.  After placing our order, we really never saw her again (that is, until it was time for us to pay).  

While this was happening, we saw our waitress hanging out at the bar, no intention of helping us navigate through the menu or checking in on us throughout the meal.  When she did have the time, she would walk by us and tend to neighboring larger tables.   

A place with great food should be complemented with a staff of equal measure. This is not the case.  

Word of advice, take the food to go (if you can) and don't forget to order the chargrilled oysters/fried alligator!  And if service isn't that important to your experience, then feel free to dine in.  Since service is pretty important to us, we probably won't be coming back unless it improves significantly.

I had the Louisiana Cochon -- LOVED it. The meat was perfectly cooked, and the flavors and textures of the fruit, cabbage and cracklins worked so well together. They had great cocktail options, and we really enjoyed our deserts, as well. I had the pineapple upside down cake. They gave it a unique take, and I really loved it. I definitely recommend this restaurant!

Really great food. Boyfriend and I got the: alligator, Louisiana cochon, mac & cheese, smothered greens. Could have done without the last bit - covered in pork. Not healthy if that is what you were looking for. Otherwise, great staff, great ambiance and all around great night out.
I really loved it here ! Atmosphere was great ! Food delicious defiantly a place for couples looking to get away ! I loved it !!

My girlfriend and I took a trip to New Orleans and decided to save this restaurant for Saturday night. It was tip top from the time we entered the restaurant. I strongly advise calling ahead or making a reservation on Opentable first. It was basically full but we were seated promptly. 

We started with the fried alligator and pork cheeks for starters. I thought the pork was the winner but the fried alligator was ALSO amazing! The GF had the roasted duck as her entree and me, the rabbit w/dumplings. The dumplings were simply delicious!! I tasted the roasted chicken but the winner was the rabbit here. 

Good selection of local beer and the decor is hip and fresh. I would definitely recommend this place if you're on a couple's trip. In my opinion, it was one of the top 3 restaurants we visited on our list of must eats.

I was seated at the chef's bar which is literally right in front of where they do all the cooking. It was kind of a neat place to be because you could see all the food as they prepared it. The woodfired Grill was constantly going with charbroiled oysters and the like.

I had the rabbit dumplings which was actually better than I expected. For dessert I had the blueberry pie pan with ice cream which is also excellent. At first, it appeared that the portions were small. However, I was full in the end. Next time I will definitely have the oysters the ribs and the mac & cheese all of which looked absolutely phenomenal coming off the grill.

First time coming here. It was the high ratings and the fact that it was in close proximity to the WWII Museum that brought me here. No one was there once I sat down (mid-afternoon).

FOOD:
-Ordered Bacon & oyster sandwich. Great suggestion by the waiter. Messy to eat but tasted great. The oysters were chewy and tough by itself.
-The Homemade lemonade has white sugar syrup. Did not order it because of that.
-I was told that the food is locally sourced

SERVICE:
-Everyone smiles and everyone was polite
-Sat at the bar so my phone can be charged. Glad they allowed me to charge my dying phone.

Clean restrooms
Interesting menu for those who like to challenge their pallet, but I'm a simple foodie who just wanted chicken.

My cousin and I basically created a tapas dinner and I'll describe everything.  Service was great from greeting to exit.  Food:

Fried alligator. Great flavor but nothing special  better than other alligator I've eaten but nothing distinct about the meat.  More of a tourist gimmick.  
Pork cheeks. Awesome dish and prepared with peas.  I don't like peas but WOW.  So good.  
Boudin.  Best boudin I've ever eaten.  Not your traditional boudin.  More like an Italian rice ball with sausage but it is amazing.  
Rabbit and dumplings.  Very good. Very much French inspired so you must like French spices. Black pepper, thyme, fresh oregano.  So good.  
Mac and cheese.   Good but nothing special.  
Collard greens.  Best I've ever eaten.   It's a MUST to order.   So flavorful
Blueberry pie.  One if best desserts ever.  Not too sweet and the star was the blueberries.  Fresh and not too sweet. The entire pie was basically blueberries with the ice cream being the sweet component.  

This place remains my favorite restaurant.

Came here hungry on a Friday night and did not have reservations. There was an immediate opening on an outdoor table. This place was also recommended by more than one friend. We ordered the Boudin balls and fried alligator for appetizers. The boudin balls were average but the alligator was DELICIOUS! My husband got the rabbit and dumplings and I got the catfish. The catfish was not great but the rabbit dish was flavorful and unique! He ordered a side of macaroni and cheese and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD.  Overall this restaurant is great for foodies and those willing to be adventurous with food!

The food itself was superb. The fried Aligator was exceptional and the dessert of blueberry pie was insanely delicious. The waitress that served me was also lovely and very considerate to my indecisiveness. My absolute favourite thing was sitting by the kitchen at the bar, watching the madness (& magic) happen. 

However the only thing that let the place down was the other clientele and the decor but heyho, its about the food, right?

Overall, a big thumbs up! I would likely revisit and would recommend anyone visiting the Garden District to pop by here if you want some delicious (but expensive) food.
Great place to have fried alligator. Tried so many other, enjoyed this one! Had the smoked pork ribs and rabbit stew! Everything was so good. The service was amazing as well! Definitely worth the go!

Overated...they like a lot of salt in everything several times.

Upstairs is great for special events..did have an decent meal there.

Great service.   Our waitress took the time to answer questions and explain the menu.

I had the fried aligator and Mac n cheese.    Food was excellent.    Prices are a little higher than I'm used to, but everything is expensive in New Orleans it seems.

Everybody loved their food, but perhaps the pork ribs.

Really cool atmosphere, would recommend anyone yet this place.
expensive with small portions.  beers very expensive.  it was good, but won't return.

Loved going here on my 28th birthday back in 2013. The food was so delicious. I remember starting off with their smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle small plate! The flavors all worked very well on this. For an entree, I selected the braised beef shoulder with roasted spring onions, tomato & sweet corn. I also got a side of smothered green. This was such a great meal and a good way to celebrate my 28th birthday !

My husband and I were in New Orleans for a week to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary.  We asked friends and family for suggestions on where to go, eat and things to do. Cochon was provided as a must place to eat by a few people. We had a hard time deciding if we wanted to go to the restaurant or the butcher. We finally decided on the restaurant. First thing I noticed was that it was absolutely freezing inside. I understand the need for AC in a place like New Orleans but I was shivering. The shivering either stopped or I was so distracted when the food arrived. We decided to go the small plate route in order to try multiple things.  All items were delicious.  We were most excited to try the pork cheeks, and were very surprised when that quickly became our least favorite plate. Not because it was bad, but because the lobster rice, ribs and Mac n Cheese were OUT OF THIS WORLD. Im not kidding, this mac n cheese could win a world wide contest! If we were to order again right now I think we would order two orders of the ribs and a side of the mac n cheese. Im happy and pleased we chose to eat here but we are still curous about the butcher and think we would have like it equally if not even more.

simply stated, Cochon exceeded my expectations! The meal was delicious, we had the fried alligator appetizer and the ham hock and Cochon with a side of mac and cheese for our entrees. All were fantastic, and so flavorful, which earned them 4 stars, but the 5th star came from the service which was impeccable. I wish I could remember out waitresses name, because she went above and beyond to make us happy diners. She was not only attentive, but noticed that we were struggling to enjoy our meal with our two kids (2 years old & 4 months old) climbing all over us and stepped in to hold the baby so that we could have two free hands to dig into that delicious ham hock. *bonus: we also saw celeb chef Curtis Stone dining there as well!!* We'll definitely return!

I'm giving 5 stars.  But not for the alligator tail.  That was perfectly cooked, but the batter was too salty for my taste. Come  for the wood fired oysters, the pork cheeks with mint and peas; and the Mac and cheese--they have figured out how to make it creamy but not floury.

I know--pork cheeks with peas?  Trust me; even the picky eaters will love it and feel adventurous. 

Make reservations or go early, it gets busy.

Don't miss it.
Went here for lunch with a few friends! We basically ordered everything on the menu! And shared it all! The mimosas was very good! The crawfish pie was awesome! And the gumbo was good!

Wow !!!
Holy NOLA ... This Place was recommended by our Hotel Concierge at Hyatt Place and it was PERFECT !! 
We lucked out with no reservations but I WOULD RECOMMEND A RSVP !!

Excellent food and presentation. Variety of cooking techniques and intricate well thought of combinations. Loved the freshness of the meals and the presence of fresh herbs. One of my favorite meals during my visit. Their bread was delicious. Wife had the gator bites (deliciously and hearty) and I had the short rib with kimchi (amazing) with macaroni and cheese (fresh, delicious without that processed fake cheese taste). Friend had the ribs which were good but our 2 dishes were better. Huge variety of whiskeys. Must visit if in town. Won't disappoint!
Great beer and delicious food. We had meat ball sandwich , pork ribs with watermelon pickles and Lima beans on the side. Food was to die for.

Ok, an update a year later. First, the food: tossed salad was good; cucumber salad was not...greens were delicious; twice baked potato was ok...ham hock was yum; oyster sandwich not so much. So, 3.5 to 4 on food.  The service: awful. One of our waiters was the same from our last two visits (he was pretty bad last year as well). The other was new to us. Both were beyond inattentive. My husband got his entree a full five minutes before we could flag someone down to ask where mine was. Then the order was wrong. No matter, it took another 20 minutes to give up and ask for our check, so we have no comment on dessert!Service - 1.5.  Think we'll find a new place!

Stumbled upon a mention of this place from a review on Yelp, so glad we went and checked it out! Started with the Wood-fire oysters with chili garlic butter. It was amazing!! This was the dish that peaked my interest at Cochon and it didn't disappoint. For the main dish I went for the Rabbit & Dumplings, it was also amazing! Added a side of mac n cheese, and I was in food heaven. Definitely recommend both the oysters and the Rabbit & Dumplings. Now for the dessert, we had a group of people so we got to try 3 different desserts. All three were delicious but my favorite was the Blueberry skillet pie. We also tried the pineapple upside down cake and the chocolate hazelnut pudding. Everything was wonderful!! The food, the service, check it out if you're in the area!

Wow. This place is amazing!! I was visiting here with my family and we cleaned off every plate. The fried alligator, short ribs, fisherman style fish, and everything else was to die for. We ordered the blueberry skillet pie and the hazelnut pudding and it was one of the best desserts I have ever had. On top of everything we ate the service was phenomenal. I wasn't a huge fan of New Orleans but I might just have to come back for this place.

Visited here August 1st at the recommendation from our hotel concierge (The Ritz). Very disappointed.  It is nothing more than a high priced pork place. Yes there are things that are somewhat unique but nothing extraordinary-Alligator bites were delicious. The beef short rib was fatty, the pork patty was dried shredded pork formed into a patty, their signature made in-house bacon was so chewy and tough you could barely chew it.  Maybe because we are from Dallas where it is very foodie, but this place is not worth your time or money.  Visit a tried and true NOLA establishment.
I don't think I'm exaggerating when I say this was one of the best meals of our lives. Beef check, crawfish hand pie and rabbit with dumplings were spectacular.
From the oysters to the rabbit with dumplings, everything was interesting and delicious.

Really good food! Had the pork cheek and alligator. Had friends in from town with several children and the staff was super accommodating!  Everyone was super happy with their selections: gumbo, BBQ ribs, Gispochio, and huge salad. Will definitely go back! The Resturant, as well as, the butcher shop behind it are both great and seem to be very popular!

I came here with a large group for a bachelorette party and had a great time! Thank god I ubered because I had a couple of drinks and would not of been able to drive because the drinks were strong! 

somehow I ordered three things which doesn't seem like much but it was:
pork cheeks with grilled squash, english peas & spring onions $12
macaroni & cheese casserole
chicken & andouille gumbo $8

I decided to try this restaurant when I visited New Orleans in May.  The menu is creative.  The dishes are great. If you like cajun cuisine, you will love this place.  For me, the dishes tend to be a little salty.  However, that is more of cajun flavor.  I'd certainly go back again.

Went for my bday dinner. It was nice and pretty but the food was just okay. It might have been because my party was seated at 9:30 and we were kinda full but I wished I went somewhere else. I did however enjoy  the chili oysters and the loaded double baked potato. The drinks were super strong so if you want something light just stick with wine.

Anthony Bourdain filmed an episode here and recommended it so expectations were quite high.

Service = exceptional. They were laid back and friendly but service level was shockingly attentive. Very nice to be looked after so well.

Menu is unique, interesting and appetizing...which matched the aroma from the kitchen.

Enjoyed a few small plates. The chili spice shrimp was amazing. 

If I lived in NOLA I would come back to this place weekly.

This restaurant was amazing. We had their alligator, broiled oysters, and the 2 lb pork chop special! Everything was PERFECT and had great flavor. The wine was amazing too. The customer service was a great experience!!!

Got the rabbit dumplings and the alligator bites and the side of Mac and cheese. Portions are a fairly modest amount (for big stomachs), but the quality and taste is worth it. One of the best restaurants during my visit to New Orleans. Got a Hopitulas on draft which complimented the meal quite well. The overall atmosphere of the restaurant is quite nice and the servers are more than willing to provide an explanation of the menu. Good service, great food.

This was by far one of the top two best places during my visit. The food was great, the staff were congenial, humorous, helpful, attentive. Really if I was having a crappy afternoon, I'd head here for dinner. I think it would cheer me up. The drinks were varied and strong. My only criticism would be dishes were a bit over sauced, I say this tentatively cause I love sauce in things, on things, under things, I'm actually a sauce-aholic.

I review restaurants very rarely but I wanted to say that this resturaunt  has delicious food and is a great stop after the WWII- musuem.  Everyone who works here is incredibly kind and awesome at their job. They take pride in their menu and make some great recommendations. They have a great whiskey menu and I really loved the fried boudin with pickled peppers. The crunch when you break it open is perfection! I came in as a solo traveler and everyone here made me feel right at home. If I didn't have to return to work I would have stayed longer. Thanks again!

This restaurant was ok. When my brother and I arrived, there were two people ahead of us checking in. Instead of checking them in then moving onto us, the hostesses (3 of them) kept the conversation going with those two guests. We weren't acknowledged at all. After about 5 mins, we were finally acknowledged and seated. Once seated, we placed our orders and out food came out pretty quickly.

We started with the fried alligator and wood fired oysters - both were super yummy. For the entrees, we had the rabbit and dumplings and the Louisiana cochon - both of those dishes were ok. We also ordered a side of Mac and cheese casserole which was extremely delicious. The bill was pretty pricey which I don't think was worth it, but, this place came recommended by my friend so I figured I'd give it a try. 

Needless to say, although my friend really enjoyed her meal here, I don't think I'd come back here for the duration of my stay in NOLA. 3 out of 5 of the dishes we ordered were delicious, so I give it 3 out of 5 stars.

I give a 3 star review for service only on this visit.  Our server forgot to put in our order and we had to ask about our appetizer after several minutes.  The table next to us was seated, order taken and their entree arrived before our server ever recognized our request for help.  

Over all the food was very good though. Loved the Cochon, it was great.

Will need to be to be diligent and ask if your order does not come out prompt.  It appeared the other tables around us were getting fine service.  I may return on my next visit to New Orleans, but then again there are lots of other good places to eat as well.
Food was really good! Everything was a littleeee pricy for my taste, but it was worth every dollar :)

What a warm welcome to New Orleans this restaurant provided. Went with a group of 5 people. The table they seated us at was a larger farm table with plenty of room in the center of their back dining room. The restaurant was very crowded on a Friday night at 9pm. 
The cocktail menu was impressive. 
I liked that the menu offered small plates to try a variety of items. I enjoyed the bowl of white chili with black eyed peas. Very flavorful with a smoked taste. I also had the barbecued oysters which were delicious. Very fun lively atmosphere.

I visited New Orleans for probably the sixth time in my life a few weeks ago during Essence Fest. I've eaten a lot of unforgettable meals in NOLA, but Cochon is hands down in my Top 5! We arrived with a large group of 10. We were quickly seated, our service was impeccable and the food...Lord Jesus, the food! Over a month later I'm STILL dreaming about it. We ordered pretty much everything on the menu and shared it all family style. EVERYthing was amazing! If you don't eat anywhere else New Orleans, please do yourself a favor and eat here!
The signature Cochon and oysters with a Dang Butterscotch root beer at the chef's counter made up for the fact that they didn't acknowledge/apologize for me being burned by a flying coal.

Took a SCARY taxi cab ride from the French Quarter just to try this place and it was sooo worth it! The stand outs were the Grilled Oysters, Crab Fried Rice and Fried Chicken Livers. They were absolutely, melt in your mouth, I don't care if I get fat, DELICIOUS.

The only disappointment was the BBQ Ribs. Dry and too smoky for my taste. I could barely finish one rib and had to doggy bag the rest. Service was on point and the ambiance had that Young Professionals with a sprinkling of a few Hipsters vibe. 

Best restaurant experience during our Nola trip. I just wish this place existed in NYC!

Beautiful, trendy ambiance. I loved being able to see into the kitchen. Ordered the gumbo and wedge salad, both of which were flavorful and delicious. Friends ordered the beef brisket, which was incredibly tender and savory.

P and I came here and we were like super excited to compare here to their sister restaurant around the corner.

I  can't remember what P and I got for drinks, but I definitely know it was tequila based, so I am assuming it was the lamplighter: mezcal joven, amaro, lime, rosemary, peach. I remember my drink had rosemary in it and it was just overwhelming my entire drink. I couldn't taste anything else, but the herb.

We shared the following items:
fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise - okay, can we say disgusting. Why can't they put the mayo on the side as a dip? Rather than covering the entire thing in this crazy mess? One thing if it was good and light, but it is so damn heavy and you smothering the entire plate with it. The fried alligator was too fried too. 

crawfish pie - did not like this at all, the flavours were not complementary at all.

louisiana blue crab rice with chili flake & cilantro - the only thing that left me not completely starving. This was the only dish that I liked and could eat without forcing down my throat.

smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle - P got this and I tasted it and I thought it was too sweet and P and I both noticed they were inconsistent. Two of them were dry and only one came off of the bone more easily than the others.

fried boudin with pickled peppers - this place makes me question if I ever liked boudin

Also, they need to clean the restaurant a bit better, our salt and pepper shaker were disgusting sticky and with a lot of sauce stains. (Will try to upload a picture.)

Whomp whomp whomp - don't get this hype around this place. The sister store is better and has better drinks.

Maybe it's what we ordered, but the food was a bit disappointing. It's also a bit far to get here if you are staying near the French Quarters. 

wood-fired oysters with chili garlic butter-this is what they are known for and hands down 5 stars. This was super delicious. I could have eaten 10 more orders of just this. 

louisiana blue crab rice with chili flake & cilantro-this was interesting, but in a good way. Not a lot of crab, but I liked the flavors together. 

chicken & andouille gumbo-have to try gumbo when in NOLA and it was only ok. Not sure how it is really suppose to be, but the spices were too strong for our liking

catfish courtbouillon-not bad, but very fishy. I guess that's how catfish is? It wasn't a great fish taste. 
 
cucumbers & herbs in vinegar-refreshing
 
creamy grits-this was good.

I took a large group of 16 to dinner and surprised them with an extra 5. They were ver accommodating. We had drinks pretty fast and server was friendly. Apps were fried alligator (little tough) but good flavor and oysters. One had the red fish and it looked great and he said it was as good. I had two small plates. Ribs (overlooked and sauced) but tasty and the crab rice. For $14 the rice did not have much crab. One diner received his dish as the rest were finishing with no apology. It was good but I think could have been better.

I've been to NOLA many times but I've only really started to branch out and explore the food scene this past year. I went to Cochon on a recommendation from a friend. When we finally made our way to the establishment I was first impressed by the staff and the atmosphere. It was much more chill than I thought it would be. The hostess was tastefully dressed and the wait staff was friendly and attentive. I especially liked observing the wait staff helping each other when food came up or drinks needed to be filled. After examining the menu we opted to order a few different things so we could experience all the different tastes. Via the dessert menu we ordered the fried alligator with a chili garlic mayonnaise sauce, the boucherie plate and a side of macaroni & cheese. While waiting for our food to come we ordered a couple of drinks that were absolutely delightful. When our food did arrive, I was very impressed with the attentiveness of the staff. They took the time to explain what our boucherie plate was composed of as well as to see if everything was to our liking. This meal is and maybe will always be in my top ten tastes. The mac and cheese was creamy with a nice crust, the alligator was wonderfully accented by the tasty garlic sauce and the boucherie plate (made up of pickled squash and carrots, head cheese, pate and other tasty things) was a great tasting experience. Between the two of us we weren't able to completely finish the meal and ended with a check $60 (each paid $30). Considering that we were pleasantly stuffed and enjoyed drinks, this place is a value that you don't want to pass up.

Great place great food this may be the only place i trust to eat alligator.  Spacious but can be cozy in the back or upstairs. Reservations suggested because it gets really crowded.. everybody wants to come here! We did not have a reservation because it was kind of last minute but luckily the wait was only about 45 min. The pple after us had a longer wait but hostesses give a good estimate of wait time.  u can also just hang in the bar area Everyone we encountered was really nice & waiters helpful. If in NOLA again I'll return

This place was recommended to us by a Louisville, KY transplant from New Orleans. Boy, were we blown away. We sat at the bar by the kitchen and enjoyed seeing the craft and skill of the kitchen crew. The food was delicious. Wait times may be long but it was worth it. Grab a bloody mary or mimosa and wait for your name to be called. This place does not disappoint.

Out of all the places we tried in New Orleans, Cochon is the restaurant that made me wish I lived in the area just so I can try everything on the menu. 

My boyfriend and I ate here two days in a row because we couldn't get enough of their Wood-Fire Oysters ($14) and Louisiana Blue Crab Rice ($14)! I actually prefer their oysters (doused with chili garlic butter) over the chargrilled oysters that most of the restaurants here offer. We ordered the Fried Livers and the catfish as well which I'd also recommend. 
 
We're definitely going back to NOLA for Cochon.

Overall, I was disappointed with our meal and experience. My son and I had a late lunch (2:00) and he wanted a "good sandwich." When we arrived, the restaurant still had a busy lunch crowd, but it was not packed. The space is very appealing to the eyes...nice lines and noise is minimal. We stated with fried boudin; very cold, but palming in comparison to those at Billy's Boudin in Scott. My son's oyster and bacon sandwich was excellent. I had the special (braised pork cheeks on ciabatta). The pork lack flavor; was minimally dressed; and the bread weighed a pound. The fried egg topping was great and the quinoa salad side was superb. Service was marginal.

Fried alligator: 6/5 - so good I got it twice 
Mac n cheese: 2/5
Rabbit & dumplings: 4/5 (not a fan of the dumplings but the actual stew was amazing)

Service: 5/5
Experience: 5/5

Never again! Waited 2 hours for a table. Finally got seated and ordered the fried alligator appetizer, fried boudin balls with a side of Mac n cheese(because my server said they were 'amazing') and the short ribs. The food took another hour to come out. The alligator wasn't anything special, tasted just like the Dynamite shrimp from PF Changs. Boudin balls were awful, dry and pasty....gross! Ate one and left the rest. Short ribs were ok, the grits it came with had no flavor. The Mac me cheese never came....when I told the server to cancel it he said don't worry cause he had already comped us for it since it was taking so long. Well...even 20 min later I still never got my 'free' Mac n cheese...a frikin side dish! I will never recommend this place to anyone! Only giving it 1 star since our server was very apologetic....not his fault the kitchen sucks!

So much yes. Cochon is huge. There are two large dining rooms and an upstairs. First off, they have a large cocktail, liquor, and wine selection. I went with the four roses bourbon on the rocks. 

For appetizers we got the fire roasted oysters and the smoked pork ribs. The oysters were spicy and we made little sandwiches with the buttered rolls. They were great. The oysters were big and fresh. 
The ribs were the highlight of the trip. They were smoky and sweet with a spicy pineapple slaw. The sauce was thick and flavorful. Get them.

I got the oyster and bacon sandwich. It was huge and I couldn't finish it. The Texas toast was good and the bacon was thick and good. The oysters were overflowing from the bread. 

My girlfriend got the rabbits and dumplings and loved it. It was really rich and the dumplings were great.

Her dad got the short ribs and said he really enjoyed them.

I'll be back, I liked everything I put in my mouth.

So so so so so good! We were looking for a place that had gumbo and Mac and cheese and here it is! First off we had the charred oysters and let me tell you the sauce it's in is to die for! Next we had the crab and okra gumbo and it was again delicious another great choice. We got the Mac and cheese and smothered greens next and again no words for how good they were! Lastly I had the pork sandwich which was a special it was so good and the okra salad that came with it another excellent addition. Our server I believe his name was Terin was the best server I've had in the state of Louisiana (traveling for New York) his descriptions of all the food were extraordinary he knows his stuff I'd def come back here I recommend  this to anyone in the area. I hope everyone gets our server. Stuffed isn't even the word and the pricing is great as well. 5 stars!

I have been to the CBD many times without checking out couchon, and once I did I felt stupid for not giving it a chance before. I normally regular at Woods for a cute nightcap and some dessert, but it was dead the other night so I took some friends across the street to Couchon, where there were more patrons. It was quite pleasant, we started off with a recommended drink, from our waiter, Terry. I had the lavender kisses cocktail, which has an odd name but was delicious. It was quite citrusy with a lavender aroma, and for my accompaniment food I ordered the ribs which were spicy, tender and full on the bone. I was a big fan of all of it. After trying a new drink, I decided to fall back on a favorite, White Russian, and order some dessert to go with my milky drink. The blueberry skillet pie, combined with the WR was to die for, the pairing was perfect. Service, food and drink were great. Bathrooms were a little unclean but the overall atmosphere makes up for such a trivial thing

We had a 9pm reservation, but showed up at 8:30 and they were able to accommodate us.  We ordered wood fired oysters, catfish courtbouillon, rabbit & dumplings, chocolate ice cream, 2 glasses of wine. Total bill came to $100 plus tip.

The wood fired oysters were worth ordering and had to be my favorite between all the dishes.  The catfish was too sour for my taste.

Our only issue was, it took about 15 minutes to take our order.
The bacon and oysters app was good but the oysters were on the small side.  I got the oyster and bacon sandwich, a good flavor dish, fried oyster with thick bacon, tomato and lettuce.

It was definitely an experience. We had some very good friends bring us here so we could try something new. The place was packed with people all seeming to be having a good time. 
The menu I felt was very small and did not have a whole lot for kids. I was not overly impressed with the food. But I admit that perhaps some of the other entrées were better than the ones we had. Maybe next time we will select something else. 
I was definitely not a fan of the pig cheek.
It almost felt a little cannibal like.

Waitress never came back to the table and then refused to split the check. Three single females. Why is it hard to have 3 bills. Other restaurants do it no problem. Waitress had an attitude when my friend asked SO politely if it could be split up. I'd put one star, but the mac and cheese was great.

First meal in NOLA! It was pretty good. Seated quickly and food came out fast. The bread is awesome!! My family and I decided to share everything. We got the fried alligator which was very interesting. It really did taste like chicken. The crab rice was so good. One of my favorites. Smothered greens were good but I've had better. The ribs were very tender and had awesome flavor. The crab and okra gumbo was pretty good too. Very rich. Finally, the oyster and bacon pie was my absolute favorite - so much flavor! A must try. All in all a great meal.

Do not overlook the oysters! My wife and I are from Washington state so we aren't used to all this southern hospitality. Great service, cozy atmosphere you can smell the wood smokin! Very pleased we made the stop! 

The sandwich next door called Cochon butcher is defiantly an amazing place for lunch!

NOTE: This is not in regards to the Butcher shop down the street, that place is good (same owners too). 

Have to give this restaurant 2 stars for the following  reasons: 

The pork cheek appetizer was a little dry and comes in a sauce similar to chili. 

The Rabbit and Dumplings was more like a rabbit pot pie that comes in a Cracker Barrel style seasoned pan like I was on a wagon on the Oregon Trail. Taste was alright but wasn't impressed with the dumplings. 

Overall, I don't mind dropping $100-$125 for a nice meal for 2 but it needs to be nice. This place didn't cut the fat (pun intended). 

Service was slow, menu has very limited options, and we were sat 15 minutes after our reservation time despite empty tables. I understand 5-10 mins but 15 just goes to show the overall quality of management of the establishment.

By far the best meal I had in NOLA, and a must do for NYC food snobs looking to take a break from gutbusting tourist fare. The spicy crab rice and the ribs were amazing and saving room for dessert is essential. Beer selection and service were great, too.

I really enjoyed my first time here.  We ordered 4 or 5 things from the tapas style small bites menu.

Wood fired oysters and boudin balls were the two I ordered.  Boudin balls were very good.

This place has an excellent bourbon selections.  Hundreds of choices.  I loved it.

I will be back when in New Orleans.  Next time I will have dinner.

This place was just ok for us.  The prices were a little high and the menu a bit too limited for us.  We ordered the wood fired oysters, the ribs, a brat sandwich and the chocolate hazelnut pudding for dessert.  

The bread was amazing, so fresh and warm with delicious butter.   I am not the most adventurous eater, but wanted to try the oysters.  They were good, but since I was the only one eating them, there were too many (not a problem if you have a group of oyster lovers!).  The ribs were good, but not noteworthy (maybe because I am used to Texas BBQ). The Brat was good.  Dessert was delicious.

This was out of our way but worth the trip. Every meal I saw looked so good it was hard to pick. My wife had the ribs with mac and cheese and my catfish with a wonderfully flavorful rice toppling it went well with my smothered greens with a butterscotch root beer. Finished it out with a chocolate pudding. Don't miss Scrap House a couple of blocks towards the river.

Despite having to wait a long time for a table this restaurant was worth the wait.  It smelled like pork which made us even hungrier.  It was the most memorable meal I had during my trip to New Orleans.  I went with a local who was thrilled to be there.  

Our table had macaroni and cheese and stuffing with eggplant and shrimp.  They were great.  I had short ribs.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.  Next time I will have desert and reservations.

Very busy and trendy spot with a very high noise level.  Difficult to hear each other let alone the waiter.

Food sounds creative but failed to deliver.  We decided to order small plates , appetizers and a salad to share.  Portions were generous and what we ordered certainly sufficed as entrees.

We ordered wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter,mushroom salad,  fried shrimp in a sweet chili sauce, braised pork cheeks and black eyed pea gumbo.

The 5 oysters were good.  Plump and fresh.  The sauce reminded us of buffalo wings.  We used the yummy dinner rolls to sop it up.

The  mushroom salad in a lemon vinaigrette was very nice.  A bit too much mint leaves though.  The 4 pork cheeks were fall apart tender, but other than that nothing exceptional.  The fried shrimp were nothing spectacular either, they were on a bed of sauce that was tasty but really didn't seem a good match to the dish.  The black eyed pea gumbo was the most disappointing since it was so salty it was inedible.  

Waiter was kind enough to remove the gumbo from our check.

The wine selection is extensive and the mixed drink and beer selections are as well.

Bill wth 1 glass of wine and a cocktail (rum with pickled pineapple?) was $75 before tip.
Fantastic!  I strongly recommend the fried oyster & bacon sandwich.  Bring an appetite; the portions are HUGE!

We were told by two trusted folks to "just get the appetizers" - and we did. It was incredible. The mushroom salad with fried beef jerky was very interesting - the mushrooms were razor thin and required an insane amount of preparation. The fried chicken livers with pepper jelly and herbs on croquettes were just perfect, but this is a classic snack. The "boucherie" cured pork that included pickled green tomatoes, head cheese, and a pork and fig terrine was so much it was hard to finish. The piece de resistance though was the braised pork cheeks country captain with raisins and almonds - completely blew my mind. It was perfect.

Schooling the Old School.
After 4 days in NOLA on a food and hooch excursion, we made it to Cochon. Highly recommended by a local friend, they did not disappoint.
Fried Alligator bites, surprisingly tender and not chewy with just the perfect kick from the sauce...and not drowned in it like (insert most any old style NOLA restaurant here).
Pork cheeks that offer a lesson in proper braising and slow cooking. The most tender, fork split deliciousness! Again sauced too ideal.
Rabbit and Dumplings. A cassoulet/stew-ish dish that was beautifully prepared leaving the dumplings half immersed to absorb the luscious sauce and half exposed to the broiler to crisp their tender tops. Spot on.
Twice baked Spud that was fluffy inside and cheese browned on top.
The service is comfortable and casual as befits the very attractive warehouse type space. Fairly priced and efficiently delivered.
These newcomers like Cochon and Peche are teaching the old NOLA standards that there are delicious, innovative ways to prepare Cajon/Creole. The old guards are losing step with their drowning star ingredient in 70-80's style, over salted unattractive sauces.
Game on!
Amazing food. Everything we tried, including their bread and butter, were simply delicious and well portioned. In fact, the portions are pretty generous so don't over-order like we did :-)

Amazing from start to finish. We each had cocktails, appetizers, a main and split dessert. The staff was very friendly and spent a good amount of time with us walking us through the menu. I started with the oysters (perfect!) followed by the short ribs and the blueberry skillet. Loved it all and highly recommend

This is a little biased of me. If a place serves good alligator, it's hard to give them less than 4 stars. But everything here was solid and the service was great and they really know how to speak with you in a casual way. Maybe people like servers that make them feel like royalty, I prefer feeling like I'm speaking to a friend and both servers did just that. I didn't get a chance to try their flights of local whiskey but maybe next time.

It's very trendy to be a pig-obsessed eatery these days, it seems. Add Cochon to the list! Our food was yummy, but not mind-blowing. The menu appears to change often and seasonally, and their drinks menu is pinot noir- and whiskey-centric (as it probably should be given its dishes).

I ordered the fried alligator bites, which are tossed in a spicy sauce akin to buffalo wings. The sauce was creamy and tasted great, but at one point about halfway through the dish, I wished there were fewer of them.  They were just incredibly heavy and I regretted the amount of stomach real estate they were taking up. The husband ordered the fried livers, which were probably the best dish of the night. Please allow me to steer you towards that dish!

The husband also got the cochon dish. He thought it was great, but unfortunately, his memory of it pales after our subsequent meal at Toups' Meatery. I also ordered the smothered greens (so so good) and the cucumber salad (SIX DOLLARS? What was I thinking?). 

This is definitely a solid dining choice while in New Orleans, but if you are limited to only a few couple stops while there, some other places may be more worth your time, like Toups Meatery.

Numerous stops and dishes for several years. Consistently excellent.. Menu changes frequently but have never been disappointed with anything from the restaurant or the  butcher shop.  Travel the country and constantly try new restaurants and this has long been one of my favorites.

This place is indeed popular, but the space is HUGE, so there's plenty of room for groups. Oyster happy hour was dawning on us soon, so we just had a few items to share between the four of us:

fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise: Too much mayonnaise - could have been more crispy
louisiana blue crab rice with chili flake & cilantro: everyone's faves
macaroni & cheese casserole: can't really go wrong with baked mac n' cheese
smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle: bbq sauce was SO overwhelming on the ribs
chicken & andouille gumbo: not bad, not great. I wouldn't order it again.

Overall I think the place is overrated - but I also heard that I missed out on the Grits.

How two people should tackle a menu where everything looks so appealing: order two or three small plates, another from the daily special list and split an entry. Spread around the wealth of flavors as much as you can because it all tastes as good as it sounds.  Had rabbit and dumplings, wood fired oyster with chili, pork cheek with crushed herb and radish, wood oven roasted eggplant and yogurt and a side of grits.

Visiting from NY and had one goal in mind for our NOLA trip, FOOD, FOOD, and more FOOD! The food here is soooooooooooo good, but pales in comparison to the service. 

Our waiter Chris was awesome. Recommending great options, being there consistently, and even snapping a pic of me and my girl for our vacation. 

Next time in NOLA definitely coming back!
Avoid this dump. I'm sitting here waiting for a drink I ordered 45 minutes ago. Also, they were out of the special at 7pm on a Friday. Take it off the special menu if you're out of it.

I probably only have a handful of restaurants in my life that I give a 10 out of 10 to and this was one. The gulf fish was excellent and the mac and cheese was sinfully amazing. Also this restaurant turned my husband into a fan of collared greens. Will definitely be back!
One of the best experiences I  had in all of New Orleans.  From the oyster appetizers to my rabbit and dumpling stew, the meal was delicious.

Fantastic evening. A colleague and I met at a conference and wanted to find a great place to eat. We loved this place. We did not have reservations but took the risk and showed up anyway. We offered to sit anywhere. We waited like 15 minutes enough  time to order some Tito's at the bar and we were seated at the kitchen seats. AMAZING- Jack and his partner were on fire and keeping up with Michael, Executive Sous Chef. The food- Wood fired oysters, Fried livers, Fried Red Snapper whole amazing and topped it off with pineapple upside down  cake and spice cake. This place is busy and should be. One of my most favorite places left extra tip for kitchen!

If you don't have reservations, don't bother. The food isn't worth more than about a 15 min. wait. With no reservation, we  were first told that it would be an hour but then we were told it would be about 45 mins. We waited over an hour and a half and the best thing that I can say about this place is the bartender Myles was terrific! The customer service at the front was terrible. It was extremely evident that they weren't used to handling large crowds. I was ready to go someplace else except I was in the minority and the restaurant came highly recommended. Once we were seated and our food came I was disappointed. It was very average. I couldn't believe that we had waited so long for average food (shame on us!). The next night we went to Oceana's where again there was a wait. Only you could tell they were used to dealing with large crowds and waiting customers. AND the food there was so much better!

I have mixed feelings about this place. I would probably return based on the food only (maybe at an off hour) - the service definitely left something to be desired.

We had a reservation at 9:30pm. We arrived at 9:35 and they said that our table wasn't ready yet, and we could wait at a bar. There were at least two or three small tables that were vacant but needed to be bused. We sat at the bar and looked at the menu. Twenty minutes went by (now 25 minutes after our reservation time, and remember there were vacant tables when we walked in), and we had not been called to sit down at our table. It was not very busy, and the hostess didn't even check on us and let us know that they were still working on our table. Eventually we just decided to eat at the bar.

The bartender was friendly but a little inattentive. We ordered the wood fired oysters, the alligator, and the smoked ribs. Once we ordered, the food came very quickly (probably the best/only particularly good thing about Cochon's service on this particular night.)

The oysters, as other reviewers have said were HUGE and delicious! They were the fattest oysters I've ever seen - however one of our five oysters was very small. I'm not sure if they did this because ours were extra large (I'm not sure they were, because other reviews have mentioned how huge the oysters are), but we felt a bit cheated that one of our five oysters was tiny. The sauce was so good, we wanted to soak it all up and not let any go to waste! Other reviews mentioned how good the bread is, so we were a little disappointed that we were not given any bread and had to order it. However when we did get the bread it was hot and fresh and lived up to expectations.

The alligator was just okay for me, though my fiance liked it.

The ribs were very tasty and a little spicy! They were messy with all the bbq sauce, and perhaps a bit too saucy.

Food: 4/5
Service: 2.5/5

I've never eaten a whole shrimp head without thinking about it, and then savored it like a masterfully executed slice of heaven, and then choose shrimp heads over the shrimp meat when given the choice by my fiancee when we were dividing up the last bits of our appetizer. I didn't have to think about giving the 5 star rating here.

We shared gulf shrimp as an appetizer, and she had the catfish as a main while I took two small plates as my main, the alligator bites and the pork cheeks. We also finished with a pumpkin layer cake. The beer, cocktail, and bourbon selection was spectacular.

Each of the 4 dishes we ordered had that effect of multiple layers of flavors which hit you at different times, each a few seconds after the other. The gulf shrimp came with 3 pieces each of whole shrimp heads and bodies, in a very spicy and fresh tomato-based sauce with kale chips and whole deep-fried slices of lemon which were edible.

Alligator bits were the right texture with a light sprinkling of delicious garlic-chili mayo. This served as a wonderful side dish for our dinner.

The boneless catfish had flavors I couldn't describe, although we figured out there was a heavy helping of mint which contributed to the whole mix of spices. The pork cheeks melted in my mouth the way ice cream does, and the flavor profile had a bit of a north-african vibe to it with sultanas, finely chopped almonds, and lightly pickled zucchini bits.

The pumpkin cake was also delicious, although just a tiny tad dry. That's why bourbon or coffee would go excellent with it. 

As to service, we arrived without a reservation at 8:30 on a Wednesday night and waited 45 minutes in the bar to be seated, as predicted by the hostess. Service was great: attentive, but not overbearing. Good suggestions, but not too salesperson-y.

If I could give this restaurant ZERO stars, I would simply based on this fact they did not want to seat us .... 

I understand that there is 19 of us, but we said they could seat us apart. It's not that there was a lack of tables I counted tables and seats, but they simply didn't want to seat us. 

And it wasn't too late because individuals walked in right after us. 

I don't want to say it's because we are Asians ...but we are. Worst part not even a sincere apology.

First night I went here by mistake as I was actually looking for butcher lol. Second night in Nola I decided to go after seeing the great menu. I had the alligator "nuggets". It came with a tasty sauce drizzled over it and done mint leaves. It was very tasty. Now I never had gator but I will again. 
The wood fired oysters were great also. Touch on the salty Side but hey it's oysters. Lol
The best dish though was the ribs! Well smoked and had some great pickled fruit on top. There was also a very tasty glaze on the ribs with a hint of spice. Great overall dish.

Hailing from Williamsburg, Brooklyn, I felt right at home at Cohcon. This place is definitely hipster but unlike restaurants in Williamsburg, the service here was excellent when I dined here for an early dinner. 

We ordered fried alligator with the sauce on the side, wood fired oysters, braised pork cheeks, and the Louisiana cochon cabbage. Everything was amazing but oh my goodness the pork cheeks were incredible. Soft and tender and all of the flavor combinations in that dish were so yummy. 

I will say it was pricey but well, well worth it.

The food and cocktails were good but they didn't match the price point. 

We started with the livers and they were incredible a real high point of the night. Our cocktails were ok. Nothing special and definitely not worth what they were charging - not complaining against high priced cocktails just that these ones didn't fit that category. 

We had a few other small dishes which were good but not great. 

Unfortunately the low point of the night was the Louisiana Cochon, which we were sold on once the waiter told us "it's what we are named after." Mediocre pulled pork in a ball over some root vegetables. Nothing special.

By far, the best dining experience my wife and I have every enjoyed...period.  We were in town to celebrate my 50th birthday and weren't sure where we wanted to get my b-day dinner.  We looked at the menu online and took a chance.  Best decision we made.  We did not have reservations, but the host staff was pleasant and courteous, and we only had to wait 30 minutes for a table.  Went in on a Wednesday night (9/21) and the place was packed - a great sign.  We were greeted by our server, Colleen, who was very cheerful, helpful, and help recommend some great choices.  We started with drinks and the fried alligator.  The alligator was light and tender, served with a delicious aioli.  This was very impressive, because I am not the type to venture out and try new dishes, growing up in the Midwest.  Colleen recommended the bourbon flight for me, which was great!  She recommended the catfish courtbouillon for my wife, and I had the smoked ham hock.  Both dishes were amazing!  My wife stated it was the best catfish she ever had, and the ham hock was literally "fall-off-the-bone" tender.  It was sooo good!  And, paired with pinto beans and diced apples, by far the best dish I had in New Orleans.  The atmosphere is lively, but still intimate - perfect for couples and friends gathering for a nice evening out.  I cannot say enough about our server, Colleen, who was also patient, provided excellent service and recommendations, as she knew the menu items perfectly.  THANK YOU SO MUCH Cochon!!!
The food and service was amazing. The waiting staff gave excellent recommendations on food and brinks

My hubby and I were in NOLA looking for something different. We happened upon Cochon and decided to give it a try.  I had the gumbo which was served with a deviled egg on top (definitely different).  My husband enjoyed the alligator appetizer and a sandwich.  Overall the setting is trendy and the food wasn't offensive but definitely not on our "must do" list for return visits to town.
I love it, Cochon restaurant and cochon bar it's amazing, finished food then jump to drink, and people helpful a lot, dinner time it's the fun and busy time. Thank you for all best service.

Excellent service. Delicious meaty food. My friend had the rabbit & dumplings, I had the cochon, and we shared the pork cheeks. They were all flavorful with tender meat. The restaurant was over air-conditioned, but that seemed common in many buildings during our visit in late September.
This place has the best ribs! The pickled watermelon on them is amazing. The cocktails were good and the service was excellent.

We had a number of recommendations to go to Cochon, all of them from the same person. Since it was right around the corner from our hotel, we figured it was worth a try. The restaurant smells great and is both lovely and roomy. We were seated immediately and I was given a good recommendation on Bourbon, a Jefferson Reserve with one rock. 

We ordered the fried gator and the blue crab rice to start. The rice was very tasty with a good balance of crab and the seasoning was enhancing rather than flavoring. 
The fried gator was like a wet dream that buffalo popcorn chicken has.  Great flavor and perfectly cooked. 

I ordered the Cochon which is served over cabbage with the fried pork rinds.  Initially I was not impressed until I started getting these perfect bites of pork that melted in my mouth with a bark that added just the right chewy crunchy feel, balanced against the cabbage as well as pickled turnips. The turnips weren't particularly great but everything else was.

My companion had the short ribs. The waiter discouraged the folks next to us from having them which I consider a disservice as it was the best short ribs I have had. Smiley with a perfect bark, legitimately melt in your mouth. If it doesn't melt in your mouth then slow down.  She kept closing her eyes. The accompanying potato salad was modest and just right.  

We had to ignore the desserts for our own safety but they looked great. 

Service was very good. The kitchen is open and they were fun to watch, energetic and clearly a good team. 

Worth getting out of the French Quarter for.

Stopped here specifically for the fried alligator and was pleased. They toss it in this amazing sauce with mint leaves. I'm not a mint fan but it's so faint you barely notice.  I also had two orders of the wood-fired oysters and I highly recommend them. Seasoned perfectly and had quite a few juicy pieces in there. As far as drinks go I tried the local wheat ale which was super light but had just a bit of bite at the end. If you wanna break away from the craziness of the French quarter i recommend this place.  The whole area is calmer, Soon as you walk in you we'll smell the smokey oak smell. Staff was very busy but polite enough.

Delicious! Had a big group of 30 and the staff was so attentive. Best smoked prime rib I've ever had. It was served with celery root mash, unbelievably good. Enjoyed my first taste of alligator as well! Plenty of excellent beverage options.

Superb porchetta! It was a special of the day so I'm not sure how often they have this, but if they have it, make sure to get it! Cooked perfectly and I love the mixture of crunchy skin and meat that melts in your mouth.

The fried alligator was just okay...didn't really captivate my taste buds but maybe I just don't understand it, since that seemed to be one of the most ordered dishes. (We sat by the bar in front of the kitchen so could hear all the orders!)

The fried boudin was probably our second favorite dish! It was a tad spicy so a nice appetizer to get to open up your appetite. 

Grilled oysters were good but not to die for. Probably many other restaurants that have better grilled oysters. 

The upside down pineapple dessert though...oh my...reallyyyyyyyyyy really yummy! Especially if you enjoy pineapples. The cake was moist and the tangy pineapple taste makes the cake not feel too sweet and actually quite refreshing. 

Overall, great experience, I also loved the ambiance. A good place for date night or for groups but make sure you make a reservation if you have a party of 3 or more. Walk ins you'll likely only get bar seating.
Cochon lived up to it's reputation...especially enjoyed the smaller plates such as alligator bites and roasted oysters.  Mushroom salad was out of this world and the cocktails were memorable as well!

Considering that Cochon literally means "pig" in French, I was thrilled to try this place on a visit, especially since it was so convenient from the hotel. We had no reservations on a Friday night around 9, but we walked in and put our names down and then went for a drink elsewhere for a little while. 

The inside is much larger than it looks, with winding paths to other rooms. This looked like a group-friendly place (we were only a party of 4), and it's a great place to come and share a bunch of items off the menu. We had the smoked pork ribs, pork cheeks, mac and cheese, chicken and andouille gumbo, and the beef short rib. (You can get fried gator in a lot of other  more traditional places, so we didn't go for that.) We liked the mac so much that we got one more serving for our table to share. The beef short rib was actually my favorite; it was so flavorful and the grits complimented it very nicely.

Service was great despite the restaurant being busy. I also recall the drink menu having a variety of whiskeys.

The dishes are relatively small, and the tab adds up quickly. However, this is a fun twist on and "fancifying" of Southern and N'awlins food with a trendy interior - definitely a pleasant evening out.
The food is good and the service was great.  I'll be going back during my next visit to the Big Easy.  I may become a fan.

Place is much bigger than it looks from entrance as wraps around.  It has plenty of large tables and ability to combine so great for large groups.  Recommend making reservations as still very popular.  Nice bar area to hang out while waiting if do not.   Disappointed that specials I wanted and first two beers ordered were out.  My third beer was fine as was entree but always going to think beer and entree did not have would be better.  Rabbit dumpling was like a deconstructed pot pie.  Service was good and place surprisingly not too loud considering how crowded. Offer many wines by half carafe.

Excellent Service...meet...Great Food!  That sums up Cochon. Beautiful, industrial space that is actually larger than first appearance. The staff is super friendly and the aromas of smoked meat will make you instantly hungry. 

This was a quick meal for appetizers only. We ordered the Fried Alligator with Chili Garlic Mayo and the Macaroni and Cheese Casserole--soooo good!!! Comfort food at its best. I could have eaten two orders of each by myself, but was trying Not to be Miss Greedy Girl today LOL. We had two servers and they were on point! Thanks so much for a terrific dining experience. Definitely will be back :-). Happy Eating!

Great lunch spot on the corner next to Cochon Butcher. I enjoyed the daily special -  an open-faced sandwich topped with smoked meats, soft-boiled egg and greens, accompanied by fried peas and assorted veggies.  Delicious! My co-workers ordered several small plates, including the oysters,  which got rave reviews. 

Service was good, although the host was rigid about not seating us until our entire party was there. Somewhat understandable,  but with a party of four and three present, we just told her our fourth cancelled - and they of course seated us at a table for four anyway. No impact on my rating though, as the food was wonderful.

This restaurant was on our list for a "Go-to" dinner spot while in town. We were only able to make it here for lunch and we were glad we did. 
We ordered the fried alligator 4.5/5, the blue crab rice 4/5, and the peanut butter chocolate crunch ice cream 5/5.  The alligator had a good sauce but could have had more spice. My husband had the whiskey flight which he also enjoyed.
The main entrees and salads also looked really good. I would love to return here for dinner next time.
Want a taste of local food? This is a nice spot. Tried gator for the first time, and yes it tastes just like chicken. I forgot the sandwich I got but it was something fried on bread, and excellent.

Food was delicious. A little heavy on the salt for side dishes.  Dessert was ok; had the pumpkin gateaux which was too heavy on the cream cheese.   I sat at the chefs table which was interesting to watch, however the heat and smoke from the oven was a little overwhelming.  I couldn't switch due to the restaurant being full.  Would return for a regular table and skip dessert.

Given the plethora of restaurant options nowadays, it's rare for me to go to restaurants multiple times - let alone doing so on vacation. Cochon is so good that I had no qualms visiting 2x during my 4-day trip in NOLA. But honestly, I wouldn't mind if I had Cochon every day on my trip..

The food at Cochon is creative but, most importantly, delicious. Also, there's something home-y and familiar about all the dishes here. 

Came here for both lunch & dinner - menu is the same for both meals.

MUST ORDERS: 
*Wood-fired oysters with chili garlic butter: Everything is amazing with butter and oysters are no exception. I like this better than other chargrilled oysters in town (other restaurants make it almost like oysters rockefeller) 
*Smoke Ham Hock with Pinto Beans, Apples, Sage & Jalapeno Buttermilk: Fall. Off. The. Bone. The smokiness in the ham hock was so beautifully developed. I also appreciated that the pinto beans were very flavorful and complex (vs. typical one-note bean taste)
*Fried Livers with Pepper Jelly & toast: I'm not an innards person but the pepper jelly really helped to balance out the liver. It leans a little on the sweet side from the jelly but I surprisingly liked it. 
*Mushroom Salad with Deep Fried Beef Jerky & Lemon Vinaigrette: Not a leafy green in sight - just a beautiful pile of mushroom. So, if you're a mushroom fan, recommended! 

NICE TO TRY: 
*Fried Alligator with Chili Garlic Mayo: This oddly reminds me of orange chicken - bold, tangy flavor - but with alligator. When I've had alligator in the past, it was really gamey and tough. This really tasted just like chicken! 
*Smoked Pork Ribs: SO flavorful and the heat definitely builds. I prefer my ribs less saucey but it was still a solid dish 
*Cucumbers & Herbs in Vinegar: This is only a nice to try because this is pretty popular in asian cuisine. Cochon does this dish justice though! If you want something light and refreshing, it's fantastic! 

There are no "eh skip it" on my list. You really can't go wrong!
Honestly their sister restaurant, Butcher, is much better. This is more of a sit down place, and the food is good, but it's not Butcher, so don't expect it to be.
Man, this place is hard to beat in New Orleans. The meat is as it should be - tender, flavorful and just down right delicious. Service was impeccable.

Amazing, from first bite to last. My colleagues and I shared a number of small plates -- oysters, blue crab rice, shrimp, alligator...each made us exclaim out loud. The cocktails are also fantastic. Try the ominous sounding Blood of Our People.

Simply awesome! Best dining experience in a while. 
The smell, atmosphere and food were amazing. 
I had the rabbit. So cool. Patty of 8 and everyone tried different entrees. The Redfish was excellently prepared. The ham on the bone was the best. It was a special. See my pics
Great menu, amazing staff and awesome service. Ordered the grilled oysters, smoked ribs and hazel pudding. Everything was on point.

Amazing! Came here for lunch and was very impressed. The food was unique but delicious. We tried the duck pastrami sliders and I had the cubano sandwich.  Both were very good. Service was pretty fast which is always nice at lunch time. I'd definitely come back.

God Damn. Wish I lived here for this place. 
Truly amazing. Service Top notch. 
Great beer selection and sides.

1.  Our waiter (server 103 T on the receipt, dude with the horrible goatee) was an ass.  Took our plates away without asking.  And when we asked to get leftovers wrapped, rolled his eyes and put garbage onto the leftovers plate while taking it away to wrap.  

2.  Food is overrated.  Our friend got the catfish, my wife got the ham hock, and I got the cochon.  Nothing worth the 4 stars this place is getting.  My cochon was just a BBQ pulled pork patty with cabbage & pork rinds ("crackling").   
     Ham hock and mac & cheese were decent. 

What a huge disappointment.  Go elsewhere!
Concierge suggested this place for dinner, it was mediocre at best.  I had the spare ribs, sautéed greens and gumbo.
YAAAAASSSSS! Try it! Enjoyed most of what I put on my fork. Only dislike was the apple/buttermilk remoulade-type sauce on top of the ham hock. Otherwise....LOVELY!

The boucherie plate is a great start to introduce your taste buds to the aged smokey meats. It gives you a wide variety of different styles of meats that are complimented with mustard and pickles (both clearly made in house and perfect at that). 

The Cochon is like something I've never tasted, and I've had a lot of experience with smoked meats. It was extremely smokey but in a way that let you still enjoy the original flavors of the cochon. And the cracklin's were so freshly made it creates high standards the next time you plan on delving into a bag of pork rinds. Definitely a must have.

I also would recommend getting the mac and cheese as a side. Soooooo much smokey goodness!

Such a shame because the food here was great. But the service really does make a difference to the experience and Cochon should work to fix it. 

We sat at the bar because we got a seat sooner than waiting 45 min for a table. Then we sat down ordered food. Took us 15 minutes to get our first dish which was a charcuterie plate. Then there was a hair in the pâté. They thankfully replaced it.  Then we waited 27 minutes for the rest of our dishes. 

The waiters seemed uninterested in expediting service. 

ALL in all. Food is good. Service needs to be much better.

The decor to this place is very clean, rustic, modernized farmhouse vibe. Perhaps it's because we came on Halloween day or the fact that we changed our reservation from 6pm to 830pm the day of, or could be the southern hospitality or being under staffed but the service was slower than expected, however very kind and accommodating. Super gluten free friendly! 

As for the food, we decided to do family style dining. Ordered the charred oysters (gluten free), fried alligator, Louisiana crab lumps chili cilantro rice (gluten free), fried boudin, mushroom salad (gluten free), cucumber herbs (gluten free), catfish bouillon (gluten free), rabbit and dumplings. Coming from a big city, I feel the taste overall was delicious especially the charred oysters & catfish, it was a different and more refined southern fine dinning experience. (Sidenote: I can only eat gluten free dishes, the others I asked my friends about them). 

I personally enjoyed it myself. I definitely recommend it and don't mind returning again for the fact that it was very gluten friendly and delicious but I don't think it's a must try for everyone that comes to New Orleans as tourists.

I like this place mainly because I was able to try fried alligator here. That said, I probably won't order alligator ever again- it's too chewy. Like a mix between chicken and overcooked squid. The wood fired oysters here were my favorite--- oysters are delicious on their own, but the sauce that they used on the oysters here was fantastic. 

I always say I don't like mac and cheese but I surprisingly really enjoyed the mac and cheese here--- cheesy burnt goodness right on top of it. I ordered the specialty Cochon dish, which came with cabbage, peaches and cracklings--- it was good, but nothing to write home about. I liked the Louisiana crab rice, but would pass on the eggplant and shrimp dressing. I guess I didn't expect it to be so heavy, which I should have known, but it was a bit bland as well. 

Food did take forever to come out, but we dined here at lunch on a Friday so maybe it was busier than usual.

Bruh. This spot gets so much hype and its clear why. You'd have to have bad taste to not enjoy eating at Cochon. 

I had the Moroccan lamb and it was probably the best "gyro" I've had. My girlfriend got the pork belly sandwich and it was very good. 

The manager was nice enough to give us a pork and chicken liver sausage with rice and it was very interesting. I think it was boiled so it didn't have crispy skin like I prefer but was just delicious anyways. 

Seating can be frustrating but I like being forced to eat with strangers so it works out. 

Any trip to NoLa would be incomplete without a stop at Cochon.

This place was amazing. The fried alligator was so damn good I ordered 2 orders. The oysters are a must! I could eat their oysters all day! The oyster and bacon sandwich was also very good.   Great place. I'll definitely be coming back next time I'm in NOLA.

I couldn't understand what the hype was for this place - the ambiance, loved the building and the bricks and the modern design.  Can't say our server was friendly or even good - she just seemed like she didn't want to be there.  But I can't judge a place based on those two factors, they are minute points after you consider the food.  So what do I say about the food - some creativeness here but nothing out of the ordinary that I was amazed about.  The wood-fire chargrilled oysters, they were good but not the tastiest oysters I had this trip.  The chili garlic butter was good but it lacked the kick I wanted on the oysters and the oysters themselves were small.  The fried liver with pepper jelly and toast was probably my favorite dish this meal - it was unique with unique flavors and the combination went very well together.  We also had the fried alligator with chili garlic mayo and it tastes exactly like it sounds. Nothing dramatic, just good, not spectacular.  The fried boudin was rich and good flavors - also lacked the kick and mediocre at best.  We also got the mushroom salad with deep fried beef jerky and a lemon vinaigrette.
