Good flavors and unique as well.  And we couldn't go to a place called cochon and not try something with pig so we opted for the smoked ham hock with pinto beans, apple, sage, and jalapeno buttermilk.  The ham hock was smokey and fell off the bone, however it was a little salty and I didn't feel like there were any flavors infused into it but the smoke.  Unimpressed with cochon and thought the whole experience was just A-Ok.. Wouldn't crave this place or go back again..

I came here on the last night of our New Orleans trip and it is really good but i would stay away from the usual etouffe and jambalaya. There are many options here that are full of flavors and different texture. As the name suggest, anything with pork seems to be a good choice.  The porkbelly was my favorite.

Blow the trumpet. You've got 5 stars!!

I don't hand out 5 stars easily. I don't want to be considered a loose Yelper. Plus, you people trust me. 

But Cochon delivers. 

I was hanging out in New Orleans being a total tourist. My friend from Mississippi came in to hang out with me...she's no tourist. A New Orleans regular. She suggested Cochon and brother, let me tell ya, she picked it right. 

Midday lunch on a spotted rainy day, we walked in and were greeted by seriously happy, cheeky, helpful staff. Our servers had fun attitudes that made for great banter; which to me is like a pinch of salt on my dining experience.  Warehouse feel, trendy and yet warm and inviting. 

We started with alligator...those little menaces...who knew they taste just like chicken (a little more tender and sweet). The sauce it was served with was a blast of flavor. Sometimes, I wake up hungry, from dreams filled alligators with chicken wings and I know Cochon is to blame. 

My entree was the onion glazed pork cheeks with grits, radish and herbs. Beautifully cooked, tasty sauce, and presented well. There is nothing I'd change about this dish...except to have more. 

My dinner partners had Cochon with cabbage and pickled greens. It looked like a big ole mess but geeeeeez was it good!! A perfect melding of flavors. 

We had drinks from the bar, mine was an elderflower concoction they had wine. My drink was healthy and tasty, the wine pours, ample. 

If I went back to NOLAi would definitely revisit Cochon. 

If food was jazz, Cochon would be the trumpet.
If you love pork this is the place for you. I thought the small plates beat the entrees. Pork cheek and oysters were my favorite

Overall, I was disappointed with our meal and experience. My son and I had a late lunch (2:00) and he wanted a "good sandwich." When we arrived, the restaurant still had a busy lunch crowd, but it was not packed. The space is very appealing to the eye...nice lines and noise is minimal. We stated with fried boudin; very cold, and dismal in comparison to those at Billy's Boudin in Scott. My son's oyster and bacon sandwich was excellent. I had the special (braised pork cheeks on ciabatta). The pork lacked flavor; was minimally dressed; and the bread weighed a pound. The fried egg topping was great and the quinoa salad side was superb. Service was marginal.

Food was great! All you would expect, and more! But, don't expect to be able to enjoy conversation with your table. The noise is off the charts. And the wait staff are all about getting you in an out. Turn those tables as fast as possible!

Not worth the hype. Food was disappointing and service wasn't good either. It took around 40 mins for us to get our entree after our second course. Understandably, it was a busy night but for what we paid it should of been a better experience. We were offered dessert on the house, which was a nice thought. However,  the dessert was just as disappointing as the food and service.
Neat setting gives you the NOLA feel. Very diverse menu for everyone. Food was really good but not worth 5 stars.

I must be missing something. The food was just ok . Everything has a smoky taste. The service was excellent especially for such a busy place. We were four hungry men. The waitress suggested the 2lb pork chop. When it came it was 79% fat. We called for the manager and he agreed and took it off our bill. We ordered the ham hock,short ribs and Alligator. Nothing outstanding. The dessert was the best part of the meal.

If you like meat, you really can't go wrong here. All kinds of meat, prepared in all kinds of delicious ways. Come with a group, try a little bit of everything. A fun, vibrant atmosphere with excellent food.

I was a little nervous after reading a few of the lower-rated reviews, but we had a great experience! The food was incredible, and our waiter recommended the pineapple upside down cake for dessert- it was perfect! Wait staff was very helpful and informative, and helped us with our choices. Would definitely come back!

WOW. WOW. WOW.

Probably the BEST place I have had dinner, and I dine  A LOT, and have lived all over the world.

The fried alligator nuggets and wood fired oysters were divine, so yummy, full of flavor and great portion sizes. The ham hock fell off the bone and the mac and cheese was perfect.

Shout out to our server Colleen and the amazing hostess Mary!!!

The food blew me away, everything was amazing. Service, staff, ambiance. I want to go back to New Orleans just to eat there again.

You know when you have great service because you don't notice it? Well here you'll notice your server complains while providing subpar service. Almost every dish served at room temperature but by second course you realize I don't want to deal with flagging down a waiter again. The food is like your momma makes in that it really is like your mom could make this simple nuance-lacking food. James Beard awarded these guys a medal? Based on my experience it is unthinkable. Why two stars? average food meats unhappy waitstaff equals a meal I wish to have back for our stay in a city of other worthy options.

This should be a MUST on every foodies list. Cochon did not disappoint! From the moment we walked in and were seated overlooking the kitchen, the staff, drinks, and food was fabulous.  Wanting to try all the  mouth watering items on the menu we tried multiple starters, these are all 5 star options cajun alligator bits, fried chicken livers on croutons with peper jelly, braised pork cheeks, boudin balls, fire roasted oysters with chilli garlic sauce. If you visit New Orleans go by and have dinner you'll be glad you did.
Awesome industrial vibe. The mac and cheese is what we came for. Fried alligator was amazing. The Boudin and mac and cheese was my favorite meal during my trip to New Orleans.

4.5 

We went for a late lunch on a Friday so we had no trouble getting a table. I've heard from others, however, that if you want to have dinner, you have to make a reservation in advance, and not the day of. 

We ordered way too much food, but all of it was so so good.
Wood fired oysters
Smoked pork ribs
Braised pork cheeks
Boucherie plate
Crab fried rice

Of these, my favorite--the wood-fired oysters. SO. Good. 

My least favorite--Braised pork cheeks. They were good, but compared to the other dishes, this wasn't the best. 

Service was ok. Friendly isn't the word. More like acceptable. The server spilled my husband's beer on our table. She didn't apologize or offer to top it off or bring another one. 

Our table was very close to the table next to us, which was a little annoying given that the restaurant had space to seat us farther apart. Normally I wouldn't even care if we were seated that close to another table, but the dude next to us complained about everything. Why he was eating there, I have no idea. He should've just had his beer (that he complained about) and left. 

It would've been a 5 star experience if the service was better. I expect 5 star service for a $100 lunch for 2.

Absolutely a great restaurant. Everything we had was amazing. Mac & cheese is probably the best ive ever had, and the oyster and bacon sandwich is amazing. Great atmosphere, just be sure to get a reservation.

The food was good but my service experience was not. The server walked past my table multiple times and tended to all of those around me. My guest and I felt invisible. It was a terrible experience and I will not support this behavior by giving them another shot. I am very disappointed.
Service can only be described as glacial. We were waiting over an hour on a Monday night. I can't imagine what this place is like on a Friday.

Have been here many times and have never had a bad meal.  Tonight with some colleagues, I had the cochon with cabbage, which was pulled pork, lightly sautéed in a patty with cracklin's. and sautéed cabbage. It was a little spicy, which surprised me, but was so flavorful, I ate the whole thing.  The atmosphere is busy but not overly loud and service was quite good. Came earlier in the day for a muffaletta - again, yummy and flavorful.

I am a fan of Cochon, and Butcher. The food is incredible and Donald Link has led a return to rustic, down home cooking. But some of the prices for what are humble ingredients and cuts of meat are just laughable
A wonderful meal! Got a great bottle of Pinot noir, fried alligator bites, the cochon and rabbit dumplings. Just a delicious and flavorful meal. Service was excellent.

Cajun food is a recently acquired taste for me, but this place executes with a modern-foodie flair. Add a great ambiance and decent portions and prices, and you've got a sure future favorite. I'll definitely be back here again :)
From the first sip of my cocktail to the very last lick of my dessert plate, this was some of the best food and service I have experienced!
Stopped for lunch after WW11 museum. Very good. Waitress was a lot of fun. Good beer menu. Ask what has spice/heat in it as the gumbo had a lot of red pepper in it. I wasn't expecting that.

Started with the alligator bites.  Nice and tender and a little bit chewy.  Dinner was an outstanding rabbit and dumplings and a good but salty ham hock.  Finished off with a chocolate pudding that hit the spot.  The atmosphere was lively with a cool brick and wood paneling decor.  I get the sense there is always a crowd at Cochon.  I was considering giving four stars but the rabbit was so tasty I have to rate the overall experience a five.

The price was a bit on the higher end for what we expected but my friend and I sat at the bar table in front of the kitchen. That was cool. We ordered the wood fired oysters and the rice from the small plates option (both $14). The rice was delicious and the oysters just okay. We were able to see a lot of dishes being prepared and everything looked absolutely delicious! I wish we could have tried more but I'll definitely be coming back (with my sugar daddy  kidding).

Items Selected:
Fried Alligator - Chili Garlic Mayonnaise
Oyster and Bacon Handpie
Boucherie Plate - Pickles, Mustard, Buttered Croutons, Shoulder, Loin, Jowl, Headcheese, Rillette
Cochon Cuban - Fontina, Pickles, Onions, Mustard, Show Roasted Debris, Smoked Shoulder on Herbed Focaccia with Crispy Brussels Sprouts
Macaroni and Cheese Casserole
Twice-Baked Stuffed Potato
Shrimp and Eggplant Dressing
Cornbread with Salted Butter
Dutch Apple Pie - Cheddar Cheese Crust, Vanilla Ice Cream
Pineapple Upside Down Cake - Coconut-Lime Sherbet and Dulce de Leche
Chocolate Hazelnut Pudding - Whipped Cream, Chocolate Croquantes, English Toffee
Steen's Gateaux - Spiced Layered Cake with Pumpkin Jam, Cream Cheese Frosting

Perhaps the most talked about restaurant in New Orleans since opening its doors, Cochon from Chef Donald Link remains as relevant in 2016 as it was revolutionary when it renovated an old Warehouse on Tchoupitoulas Street, all hours from Lunch to Dinner seeing diners compete for seating as the kitchen turns out both modern and traditional Creole plates.

A growing concern since 2006, several Chefs both local and distant attempting to replicate Link's success with locally sourced spaces and all-in-house butchery programs, it was minutes past opening that a party of three arrived at the hostess podium requesting seating, only two other tables full allowing for a sizable four-top in the middle of a soon-to-be bustling dining area.

Changing up the menu daily, some signatures joining off-menu specials and all sorts of small plates, entrees and sides, it was after some discussion both amongst the group and with one of several young, male servers that decisions were made - table bread not delivered, literally, until before dessert for unknown reasons, the Dinner Rolls already gone and the Cornbread far too dry, even with the locally-sourced Butter.

Not dining with the sort of people interested in Oysters, Off-Cuts or some of the more esoteric options presented by Cochon's menu, it was nonetheless with an eye on big flavors that the meal began a mere ten minutes after placing the order, Link's famous Fried Alligator not really that much different from the meaty part of Frog Legs with or without the spicy Aioli, the Boucherie Plate featuring several delicious options including particularly funky Head Cheese while the Handpie was picture perfect as flaky crust shattered to yield tender Oysters, Bacon, Rice, Carrots and Okra.

Increasingly busy with a wait for tables by noon, round two arrived hot on the heels of the first in a way that indicated that the kitchen had been waiting as the table savored each bite, the "Cochon Cuban" not quite the same as those served in Florida as it married Debris to Smoked Shoulder beneath a rich layer of Fontina, housemadePickles Mustard, the Macaroni and Cheese pretty standard in a scalding hot skillet while both the Shrimp and Eggplant Dressing as well as the Twice-Baked Stuffed Potato were truly innovative sides, the latter straddling a fine line between an oversized French Fry and best Mashed version using the crispy skin almost like a Sausage casing.

Hearing nothing but good things about the dessert program, not a focus for most but well worth exploring as Pastry Chef Maggie Scales has continued to invigorate all of Link's menus regularly with modernized classics since joining the team in 2014, it should prove impossible for any to select just one dish from a bevy of choices, the Nutella themed Budino far lighter than most with good texture added by both the Chocolate spheres and English Toffee while two Cakes and a Pie all tasted as good as they looked, the caramelized Cheddar adding an extra dimension to Apple Pie beneath an enormous scoop of Ice Cream while the layered Spice Cake was like an early taste of Thanksgiving with Pumpkin Jam and tangy Cream Cheese Frosting.

This place has great food and service! We walked over for a late lunch after seeing the WWII museum, and were delighted by the experience. Our food was delicious (especially the fried gator!) And our server was super friendly. She even have us a great recommendation beignets to avoid the craziness of Cafe Du Monde!

I came here with a big group of friends. I'd highly recommend making a reservation as the place is very popular. It is on the pricier end of the scale for New Orleans but the food is good. I just wish the portions were bigger very small tapas style.

They had a mixologist who made some really fun but kind of small cocktails. I had a smoking bourbon cocktail that was delicious.

The food we pretty much have everything on the menu twice over.

The smoked pork ribs had to be my favorite thing they were absolutely delicious meat just fell off the bones.... it was so good!

Fried alligator with some type of sauce on top. I would ask for this with little sauce . We got this dish twice the first time with a little bit of sauce and the second time it was loaded with the sauce. The soft rounded the dish so I would definitely recommend this but light on the sauce. 

The cochon is very tasty and I highly recommend ordering that. 
Mac and cheese-standard
Chicken gumbo-ok, not Fantastic
Rabbit dumplings- very doughy 
Louisiana crab rice- very tasty just wish there was more crab

Overall I felt satisfied with the meal but it was pricey and very small portions on the food. We ended up paying $82 each.

This was the best and cheapest dinner we had in New Orleans.   Three cocktails, two appetizers and two entrees were about $115.   The portions were generous and everything was excellent.   We loved the braised rabbit stew best, but the cochon was also excellent.   The oysters and braised pork cheeks with pickled turnips were also great.   I would come back when I visit again!

Came in with some friends, had reservation of course, started off at the bar with a drink...then once we got seated we ordered a bunch of items to share: fried alligator, mac & cheese, Louisiana cochon....all were very tasty! Oh and awesome music....

Best restaurant I have eaten at in New Orleans. The alligator is incredible. Also ate the rabbit (best I have ever tasted) and tried the red fish (delicious - first time). The buns - make sure to get the hot buns! Cocktails also a must - try the Backwoods Mule. The wait staff were also extremely helpful. One of our party could not eat anything with gluten and they took care to help her choose things that she could eat. Also, it was very busy, and they apologized for some delay (did not really notice it) and gave us our desserts on the house.

I had lived in the greater New Orleans area for all of 2 weeks before I found this place. Though I am NOT the biggest pork fan (I KNOW RIGHT?!) the food was amazing. Nothing over pork-ified. it was all done so well and I would and DO recommend this place for a bit of the local food with a unique flare. I mean the mac and cheese. The boudin balls? I MEAN COME ON.

Great selection and a few specials each night. The mac and cheese is incredible. Steak was well prepared. This isn't your average cajon place, but I think that's the point. 

Service was good, we were seated promptly with a reservation. 

Tables for two along wall were a little close together.
Bad services and waited to damn long to get served. Charged me extra 2 alligators when my bro only ordered 1 and didn't even take it away. We spent 90.00 each good food/but shitty services.

Good food. Friendly service. Refreshing ambiance. Went on a busy lunch time on a recent visit to NOLA. Place was packed so I gladly accepted offer to sit by the chef's counter. Not a bad decision as it turned out. You get entertained with the kitchen staff working their butts off in front of you. I had the fried liver and the Louisiana cochon. Both were excellent and filling. I can see myself coming back again on my return trip to NOLA.

Cochon means pig, and this place features all parts of it. Ambiance is semi-trendy in converted warehouse, wood tables & chairs & decoration with concrete floor that might get noisy if crowded. Went for lunch. Opted for two plates, very tasty: mushroom salad with meat crackling in mint vinaigrette, pig cheeks with cucumber(?) shavings in vaguely curried sauce. Flavours were balanced, nothing overwhelmed. All the plates look nice, including one neighbor's pig patty over cabbage and another's charcuterie sampling. (Neighbors were pretty close.)  Loses a star in service, as, for all the hovering of two hostesses & existence of multiple servers, no one describes plates well, had to ask for bread, got no water refills, weird table clearance. Good spot if going to WWII "museum" or walking @ art galleries in area.

While the food was amazing, the service was sorely lacking. We had a 9:00pm reservation, but we weren't seated until approximately 9:30.  At 9:00pm, we were told that our table would be available shortly, but this wasn't the case. We were enjoying dinner conversation, but the wait staff was rushing us out.

The food alone deserves 4 stars. What tainted the experience was our short haired ginger female server w/ a nose ring who was not friendly at all. She definitely hates her job. Every question we had about the menu she was very condescending and not helpful. I had lunch Late afternoon on 12/3/16. It's disappointing because so many people recommended this place to me. Every other Customer Service experience I had in NOLA was super friendly. She must not be from there...

Service was phenomenal and decor was nice. A little loud, but that worked fine for us.  The highlights of the meal were the chicken livers with a sweet jelly and the rabbit dumplings. both were great. Fried alligators were nice with a nice dipping sauce.  

Had bites of the grilled beef short rib, but not as good as the rabbit dumplings in my opinion, the dumplings had a great sauce with them and the rabbit was nicely cooked.

** DO NOT MISS COCHON BUTCHER! **

NOLA is a city that everyone can indulge in a colorful culinary scene. As an international who spent almost 2 years in the USA, I have to say that dining in New Orleans is a great experience that rivals no other American city. Even before arriving the city, I was impressed by restaurants having 4 to 5 stars with so many reviews. There was Cochon Butcher at the top of the list and we got intrigued enough! Then we realized that they got two options: Cochon and Cochon Butcher. As we wanted to try the fried alligator, our first choice was Cochon.

Besides the fried alligator we also got salad with sundried tomatoes, mac & cheese casserole and grilled beef short rib. We were satisfied with our choice except the main reason why we came here. (Personally I didn't like alligator at all.)

I would like to thank Cochon because:

+ We took a great walk from our hotel to Cochon.

+ It has great atmosphere.


Please don't miss Cochon Butcher next door! We had our dinner at Cochon and came back the next day to have our lunch at Butcher!

Food & Service: (4/5)

Atmosphere: (5/5):

Value for Money: (3/5)

Oh my God. Every single thing was the best. The brisket was like butter, crab rice delicious, mac and cheese was delightful, pork was phenomenal...I could go on and on! What an experience! Beautiful ambiance and a great bar with clever cocktails. Can't wait to go back. Worth every penny!

We started our New Orleans here by accident and ended here on purpose.
This place is amazing!
The fire grilled oysters are to die for! Succulent oysters- wow.
Fried alligator was okay. You should try if you haven't had it before. Sort of like fried chicken poppers.
The rabbit and dumplings were rich, heavy, and wonderful! Very tasty. Had great flavor.
The dinner rolls that come for free are warm with a crisp top and soft center. 
Mac and cheese was also very decadent and delicious.
Can't go wrong here with food or with drinks.
Service was pretty good as well.

Cochon is an excellent choice for a New Orleans dinner for both locals and tourists.  Cochon is in the hip part of town which usually demands a higher quality of dishes.  My takeaway was the restaurant's theme was different cuts of meat that are not currently popular.  For example their gumbo was based on turkey necks and one of their main dishes was ham hocks.  The wife and I ordered two apps the gator bites and fried boudin balls.  The gator tasted like a chili powder boneless wing which was very good.  For my main course I got the gulf fish of the day which was red fish.  It was flavorful and cooked to a good finish.  I ordered a shrimp and eggplant dressing and it tasted like what it sounds, a thanksgiving side with those flavors.  Cochon is one of the newer staples of the cityfor a reason.

The best food I've had in New Orleans to date! Great ambiance, quality food and excellent service. This place is on the high end in terms of price, but you have to pay for what you get and what you get here is an amazing dining experience with wonderful cuisine. The signature wood fired oysters in chili garlic are the best we've had and the crab fried rice is nothing short of amazing. I highly recommend this place for oysters over Drago's. very clean, quality and very eclectic menu options. It's worth the prices. You'll leave here happy with the whole experience

Without a doubt one of the best meals I have had anywhere, let alone New Orleans.

We were promptly seated for our reservation and ordered some interesting options off of their extensive beer menu. We then ordered up anything and everything on the appetizer menu that looked even remotely good.

We had the boucherie platter which came with the most amazing cured meats, pates and rillets. I especially loved the pork rillet which tasted like deviled ham on Walter White's home-cooked blue. I could eat that everyday until my heart went on strike. 

The smoked cheeks could have started s fist fight but luckily we ordered two portions so there was almost enough of that rich, smoky, porky goodness to go around.

The bacon pie was obscenely good, like the greatest empanada you have ever had. I wish we ordered 4. 

The boudin was like tiny little pork scotch egg happiness. 

Even the non-pork items were amazing as the shrimp, greens and lima beans were all devoured as fast as they arrived. 

Since there was a tiny bit of room left after the carnage we split some pudding which was rich and decadent and tasted amazing with the Bib and Tucker bourbon I requested. 

Service was fantastic and knowledgeable and the best part was all of this ran just under $200 for 4 people. How can you beat this kind of food at that price? Cochon is right up there with Commander's as my favorite food outpost in New Orleans.

This is our second time at Cochon, and if I had remembered that this was the same place  I wouldn't have come back. I don't understand all the great reviews. The restaurant was an ice box tonight so if you go, wear a winter coat. The waitress (I think her name was Stacy?) was strange. She kept talking and making jokes that were odd and not funny. She knew I didn't like the food that was delivered but never asked why, or what was wrong with it. I'm usually very easy to please food wise.... but this place definitely missed the mark on everything. The oysters were ok. Decent enough flavor but not as good as we've had elsewhere this trip. The rice had absolutely no flavor and the pork belly was incredibly salty. We also tried some liver small appetizer. (I can't recall what it was called). It had a weird gamey taste. Not like any liver I've ever tried. Not a good restaurant and I definitely can't recommend it.... especially as there are SO many good places to eat in New Orleans.

Made reservations for dinner and was seated right away. It is loud at dinner time, you can hear everyone talking but the lighting is semi-dim. The waitress was really friendly and funny. We ordered a little bit of everything because the items are a la carte. The mac in cheese was delicious, roasted carrots dish was amazing, BBQ Ribs were great but had a spicy kick after, Garlic Lemon Oysters were tasty and a bit spicy as well. I tried alligator for the first time and it was good too, tasted chewy like calamari. Was too full for dessert, but would for sure come back for dinner again. The attire was dressy.

Accidently came here instead of Cochon Butcher (was pretty buzzed). Cochon Butcher is actually right next door, woops. Waitress was SUPER NICE and kept giving us generous portions of bread and water even though we didn't order very much for 4 people. 

Fried alligator - AMAZING sauce
Braised Pork Cheeks - MUCH tender
Mac & Cheese - LESS memorable

This place is amazing! The food, the ambiance, the service and the options. Try the chef's counter where you can watch them work. It's like a well choreographed dance. I had the cuchon, which was perfectly cooked and presented in a unique way. The server was well informed and right on point. Enjoy!

Best courtbouillon I have had in any restaurant hands down.  I grew up on courtbouillon among Acadiens of South Louisiana and it takes much for any restaurant to impress me for this dish and/or any other gumbo/Cajun food.  Will happily go back for more...

Soooooo delicious!!! 

I was waiting for the moment I would step foot into New Orleans and have some great food. The people I came with believe eating salad is a rite of passage and I just couldn't. Not today! Today was all about me! I walked into Cochon all by myself and I didn't care that I was single and dining alone. Me and my appetite was enough to be considered 2 people! I sat at the dining station watching the cooks and the oven fire in the background. I ordered delicious egg nog and oysters to start. By far the best oysters I have ever had. If I could eat 100 of them I would! The waiter was so incredibly polite and he sounded just like Denzel Washington! After the oysters I had to try the fried alligator because shoot its fried alligator and smothered greens. Delicious!! The best meal I have had in a long time. Everything is moderately priced but well worth it!

Just go -- you will not be sorry.  Their greens are perfect, their oysters are perfect their gumbo is perfect -- my friend ordered the grilled fish of the day and it too was perfect.  Simple foods all done just exceptionally well!!

Definitely get reservations ahead of time. We had a long wait getting in. However, the food was very good! We had the brisket, ribs, and the oysters. The brisket was especially good - perfectly smoked. I definitely recommend it.

I was having a bad day and was so hangry that I was that person who gets mad over stupid, ridiculous things. One bite of the pork shoulder instantly turned me from Medusa into a normal, happy person again. Everything I tried was fantastic. I will always recommend this restaurant with enthusiasm, and I will always come for a meal when passing through town.

Everything looked so good on the menu so we had to order strategically. We ended up getting: 1 crab fried rice, 2 boucherie board, 3 wood-fired oysters, 4 rabbit and dumplings, and 5 mixed green salad with pumpkin, goat cheese, and cranberries. Every dish was flavorful and well-cooked. The rice was the bomb. I was worried that they wouldn't put enough crab, but I was pleasantly surprised. The oysters were cooked a little differently compared to other other joints and I especially loved that they were just a bit spicy. The Boucherie board definitely should be shared and it felt really plentiful for two people. All the types of meat were excellent and the accompanying pickles and mustard completed the board. If you have room, i definitely suggest the rabbit and dumplings. It was hearty and heavy, but so flavorful. It's like a comfort food dish, and was perfect for the cold weather. Our only regret is that we wish we could have ordered more!

Our friends in New Orleans recommended this place to us and I'm so glad they did!!! Everything was amazing! We had the oysters, alligator, and rabbit with dumplings which I would absolutely get again. Atmosphere and staff were both great.

The fried alligator here is the best I have ever tried in New Orleans. It is a must-have dish. 
Rabbit is just ok. Not too fancy about it.

Very overrated. An upscale overpriced version of the delicious Cajun meats you can find between BR and Lafayette, and near Opelousas, but not nearly as good. Local Louisianians like myself probably won't be impress. Pretty restaurant, but won't be going back.

This is a lively restaurant in the warehouse district with a great take on the local cuisine. 

The fried alligator is very spicy and rather chewy. 

The grilled oysters are also well spiced and have an an enjoyable, meaty flavor. 

Be sure to cleanse your palate for the more subtle taste of the mains, if you go with these appetizers. 

The Louisiana Couchon is an amazing porcine experience. The core of the dish consists of pulled pork formed into a puck which is fried. Strewn about this are a generous portion of crispy pork cracklins. Nestled into the underlying bed of vegetable matter are tender chunks of pork belly. 

The "Blood of Our People" is a concoction of bourbon & rum, ginger, and tropical bitters.

Ordered the rabbit with dumplings, creamy grits, macaroni and cheese casserole, and apple pie for dessert. I felt that the rabbit with dumplings was overpowered by the rosemary/sage/thyme but was SO enamored by the grits and macaroni and cheese casserole that it was ok. As a mac and cheese fanatic, the mac n cheese casserole was THE BEST mac n cheese I've ever tasted. The apple pie with cheddar cheese crust was also one of the best desserts I've ever had. Service was also great!

Took my daughter and her two housemates here for dinner. They seemed to like their food but didn't finish their meals, got to go boxes which were thrown out two days later. We ordered the alligator app which had a good sauce but it was pretty chewy like atleast one other person has commented about. The alligator on a stick at the local music festivals is better.

I ordered the brisket with potato salad. Being from Texas I should have known I would be disappointed. The brisket was good, tender, flavorful and I liked the sauce. The potato salad was bad and tasted too tangy almost like it was spoiled. Didn't get sick. Any grocery potato salad is better. What is disappointing to me is the value for the money. Just about any BBQ place is just as good for one third the cost of Cochon and the portion size would be atleast 50% larger. Would have left hungry if not for the bread they serve before the meal. Took about an hour for the main course to arrive.   

The service was friendly but slow and the food came for the three ladies and they waited patiently for five minutes for my food to come only to discover that the waitress forgot to place my order somehow. If you are looking for more than just being seen at the current trendy hot spot and expect really good food when going to a upscale restaurant then you should keep looking. I wouldn't consider going back until I have tried several other places.

Disappointing. Picked this place after researching great places to eat in NOLA. I ordered the fried shrimp and, when it arrived, I saw about 4 fried shrimp on my plate hidden under a mound of fried onions. It was also really fishy tasting. Thank goodness I ordered the twice baked potato---it was great. 

Maybe I set expectations too high?

Two waiters assigned to our group of four. They were completely uninterested in providing service. 45 minute wait for our order to come out of the kitchen. Food was not worth the wait. Over inspired, over seasoned and cold. Blah!!! So disappointed. In addition to the mediocre everything, our special request was completely ignored. Shame on management for allowing a once grade A, stand out restaurant to diminish into a place I will undoubtedly never visit again. Boo!

Love this place...and I don't even eat meat!...I do eat some seafood thank goodness, because their grilled oysters are amazing. Amazing cocktails too! I bring family here whenever they visit. Can get busy sometimes, so may wanna call ahead.

Absolutely amazing!! From drinks to appetizers to dinner to dessert and after dinner drinks. This restaurant has a very well-oiled service, staff and kitchen. Even when they were swamped in the kitchen(you can see them) everything went swimmingly!! One of my top 10 restaurants!

This was surprisingly one of the best meals we had in NOLA. I was hesitant making a reservation for our large party of 19 people all with varying tastes and budgets. Usually for a large group I would tend to stick to the creole classics but this restaurant had such great reviews I decided, screw it, let's go for it. The masses can riot later and I can blame Yelp if it doesn't work out. 

I gambled and won. This was really a fabulous restaurant. The service was impeccable and the ambiance was just laid back enough to be comfortable and still inviting without the snobbery one would expect for food of this caliber. Everything we tasted on the cocktail menu was perfect. Just get a drink, go for it. This isn't Bourbon street, get something that is thoughtfully crafted, you'll thank me later. 

Now onto the actual food menu. OMG we ended up passing around a few plates and every single entree and meal was really delicious. You can't go wrong with the Boudin balls or Braised Cheeks but the smothered greens and mac and cheese were truly memorable. The shortrib and the cochon were particularly memorable. Now I live in TX where we know a thing or two about meat but Cochon, hands down knows more. Go. Eat. Enjoy.

A little hidden gem off of the beaten path. Couchon has the ambiance of a reclaimed warehouse with exposed wood and industrial fixtures about. It is also much bigger than expected. We got a table on the second floor, which was very nice. Things felt more intimate with just the few table around us. 

I know this sounds crazy but don't skip out on the sides. I advise getting them all and sharing with a table. We ordered one per person and order seconds of a few of them. They are all amazing! The eggplant and shrimp stuffing was my favorite though. It's a combination that I did not expect but was pleasantly surprised by the way the two flavors complimented each other. 

Also, be sure to ask Daniel, the sommelier, about his secret spicy concoction. It has quite the kick so just a spoonful will do just the trick!

Came here pretty early on a weekday, so no wait. 

This is the place to be if you want to try exotic meats from classic Louisiana cuisine. 

What to get: 
-Fried alligator: Never had alligator before, but it really tastes like chicken! I thought people were kidding when they say alligator tastes like chicken, but it's true. Just a more juicy and thicker cut of chicken. As for the sauce, I would have cut down on some of the mayonnaise. 
-Wood fire chili garlic oysters: Highlight of my meal. I personally liked the flavor better than the famous chargrilled oysters. If you like raw oysters, you will probably like the texture of these oysters better than the chewier chargrilled ones. 

A lot of tapas-style dishes and a bit pricey, but worth the visit.

Been here twice now, about 15 or so years apart and this place still delivers some off the beaten path cuisine for New Orleans in a somewhat different but very cool vibe space. Related to but not the same place as Cochon Butcher, another top rated spot. 

Went for dinner with my son last time out for a pre Beck meal. He was happy to be there with me. We sat over against the wall with the sofa seats on one side looking out in the place. Perfect.

Had a two man service team and our lead guy was spot on while the other guy seemed to nursing a hangover or something similar. Did not detract from our meal though in the least. 

Catfish Courtbouillon was delicate but full of flavor. My salad was one of the best ever. Pork belly was awesome. Eggplant and shrimp dressing ditto. Blue crab rice was different and delish. Alligator was spicy and a great starter. 

Couple of different brews, Clown Shoes and a tasty cider, Thistle Cross Whisky Cask. 

On the return list for sure but not waiting 15 years. ;0)

I'll preface this review by saying that I'm not a huge fan of long wait times for restaurants. It's rare to find the dining experience that is worth an hour or more wait. That said, I didn't plan ahead for dinner on a recent road trip through New Orleans and I found myself facing an hour wait to be seated at Cochon. C'est la vie. 

To pass the time my girlfriend and I grabbed some drinks: one round at the Cochon bar and another at nearby Barrel Proof. After just over an hour had passed, we found ourself back at Cochon with promises that our table would be ready any moment. Okay. 15 minutes passed and we still hadn't been seated, so I again asked the hostess for an update to be told that "there are tables being cleaned off right now." Umm, okay, fine. Another 15 minutes passed, bringing our total wait time to 1 hour 40 minutes, before we were finally given table and then only after I again asked the hostess for an update. Ugh! We were then seated only to find multiple empty tables. Moreover they sat us, two people, at a table for four when there was an empty table for two next to it. Huh?! Were we waiting for no reason? Were they just mismanaging their table situation? Or did we get bumped down the list earlier? In any case it seems like unacceptable service. Don't quote a wait time of 1 hour and then have someone waiting for 1 hour 40 minutes.

So why am I still giving this place 4 stars? Because the food was just that impressive. From the Wood Fired Oysters with Chili Garlic Butter to the Catfish Courtbouillon to the absolutely amazing Rabbit and Dumplings, everything was prepared to perfection. The beautiful decor with its exposed brick, cool background music selection, and the pleasantness of our actual server also helped mitigate the horrible experience with the hostess. So, yes, do yourself a favor and add Cochon to your list of restaurants to try, but make sure you secure a reservation or be prepared to face waiting hell.

Good: Big open space and BBQ ribs with macaroni and cheese 

Bad: Hard sitting benches/chairs 
Not many menu options 

Best: Watermelon pickles on the ribs :-7

Great New Years Eve dinner at a great place.  Hats off to Stephen Stryjewski for creating a fantastic three course menu that felt like a ten course menu. Loved the oven roasted fava beans, oysters with green apple and cucumber mignonette, matasutake mushrooms xo butter sauce, hog head dumplings with cabbage and vinegar.  Could not stop eating the pickled cashews !!!!!

High praise for your cast and crew as well Stephen. Big fun !!!

I had the pleasure of eating here for New Years. There was a prefixed menu that included 5 serving, I believe. There is a very nice selection of menu options but for whatever reason the food just did not meet my expectations. I would recommend this place despite all that. Try the fried ice cream!

By far my most favorite restaurant in all New Orleans. We had a party of 6 and all got something different. Let me tell you: nothing was short of amazing. The rabbit soup was our favorite, but the ham hock was a close second.

Great place for tapas or a full course meal. I tried the alligator, mixed greens salad, oysters and cuchon. I normally dont like oysters but these were slightly grilled and topped with the right amount of sauce. The salad was so fresh. Personally,  the cochon was a little dry... but maybe thats just the way the dish is made

Wow. Wow, wow, wow. Thank you, Cochon. My husband and I agreed that we have only two regrets related to our meal at Cochon: 1) We didn't have enough stomach capacity for dessert, and 2) Every other meal in 2017 will suck compared to that amazingness. 

We had: Bread, wood-fired oysters, blue crab rice, cucumber and herbs, ribs, Louisiana Cochon, Mac and cheese, and twice baked potato. Every single thing - ALL of it - was incredible. I would recommend it all, but especially the oysters, ribs, and Mac and cheese. 

So, so happy!!! Go to Cochon. You won't regret it.

Coming from the new East Nashville, Tennessee 'foodie hotbed' and having eaten at Cochon's sister restaurant in my hometown, I was eager to try the original as we love Cochon Butcher near our neighborhood. I don't write on Yelp very much, if, at all. I can't say enough about my experience here. From start to finish, it is hands down in my top 3 when it comes to sheer food excellence. 40 years on this planet and I can say that. Didn't order a single menu item that disappointed... and we tried. I could go on and on but just give it a try. It's well worth the effort. They're not trying too hard. They're not being snobby or fancy. They're just hitting what they do out of the park. Go.

I rarely give out 5 stars. However, Cochon has exceeded my expectations with service and food. We were looking for a place to eat and I  came across a review from a fellow yelper Peter D. We didn't have reservations but we were hungry and decided to go anyway. As we started getting closer we noticed a bit of a crowd. As we walk in the smell of great food is in the air. We get in line and ask for a table and announce we dont have a reservation. That's when the nicest guy walks over and says Im cancelling my reservations for 3 and you can have mine. Yessss! We walk to our table after 5 minutes and the waitress comes over. We order a great bottle of red wine. I notice the pig picture and realized I made a boo boo. My mom doesn't eat pork. WTf was i thinking. I take a breath and after she reviewed it she orders the eggplant and shrimp and the fish of the day, redfish. Whew! Saved by the fish. I order the ribs, twice baked potato and pickled cucumbers. The ribs were good. Nice smoky taste with a pickled watermelon rind on top. Amazing. The twice baked potato had a great taste. While I'm on my last rib, the star of the night Becca, came over with some towels she heated up for me to clean my hands. When our meals arrived there was an entree missing.  The manager came over about 10 minutes announcing this dish is on me. As a former server i was always told "bad news travels more than good news." Nice call! While my mom was eating Becca brought a knife over saying "I noticed you didn't have one." If that's not customer service I don't know what is.  The fish was cooked just right still juicy and very fresh. The shrimp and eggplant had a taste similar to stuffing. Great for those that don't like their veggies. The cucumber tasted like pickles with parsley and mint for a garnish. I recommend this place to everyone. Food is great and the staff is so accomodating they make you feel that every dollar was well spent. By far the best meal and service in NOLA.

We haven't been on NO for maybe 15 years, so we asked friends and fam for recommendations. Cochin was on everyone's list. After tonight, it's on ours, too. 

Through a slight miscommunication, esposa and I ordered the same cocktail, the Little Dragon. Gin, lemon, herbsaint, tarragon. A little sweeter than what I normally opt for, but very refreshing. We ended up having another round. ;)

Starters: blue crab rice w chili and cilantro was a hit. Mrs. D would've just had more of that I think, but I talked her into the spicy smoked rinds. These were perfect, IMO. Definitely spice, but with a bit of sweetness, and some snap from the watermelon pickle garnish.

Mains: my smoked brisket was excellent, as was the  horseradish potato salad. Gotta recreate that at home. :) Her cochon (sorta pulled pork) had a great sauce w bacon, cabbage, carrots etc and perfect little cracklings (chicharrones) on top. Two more clean plates. 

We shouldn't have, but we went for the German chocolate cake. It was good, but my German grandma wins that round. :)

First-rate selection of whiskeys BTW. 

Service: solid, millennial-ish if you know what I mean. They are never intrusive and don't fawn over you, which I like. Casual, which we are fine with at a place like this. It's really 4.5 stars, but we had such a good time, I'm rounding it up. :)

Value: 4 cocktails, 2 starters, 2 mains, a dessert, and a cognac for me. $158. I'm good with this. 

Bottom line: I don't think you can go wrong here. Menu selection is not huge, but each dish is unique. Go!!!

Everything about this place is a YES! Best Oysters I had in New Orleans. I think my favorite meal of the whole trip. Hands down the best server we had the whole trip too. The guy had us salivating as he described the menu and specials to us!!! YESS. I suggest just getting a bunch of small plates or going with a group and trying a bunch of items.

Highlight place of my trip! I was here last Wed for 9 PM reservation for dinner. They didn't seat us till 9:15 or so and we were a party of 4. Place is pretty big and place was packed even during that time. We decided to come here because it was recommended by a friend and I can't rave enough about this place. If you do come here, you must get the oysters~! We liked it so much that we had to add a 2nd order in. The Louisiana blue crab rice was also really good. It had a lemony taste to it. Their gumbo was pretty awesome too. Favorite entrée of mine was the oven roasted gulf fish. It looks simple and plain but it's sooo delicious. We also tried the beef brisket and cochon but they were just ok to me. Also, the mac and cheese casserole was probably the best one I ate on this trip since I had it at a few other places. This is a must go to restaurant!!! Everything was just savory and yummy. I will definitely go there again if I end up going back to NOLA.
Server was very knowledgable about everything and helped us pick more food than we can handle. Everything was excellent. Cochon and ham hock was amazing. The boucherie platter was excellent.

I had a cocktail called the Turning Point.  I'm a lover of bourbon and this cocktail did not disappoint.  Got lunch - we noshed on fried alligator which was tender and in a delicious sauce as well as the most incredible wood fired oysters with a spicy garlic sauce.  Those oysters were ridiculous.

If there were more stars.....
The alligator appetizer is delicious. The pork is also very good and the rabbit an dumplings is good but could use a little more seasoning.

omg,everything taste so great. We order oyster and fries alligators. In order ham hock as my entrees.i just wanna said omg omg omg. And staff so nice. Everything is perfect..中国朋友一定要来这家餐馆吃饭，真的太好吃。我点了烤生蚝和炸鳄鱼肉，烤生蚝真的非常好吃，我还点了肘子，跟我们平常吃的不一样，真的非常好吃

This place is great...the food, the service...let me elaborate on the service.  I had to send back my meal because the steak was a bit under done for me.  I had eaten probably 1/3 of the plate...they brought me an entire new plate of food!  That really says something to me.

Walking into this restaurant it was very busy and loud. The building and atmosphere inside is beautiful! You can tell large parties and couples all fit in here. Being a college student on a budget I ordered a Bourbon cocktail called the Blood of Men. It was okay but tasted more like straight Bourbon.  The staff at the front seemed nice but the longer we were their the weirder the staff got. They just seemed awkward. Also our waitress seemed to disappear for long periods of time. I got the catfish dinner. It was good but seemed a bit over priced. My friend got a rabbit pot pie that tasted very good but once again was a bit much. The prices have been raised from what is on the menu on this app. Good date night but definitely hit the top of my budget!

NO-CHON. All hype no substance.  First of all THE SERVICE SUCKS.  Give yourself plenty of time to eat because you will need to flag down the staff for everything.   

Ordered the salad with goat cheese, pumpkin and lots of other goodies.  It showed up lacking all the goodies, but lots of onions snuck in (not listed as an ingredient) and the remake never returned (finally told the waitress to just forget it).   The beef brisket is good but really fatty.  Yes, fat = flavor, but expected a leaner cut at these prices.  

The worst was a pork patty thing that tasted like a salt lick.  Inedible. 

I would not return.
Great food and libations. The jitterbug perfume was so good! All of the dishes we tried were delicious. Worth the long walk.

This restaurant is more of the cutting edge I was looking for in NOLA, so was happy that we were able to squeeze in between the reservations.  Had the alligator- hmmmm, would not bother again.  It looks like KFC little bites, and no discernible taste.  Could have been chicken for all we knew.  Oh well, gotta try alligator.  Small rolls with dinner were fab.  The Cochon plate with pulled pork, sauerbraten, and pork cracklings was well worth the try, and the fish special was definitely good with an excellent sauce.  But did I discern Sriracha mayo?  Don't know for sure.  Drinks were fine, atmosphere is excellent.  I enjoyed this meal but am not sure it reached the level of 4 stars.  If you are going to the WWII museum it is just a block away and a great end to a day of seeing why the greatest generation IS the greatest generation.

Lord have mercy! The smoked oysters are amazing! And I don't even like oysters! The blend of smoke and spice was so perfect that we just had to order another round. Each order comes with 5 oysters so it was perfect to share family style! Best appetizer choice of our Nola travels! 

For a true New Orleans experience, we tried the fried alligator. It has the consistency of frog but the taste of chicken. We liked the chili aioli blend but wished it had more mint parsley and onion within it. If you haven't tried it and you don't have much time left on your travels, definitely come here to try. If there are other options I recommend elsewhere. 

Yes, I know you are wondering it, they serve free bread and butter here, and it is absolutely addicting. Happy travels!!

Four of us dined here on December 26th. We order and share and share and share, then took leftovers to eat later. Everything was absolutely fabulous. All of the wait staff, chefs and hostess were so very kind, helpful and made our time there exceptional. I would suggest Cochon to everyone.
Incredible! I hardly ever give 5 stars. The Cochon was out of the world. The oysters were so flavorful. Bread was perfect for soaking up all the sauces. Such a good experience.

Out of all the places I wanted to try, Cochon was the one I surely wanted to make reservations for. It was a definite must. Should my plans all fall apart, I knew there would at least be one place to save my trip.

Cochon means "pig" in French and I was definitely stuffed like one by the end of the meal. I started off with the popular Fried Alligator with Chili Garlic Mayonnaise. It was a fried alligator bites mixed with the mayonnaise and accompanied with mint leaves. I loved how the batter didn't become soggy even dressed with the mayonnaise. It was my first time trying alligator so it did have this fish/chicken-like texture. Also, it was a little chewy. Don't know if that's the case with all alligator but I'll have to try another alligator dish to compare.

Next were the Fried Boudin with Pickled Peppers. They were fried to golden crispy deliciousness. You could taste the rice, the pork, and the veggies. It was sublime dipped with the mustard and the peppers cleansed the palate from all that richness.

The entree I chose was the Louisiana Cochon with Cabbage, Cracklins, and Pickled Peaches. I thought the meat was nice and juicy but the sauce was a little salty for my taste. The cracklins were like pork potato chips. Excellent. 

I wasn't planning to get dessert but my awesome server convinced me otherwise. The Chocolate Hazelnut Pudding seemed like something that wouldn't take too much space in my stomach. I liked it and it seemed like a satisfying Nutella-style pudding. 

There were a few subtle misses but overall the experience was great at Cochon. 

Overall: 4.5 stars

Our dinner experience was like being at a track meet. I'm disappointed in the service.My wife and I had a very rushed meal . When I voiced this to the server she never slowed it down or seem to care.With all the  other restaurants in NOLA,we should have gone somewhere else. Service didn't match price point.Food was okay but didn't wow us ...$29 for brisket seemed high for what was on the plate.

The food was good, but writing a review about the service. For such a well known restaurant, my group was really disappointed in the service. For example, when I asked what "Cochon" was, I was given a very brief almost rude explanation: "it's pork." Moreover, our waitress never checked on us during the course of the meal. She only came over to take our orders and give us the check. Our water glasses remained empty through the course of the meal. Very disappointing!

You get what you pay for. Excellent service and very good food but really pricy for us. We went for lunch. 4 people 2 drinks 3 entrees (a salad, a sandwich, and the brisket) 2 small plates for $140 (with tip). I thought The portions were a bit on the small side especially the salad but we did all leave with plenty of food in our stomaches. I loved the service and food but not sure it is a go back at the prices.

Everything was excellent. Dessert - banana pudding to die for. Liver, beet salad, garlic oysters charcuterie board, fried alligaror, and pig cheeks were all beautifully presented and incredibly flavorful. Fantastic service. Would go back in a heartbeat!

Great comfort food in a casual environment, and OK service.  The "small" plates are generally pretty large, and we felt they tried to have us over order.. Basically we can eat but aren't huge people, and ended up getting less than was recommended (suggested we hadn't ordered enough), but still ended up having too much food.  
The ribs are great, but could be a meal by themselves. I was between 4 stars for the food and 3 for the service we experienced. I'd give it another try though.

Fantastic experience, incredibly diverse menu, great service, yummy cuisine. This place is all about smoked and cured meats along with fantastic side dishes. I had the pork cheeks with turnips along with a side of collard greens. The pork was the most tender cuts I had ever had, with a great, flavor-bomb sauce. The whole meal tasted light and was just the perfect serving size. Would go back in a heartbeat!

very good food ..extremely tasty and we'll flavored..service was also very good..ambience was grt.
Oyster and beet salad were phenomenal..smoked brisket yummy and catfish were delicious..good enough portions for 2..
What a surprise! Amazing food and great atmosphere. Oysters to die for, gumbo that was perfect balance of heat and flavor and a beet salad that I could eat every day.

This place is a gem and server amazing food in a wonderful atmosphere !!!. 
 I only wish I found this restaurant on day 1 of my 3 day trip in New Orleans.  Unfortunately this was my last lunch meal before I left New Orleans or I would have return to eat 1 more time there.

If you ever in the convention center area , end of the Riverwalk outlet or near the WWII museum , please take the 10-15 mins walk and go here and you won't regret it.  The food here is amazing.

My wife & I shared 1 appetizer :  the wood fire oyster and it was so tasty and amazing that my wife ate 4 of them and I only ate 1.  We also shared the Cochon signature dish which have soft pork as the center piece and some cabbage on a nice source underneath the pork and mix in with some really crispy & crunchy octopus (I think) .  Also we shared their special of the day which was a burger.  This is so different from any burger I had at 5 guys or shake shack.  The meat was moist and so much favor.  You have to try it as I cannot really do it justice with words.

I was so full but since the appetizer , entrees was so amazing , I had to order a dessert to try. Since I love the banana pudding at Tao in NYC, I wanted to get the banana pudding here as  a comparison and Cochon's version blew Tao's version away.  It was so beautiful and so warm and tasty that even my wife who is not a big fan of pudding cannot stop.

I also tried the barley & south perish beer and it was really good and washed all the food down in a really satisfying way.

The food itself already justify its 5 stars.  But the waiter and staff there would be the 6 stars.
My waiter was able to describe how all the dishes to me as I order and I can tell he was proud working in such a fine establishment.   The energy from other waiters was good too and they even ask if I needed anything when my main waiter for away.  

I already told all my Facebook friends that I had my best NOLA meal at Cochon and they should make sure they go there if they ever go to NOLA.

The oysters are amazing, the service was helpful and friendly. Be ready for a "bistro" style dining, we loved our neighbors. If you need quiet, this is not for you. We also had gator which was perfectly cooked and seasoned. We had the best time, make sure you try a cocktail on their menu as well.

I had been looking forward to eating at this restaurant for some time, and it was a disappointment. The wait staff was not too friendly plus the food wasn't very good.  I had "cochon" which I assumed would be a signature dish because of its name and it had no flavor. It was service with picked turnip, which also did not have any flavor.  I enjoyed the shrimp and alligator appetizers.  It is a beautiful restaurant, but I will not return.

How how howwwww is this place so popular???? I came here excited to try the short rib dish only to find out it had been discontinued. Instead I got the braised beef dish which I was told was the substitute of the previous short rib dish. It was literally awful, to the point that I had to throw it up. It had the ODDEST marinade that literally tasted like pure vinegar. I wanted to still give it a try so I asked the waiter for a sweet sauce in an attempt to balance it out. The BBQ sauce he got me was SO spicy and hot that all the different flavors just messed with my stomach and made me yack. The mac and cheese was good but supppppper heavy for a "side dish." The waiter was very kind and took the beef dish off the bill.
Sort of overrated. I ate the pork cheek app and brisket main course. Both were very salty. Derive was great, awesome ambiance. Excellent whiskey menu.

AMAZING! I would highly recommend this restaurant. We went here randomly after Yelp reviews and didn't regret it for a second. The atmosphere is trendy southern charm, definitely fun and lively.

THE FOOD: OMG. It is amazing. If you're looking for real southern Cajun food, go here. We had the ousters to start - they were perfectly cooked with a little kick to them. Then the fried alligator... which at was a little weirded out to try but loved. Tasted like a cross between chicken and popcorn shrimp. Then we had the gumbo, it was so savoy and rich. This one was thin in consistency with less "stuff" in it, still great flavor. For our main, we have the brisket. WOW was it good, so buttery and melted apart. It came with horseradish potato salad. I don't even like potato salad and I loved it. We had it with the eggplant and shrimp side... that was my boyfriends favorite thing. 

I had the Jenny Diver Mule to drink, it was also amazing. It had vodka, grapefruit, ginger beer and miles spices. It had a great warmth to it. We had the chocolate German cake for dessert, a little dry but hey, it chocolate cake. 

The service was good, but could of been a little quicker. We really enjoyed our time so it wasn't a big deal. 

We couldn't even pick a favorite dish. It was all amazing! Overall we would HIGHLY recommend and will be back if we are ever in NOLA again! Thanks for a great first night, Cochon.

We thought we were going into the sandwich place but ended up here instead. It was a perfect light lunch. I had the mushroom salad which was amazing and I will make it at home! My friend got the beet salad we all liked it as well just wish it could be an entree size! we shared a gumbo I wasn't a fan but I am not always a gumbo fan my daughter got the oysters and mac n cheese she's 11. she loves her oysters but the mac n cheese gets a 5 and she doesn't usually love mac n cheese places. 
so overall we give it a 4. nice light lunch and now we can go find beniets (sp) in the french quarter

Went here with my husband on our second day of NOLA vacation. Heard about the restaurant via organic living magazine and NYT. After checking out some reviews on Yelp, we were sold. 
Went around 3pm on a Saturday after visiting the WWII museum. Got seating outdoors right away. Ordered a few beers (solid selection of local brews) and the jenny diver mule. I had the Cochon entree and my husband ordered the ribs. 
Drinks were excellent, especially the mule. Very pretty and not too sweet. Didn't seem super strong which is good for some but maybe not so for others! Food arrived promptly and was simply extraordinary. My cochon was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Cracklins on top were amazing. Husbands ribs were just the right balance of smoky, tangy, little bit sweet and tender. 
Service was attentive and friendly. All in all, very satisfied and would absolutely recommend to anyone visiting the area!

I can not describe how amazing this food is! My friend and I came here and shared four small plates and two desserts. Even the complimentary bread was incredible! We ordered the macaroni and cheese, fried alligator legs (my personal favorite! Mind blowing), the cucumber salad (how can a salad be so good?!) and the oyster plate. For dessert we had the German chocolate cake and bread pudding. This is the type of food I will dream of and that will make me wish I didn't live 2000 miles away from this special place. The service as great as well. For all those plates, desserts, and three drinks we walked out for less than $100. I highly recommend. Oh, but make a reservation!

I picked up and headed to NOLA with two goals in mind --- 1) eat as much I possibly could with no budget in mind and 2) only eat seafood as I can without having iodine or mercury poisoning.  Luckily this joint allowed me to do both. The atmosphere is chic and it's glaringly obvious as your uber pulls up that you're at the cool place in town.  There is an eclectic mix of diners and you're aware this is the weekend hot spot as the bar and room are entirely packed. I started with a bourbon cocktail and oysters and oh dear they were the perfect combination of spice and ocean salt. I continued with a glass of wine and the gulf fish. Perfectly seasoned and executed skin on elegance. This place is worth the hype y'all.

I had eaten here 8 years ago and it was the highlight of the trip, I went back today for lunch and it is still amazing.
The service is very friendly, informative and efficient.
I had the cochon house dish, of basically a fried puck of pulled pork, on top of braised cabbage, with large prom cracklings on top.
A healthy glug of the homemade hot sauce and a well balanced cocktail helped cut through the richness.
Yum! Everything played so well together. The flavors were very complimentary, great array of textures, nice presentation. I had to remind myself to slow down and take smaller bites when I realized I was getting sauce on my chin.
The bread is very good here. Home made Parker house type rolls.
They gave an amuse bouche of the head cheese. It was a nice taste, but I wouldn't get a whole order of it.

Delicious! We started the night here for my friend's Bachelorette party. We opted to share a bunch of small plates, my favorites being the oysters and crawfish pie. After that, we shared the strawberry pie and a pumpkin dessert, both incredible. I would definitely recommend for my friends to go to Cochon if they are in New Orleans!

While traveling on business, this was a recommendation from a colleague.  And a solid recommendation it was.  Everyone at our table enjoyed our meal.  We started with the wood grilled oysters which were delicious.  The oysters were great and than you take the rolls to soak up the extra garlic and butter!  I had the rabbit and dumplings which was unique and good.  It was a bit spicy to my surprise but still so good.  I also had the Jenny Diver Mule and I was a big fan!!  I would recommend to anyone traveling to NOLA to stop in and enjoy!!
The ribs there are amazing, and I also tried the crawfish pie, which is supervising tasty. And they have a good collection of beers and whiskey

Cochon was one my musts when visiting New Orleans and it wasn't a disappointment. One word to describe the food here is, AMAZING! This probably is one of the best tasting food I've ever had, and from what I hear, Anthony Bourdain digs this place too.

The fried boudin was love at first bite for my boyfriend. The crispy casing, to the blend of their pork and rice sausage was so delicious. I've tried boudin balls at other Cajun restaurants and they didn't amount to these ones since the others were bland, but this one just tasted so right. My favorite thing on this menu are the smoked pork ribs. The meat was fall of the bone, oh so tender, and the flavor was perfect with the right mix of spice & rub, and then topped with a watermelon pickle. Loved this dish so much, I wish I could've gotten a second round. As a side, the mac & cheese casserole was a nice add to the table.

Located outside the popular French Quarter, this restaurant is worth making a trip for. There's no parking lot, but street parking is throughout the block. It's a very clean and chill spot to hit up.

I came here with my wife and came back the next day with a friend. Go here and get the smoke oysters. And after that get another round of smoke oysters. I'd never had oysters prepared that way and damn it was good. So good we showed up the next night with a friend.

We were in the area after spending hours at the Louisiana Children's Museum and we were hungry, so we found this place and decided to check it out. I love the decor inside, it's really sleek and posh. We were seated immediately and even though there weren't kids menus, our waitress offered other dishes for our kids to eat. However, they're not picky eaters so it didn't matter, but the offer was really sweet.

Things we ordered:
-wood-fired oysters with chili garlic butter (amazing!!!)
-Catfish courtbouillon (Amazing, I licked the plate clean, so many spices and perfectly cooked)
-Smoked beef brisket with horseradish potato salad (really really really good!!!)
-macaroni and cheese casserole for my kids, we loved it so much, it was gone in a matter of minutes!
-Then for dessert, we got Pineapple upside down cake with coconut lime sherbet and dulce de leche. I can't even begin to tell you how this completed our meal so well!

This was one of our favorite restaurants we ate at while in NOLA, I'm really pleased and would come back to NOLA just for this restaurant alone.

Like the restaurant set up. Don't feel claustrophobic. We ate while it was storming out. Lots of light coming in made it a lovely setting. 

Service was prompt, welcoming and friendly. Adjusted our wine request without any fuss, when the first one was not to our liking. 

What we had:
Fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise - I don't know if I could tell what alligator tasted like from this dish. The seasoning and sauce made it super tasty. Id get it again. 

whole fried shrimp with pickled mustard seed hot sauce - very tasty. The pickled mustard seed and hot sauce was the surprise and added so much flavor to the already tasty shrimp. We ate the heads and all!

Roasted beat salad was very refreshing and tasty

oven-roasted gulf fish "fisherman's style" - it was drum again. And we loved it. Such lovely flaky fish that absorbs the flavors well. I'd like to cook this fish. 

Creamy grits were perfection. The others had never had grits before. They became fans. Well done. 

Dessert:
German chocolate cake - moist and delicious

Pineapple upside down cake with coconut lime sherbet & dulce de leche - amazing. It was warm and delicious. The fresh pineapples made the difference.

We had such an amazing time at Cochon Butcher and couldn't wait to go next door to the Cochon restaurant. It was very classy compared to the casualness of Butcher with a beautiful interior. Our server was extremely informative and attentive throughout the whole meal. 

We ended up having a light meal and ordered: 
Louisiana blue crab fried rice - Loved every grain of rice in this dish! Perfectly fried and crunchy with good bits of crab in every bite.

Whole fried shrimp with pickled mustard seed hot sauce - We ate everything. Everything on this plate was perfectly fried, not greasy, and went very well with the mustard hot sauce. 

Louisiana cochon with cabbage, cracklins, and pickled turnips - Literally a ball of delicious meat topped with cracklins everywhere. The cabbage was cooked well and soaked up all the liquid. The pickled turnips added a nice crunch to the dish and cut the grease from the pork. 

Overall, great meal and delicious foods!
It was crowded and had to wait. Nice service and exotic meats. Ordered boucherie plate, remind me of the Italian cold cut.
Awesome!  Fried alligator tender and great flavor.  Crawfish pie, flakey crust and delicious.  Boucherie meat plate was outstanding.  A must place to try if you are in New Orleans.

Wow. The companion (upscale) accompaniment to the Cochon Butcher around the corner. Wow. Hip place with a nice casual atmoshphere. Ended up here because as usual the butcher had a line around the block.
For the food:  amazing.  Cant wait to eat there for a dinner service (we went for lunch).

Special: slow roasted mustard rubbed porkbelly loin.  On a potato roll with slaw and aioli. Soooo tender.  Side of broccoli carrot salad with golden raisins. Yum. 

We also had wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter (smoky, spicy and big) as well as the near magical crawfish pie with some kind of spicy chutney. Seriously, the crawfish pie was out of this world. My girlfriend was still talking about it the next day.
The best. The food was awesome the waitress was excellent. I will definitely come back.
Yummmmmmmm! A must go in NOLA! Fried alligator, grilled oysters, orgasmic spare ribs... stands out even in the midst of NOLA's considerable culinary gems. GO!

A friend recommended this place while visit NOLA. Ordered a apple martini  strike 1. They couldn't make it. That's a first for me. Settled for a cosmopolitan. The size left a lot to be desired. It was literally shorter than my dinner knife-strike 2. For dinner ordered the Catfish Courtboullion looked awesome until I dung. It tasted like the time my salt container cap fell off!! My blood pressure shot up. They offered to remake it no change. Aw well can't win them all

A must go to in New Orleans but reservations are a must! Service is good but could have been better; the quality and tastefullness of the food made up for it. Very trendy and fun ambience! This goes straight to the top of my lists-
- rabbit dumplings were my fav
-pork cheek country captain was mind blowing
- smoked ham hock was delish
- chicken chilli soup was amazing
THE END

My favorite dish was the fried gators. It felt light for a fried dish. Not too salty. 

The staff was kind and more than one person served us and took care of us. It felt like we were being attended to. 

The ambiance was perfect. I am having a fascination to wood art and this place was filled with well-crafted wood. Wood tables and chairs, bar chairs, wood wall accents and it felt clean and put together. 

We walked here from our hotel so I am not too sure about parking. 

Thank you for a wonderful experience here in New Orleans.

Incredible food. Try the oyster appetizer! Simply amazing. Do make a reservation ahead of time. We didn't and sat at the bar for lunch. What a treat while visiting Nola. Leave room for dessert. Good portions.

The food was excellent. Garlic chili oysters, beet salad, pork cheek, chicken livers, rabbit dumplings, greens..  everything the four of us ate was really good. The service was not. Our waiter disappeared for a really long time and the food runner had to fill our drinks and clear out plates.

And to think that we thought about cancelling our reservation! It was the last night of our NOLA trip and we were just a bit tired. We thought about cancelling and just ordering room service, but I'm so glad my BF reminded me that it was our LAST night in NOLA, let's just check it out. OMG! The meal and service at Cochon was amazing! I'm so glad I didn't give in and we kept our reservation. We had to try the oysters as everyone says they're the BEST and THEY ARE! I decided to keep it somewhat light so I could enjoy dessert and had the turkey neck and tasso gumbo . . . YUM! I also had the beet salad . . . Amazing! My BF had the smoked brisket with horseradish potato salad. . . THE BEST EVER! For dessert we went with the banana pudding and it did not disappoint! I know, so many exclamation points, but when you dine there you'll know why. We just wish we had bigger appetites so we could've tried some of the other appetizers. The whisky flight was also delightful. This was one of our best meals ever in NOLA. Looking forward to our next trip back!

I was disappointed in a couple areas of this restaurant.  The tables are too cramped in, one side is a long bench you are sharing with other diners, knocking elbows if not careful. While the restaurant was half empty they seat you right next to other diners and it is impossible to have a private conversation.  The food was good, not outstanding and I felt it was overpriced for what you receive.  Service was fair at best. We were not told about the specials which was disappointing when we heard them for the next table's waitress.  We had Fish and the Rabbit n dumplings, they were seasoned well.  Alligator bites would have been better if not drowning in sauce that made them soggy.  Rolls were hard on top and stale.  Perhaps I set my expectations too high after reading some of the reviews.  Average, overpriced, cramped and loud is how I found it.

My boyfriend and I stopped here on our way to the WWII museum for lunch. It was in a semi-industrial area and the restaurant stands alone. The smell of a wood fire fills the restaurant, but isn't overwhelming. We were seated immediately and the service was quick! The waiters were very knowledgeable and gave good recommendations. They also had a lot of daily specials, in addition to the menu. Excellent drink menu. I thought this was going to be more of a barbecue restaurant, but was pleasantly surprised.
Awesome yummy food. I recommend the brisket, Cochon, and fried alligator. After all that I was too full for dessert, but it was hard to say no.

Couchon which mean "pig" in French is one of best restaurant in NOLA. And that is saying a lot considering you can't really go wrong with food in New Orleans. But Couchon edge out from the rest due the ambience of the restaurant, location, and of course, the food. As the name suggest, you can't go wrong with any of the meat dishes. Try them ALL! They are that delicious! The Mac & Cheese was mouth watering good. Alligator meat was out of this world and have to be tasted at least once. My friends and I had our bachelorette dinner at Couchon and the drinks were also absolutely amazing! 

Honestly, you can't go wrong of any of the dishes ordered at Couchon. It is THAT good!

4 star food and 5 star service with our waiter Sean !!!
Alligator tastes like meaty fried calamari... wood fried oyster is flavorful and we end our dinner with pineapple upside down cake, yummy!!
Trendy but relax feel, will be back again!!
Perfect spot. Must go if in New Orleans. Oysters and gator are definite buys. Rabbit dumplings were amazing. A couple extra pieces of rabbit wouldn't hurt.

This review is teetering on the edge of a 3-star review but I had to give credit where credit is due.

Stopped in Cochon for a late dinner on our first night in New Orleans. I'd browsed the yelp page and already knew what I wanted. 

To start, we had a cocktail. Can't remember what it was but it was rye based and delicious. Had a rosemary garnish.
We shared the alligator bites and wood-fired oysters.
The oysters are 10 stars. So tender and the chili butter .. OMG. Dip the AMAZING rolls they give you into this butter once you've scarfed down the oysters. Cannot recommend these enough to my oyster lovers out there. 
Alligator bites were OK. I think I just don't like gator.. Have tried it in 2 nice restaurants in NOLA & Charleston. It just reminds me of chewy chicken in Chinese food. I'll skip next time.

For main courses, my boyfriend had the rabbit & dumplings. I kept stealing bites because it was so delicious and comforting. Like the best chicken pot pie you'll ever have.
