You might be wondering, what is a vegetarian doing at a restaurant named "cochon" (pig in English)?!?  I had a work dinner with my colleagues and they picked a place focused on eating dead pigs so what was I supposed to do?  I didn't want to be that "difficult vegetarian", so I went with the flow.

Cochon was featured on Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations and it's been written up about so I was curious to see what this pig-obsessed restaurant would be like.  Since we were a large group, we had to do a special sharing prix-fixe where it was $55 per person to share a bunch of food that I couldn't even eat.  We didn't realize we had to share everything until we got to the restaurant and I didn't understand why it wasn't just a regular individual prix-fixe for $55.  The value of the meal was terrible for someone that doesn't eat dead pigs so I don't recommend this restaurant if you're a vegetarian/pescatarian.  The server also made me feel like a problem as a pescatarian and was kind of salty even though I had called ahead of time and arranged for one of the courses to be pescatarian.

While I was dissatisfied with their food selection, they did have a nice assortment of unique cocktails.  I had the Smoke on the Water, which was a Mezcal cocktail with sage, honey, and smoked salt.  The smokiness came through and the sage gave it a comforting flavor. From the few things I could eat, everything tasted good but I wasn't blown away by it.  I really think this place puts most of their effort into their meat.

The bread with butter was delicious, the wood-fired oysters in chili-garlic butter were heavenly but I could only try one since we were all sharing 6 oysters and paying and arm and a leg.  The opening appetizer, a poached shrimp in a clam broth with basil and chilis was refreshing and unique, but not very exciting, I was appreciative of the fact that they let me have that while everyone ate the charcuterie board.  I think there were about 4 main meat courses served and one of the last dishes presented was a fish served "fisherman's style" with some nice spices and seasonings garnished with onions and cilantro, I've had better fish in Chicago though.  It just wasn't as good as it looked.  I think the texture could have been flakier and it could have been seasoned more.  The side of the macaroni and cheese casserole was another highlight of the meal.  It was rich, baked, and glorious, but when you're paying $55 for a prix-fixe meal, the best part of the meal shouldn't be the macaroni and cheese.  The desert platter was sinfully tasty and the best part of the meal since I could eat it with everyone.  The key lime pudding was extremely refreshing and the Malted Chocolate Cake was decadently delicious.

Cochon is in the Warehouse District so it's going for a modern, New American vibe.  I liked the ambience but that was pretty much it.  On top of not being able to eat most of this shared meat feast, they tried to charge me an extra $9 for the shrimp on top of the regular $55 prix fixe.  I of course had to argue with the server and he was pretty rude about it but they fixed it.  I was pretty disgusted that they tried to make me pay more when I barely ate this $55 shared prix-fixe meal.  I obviously don't plan on coming back here again and I don't recommend this for anyone with a dietary restriction.  It's just one of those places that thinks carnivorously eating dead animals is trendy and I'm over it.

Awesome, everything we ordered was fantastic.
You must get the oysters, MAC N Cheese, and
The smoked ham hock was quite a surprise, the rice and beans with it was so delicious.

Phenomenal dinner. Got the oysters and alligator as appetizers. Easily two of the best appetizers that I've ever had. The oysters were amazing. Large and well prepared. The fried alligator was delicious. My dinner partner for the rabbit and dumplings and I got the short ribs. The rabbit and dumplings was supposed to be chicken and dumplings but with rabbit vice chicken. This wasn't explained well on the menu but the dish was very tasty, just a little surprising to the person that ordered. The short ribs were great. Additionally the drink prices were some of the most reasonable I've seen at a full service restaurant in recent memory. All told a great experience and I am looking forward to going back!

This restaurant was FABULOUS! The Wood Fired Oysters were heavenly (save the sauce and dip your Brioche in it...yum)!
The Louisiana Cochon dish was super yummy. I had a side of limas and they were "to die for"! Hubby had the Gulf Fish Plate (black drum on the half-shell, wood fired to perfection) and Mac & Cheese!
I had the mid-level Bourbon Flight and I am now enamored with Noahs Mill Bourbon!
Pricy night, but worth every penny.
All staff were friendly and we met two great couples because the atmosphere seems to encourage friendliness and outreach with your fellow dining neighbors when you are dining with 2!
I hope to be back again!

This is a really nice, more modern restaurant than I am used to dining at in NOLA. Something you'd find in most cosmopolitan cities; smaller, food centric menus offering a little something for everyone. Done with great attention but over the top. 
Mary, our server was attentive but non pushy; answering my many questions and offering suggestions. She was very pleasant and was able to carefully space several courses over a few hours. Well done, Mary. 
I started with the Boudin balls and shared a charcuterie plate with my dinner mate. The charcuterie was big and could have easily fed 4. Seeing this, I knew I had to take it easy to enjoy my salad course; blue crab dressed in green goddess and served over a nice light selection of greens. Light and fresh. Lastly I had the rabbit and dumplings. Forgoing the fish [my 1st choice] since I've had plenty of seafood this week; the rabbit was perhaps a slight mistake. It wasn't bad but it might as well have been a chicken pot pie. Next time I will trust my instincts.
Overall a very good restaurant with a great selection of craft drinks, micro beers and a nice wine list. Highly recommend when or if you ever tire of traditional NOLA creole cuisine. Which I never do.

I will start by saying that it's not kid friendly at all. And our kids were legit perfect last night. I'm glad they were because I don't think I could have handled it if they hadn't been. 

The service was awful. I almost always tip at least 20% and did not last night. 

I can't even remember what I ordered honestly. My SO liked his last night but when I asked how we should review it, he couldn't even recall what we had ate. That's a pretty telling sign

He had the Cochon. And, like I said, he seemed to enjoy it when he was eating it.

Char boiled oysters were amazing! The whole place smelt like peat! Staff on point! Poached shrimp with grilled cucumbers, basil, chilis and clam broth. Pork cheek sauce piquant with hominy grit cake. All delicious!

Superb small plates!  Everything we tried was delicious. The charbroiled oysters, a couple of salads (the crab was sweet - a standout), desserts...  Charles, our server, was polite, professional, and unpretentious.  Cochon was outstanding!
不太符合亚洲人口味，但是单论菜的质量还是不错的，那个cochan是用五花，香肠不同部位的肉混在一起煎的，上边还有油渣，rib有点像腊肉的感觉，炸鳄鱼肉酸甜口的，味道还可以

Easily a four and a half star restaurant! Had an incredible linch there today. First time eating alligator.... it was fried, garlic mayo excellent, taste as subtle as chicken but texture like a lobster tail. 
The Outstanding short-ribs, this pie e of neat fell apart with the fork,  and the meat was juicy and flavorful. I also had the gumbo, rich smoky flavor made each bite-a real treat.
Then there was cake!!!!!

I don't get the hype. I had the gumbo and it was ok at best. Really salty. I asked for bread to go with it and got severe attitude. Oh, my bad. Just thought you'd serve it like every restaurant in New Orleans. We also ordered the gator appetizer which was cooked really well but covered in a mayo chili sauce that was pretty unappetizing, and the oysters which I did not try so I can't say if they were good or not. 
Service was pretty terrible. Multiple servers came to our table but were clearing things before we'd actually finished with them. At one point they moved our phones to take our napkins away. There were plenty of empty tables and we weren't exactly taking up prime real estate during peak meal time. Our waiter cashed us out and we had to go up to the bar to buy more drinks. There was just a feeling of being pushed out by the staff that was extremely irritating. I'm assuming it was a manger standing in the back near our table who also kept looking over like he either wanted us out or was expecting us to run out on the bill. 
All around an underwhelming experience. The high reviews are surprising but maybe I'm missing something or went on an off day. Regardless, I wouldn't go back.

Good but nothing amazing. Everything was done well and tasty but the hype and expectations set by the reputation and james beard award left us wanting a lot more or at least something that stood out that would be special.

The staff was amazing. The place had a very comfortable feel to it. And the open kitchen was a great touch.  To start off I had a Blanche Devereaux which was a great rye drink. Then I had the Louisiana Cochon with cracklings cabbage and pickled turnips. It was one of the best meals I've had in a long time. Thanks for the suggestion to our waiter.

What can I say, this is simply not a lunch place. Perhaps the butcher around the corner is the lunch place. But this place is not. No matter what you order, the portions are very small and expensive. Additionally, the service leaves something to be desired. The restaurant is so busy that the servers are scrambling to keep up with the pace. It wears on their attitudes.

I ordered two different dishes because the first was such a small portion. I finally gave up the ghost and decide not to worry about cost. The second dish was smaller than the first. The food alone with tip was close to $40.

The food was good. They use unconventional cuts of meat and do extraordinary things with them.

Of course, I ordered a beer too. I am always ready for the mark up here not a big deal. But what lost this place one more star is at the bartender had a big sneeze and did not cover his mouth. He sneezed all over the bottles and the draft pulls and anything else left out. I immediately asked for the check and had to leave. I don't think I'll be returning anytime soon.

Arrived just before 5 today and glad we did as the place filled quickly. We all ordered a different sandwich and everyone said they would order it again. The service was very good ( glasses never went empty).  Staff very helpful with recommendations from a group of first timers. Will come back the next time we visit New Orleans.
Great food! Creative dishes!! Really can't wait to back. Impossible not to eat this bread!!!!

We ate here after visiting the WWII Museum. The staff were very friendly and alert. Service was timely and the atmosphere was great. All the food was excellent, but their Mac & Cheese Casserole stood out. If you go here, GET THE MAC AND CHEESE! I swear to you, it is the best Mac & Cheese on Planet Earth! If you're in New Orleans and looking for somewhere to eat, do not miss out on Cochon.

What a treat this place was. We came in with a large group and they absolutely catered to us. It was a prefixed menu that was a sampling of all the restaurant's best dishes. We were able to sample the best of NOLA with some added bonuses.  I was so busy eating and enjoying I forgot to take pics.  The service was impeccable and the restaurant was lovely. We will definitely be returning to this gem.

This restaurant was amazing. The ambiance and decorum were second to none, very elegant yet welcoming to all. The food is top notch. I highly recommend the oyster appetizers and the rabbit! Also, the djinn & juice is a VERY tasty drink. I will be back here as SOON as I'm back in NOLA.

Among all the restaurants that would cost you $30 a meal with tiny portions of food, Cochon has one of the most unique menu items and great service and bread which help fill your stomach. 

Cannot recommend more for the oysters. The kimchi flavor oysters just pure genius invention. Cannot find it anywhere easily and so yummy. 

The gumbo is more on the salty side. The first sip I feel like the soup is overwhelmed by the flavor of the sausage but with more water, the soup starts to taste fantastic. 

If you are around the garden district or the World War II Museum you should give this place a try. You won't be disappointed.

Our very first ( and probably last) experience at Cochon was a disappointment. We decided to opt out of the entrees and order a few appetizers and the daily special. The fried alligator and oysters were tasty but not mind blowing. We also ordered the macaroni and cheese, which was slightly overseasoned and with the extra bonus of an unsightly stray hair that got in during preparation. We notified our waiter immediately, and he offered to bring us a new order of it, which was definitely nice of him. A few minutes later, a busser stopped by our table and asked if we wanted a refill on the root beer we had. When it came time for the bill, we discovered that the macaroni and cheese was comped but the root beer was charged twice. Essentially, we paid $5 for a refill without being warned beforehand that that we'd be charged. While some dishes were tasty, it was not worth the hype. Would not recommend.

The greens were amazing. To say the wood fired oysters were delicious is a huge understatement. Best mac and cheese I've ever had. I couldn't stay long as we were in a hurry to get to a museum,  but I plan to go back ASAP.

Outstanding. 

Bacon oyster sandwich alone is beyond amazing. 

Toss in the rest of the menu and you won't find another place better in NOLA.

Unfortunately, I just had a big lunch and was only able to eat some appetizers here along with dessert. I wish I had more space in my belly because everything was incredibly delicious! We had the smoked pork ribs and Mac n cheese casserole. The service was also on point. It was interesting because it felt like we only had one waiter/server even though there were two. They worked really well together. The reason why it's only four stars is because I really wanted their chocolate beignets. I had seen other helpers pictures and originally only intended to get that at the restaurant. Unfortunately, it seems like their desserts are seasonal and it was no longer being offered. I was disappointed, especially since I had checked the menu before hand to make sure. Even today it's still listed there. Perhaps I heard our waitress wrong and they ran out but if that was the case I wish they would add a little note. I would suggest you call ahead just to make sure they have the dessert you want! Still, Cochon is incredibly delicious and definitely a must if in NOLA!

I have no idea how this place has a 4-star rating as it was absolutely terrible. We were trying to go to Cochon Butcher, but were confused (they have the same address) and wound up at Cochon. Here's what we ordered and our thoughts:

- Mac n Cheese Casserole: It was fine, but nothing to write home about. It was essentially just mac n cheese with way too much pepper in it.

- Fried Alligator: This was probably the best dish out of the three. It was spicy but flavorful. It was my first time trying alligator and I think the breading and sauce masked the taste of the actual meat. Overall had the consistency of calamari, but tougher.

Boucherie Plate: DISGUSTING. Do not order this. I'm not even positive what was on this plate. It was absolutely terrible. There were what looked and tasted like intestines, a plain crunchy bread, cauliflower, and other weird meats. Honestly, only one meat was edible and it was a salami. We barely touched this plate as it was unappetizing. 

Lastly, the service was mediocre. We had two waitresses, neither of which introduced themselves. They also didn't describe what was on the Boucherie plate, which was odd to me. No thank you for coming in, nothing like that.

Overall, would not recommend this place to anyone.

I went here with a group of six while in town for work. We made reservations for a Friday night at 9:30 PM, and were seated quickly. Our waiter took our drink orders and left us to look over the menu. That's about the time the pleasantness ended.

Our waiter had a serious attitude. He responded to a request for suggestions by saying, "I don't know what you like." He didn't offer us a second round of drinks until we flagged him down, then it took more than half an hour to get them. We ordered dessert and he recited it back to us...but it was incorrect. When I pointed out his error, he responded, "I got it, okay?" in a very curt way. 

The worst thing, though, was the racism. He filled all the water glasses but the one belonging to my black co-worker. Took a second drink order from everyone but didn't acknowledge the black guy. Didn't offer the black guy dessert. I wanted to say something, but my co-worker wouldn't let me. I normally wouln't rate one star based on one bad server, but this was unacceptable.

The food was delicious, though. So maybe you'll have a better experience if you only go with white friends.
Just say yes to this foodie experience.  Delicious! Pork and cracklin' and yum! The cocktails were good. The blueberry cocktail was refreshing.
We went for the first time last night. The food and service were both excellent. Favorites included the fried chicken livers, cold corn crab soup and pineapple upside down cake. Great dinner!
This place was great overall,  from the quick service to the ribs and amazing rabbit and dumplings.   I will come back here again the next time I am in town.

Had a really good experience at this restaurant. Definitely recommend if in NOLA. 
We sat by the bar (full service) in a busy Saturday. Cocktails were really impressive!! Bartender's version of Old Fashioned is one of the best I've ever had.
We also tried some small plates (delicious poached shrimp and alligator which was chewy, not worthy ) and entrées were lamb with pilaf - good - with side of Mac and Cheese: order it!!! Really amazing. Service was great but we were by the bar so not sure about the main room.

The best dining experience we had on our trip to NOLA. It only took us the very last day and last meal to find it. The atmosphere was up our alley -- space was clean, vibrant and the food was delightful. My catfish was light and flavorful. The oysters were to die for and my dining partner doesn't even like oysters. The cocktails were fun and unique. Fun and clever names. Service was fantastic.

Cochon was the last dinner we had in NOLA and it was a great meal. Our party of five was able to make some last minute reservations for 9 pm on a Monday. We walked over from the French Quarter (about a 30 minute walk) for our late dinner. Since we all like trying different things, we just ordered a few dishes to share:

Fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise - if you've never had alligator before, it kind of tastes like a chewier chicken. The 'nuggets' were perfectly fried and I especially liked the chili garlic mayonnaise.

Crab and tomato salad - this was their special app of the day and it was great. I know the general rule is that you're not supposed to order a restaurant's special, but this is one of the cases where I'm glad we did. It was a nice and refreshing salad.

Boucherie plate - a bunch of mystery meats, which I forgot immediately after our waiter brought it out and explained to us. I just remember liking the crispy pieces of bread.

Louisiana cochon with cabbage, cracklins & pickled turnips - I really liked the cracklings. I think this actually stole the show from the cochon.

Oven-roasted gulf fish "fisherman's style" - I can't remember what type of fish they said this was but it was pretty basic. It's nothing you couldn't make at home with some spices and some lemon.

Braised beef short rib with rice pilaf & mushroom gravy - I'm not a huge fan of braised meats, but the mushroom gravy was very good.

Macaroni & cheese casserole - really can't go wrong with mac and cheese. I only wish we had ordered another one.

They have a sister restaurant, Cochon Butcher which I have been wanting to try, so I'll definitely have to make that one of my stops the next time I'm in New Orleans.

First time having boudin balls and I'm glad I had it here. Delicious! Also get the gumbo... my friend who I traveled with was on the quest for the best gumbo in town and practically ordered it at every restaurant we went to... and this one took the prize. Slow claps for this establishment.

We were deciding between here and Cochon Butcher. We are so happy we had our lunch here. The food was delicious. We visited WWII museum and wanted to explore the area. This restaurant is walking distance, so I highly recommend the walk for the food. I ordered the braised beef short ribs with rice and mushrooms, my husband got the gumbo and heirloom tomatoes with crab salad. We also shared the mushroom pie as an appetizer. Let's just say we inhaled our meal. The mushroom pie is a large mushroom empanada. The crust was crusty and flaky and there has to be at least half a pound of mushroom inside. Very enjoyable. The bread provided with lunch was freshly baked and it absorbed all the fatty deliciousness of the braised short ribs. The gumbo was made from a dark roux and you can taste it in the dish. A little strong in my opinion, but my husband enjoyed it. The crab and heirloom tomatoes was tasty. I was expecting large heirloom tomatoes cut up, but they used grape and cherry sized tomatoes. Good balance with the crab, but I would have enjoyed more tomato umami. I was go here again and explore more of their meal.

Spectacular drinks and delicious food! One of a kind and a must when in NOLA. The stand out for me was the short ribs.. so so good. Some other good dishes were the Mac and cheese, oysters, collard greens and the shrimp eggplant.

Meh. Nothing special except the prices (not in a good way). $54 for one small gumbo (literally one piece of chicken and one piece of sausage in the gumbo), short rib entree, a soda and a sparkling water. Should have went to the butcher side. To top it off, our server had a stinky attitude.

OMG where do I begin!! The food was amazing!! I had the Mac and cheese, alligator, gumbo  and the collards!! The chocolate cake was out of this world also!! The servers were hilarious! Definitely a place you must try when you come to New Orleans!!

Terrible front desk service especially the little troll with the green hair. Super rude to the customers should go back underneath her bridge. As soon as we walked in she had an instant attitude so bad we got up and left. Unfortunate though because the menu looked amazing
Thorough enjoyed this meal. Had the smoked pork ribs and wood fire oysters that were simply delicious! Good portion sizes.

OMG where do I begin!! The food was amazing!! I had the Mac and cheese, alligator, gumbo  and the collards!! The chocolate cake was out of this world also!! The servers were hilarious and amazing! Definitely a place you must try when you come to New Orleans!!

I really liked this place. The staff were pleasant, the menu options were pleasing and the food was good. First time trying Alligator bites.... and I liked it. The dish was seasoned very well. The grits were delicious! You won't be disappoointed after eating here.

Cochon is a neighborhood gem!  The portions are perfectly-sized, making it an ideal choice for lunch.  

This is a pig-lovers dream come true!

Until next time...

If you don't order the grilled oysters you are completely doing something wrong.

Cochon was a wonderful experience for our lunch spot on a Saturday afternoon. We had considered the Butchery next door but ultimately the loudness of the crowd was enough for us to crave some quiet and a nice glass of wine/bourbon.

We are so glad we made the choice to eat here. We sat right away, the service was a little...scattered, though. It was like the server had an extra air about him and wasn't super timely. Then it seemed like they were pulling and service was happening as a team? 

Lunch was delicious and as I mentioned before...the oysters. If you don't like oysters, these will change your mind. Legitimately one of the best bites and some of the best flavors I've ever encountered. Justin had some issues with his Cochon, and I experienced some of the gritty bites that just weren't palatable at times which ruined most of the dish. We mentioned it to our server who just kind of passed it off and didn't do anything about it.

I loved my cucumbers and shrimp. They were light and flavorful and didn't leave me feeling overstuffed for what I knew would be a long day of eating and drinking.

They had some great gluten free options even though they aren't mentioned. I was seriously surprised by the selection as this doesn't often happen within the culinary world.

Wine list was strong as you expect it to be at a Beard establishment. And the bar was cozy and inviting as was the entire interior.

Had a bunch of stuff:
- alligator bites: not that great, too tough for my tastes
- Mac and cheese: very tasty, although not as many cheeses as the one we had at Vin Rouge
- mushroom tart: AWESOME! Had a delicious sauce, crisp flaky crust, yum!
- peppers in a sauce: mildly hot, very tasty (especially in combination with the alligator!
- the "Cochon", their pulled pork marinated in something ... SO SO delicious! Didn't need the pork skins and cabbage it came with, worth the price of admission!
- warm peach pie a la mode: good, but too much crust (vs filling) and not enough ice cream

Go for the Cochon!!

I'm not sure what the hype was about this place. It's the worst service we've experienced during our trip to NOLA and the food was just ok for what it's priced at. We've ordered the wood fire oysters, fried gators, pork cheeks, Cochon (pork shoulder), and Mac and cheese. The best dish was the wood fire oysters and the fried gators.
Found this place on a whim! Sooooo delicious and the server Atticus was very attentive ! I had such a great experience . I highly recommend

Do not miss this establishment!!! Everything is on point. Oyster with chili butter sauce is amazing! Greens perfectly cooked and seasoned. Rabbit and dumplings highly recommended. Blueberry tort is better than any true French Pastry house could prepare. This place you must not miss! 5 stars for ambiance, execution and overall service.

Clean rustic vibe! Our waiter was really nice and answered my 1million questions! Food was just ok.. kids size portions which is good for my belly ( I'm the adult that orders the kids meals and gets full) but not ok in comparison to the price.. my husband ordered the greens and gumbo and he was served greens in a bowl sized for baby food.. and gumbo in a small glass bowl the size of my morning cereal bowl... 
Portions are way to small, prices WAY to big! Food, C+

The dishes at Cochon feature a smart, fun take on Southern cuisine, but the visit was tainted by indifferent, borderline-disrespectful service.

Highlights of the visit were the wood-fired oysters, featuring a tantalizing chili sauce with a perfect amount of heat. Certainly the best oysters we had on our week in New Orleans. The rabbit and dumplings, a hearty earthy dish, were also a delight and a great way to introduce yourself to this unfortunately overlooked protein. The chanterelle mushroom pie is essentially an enormous deep-fried empanada, smaller than a calzone but larger than a typical empanada, which would be a pass on a subsequent visit due to the difficulty with sharing and the fairly unremarkable flavors inside.

Lastly, the visit took a sour note immediately after our server realized we were skipping drinks, even though we ordered quickly and were in and out fairly quickly to not tie up a table for long. We were regularly ignored in favor of nearby tables. The server failed to provide concrete menu recommendations ("everything's good") and completely failed to even check on how the food was after dropping it off. We were ignored until it came time to retrieve empty plates and drop off the check. There was no manager walking the floor checking on guests to backstop potential failings of any particular serve. Meanwhile, there were two employees manning the front without a wait to get in. All unfortunately are signs of a restaurant that's allowed positive coverage to overly go to its head.

Sooo yummy!  All four of us loved our food. Casual, but trendy atmosphere. Seems like they care about the quality of food going out. The server who took our order (and whom we never saw again) was condescending when we asked questions - Rude! - but everyone else was nice. I would definitely eat here again!

Heard that I *have to go here by our bike tour guide. No fail. Cafeteria style dining but pretty nice atmosphere, activity going on at every turn. Good service, made res days in advance, which I recommended. There was a wait line pretty long outside. Pretty big place, you can't see that there's a whole other dining room next to the kitchen. 

Server was good, knew the menu well, descriptions well made. Pork heavy options. Pretty cool Cajun style options.

Had the fried alligator, had a Louisiana style creamy glaze, pretty delish. Also had the fried oysters, great chili butter on it.

Dinner was the braised beef short rib. Very succulent, rich, rice pilaf great. Also had the mc/cheese casserole (omg yummy), and corn chowder soup. Very creole style.

Had the Lima beans, cooked perfect in a smokey gravy.

Overall fun experience, great service. Too full for dessert. Totally recommend this place for small or big parties. Great tine!!

We were very excited to check out this NOLA hotspot! Unfortunately our expectations were kind of dashed once we walked in. The hostesses weren't really warm or welcoming - it seemed like they felt they were doing us a favor by allowing us in to their restaurant lol Um - thanks?

So then we are seated and are excited to order some incredible food! We ordered a bunch of small plates - ribs, cucumbers with vinegar, oysters - and DAMN - they love to just blow out the palate with spice! We're all for heat, but it was like hot on hot on hot - kind of clunky and unrefined heat that gets in your throat and stays there tickling you for a long time but you never get to enjoy FLAVOR. Bummer! We were so excited for finesse and modern deft hands taking on NOLA flavors and maybe we hit it on an off night or something but we definitely didn't get the "cochon" hype.

Simply fantastic. We went late night Friday during Essence. We asked our server Chris to pick the best items on the menu and he did not disappoint. Incredible food and service!!! And the music was on point.
Went just for the gumbo and was not disappointed. Very well executed roux. Ambiance was very nice and service was excellent. Will definitely put their gumbo high in my list.

Good food. Fresh food. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and gave very good recommendations. For starters we had the grilled oysters in chili garlic sauce, and it's a must have! The bf dosent care for much seafood but said these were very clean & he doesn't mind the not so "fishy smell". The waiter had warned us that portions were going to be big, but we didn't listen & ordered way too many food. Doesn't sound a lot but trust me, it was plenty! 
The bf ordered smoked Hamhock with hoppin John. The ham was literally fall off the bone good with a hint of smoke atop a bed of what seems to be white rice & Lima beans. He also ordered a side of greens. I'm not sure what was in it but it too was delicious! 
Like many yelpers, I ordered the mac & cheese casserole for my already forewarned gigantic oyster & bacon sandwich. The mac & cheese did not disappoint. It's not your box store creamy stuff or the dry skinny cheesey shit. This was legit homemade southern mac & cheese made of milk & sharp cheddar... heaven worthy!
 The whole sandwich was so big it took up 99.9% of the plate. They make their own bread & it shows they make it with pride. Since this was an OYSTER & Bacon sandwich they did not skimp on the bacon or the oysters. Well done Cochon! Sandwich was out of this world! Overall experience was it's a great restaurant with delicious food!

We got Cochon and Cochon Butcher mixed up, but decided to stick it out at Cochon because it smelled amazing. This was a mistake. We should have walked right out and found Butcher. I really wanted to like this place, but it's really hard when the food was just okay and the service was nonexistent at one point. If three people are supposed to be helping and no one even checks in on you, then no one is really helping. We had to look up the dessert on the website, and when someone finally came over, they asked us if we were ready for the check....and I guess we were. Wasn't awful but I wouldn't go back if they offered me a free meal.
Delicious we had the ribs, alligator, mac and cheese was bomb, chicken & sausage gumbo.  the cocktails were great as well. service was fast

This place is great! All the staff is very attentive and the food was amazing. We sat at the kitchen bar it was cool to watch the chef work. He even gave us some complimentary apps . The rabbit dumpling dish and fried alligator were especially good!!

Had a wonderful meal....pork cheeks w/grit cake, side of grits, and started with the wood fired oysters (they were incredible)!  Since I was solo, I sat at the bar in front of the kitchen (which was entertaining).  Would recommend this local restaurant.  The service was fantastic!

In New Orleans for the week and needed a good spot to eat. We walked by the restaurant and decided to check it out. 

The braised pork was fantastic. Loved the ambiance as well. It really reminds me of home (PDx!) All the servers were absolutely amazing! The root beer on tap was delicious. Highly recommend trying it!
Service was absolutely terrible! The waitress had a very bad attitude and tried to tell customers that they do not do to-go when they clearly have to-go containers. Will NEVER come back here.

Go now! What an absolutely delightful meal after a terrible dinner on our first night at a tourist trap restaurant in NOLA. We started with boudin and the cucumber salad, both were delicious. My daughter had the macaroni and cheese side as her entree, my husband had Fisherman's Style red fish, and I had the braised short ribs. Everything was delectable; the red fish was cooked perfectly and the short ribs were so flavorful. Even the bread they brought for the table was scrumptious. We finished with malted chocolate cake and peach pie. It's not often I prefer a non-chocolate dessert to a chocolate one, but the peach pie was the winner tonight. Also of note: they have a great selection of local brews, a fantastic bourbon list, and the bartender made a solid old fashioned. Service was on point and not rushed. Overall a fabulous experience and somewhere we would definitely return to.

We were visiting New Orleans for the first time and decided that this would be our splurge meal. The three of us all felt very "meh" about the meal overall and would definitely skip this place next time.

Rating Breakdown:
1/2 Stars for Taste --
My favorite thing was probably the fire grilled oysters. The sauce, generously ladled over the succulent oysters, was zesty and tangy with just the right amount of kick. The fried alligator had the texture of tough chicken and was smothered in what tasted like sriracha mayo. We definitely ordered it more for the novelty. I remember thinking that the fried soft shell crab was good...but not $30 good. The crawfish pie was nothing to write home about. The catfish courtbouillon was so forgettable that even while staring intensely at the picture I took, I cannot recall even a hint of what it tasted like.

0/1 Stars for Value --
Honestly, you're paying extra for the ambience. It's $8-12 for an appetizer and easily $20-30 for an entree. I thought the appetizers were worth a try, but the entrees were disappointing for the price. You'll easily pay $30-40 pp, which I guess is standard fare for date night (but wouldn't you rather have delicious food for that price?)

1/1 Stars for Customer Service --
Our server was nice and the food came out promptly. We weren't in a hurry though because we had actually just "snacked" next door at the Cochon Butcher. The complimentary bread was great. Whenever we go to nice restaurants, my friends are all like "Oh my God, stop filling up on bread and butter." I just wish nice restaurants didn't consider it gauche to offer bread refills because let's be real, I'm not going to eat/order any less...and BREAD. YUM.

No bonus star because there are literally dozens of better places to eat in New Orleans at a fraction of the price. 

TL;DR -- Overpriced and forgettable. If you must, try the oysters. Fried soft shell crab is way better at Acme.
1.5 stars for food, add one more for service and not giving straws automatically. Fried alligator tastes like chicken nuggets. Louisiana Cochon is a little bit too salty and there's too little sauce.

Hands down the BEST oysters I've ever had! If you're in New Orleans, this is the place to go.  I went to several restaurants and I have to say this was top 3 for sure. I had he oysters, gumbo, and brisket.

3 star for the service but 7 stars for the food! It's quite pricey but worth it! The chili oysters are the best in NOLA... i also love the rabbit stew! But the service can definitely use some improvement...

I came to this restaurant very excited because it came highly recommended to us as a great dinner spot. Unfortunately, we were extremely disappointed with most of our experience.

When we arrived at the restaurant, we were greeted by he hostess and manager. We arrived around 6:40pm. We did not have a reservation but the restaurant was 3/4 empty. We asked for a table for 2. The manager replied and said, "we are coming on a heavy reservation time. We can seat you at the bar of chef's bar." We looked around at the mostly empty restaurant pretty confused. We felt like we were in a Seinfeld episode or something. We were not going to leave just because of their seating issues, so we decided to eat at the bar.

Bartenders were friendly, made good drinks, and had fast service. Waters were served as soon as we sat with hot bread. We loved that, so we thought the rest of the night would flow smoothly. Unfortunately that was not the case.

For dinner we ordered the catfish, hamhock, and rib tips appetizer. My catfish was very good. The bartender recommended the hamhock. The hammock was extremely dry and salty. It lacked flavor and there was no sauce to compensate. We asked the bartender if there were any bones in the rib tips. He told us no. When we got the appetizer, it was extremely hard to cut through because there were in fact bones in the dish. 

By the time we were ready to leave it was about 7:20. At this point the dining room still wasn't anywhere near full. Between the lack of menu knowledge for the staff and the manager seating us at the bar with plenty of open table space, this restaurant doesn't deserve more than a 2. I understand that you want to make sure your reservations get a table when they arrive, but that was a bit ridiculous. I would not recommend this restaurant or go ever again.

On our way to the day party, we were hungry and likes the Yelp reviews about Cochon.  Very cool area we thought.  The downtown section of New Orleans.  The restaurant is well done and manicured.  We were greeted by a team of servers.  The staff as mixed Ana the food and ambience was upper middle class.

The food was well presented and tasty~

Ribs

Stuffing  with eggplant and shrimp  was amazing!!  

Mac and cheese was nicely presented - it was good but not my favorite. 

Collard greens were on point 

Nice drinks and atmosphere 


Will definitely patronize when we return to NO

We made a wrong turn and went the wrong way from our original reservation. When I realized we were going in the opposite direction of where we were supposed to be going, I said well we're near one of the other places on our trip list. Rather than backtrack, we succumbed to the closest place. Glad we did.
Was pretty busy for a Monday night, when most places we passed were empty, was a good sign.
Cochon or pig in French means you order pork. Pork Belly appetizer was tasty with just the right amount of zip. I was disappointed that the special, Paneed Pork Loin with marinated peaches was sold out forced me to order the Louisiana Cochon with cabbage. Shredded Pork Shoulder or in Texas speak, pulled pork, seasoned to perfection and shaped into a patty that was   Grilled to make the edges crisp. A unique taste sensation! My wife had the braised beef shank, tender and tasty as well. Why stop now, we capped it off with the Peach Pie with bourbon sauce, pecans and ice cream.
Bottom line, glad we went the wrong way!
We had dinner here on a family vacation. The food was exceptional but we felt the table service was not especially welcoming. Also a bit noisy but overall a good experience.

Cochon is a nice upscale place with an ever changing menu.  
It's more Cajun fusion than Cajun. 
I had the butchers plate and gumbo. Both were okay. 
Gets very busy so expect to wait if no reservation. 
It also pricey. Entrees were over 20$ and not a big portion. I think beer was $10. 

Take your date here.

The dining experience was only so-so. I was expecting more for the price. The alligator was different and interesting. The chargrilled oysters were excellent. I was disappointed with the catfish - bland and forgettable. The gulf fish was good though. There are better options close by.
Food was really good, we got there late but the service was still good. The entrees took a while to come out but the drinks and appetizers had a short turn around

Terrible service and terrible food. Blegh! NEXT!!!! 
High prices for terrible food. And if you go with a big party, be prepared to spend 30 mins divinding your checks 2-3 ways.

One of the most memorable parts of my trip to New Orleans. The food was scrumptious as were the drinks. The grilled oysters were so good that we ended up getting two plates. The dessert was chocolate beignets with ganache filling, paired with Vietnamese coffee ice cream. This was a flavorful and divine pairing. The wine list was interesting and my first time trying a French malbec, and the coffee moonshine went great with the dessert. If I came back to New Orleans, I'd definitely come back to Cochon.
Had our first dinner in New Orleans at this place during our trip early July. The food was FANTASTIC!

Delicious southern style food with a new twist.  Fried gator. Short Ribs.  Beef rib all wonderful.  Fisherman style fish was my favorite.  Enjoyed several craft beers.  Whisky selection was impressive.

Incredible food and extremely good customer service. this has been a restaurant I've been wanting to dine at for many years, and I was thrilled to finally have the chance. It met and exceeded all of my expectations. 

Don't study the menu before coming here... See how you feel when you arrive and order what sounds good to you. Ask your server for recommendations, because the menu changes and there might be a really amazing new dish that you would not have otherwise considered.

The cocktails are perfectly crafted and the staff is very attentive and aware of every need. While they didn't hovering, they immediately cleared any empty dish or glass from my area. it was the right balance of attentive without rushing a guest from the table. Some places clear your seat and make you feel unwelcome, like they're ready for you to leave and fill the seat with another guest. That is not at all the feeling you get at Cochon.

entrees are reasonably priced, and there are many small plate options to choose from if you want to have a light meal by yourself, or share a few plates with another person.

Check it out when you are in New Orleans.
Great atmosphere, great vibe, delicious food, wonderful service! We thoroughly enjoyed everything we ordered. Highly recommend!

Cochon was near our hotel and my two daughters and I went for dinner on a Saturday night. We didn't have a reservation, so waited only about 20 minutes and were able to sit at the full-service bar. We were not that hungry, so ordered a sampling of appetizer/sides: oysters, cucumber salad, grits, Lima beans and marinated shrimp. All were excellent, but the oysters were to die for!

I just keep thinking about that red snapper and my mouth begins to water! Cochon has amazing small bites! Everything we ordered was delicious! The customer service is sweeet and the servers are knowledgeable about the food. I know I was suppose to come here for the pork but for some reason I had almost all the seafood options. 
Creamy Mac and Cheese is worth every calorie
Eggplant and Shrimp dressing has inspired me to make it for thanksgiving
Gator bites were surprisingly flavorful and scrumptious.
Just make reservations and eat here! It's worth it. 
Also leave room for dessert.

Well, well, well. Came here with a buddy who lives in the area. We ordered a bunch of appetizers to sample different items. Blown away. The ribs were some of the best I've ever had. Great oysters! There bar selection will knock your socks off. They also have a sister restaurant right around the corner if you feel like you need more. Try them. One of my fav places in NOLA.

My family and I heard so much about this place by many of our foodie friends from San Francisco and just had to try it. We had an amazing meal, selecting 8 items from the alligator to the short ribs. We could not have had a better evening our first day in New Orleans. The wait staff and manager were delightful and gave us a great experience.

Talk about deliciousness! Everything from the appetizers to the side dishes are perfectly executed to the point you will be dreaming about the meal for days. There is always quite a wait so make reservations or just know you will probably be waiting for a minute but it is definitely worth it!

I can't wait to return!

This is a pork specialty restaurant. You need to order the collard greens with pork neck or the Cochon or another dish with pork in it to understand why it's loved.

The wood fired oysters and rabbit with dumplings we got were also excellent dishes, and the cocktails were delicious and generous.

For a nice restaurant, the ambience can be broken up a bit by the bachelor and bachelorette crews, but that's New Orleans for you.

Overall great experience. Cochon was a constant recommendation by friends when I told them I was visiting NOLA. They weren't wrong! Everything was good. My friend put a reservation for 6 of us ahead of time.

Djinn & Juice - The gin was bit too strong for me, but still a great drink to sip.

Wood-fired Oysters with Chili Garlic Butter - easily the best grilled oysters I had.

Braised Beef Short Ribs - Meat was so soft and tender. Rice balanced it out. Typically I am not a big fan of mushrooms, but even that was delicious!

Great food and excellent service. I ordered the smoked hock and it was excellent. The hopping beans were well prepared but the portion was minimal at best. My dinner partner has a garlic allergy so was limited in what choices she could make. Her grits were not entirely fine so the remained on the plate. Overall I would come back to try other items on the menu.

My girlfriends and I absolutely loved this place. We made a reservation to eat here for dinner (because it does tend to get packed). 

To start off, we had the Wood-fired oysters as the appetizer. They do only come with 5 shells (but some had 2 pieces of the oyster so it was shareable). THIS WAS SO GOOD. so good that we ordered another round of it. Do note that it's a bit spicy but it was so delicious! 

Then for our meal, we had the catfish courtbouillon, rabbit & dumplings, braised beef short rib, & the Mac and cheese. Everything was so delicious and flavorful. Our favorite dish of the night was the catfish courtbouillon! The Mac & cheese was creamy & the braised beef was so tender! 

They have a dessert menu as well! We got the warm peach pie and it was DELICIOUS. It was so warm and flavorful from the pie and the ice cream just made everything taste so good. 10/10 would recommend. 

Our waiters were both really sweet and the service was excellent! Loved this place.

When I'm Rome (or New Orleans LOL) you've gotta try the local places. With over 3000 good reviews this place did not disappoint.  Went for lunch and I had the cheese Cochon with cracklins, cabbage and pickled peaches.  So delish!  Cochon, by the way is pulled pork.   Juicy and flavorful!  Had homemade lemonade too which had just the right amount of sour.  Oh so good.  A touch pricy for lunch. Mine with the lemonade was $28 but well worth it.  Love the food in New Orleans!
Shared small plates with a large group. The meat pies and seafood salad were two of the top dishes for the evening. Quality food and excellent experience, highly recommended.

I cannot speak highly enough of the experience we had at this restaurant. We came for lunch, without reservations, because we are nearby. The restaurant is lovely in a casual way. 

Our server suggested we try the boudin, which were delicious crispy balls of rice and liver and I don't know what but it was good. We had the signature dish, Cochon, which is made of roast pork and is delicious. We had a few other delicious items as well, including a round pie type pastry for dessert. 

Everything was delicious, the staff were friendly, professional and knowledgeable. I'm coming here on my next visit to New Orleans.

Food was excellent and plentiful. Don't know my waitresses name and there were few trips to the table as well as no communication other than what do you want to drink and order. So, instead I'll just mention Joe. A waiter that we've  had at a previous dining location since he was the only one to pay any attention and the B waitress who was very awesome and polite. Gave 4 stars for the food and value alone had service been better most definitely would have garnered a 5. 

Can't wait to come back and try dessert, wasn't offered so, meh.
Wow! Just amazing. Great food. Great service. Great ambiance.  Family of 4 kids 11 and 13. Kids loved it.

I liked their signature dish Cochon but all other dishes were just ok. I don't really understand the very good reviews. The gumbo soup was too salty, the pouched shrimp plate was so tiny and had only 3 small shrimps in it for $12. This place was recommended by local food journalist so I had very high expectations but I don't think I'm coming back.

The food and the service was the best we experienced in New Orleans. (We ate out 3 other nights.) 
The service was amazing, the server (i wish I'd gotten his name) was knowledgeable, fast, helpful and hospitable. I have life threatening food allergies and the kitchen went above and beyond to make me an off menu dish so I got to enjoy dinner with everyone else. It was absolutely wonderful. Can't say enough good things about our experience at Cochon.

We went here for lunch upon arrival to New Orleans. The dishes were okay, certainly not justifiable for the price. Small portions plus inflated prices does not equal fine dining. The ambience is casual, serving tiny $12 cocktails that tasted okay, but are absolutely pretentious in price. If every item on the menu were lowered by $4-5 this restaurant would make a lot more sense. Having dined at many finer establishments for the same cost, it's simply ahead of itself.

We got tired of the touristy creole food in New Orleans and wanted to try something edgy. Conchon was just that. They prepare things in interesting ways. 

The compressed watermelon was refreshing. It had something like Mexican tajin sprinkled on top. I don't notice any difference between the compression and normal watermelon though. The flavors weren't any more concentrated.

The gator nuggets were served with buffalo sauce. It was my first time having gator. It's like a tougher blander version of chicken. I still enjoyed the experience.

The soup of the day was some beans and Spanish sausage. Too salty.

Prices are on the high side.

I wasn't blown away by the food here but I was still satisfied nevertheless. The place is very trendy and modern which just seems to contrast too much with the traditional cooking they're trying to make a twist on. 

The fried alligator was delicious and, I hate to say it, but it tasted like chicken. The sauce with mint that it was dressed with really made it stand out. The rest of our dishes (jumbo, squash salad) were good but nothing to write home about. It seems as if when trying to find a modern twist on old, local classics the heartiness of the original dish has been lost. I still really enjoyed this place but it wasn't the best food we had in New Orleans.

So i was actually looking for the sandwich place next door and stumbled across this gem! I took a quick glance at the menu and everything looked really good! I did the chicken livers, fried gator and mac and cheese...man oh man, was this food delicious! Probably the best food i had in NOLA. Chicken livers are served with this pepper jelly that's actually really good.  The fried gator was out of this world...it has this type of mayo sauce drizzled on top (thick of the sauce as a bang bang shrimp type of thing...if you love bang bang shrimp you're going to love this gator!) The Mac and cheese came out bubbling and it was delicious as well! If i could give an extra star, i would! You will not be disappointed in this place !

DO NOT eat here if you have food allergies. They intentionally cross contaminate their oil. I was seconds away from getting sick. If I hadn't asked my party not to use the same forks on the shared oyster app as the alligator I wouldn't have been warned by the waitress that they use the same oil for shellfish and other food. I've never even heard of anything like this. Horrible.

On top of that the food sucked and there was over an hour wait time.

Cochon is a good dinner place. The service was good and the food was good. Everything was solid but not great. The rolls were a little overdone. My girlfriend had the oysters, she loved them. I don't eat spicy food so I didn't get a chance to try them. She also had the pork cheek, which she said was ok. I had the oyster and bacon sandwich, it was really good. This place had a good atmosphere and a good location from our hotel. They need a few more options on the menu though.

I absolutely love and miss Cochon Butcher... I live in Nashville and was sadden when the Butcher closed there, I really would love to see it come back there ... but I'm a better location then Germantown somewhere outside of the city. But every time I come to New Orleans I will make sure I come by and enjoy a Muffuletta

I was recommended to eat at Cochon for my first night in New Orleans and had my doubts. Being I was alone I sat at the bar and the bartender, Steve recommended a few selections and I chose the smoked Hamhock with doubt. When I was served I thought it was average until my first bite. It was more than I expected, the meat was smoked to perfection and melted into my mouth. I would definitely come back in a heartbeat.

This restaurant came highly recommended from a friend who grew up in New Orleans. Overall, it was nothing special. If you find yourself here, I'd recommend the Flame-broiled Oysters and Rabbit and Dumplings. I'd only recommend the Fried Alligator if you want to just try alligator for the novelty of it, if not, skip it. For 5 people, we spent close to $200 on average food.

I sat at the chef's bar with an entertaining view into the kitchen. The restaurant vibe is cool and modern. The grilled oysters were delicious and the cocktail was strong. The downfall was the evening's special, which I ordered as my entree. It was a crispy pan fried pork loin with warm marinated peaches. Sounds great...tasted mediocre. The loin lacked seasoning except for a sparse amount of black pepper. I imagined that I couldn't go wrong ordering a pork dish @ Cochon, but this plate left me wanting something more. The benefit of sitting at the pass was seeing the other wonderful dishes that they offer. The fish, rabbit and dumplings, and braised beef were the frequently ordered and the most eye catching dishes.  I would probably try this place again, but New Orleans has so much to offer so it will have to be another trip.

When we arrived at this restaurant we had no idea what we were getting to...but definitely after looking at the limited menu it was not up my alley. Cochon Butcher was more my style!!!

When making our way back to the table and peeking at other tables to see their food..I could have save us time as the tables where covered with oysters of various types.....

The service was right on track though!!! 2 guys assigned to our table was right on serving us, but much to their disappointment we did not stay...it was not my place.

Deserves 6 stars. Incredible food with incredible effort by the chef and a staff that's incredibly on point. Just entering, the smell of roasting meat hugs you like a cooking granny with bbq sauce stains on her apron.

I tried: fried alligator, which was wonderfully lightly fried and wonderfully sauced, smothered greens that were soft and seasoned so well, mac and cheese, rich with a sauce so blended you couldn't tell how many types of cheese gave their lives for it, rabbit stew and dumplings that took me to my sofa all the way back home with a blanket of gravy warmth, a huge twice-baked potato that could serve as a gravy receiver pillow, and a boucherie platter that was truly an enjoyment for the eyes and mouth and presented lil bites of wonderful taste.

My friends and I were delightfully happy to have eaten here. The guilt of haven eaten so much made us walk all the way back to our hotel. And if you don't try this place while you are in town you will regret it.
We are traveling and found this local place on Yelp.  The food was amazing and finished it off with an upside down pineapple cake.... true perfection!!!

Our dinner party dined here for lunch today. We had the chicken andouille soup and it was delicious.  The bacon and oyster sandwich was amazing a bit heavy, but delicious and fresh. The collard greens where authentic southern-style greens with a touch of spice.

Came to NOLA for my bachelor party and my friends chose Cochon for our last night. Atmosphere was great, seemed very upscale and fancy for the area. 

Must try: 
Oysters, gator appetizer

Avoid:
The Cochon was their signature dish. It was extremely salty that I could not finish more than half of it. I was extremely disappointed that they named their restaurant after something that was barely edible. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

2 stars for the great appetizers. 

Our server also seemed quite uninformed about the items on the menu. You'd think they'd have an opinion about the options but it didn't seem like he's ever eaten anything they were making.

A little off the radar in terms of location but so glad our group came here to eat. We chose it based on Yelp reviews and the food and service were both amazing! It was a group of 12 girls during the July 4th wkeend and we ate family style. So we all tried a little bit of everything. Everything was amazing esp the Oysters. After trying it we ordered a few more. Only downside were the portions were kind of small.

Wow! So glad I stopped in for a quick sip which turned into a huge bit! Cochon meaning "pig" from what I was told is a hit! Odd things on the menu here, so if you are looking for something odd to try, here's the place! They have a pretty cool whiskey flight and tons of wines and beers to choose from! There oysters are a hit, however I thought it was "odd" it wasn't served with crackers and lemons. Luckily there is the complementary bread I ate along with it and super happy when I asked for a second round of the rolls they brought them out hot and fresh! I sat at bar and did some people watching, while I waited on my main course to be serve. Went with the dumplings --Rabbit Dumplings that is! Oh my, I'm so happy I tried this! Was tender and the dumpling had like a cornbread texture that was thick and filling! So full packed it to go, even better the next day!

So I am a huge fan of Cochon Butcher and highly recommend it if you want a great sandwich and homemade chips with a cold beer.  This is the fancier more sophisticated big brother of you will.  Had an early dinner before our flight out and there was no crowd at 5. 

Wait staff is super friendly, some of the best service we have had this trip. We had the gumbo and the Boucherie plate. Both were excellent. I will say that the meats on the Boucherie plate were different from the head cheese and pork pate'.  I loved it but it challenged my wife a bit with some of the textures.  

They also have a great wine menu and a separate and equally extensive whiskey menu.  The Four Roses Small Batch was excellent with the gumbo and mix of meats.   If we had more time we would have gone next door for a cold beer.  

Enjoy your trip to NOLA and venture out of the quarter to get some great food at the Cochon franchise.
I love oysters!!! I love Cochon woodfire oysters!!! I come just for the oysters. It's my favorite thing there.

Nice higher end restaurant for BBQ or some seafood. Relaxing atmosphere with good service. Can be a little pricey but food is well prepared. Did not realize the back of the restaurant is a sandwich/butcher shop owned by Cochon. So if you want a walk in restaurant, or a take out for sandwiches you have both.

This may have possibly been one of the best meals i've ever had in my life. The apps(fried gator,ribs,grilled oysters and the charcuterie board) were on another level. Then that level was exceeded even more when all our entrees arrived. Highly recommend The rabbit and dumplings or the po boy sandwich. Cant wait to come visit again when back

I was visiting New Orleans for a conference and stumbled upon both Cochon and Cochon Butcher. I visited both establishments and enjoyed Cochon Butcher much more. 

While Cochon was not bad by any stretch of the word, the flavors were lacking and overall I felt very bored with my meal. I had the wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter and these were the clear standout here. All 3 of the stars are for the oysters, they were truly that great. My entree was the rabbit and dumplings which seem to be one of the more popular options however, I was very underwhelmed. My stew had absolutely no flavor, and was very meh. The rabbit was tender so I'll give them that. I do not think I will return to Cochon unless it is for the oysters.

I went here for the primary dinner for the bachelor party I was with. Amazing food! The energy in this place is great and everyone who works there that I came across had maximum knowledge of everything that they offer. I was with a group of 8 dudes and we all left full and satisfied. GO EAT HERE!

Great Meal! Innovative Menu! Excellent service!
Creole Mac and cheese is bamtastic.
The ambiance is really nice and the place is really busy!!!

Probably the best oysters I've had. It came with some cajun sauce of some sort but were great. Super fresh and super flavorful. We made a reservation for a table of 8 and we were treated very well with a round table where everyone could talk to each other. Drinks were stiff and prompt. I had the pork/cabbage dish for my main dish which was amazing! Hope to be back!

I really wanted to like this place and if you like vinegar you'll definitely like it. Everything tasted like vinegar even the cocktails. For the price point it was a bit disappointing since it was higher priced. 

Drinks: Got to try the Black magic woman which was rum, strawberry, ginger vinegar and lemon. Presentation was beautiful but first sip. Whoa! vinegar anyone? it seemed it was just floating on the top. I know ACV is the new trend and it helps suppress appetite but is that what they are going for? Hold the vinegar next time please! 

Appetizers: The watermelon salad was good and refreshing, surprised to find it was yellow watermelon (fancy!). The flavors were fun and interesting but smoke pork ribs... not fall off of the bone smothered in a sauce that was heavy on the vinegar. So disappointing.  The alligator bites were good as they were fried and in a chili garlic mayonnaise. I didn't find it spicy at but tasty. 

Entree & Sides: The pork neck was dry and disappointing. It was a beautiful dish but over cooked and not too flavorful at all. The oven-roasted gulf fish was good but nothing to write home about. I really enjoyed the squash salad with goat cheese. I'm not sure how they did it but we ordered goat cheese on the side and it was lightly shredded goat cheese. It didn't have the typical strong flavors of goat cheese which I don't mind but members of my party did mind. The mac and cheese was also made well as it had a good amount of cheese and not too oily but at the same time not too memorable. 

Overall, for the price point of this restaurant I wouldn't care to go back. Nothing really stood out to me or blew my mind. Most of the dishes were mediocre at best.

This was my husband's favorite meal in New Orleans. We stopped by late one afternoon to share a few small plates and walked away with very happy bellies. The restaurant space is very cool and modern. We would recommend the wood-fired oysters with chili garlic butter, fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise, and smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle!
This place has a great atmosphere. Great service. Also the food was amazing. Just writing this review makes me want to go back.

The food was OK.  I sat at the bar with 3 bartenders.  One bartender was good, the other 2 not so much - and I'm being generous.  No chit chat, no engagement, no friendly service. I was there on 9/1 around 5:30 so I hope management will look back at the video of the bar.  Pitiful. The guests seated next to me got food I didn't see on the menu.  When I asked them about it, it was a special.  It would have been nice to have known about those without having to ask.  There was a cool drink on there that I would have ordered had I known.  I even asked the first bartender if there was a good drink to try but she didn't have the presence of mind to go "oh yeah, there's a special". Just disengagement.

I got the Cochon with roasted peaches.  It was good but not exceptional for $24.  The gentleman beside me got the duck and dumplings and it looked wonderful! I think I would order that next time however I won't be going again.

The wine list was good, heavy on French wine if you like that. I'm prepared to spend up to $100 for a bottle but again, my service experience was so subpar that I just kept my consumption to a glass. Oh well, probably no big loss for this restaurant.

I love the food in NOLA but based on my experience, I spent $70 on a roll of the dice and lost.
Great food. Good portions and variety. We got a few main dishes and sides and shared. My favorite was the red fish . Beautiful atmosphere and great wait staff.
Great out of the way place for lunch. The roasted eggplant was divine. Fun atmosphere.
Hostess was rude, supposed to be a dog friendly place, they have tables outside, but they don't have service for tables outside.  Pretty bad, we didn't even get a chance to try the food...

This place knows how meat is supposed to be cooked and served. As soon as you walk in, it smells like you have stepped into a bbq smoke pit. I love to smell that; as it tells you the place is properly preparing their meats. I ordered the ribs with the mac and cheese casserole. The mac and cheese was easily the best I have had in a very long time. It was masterfully made and served on its own in a cast iron skillet. I get chills thinking about how delicious it was. It had a crispy crust on top, with very high quality melted cheese underneath. The ribs were also very delicious. The watermelon pickling that they garnish over the top of the meat was good individually, but I didn't understand this flavor profile in connection with the smoked meat. It definitely didn't take away from how great the ribs were though. The meat was super tender and seasoned perfectly. They put a sauce on the ribs but honestly, you really could just eat the meat by itself with the way it was seasoned. 

I recommend getting here before 7-7:30 on the weekend. Our reservation was for 6:30. The restaurant wasn't full at that time and there were plenty of seats in there. After about 30-40 mins, there wasn't an empty seat in the house. I also recommend sitting in a both. They have mood lighting in the backrest and it really adds a ton to the ambiance of the dimly lit restaurant. 

The service was excellent here. They use a team approach to waiting each table, so be prepared to be waited on by multiple servers. Everyone was extremely friendly and make you feel at home. Parking wasn't the best as we had to park all the way down at the convention center, but this is a must check out place when in the N.O. We will be back.
Great casual vibe. Best ribs I've had in a long time. Grilled oysters perfection. No complaints here. Priced well.

When we arrived from Texas we asked around for a good place to eat. We had several people recommend cochon. So we made time to have dinner here. We ordered a large buffet of items to share. The oysters, alligator, shrimp, ham, macaroni and potatoes. The food was actually really great. Though they forgot one of our sides. The big turn off to this place is the awful service. Our waitress came by about three times total. We had to get help from other servers for pretty much everything we needed. If the service were better I would have given five stars.
Fun, creative, delicious takes on classic southern cuisine. Great service. Great atmosphere. Prices aren't too high. Must try if you're in New Orleans
One of the best meals I've ever had. We've already made plans to return for a birthday dinner. Order the rabbit and dumplings....you can't go wrong!
Delicious food. If you're a foodie like I am you can sit at the chefs bar and watch all the food as they cook it. The alligator is great and so is the meat pie. I highly recommend eating here

Co-shone? Co-shawn? Cushion? Ok, forgive my French, but this place is freaking amazing if you're searching for authentic, Cajun flavors in New Orleans.  

Our large group of adults, kids, and babies was warmly welcomed and seated quickly for lunch on a Friday.  The space is located in a rustic warehouse but contemporarily designed inside.  Very clean and comforting.

Sharing is caring, so we ordered a bunch of apps and dishes for the table.  The wood-fired oysters with chili-garlic butter were amazing as were the fried alligator drenched in chili garlic mayonnaise (can't mess with chili-garlic anything!)  We also ordered the Louisiana cochon considering it's their namesake and were impressed as well.  Very tender and a great balance of flavors with the cracklin and pickled turnips.

Would love to try the other dishes on the menu that are hard to find elsewhere, such as rabbit and dumplings and hamhock (googling hamhock right now).

If you are looking for good food and great service, this is a solid place to go. Its was a very nice trendy place close to our hotel. The beer selection was good and gator bites where great! Only really issue i faced was the lack of portions of the food.

Amazing place. Chicken gumbo was excellent and broiled oysters the bomb. 
Little expensive but it is a quality and it is worth it.

$140.00 for two people and left still hungry.  Overpriced.  The food is good but not delicious or great.  Waiter was very nice and attentive. 

ordered: 
Two super small appetizers
One soup
One salad
One entree
Two glasses of wine
So yummy. The zucchini salad and cucumber salad was also delicious. Alligator is better than chicken.

I was visiting from Texas, and this was my first stop to some delicious Creole food! I had the catfish courtbouillon and macaroni and cheese casserole. The catfish was pretty good, but it didn't "wow" me. The mac and cheese was awesome for sure. The hot sauce was AMAZING. I had to order from the restaurant to Texas because it was so deliciously tasty, with myself being a hot sauce connoisseur, I haven't had hot sauce that had a great taste as well as the spiciness of it. Overall a good experience and good food.

Lunch on the mind after the storm took out the hotels' power during our conference. Service is great and food pretty good. It's a bit different than what we've been eating and it was a welcome reprieve. We tried the boudin balls, similar to an arancini. The dirty meat pie is similar to the chicken pot pie but with beef and is encased in pastry bread that looked like en empanada. Quite tasty as there is a nice little kick of spice in it.  The entrees we shared were rabbit and dumplings and the Louisiana Cochon. The rabbit and dumplings came in an cast oven pan and tasted like a chicken pot pie. If no one told me that that was rabbit, I would've thought it was chicken. The Louisiana Cochon was pulled pork with pickled peaches. It was good but too salty, I had to used the bread to cut the saltiness. Overall, it was a nice and trendy place with great service.

When in New Orleans you should check this place out! The wood fired oysters, gumbo and alligator bites were incredible! Nice drink menu and the house made lemonade was very good.  Great atmosphere with an upscale vibe.

Walked in from the WWII Museum for lunch, sat at the bar during peak lunch time and still got our food 10 minutes after ordering.  We ordered some small plates to share and a few vodka tonics.  We highly suggest the well vodka, Cathouse Vodka, which we found out was a local vodka; better than Tito's!  For food we ordered the gumbo, shrimp flatbread, and fried gator, all great with traditional NOLA tastes with a modern presentation!  We watched the bartenders making specialty drinks and swore we would come back and try them all, including the Millions of Peaches drink.  It's a "must visit" place!
French for pig and this is what they do very well.  The ribs alone are worth the trip.

We went into this location due to its good reviews, i was unaware it was a classy/hipster looking restaurant. Ignoring that the local beer and fried alligator with sweet chili sauce was great! Although the portion size was a little lacking. Great place for a date but not if ur dieing of hunger!

We heard rave reviews. So we were super excited to check this place out. We wandered in on Saturday and the hostess very snootily told us that they "are really reservation only". We asked what the wait would be and she told us we could eat at the bar (there were no seats available) or make a reservation. It was 4:45 and we were hungry so we decided to make a reservation and come back another day. We strutted back in the next day with our reservation and we're quickly seated in the section of the world's most unpleasant waitress Whitney. Between throwing the menus on the table, ignoring when we asked questions, and appearing to be extremely distracted I find it hard to find anything even remotely positive to say. We asked for the wine list and when she finally strolled over with it we were well into our main courses. She grudgingly answered two questions about our wine choices. Without saying anything, she chucked the dessert menu on the table. We asked about the tea selection and she said "what? Oh we have some green". We ordered three green teas and the fourth member of our party began asking about the daily selection of sherbert and mid sentence the waitress turned and walked away. We asked another waiter to cancel our tea orders and bring the check. Derwin was assisting her and was possibly the saving grace. He was polite and quick to ensure our needs were met. I would have been happy to share all of this with the manager, however we were never asked. He stood by the bar the entire time and didn't seem to even pay attention to the tables. 

The food? It wasn't bad and it wasn't good..We had the ribs, pork cheeks, beef short ribs, and the cobia amongst other dishes. These are worth mentioning because they were tasty. But they certainly did not compensate for the abhorrent service. 

Overall, I wouldn't tell anyone to go. I'd actually tell them to go to ten other restaurants before visiting Cochon.

Be fore warned. We were headed to the butcher. This and the butcher have the same name and the same address. Different suites.... but happy mistake! Foot and service were great! 

Catfish Courtbouillon off the chain
Rabbit and dumplings. Great flavor
Louisiana Cochon with cabbage, cracklins and pickled peaches ... damnnnnnnn!

The food and the service here is amazing. It was very flavorful and seasoned well. It's funny because this place doesn't look fancy on the outside but It was such an amazing place. 

I had the fried alligator and it was my first time. It was very delicious. The service here was great too as well. My friends and I decided to give this restaurant a try because it was right down the street from my hotel. 

The drinks were good too. I felt like they were kinda pricey. I would love to come back to this place when they have happy hour.

Excellent cajun food!  They really have attention to detail when it comes to flavor.  Grits are fantastic. Their house rolls are delicious.  Get the pork cheeks   You won't be disappointed.  And the boudin balls are way too good!!!  I can't wait to go back and try more things!
Awesome helpful staff and wonderfully prepared sandwiches. Visited 3 days in a row on my last visit to NOLA.

My meal was beyond excellent. Cochon is on another level. I had the charcuterie board which had house made cured meats. How avant- guard.  The boudin balls were also great mustard had a nice bite of heat and acid to balance the richness of the pork. Last but not least was the Cochon. OMG! So good!!! The pickled peaches and pork had perfect balance and the crispy pieces of pork were absolutely the definition of swine heaven. We didn't have any dessert as we where in a food coma following the meal, but the options looked amazing. This place has a beautiful interior and a massive dinning room. The staff was beyond gracious. I can see why the chef is a James beard award winner.

I have been here two times, and both times, did NOT disappoint. My first experience was August 2017 for dinner and this past September 2018 during lunch, so there were completely different menus and everything was amazing! We had a large group, and no reservation, and they were able to accommodate us in less than 10 minutes, although we had to split. That was fine with me because that means less people to share with haha. 

Small plates:
- wood- fired oysters 
- fried alligator

Boucherie:
- fried boudin

Soup and Salad:
- gumbo

Entrees:
- Louisiana cochon
- braised beef short rib
- oyster & bacon sandwich

Sides:
- macaroni & cheese

Personally, the oysters and boudin were my favorite "apps", the gumbo was just okay to me. The entree's were A+ !!! I dont each mac & cheese but the others in my group loved it. Portion size is perfect, and the service was great! I can eat here over and over again..
