Really the best meal I have had in New Orleans out of 10 meals so far. I would have loved to have given it 5 stars but the service was slow. 
I had the smoked ribs with watermelon pickle and they were awesome. Sauce was thick and had just enough tang in it. Entree was the Cochon with cabbage and let me tell you the cabbage makes this meal. The pork is tender and flavorful but when eaten with the cabbage it is to die for. 
I will be back!

The only reason this does not get a 5 star its because its def on the pricier side for their portions and when we went the hostess told us we could not sit because she had a lot of reservations while the restaurant was literally half empty...

BUT THE FOOD IS DELISHHHHH pricey but wow hands down great quality!

Our group when in late on a Monday night and was surprised to see it still very busy. After our meal we knew why it was busy. Outstanding food, amazing taste of New Orleans in every bit. Will make this a stop the next trip in town in a few weeks.

Excellent! 

Would recommend for anyone coming in town to visit or even locals looking for a guaranteed good meal. 

I came here with family and friends for my post graduation lunch and loved it!

Food:
Everything is good! 
We ordered an appetizer and we ordered all the sides as our entree. I know that sounds strange, but sometimes the sides are the best part! It felt like a fun, intimate thanksgiving in the summer. 
The rillettes on the appetizer board was my favorite!! Everyone got the try something new that day and it was all delicious. I can't even pick my favorite side. 

Service: I had reserved a table just in case it was busy that day, and it was ready as soon as we arrived. The hostesses were nice. We did arrive just as our waiter's shift was about over so we switched waiters about 20 minutes in, but both guys were sweet and attentive, especially for us being a larger party. 

Atmosphere. I loved the look of this place. Plenty of seating, but somehow it still felt open. It was very laid back, but modern at the same time. It's definitely an experience when you visit this restaurant.
Some waiters didn't seem very friendly but the food was good. They do not split the check and don't even ask as it seems to annoy them. They will take multiple payments though.

I've been to many restaurants in Nola. And can't believe I waited so long to return to Cochon. First time, it was very enjoyable. And I kept saying I was going to return. A few months later, I finally returned. And can't believe it took me so long...

Delicious warm rolls served to every table were spectacular and gobbled up three warm rolls straight away. 

We ordered an array of the small plates and the oysters were delicious. The equivalent to their charcuterie plate was Devine. 


Ordered the rabbit and dumplings pee the serves rec and so glad we did...the biscuits that topped it. Along with the pepper and warmth of the gravy was memorable.  Will definitely be back.

Fan-freaking-tastic food. But truly the greens were a game changer. Smoky, silky yumminess. The oysters had a good kick and not smothered in butter and breadcrumbs like many of the other restaurants in NO. The ribs, alligator and gumbo we wanted to freeze and take home. Everyone else will talk about the meat which is delicious but the sides and apps are nothing to sneeze at.

Best ribs I've ever had in my entire life. No joke. The atmosphere is cool and dimly lit which I could see being nice for a date night or intimate meal. The cocktails are a little pricey but good nonetheless.

The Ham-hock and hoping johns was out of this world good.  The Brunch included rabbit and dumplings, cioppino soup special (amazing) and Mac and cheese (couldn't not eat the entire thing-goes perfect with their Cochon sweet pepper hot sauce).  Best meal in NOLA in all my times.

One of the most expensive and overrated restaurants I've ever been to. Tourist trap much? You can get ten times as good for half the price in other parts of the city and outside of it. Zero customer service.

Wow! Highly recommend this place!! It's not touristy, it's clean, beautiful decor is pleasing to the eye and the staff is really great!! They do have an unlisted kids menu you have to ask your waitress/waiter about, and that's amazing! I *almost* at my kids grilled cheese sandwich!!  

The food was seriously delicious!! I had the redfish and it was just amazing!! Fish is really hard to perfect and being a pescatarian for nearly 30 years - I have some high standards... this was seriously amazing!! 

Our table also ordered the alligator bites, the cheese plate with pâté, baked oysters (OMG YUMM!) and a few other things that were surprisingly filling and incredibly mouthwatering!  Oh and their dessert... AH-mazing!! Made fresh daily... order the Apple pie and cookie layered cake!!

My only 'gripe' is the wine list isn't updated... this would be my only point to improve. 

All in all, highly recommend this off the beaten path spot! I also recommend a reservation... they're super busy and always packed... not sure how we were able to get in but we did!

3.5 stars

I had higher expectations for the restaurant. No line or a wait when we came around 5pm. We got the following:

Fried alligator $12: the breading has a spicy kick to it. The alligators were a bit chewy for my liking, my husband thought it tasted like chicken- I on the other hand am indifferent to the dish. 

Smothered greens- too salty but otherwise the consistency was cooked perfectly.

Mac and cheese- tasted like boxed Mac and cheese. I was hoping for a more gourmet cheese-like taste and not the processed taste this dish had.

Louisiana Cochon- pulled pork that's fried in a circular form. By itself it was a little dry but when eaten w the ingredients it came with (tasted like a sweet pickled ingredient, cabbage, and cracklings) it blended well together. 

Over all it was an experience. I wouldn't go back but open to trying their butcher shop next door.

I travel for work and always sit at the bar for dinner. If it's a popular place, I call ahead of time to ask what the wait looks like. Most restaurants are happy to save 1 seat for me if I let them know I am very close to arrival. When I called Cochon, the hostess indicated the bar was first come first serve. She urged and defined the phrase to make me understand what that meant (I didn't appreciate this). She indicated she was sitting in the office and for her to check, that would mean she would have to get out of the office and walk to the bar. I didn't think Cochon was the size of a football field. I told her not to bother, thanked her and hung up. 

Popular restaurants rely on their popularity to attract a constant stream of customers. Although my comment won't make a dent in Cochon's reputation, I hope the staff checks the attitude at the door before entering.

Our experience at Cochon was incredible!  Let me start with the service... the team of Diego and Alex not only exceeded service expectations but also provided detailed knowledge of the food and its preparation.  The entire staff was impressive to watch as they all served wherever they were needed.  Now for the food... dear Lord... We ordered most of the small plate starters then had the Rabbit & Dumplings and the Smoked Hamhock with Hoppin' John.  The flavors are delicious and unique... even if you've had the dish somewhere else before... try it there!  Well worth the trip and will absolutely be back!

I was ready to be impressed and Cochon did not disappoint. We started off with the wood fired oysters and bypassed the forks to shamelessly slurp the oyster and drink the sauce. My rabbit and dumplings was incredible and the gravy was full of flavor. The dumplings were cooked perfectly, I couldn't get enough. I also had the pork ribs with watermelon which were a perfect combination of tangy, sweet, salty, and smokey. Definitely a memorable restaurant that I will be returning to!

Fully trusted the staff and almost let them order for me, and it was GREAT. Had the pork ribs, the old fashion lager, and an Apple pie at the end. Great place, super friendly staff, and the service is crazy fast. If you have the chance, sit at the front of the magic, by the oven and you'll see the great dynamic behind the scene.
Good food, great atmosphere, affordably priced!  Located conveniently next to the WWII museum.  One of the best value places to eat in pricey New Orleans.

I go here at least once a week. I work in the area. Some of my favorites are the gumbo, macaroni. And the twice baked potato. I recently had their bologna hush puppies. They were special and I hope that they consider putting them on the regular menu.

This place is bougie. It's like you're on the set of Chopped - the waiters can describe a dish to you like poetry, they're not intrusive but attentive. They will also correct your pronunciation. But the food. Dude, the food. You're spending your whole paycheck on it and it's ok because it's delicious. Get anything, but especially the boudin.

C'est très bon! I made a reservation at 1pm on a Friday. Super easy to make a reservation on their website.

We were seated immediately when we got there. This place is gorgeous. The decor is great and we sat near a window. The menu is excellent where you don't feel like you have too many choices. We ordered the wood-fired oysters, soup of the day and Louisiana cochon. The oysters were delicious. We had to order more rolls to go along with the oysters. The soup of the day was really good. It had hamhocks and greens in it. Yum! The entree was very memorable. I am still imagining it now. Very tender pieces of cochon. You can feel it was cooked slow and it definitely was packed with flavors. So good! The Mac and cheese casserole hit the spot! 

The service was amazing. When they took our silverware with the soup I was surprised they came with new silverware for our entree. Fancy! I loved the whole ambiance, service and food at this place. Check them out!

This was an overall good experience! The waiter was what lost three stars on this review. I asked for a few additional moments to decide (from the rest of my party) and more than 20 minutes later he came back to see what I wanted. The rest of my party had their food, a food runner brought it out. Drinks took about ten minutes to get which was okay, And unlike the rest of the tables we never got bread, when we asked the food runner about it he said to ask the waiter. The food was pretty good but not worth it for the price you pay.
Our entrees were very good, and the service was even better.  Some of the appetizers were underwhelming, but overall a very good dinner and experience.

I guess this is the restaurant you should try just to say you've been there. I was not impressed.
The oyesters with chili sauce was great.
But I don't think I would return. Make reservations first, I heard the wait is long.

So this was my favorite restaurant in Nola while we were here. It's Cajun/creole but it's got its modern hipster twist. The oyster were amazing and the shrimp appetizer was also amazing. I thought the service was good but nothing above average. The oven roasted red fish plate was great for my wife and I to split and it was out of this world good. Highly recommend. 10/10

We arrived around 11 on a Saturday. The establishment was clean, we had no wait time ordering and our food arrived in a timely manner. I ordered the Muffaletta sandwich, that thing melted in my mouth and was extremely flavorful! Will definitely be a reoccurring stop during my future New Orleans visits.
Very delicious food. Great atmosphere. Amazing complementary rolls. Diverse menu. Small portions (which helps when NOLA food is so heavy). Extremely attentive staff. 10/10
Amazing mac n cheese!!! Fried gator was a little tough. Candied pecan blue cheese salad was great.

My god. What have I done? My standards for everything in life are usually very low so that I am rarely disappointed and pleasantly surprised when things are slightly above average. After eating at Cochon my standards have skyrocketed and I don't think I will ever think of anything the same ever again which makes me sad but the stuffed baked potato was worth this change. I don't know what I'm going to do now that the meal is over, but I will not cry because it is over, I will smile because it happened.
This place is epic. Great food, service and atmosphere. A must stop in New Orleans. Fried Alligator, Mac and Chz, Short Ribs and Conchon were all to die for. I would highly recommend dining here.

Packed at 9pm. Waited @20 minutes for a seat at the bar. Worth the wait. 

Steve made me a delicious Old Fashion to start. Perfect. 

Alligator small plate and the Oysters small plate.  

Alligator was tender, cooked and seasoned slightly hot. 

Oysters were delicious.  Sauce was great. 

Finished with a bowl of Gumbo and a Sazarac. 

Come and see why it is the number one place on Yelp.
Loved it here- the food was fantastic, I could eat the beef cheeks all day. There was a mixup with our reservations and they were still able to get us in with only half an hour wait.

The food and service were good. I'm not a regular drinker (maybe 1-2 per month), but really enjoyed "The scarlet letter."  The fish special was a hair overdone, rabbit and dumpling was excellent, and cucumber salad was delicious.  If it wasn't for the fish, this place easily would be a 5 star place.

I thought Cochon was very good. The food is heavy and filling, so come hungry. The meat pie and oysters were phenomenal as well as the Mac and cheese. Service was top notch. We didn't have room for dessert, but it looked really good. Not the best meal we had on our trip to New Orleans, but worth the visit.

I was so excited at eat at Cochon. Friends had told me how delicious it was. So last night I went with friends and I'm sorry to say I was disappointed. The hostess staff (3) were a little preoccupied and not very attentive. Our waiter was forgetful and we had to ask three times for missing food items. The food was either over or under salted, and one of the servers knocked a full water glass across our table. Went to the restroom and it was a MESS. Paper towels and empty toilet paper rolls all over the floor. Looked like no one on the staff had checked the restroom in hours. They say in the restaurant business that the condition of your restroom reflects the condition of the kitchen. Makes me concerned. Incredibly disappointing. Won't go back.
Sat at the bar. I had Pineapple Upside Down dessert. It was delicious. This place is busy! Make your reservations ahead of time!

I love this place. The food was incredible. I've waited 7 years to come back and it was even better than I remembered. We had a prix fix menu and it was fantastic. The cracklings were a new addition for me and incredible. The boudin balls were a favorite of the table. This is what the food scene in NOLA is all about.

Cochon was a letdown and bit overrated. Beautiful huge space but the dishes we ordered we're nothing special and overpriced. The fried alligator was 4 stars though as that was new to us and the spicy garlic mayo sauce never fails. We also got the smoked ribs, pork cheek with grit cake and the Cochon. The smoked ribs were ordinary, pork cheek was decent but I don't prefer the flavor and the Cochon was our least favorite. It is quite dry pulled pork and tough to eat unless you don't grab some of the cabbage together. Were pretty full afterwards.

The cochon was tasty but a little on the dry side. Grilled broccoli salad was also tasty and would have benefitted from a little acid, maybe some lemon juice or zest. Mac and cheese was bomb! Super creamy with a nice cheesy crust. For dessert we had yummy pork spare ribs that fell off the bone and the watermelon pickle added a delightful tartness to the sweet BBQ sauce. 
Cocktails were ok, a little on the sweet side.
Hands down the best drink and food. Extensive whiskey and bourbon list, mix drinks are good. Next door is the butcher so you can take some goodies  home

Stopped by for lunch - great vibe in old warehouse brick building.  Garage doors open up to outside and lots of windows to let in natural light.  Smell of the smoked meat in the air.  We had the wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter, smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle, and the fried alligator with chili mayo. All were delicious and full of flavor!  Wait staff was very attentive and helpful.  Would definitely recommend this as a place to eat.
Great craft cocktail bar - our drinks were delicious  and so well balanced. We had the charr oysters which were amazing !!! They send out warm bread before your meal - yummy !

I thought there were several bright spots on the menu like the oysters and the Gulf Shrimp... I hear and at the butcher but they did not live up to the reviews that I read it maybe what I ate or it may just be my taste I feel like I'm a traditional American not really obsessed with New Orleans Food... Overall I was not impressed just not my style

Visiting NOLA for a bachelorette party. First time here and this place is one of my reasons to come back. Food quality is impeccable. Real ingredients used by people who obviously know how to cook. They accommodated our large party of 11 and service was great. The most delicious thing I tried here were the ribs and I only got a sample taste from my gf sitting next to me lol we all left fully satisfied. Cocktails were also well made

3.5 stars. Came here while on a bachelorette party trip to NOLA. Found this place on yelp and saw that it had so many reviews so we had to try it. It was a pretty cool place, the interior was very rustic and warehouse type feel and there was a butcher place right next door. The menu is a decent size, it's not overwhelming so you don't have to sit there and decide on what to order. We ordered the fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise and it was pretty good - a bit of a kick to it and it tasted kind of like chicken but a little more chewier. None of us have ever had alligator before so it was an experience. Next we ordered the Mac n cheese casserole which was also pretty good, not the best Mac n cheese I've ever had but it was alright (I'm a huge Mac n cheese fan so I have very high expectations for it). I ordered the rabbit and dumplings as my entree and it was pretty good as well. Savory but I would have liked a little more flavor. Next time I will have to try the oysters and Cochon. Overall, good food but I'm not quite sure if it lived up to the hype for me.

One of our best meals while in Nola. I don't understand the mixed reviews. Good service, new vibe and tasty food! We were seated right away at the kitchen bar without reservations and ordered several small plates. Definitely order the baked oysters. Mixed drinks were good.  Enjoyed it more than than the highly rated palace.

We ordered a variety of things hoping that we would love one of the entrees thinking Mac n cheese was a safe bet. However, it was all pretty much over priced and overdone. I wouldn't go back the next time I'm in NOLA. I really just liked my lemonade that I ordered. Everything else was subpar.

The food was very good and priced accordingly.  The menu was a bit limited but with a name like Cochon, I guess one shouldn't expect much of a variety.  The ambiance was great and the service was excellent.

WELL IT WAS LOUD. OMG people, it's 2018, have you heard of acoustic tiles?! The tables are packed close to each other as well, which contributes.

NOT a great place for a couple who wants to talk, but the food was really good. 

I had the smoked ham hock - superb, and my wife had flank steak special. Sides of greens and Mac and cheese were high quality and tasty. And it's true, the pineapple upside down cake is worth ordering and awesome, but definitely non-traditional. A great meal, minus the noisiness.

Meh, tried it because it was recommended. But this restaurant is definitely a tourist trap (as someone else on here mentioned). I should've listened to that review because it's very accurate. I had better food in NOLA for MUCH less. Honestly, I wanted to love the food but it just OKAY. We ordered the fisherman fish, Mac and cheese, twice baked potato and oysters. I thought the service was good and the food came out pretty fast.

Incredible meal and drinks.  This wood fire kitchen was a blast to hang out at and we had some amazing dishes to share.  We recommend the wood fire oysters, fried alligator, and if they have it, the wagyu beef dish with shaved mushrooms which they will ONLY serve medium rare.

First time in New Orleans! Wanted to try creole food. Found this restaurant on Yelp and accidentally the hop on hop off bus was stopping nearby, so we gave it a try. 
Our server was awesome and recommended us some dishes. We chose fried alligator (first time trying), gumbo and rabbit w/dumplings. Everything was delicious, especially the rabbit with dumplings! 
The restaurant is pretty big and nice and you also can sit outside. 
Highly recommend!

Very disappointed after seeing all their reviews! Went in on a busy night and sat at the bar. Ordered the Louisiana Cochon. 5 min later, a waitress brings it over and shoves it on me. "Wait a second, I just ordered it less than 5 min ago." Another woman next to me says it's hers because she ordered it 30 min ago. So I said, "sure take it, it must be yours." The waitress leaves and comes back and says "no here it's yours". So I try and give it to the bartender and I say "I ordered this five minutes ago, it's not mine." "I know you did and that's why I'm giving it to you." and she pushes it back on me with an attitude. So after looking at the plate and eating the first bite, I realized they made it by mistake or it was someone else's because it was cold and average if that. Thanks for making my experience a bad one. Will never go back.

It's very "MEH". You can find this same food at almost any "farm to table" Southern joint in any city. The menu is tiny and a little boring in my opinion. The food is fine but overrated and the service is almost non existent.

Nice ambience. Cute little spot to go with friends or date. I had the fried chili alligator as appetizer. I've never had alligator before so I can't say it's the best. It's an acquired taste. For my main entree I had the Louisiana cochon which was good. It's shredded pork that looks like a crab cake. The bread rolls were great as buttery. For desert I had the rum cake with the banana pudding which was delicious. For drinks I tried the on the tree which was an apple fusion vodka. It was strong.

Not impressed. I heard good things after my dad and brother ate here twice on their trip to New Orleans a few years ago, so I came in with high expectations.

Unfortunately, Cochon didn't deliver. We started with the grilled oysters, fried alligator, and fresh cucumber. The oysters were fine but didn't stack up to grilled oysters I have had elsewhere. The texture was fine but the sauce didn't quite give the punch I was expecting. Being gulf oysters, they needed it. The alligator was ok. The meat was nice and tender but didn't taste like anything special and I found the pieces to be over-battered. The glaze they came with was a little on the sweet side, and could have used something to balance it out. The cucumbers were nothing more than I could make at home -- just cubed cukes with a simple dressing and Italian parsley. The parsley I thought didn't work at all in this dish, and that's speaking as a big fan of Italian parsley.

For mains we ordered the oven-baked fish and the smoked ham hock. The fish was pretty good and seasoned well without overpowering it, but nothing special. The accompaniments could have used some char. The smoked ham hock was a big miss. It is just a giant chunk of ham on the bone with some beans and greens. The texture is good but the flavor of the dish was too one-dimensionally rich for me.

For dessert we had the banana pudding. They definitely didn't hold back on the rum which was nice, but the actual bread pudding was dry and essentially needed to be dunked as a prerequisite to eating.

Overall, the meal was fine but nothing special in a city with so many amazing restaurants. It seemed to me that Cochon is riding on its reputation.

We ordered the duck pastrami, brisket sliders, pastrami on rye and the turkey avocado sandwich. Everything was really tasty and came quickly to our table. Servers were really nice and the restaurant layout was modern compared to many of the places we dined in the French quarter. 

It was a nice break from the typical NOLA food!

We picked Cochon as the closest restaurant to the incredible World War 2 Museum.  I was only a short two-walk blocks away.  It's a nicely-decorated "modern-rural" design establishment, and we were greeted and seated promptly.  The place was quite clean.  There was a nice assortment of national and micro-brew beers; I enjoyed the Devil's Harvest IPA.  We had two orders of BBQ ribs - spicy and delicious.  We also had "crisp pork" sandwiches which were greasy, not crisp.  The pork was all greasy fat.  We were not charged for the sandwiches.  The manager offered to substitute, but we opted not to stay. If you choose this restaurant, I suggest you order very carefully.

This is one of the finest restaurants I've been to anywhere. The rabbit was divine. The collards greens were the very best and the boudin requires a thesaurus. The front staff was superb. Get reservations and be amazed.

Astounding service with impeccable food!  I had the privilege to sit at the bar near the cook's and watched their art flow.  Couldn't be happier and I will return.

Anytime after 1830, it gets busy so be prepared to wait, but it's worth it!

NOLA is full of classic cajun fare, but this spot is a refreshing break from the old standards, serving up modern takes on southern food. Like fried boudin balls that were surprisingly delicate. Or a ham hock on a bed of "hoppin' John." Our reservation got a little botched, but we sat at the counter by the kitchen and got a great show.

This is the best restaurant in NOLA! We spent a week here and went to Cochon twice. Everything we've tried was delicious, from the fried alligator, the smoked hamhock, to the pork cheek. This is a must go for anyone visiting NOLA. Highly recommend!

First real meal in New Orleans and this did not disappoint. Vegetarian friendly, if you eat fish. We got the gulf fish "fisherman's style", the mac and cheese and the shrimp/eggplant dressing. Great service and great food!!

This place is way worth the wait! It was jam packed every time I tried to get a seat, so just know you'll have to wait to get in.

I sat at the bar and had a friendly bartender. Several great cocktails and draft beers. I ordered the wood fired oysters and the catfish and man oh man, so on point! The oysters tasted like a mixture of butter and sambal, and were the tastiest oysters I had in all of New Orleans. A hint of lemon on top balanced out the flavors. Highly suggest ordered some bread to dip into the sauce!

Next the lightly pan-fried catfish on a bed of rice was incredibly flavorful. Mint, lemon, and a plethora of other herbs and flavors made this incredibly aromatic dish. The flavors caught me off guard from the typical Cajun seasoning, but it was delicious.

If you're more into sandwiches, check out their sister restaurant next door!

I really enjoyed my visit here. Mike the bartender really made my experience better. He was very helpful and helps me with my selections. They make their own Bloody Mary mix. I ordered a drink called from the tree. Apple infused vodka cinnamon & clove was very different but my favorite from the two drinks I had. 
Mike let me taste the Bloody Mary mix. 
The fried oysters were amazing. Hands down the best food I tasted from this whole trip. 
Mike told me to soak the juice with the bread. Which I almost told him I don't eat carbs but I thought to myself live a little! OMG! I wish I would had ate two of those. 
My drinks, the staff, the food! We're all perfect.

If you are in New Orleans, this place is a must!!! Great for groups, birthdays, families, date night. 

We came here for dinner one night and oh boy, everything served to us was good! 

The restaurant is very big, don't let the store front fool you. 

We had reservations which we got seated right away. We ordered a bottle of wine, and some fried oyster and fried alligator to start with. Both which were good but u loved the fried oysters better. 

As for dinner I ordered the Rabbit and dumplings and it was super hearty and delicious. Something I'd eat more in the winter then something in the summer. He go the braised beef short rib on top of rice which was also hearty and delicious . As for sides we got smothered greens and cracklings (cracklings was a special order). 

For dessert we got pineapple upside down cake that came with a coconut lime sherbet which complimented very well. 


Staff was wonderful and sommelier was knowledgeable.

What a great birthday dinner here with good friends.  There's a reason why this place is on the Hot List.  From the attentive service to the Fabulous Food.  It was a fantastic first visit from beginning to end.

Cochon means pig in French.  The menu is well rounded from pig being the star attraction whether in the boucherie or entree part of the menu.  But there's plenty else to pick from with Cajun & creole influence.

Two highlights from the small plates section.  Wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter.  And fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise.  Fabulous!  The flavors of the oysters were amazing.  (See photo). The alligator was gone so quick I wasn't able to get a photo. 

The house specialty I ordered from their main entrees was the Louisiana Cochon with cabbage, cracklins' and pickled turnips.  Simply amazing.

My husband had the rabbit fish which he said was excellent.  And they also offered a fried oyster sandwich which another friend had which they said was also good.

The wine menu by the glass and bottle are pretty extensive.  Service was wonderful and the dessert I had was equally delicious.  A Chocolate Chip Cookie Cake.

best bet to visit this place is Calling for reservations at least 4-6 weeks out.  Especially for a Sat night.  I did notice that there is 4 seats at a high top so u can see the cooking up close as well.

This place is a must visit!

Food is amazing! I highly recommend the braised short rib! We didn't have reservations but were seated at bar in front of the chefs. Not ideal, but fun to watch the action. Great service as well, don't come to NOLA without paying a visit. Going to try Cochon Butcher next!

Still as amazing as opening night!

Great for groups. My compliments to the Genial manager on leading such a smoothly running operation that has help its standards high!
Food was excellent, 5 stars.  Issue is $10 for a draft IPA.  That brings down rating to 3 stars.

This place is amazeballs!!!! The food is just phenomenal. Masterful. We wanted to try everything so we had a bunch of small plates and shared one entree and a side dish... OMG people!!
My tastebuds are still doing a happy wiggle dance...

I visited Cochon for dinner based on the recommendation from a friend. I'm really glad I went!! You do need to make reservations. I booked about 5 days ahead and had a very short list of open slots.

First, the atmosphere is great! Warm and inviting, but not stuffy or pretentious at all. There is just a hint of burning wood in the air and that enhances the experience. I was seated promptly and water was on the table immediately.

My server arrived quickly and greeted me. I ordered a nice glass of wine to get things started while I Das perusing the menu.

Warm bread and butter arrived shortly and it was delicious. Perfectly cooked and the butter was just soft enough to be spreadable. A great way to start the evening.

I first ordered the fried alligator. I've had alligator multiple times at other restaurants and it is a tricky meat to cook. It is often dry or chewy. Cochon, however, got it right! Perfect bite-sized chunks of tender, flavorful meat with a delicious chili garlic mayo dipping sauce. The portion was very generous and I loved every bite.

For the next course, I ordered the Rabbit & Dumplings along with a side of smothered collard greens. Definitely comfort food. Both arrived piping hot and in generous portions. I enjoyed every bite of both dishes. The rabbit was tender and flavorful, the gravy was the perfect consistency, and the dumplings were tender and soaked up the gravy nicely. The greens had lots of flavor and were very tender.

Sadly, I was stuffed by the end of the meal and couldn't manage to try a dessert. I save that for another time.

Highly recommend Cochon. I will definitely return!

Cocktails are yummy. I got the chicken and andouille gumbo, very tasty. It is very $$$, but super tasty. The BEST thing on the menu is the fried alligator. Def a must try place. Hope to come back again. Wait staff was also amazing. Never had an empty drink.

I don't know people, but this must be the most overrated restaurant ever. 
First of all no vegetarian items at all (don't even expect a vegan dish) !! Not even a pasta dish or a salad. They had mediocre mac n cheese and really gross brussels sprouts casserole. It didn't resemble casserole. It was more like a soup. Very gross. 
Even the meat dishes that my table ordered were tasteless. They had to add salt or hot sauce to make it edible. The price is ridiculously high. 
Service was good not perfect. With dishes as high as $26, I expect a perfect service. 

The one star is for the warm bread. I do not recommend this place.
Hard to pick one place in New Orleans as the "not to be missed" but this is right up there. Alligator bites, gambino and a fantastic mufalleta sandwich. Gold!
Just go. You'll thank me. Meat pie was outstanding, cochin was great, sides were decadent in the best ways possible. The desserts .

This is my favorite restaurant in Nola. People can fight me on it but I stand by it. This is the winner for me among this family of restaurants (Butcher, Herbsaint). 

I always order the same thing when I go here and sample what others have gotten for variety. Hands down, the oven friend oysters are THE BEST oysters I have ever had. Each oyster shell usually two in it so it's really 10-12 oysters.  I always get an order with an order of the fried alligator. You cannot come here without ordering at least one of those things. The oyster sauce is so good you'll need all your bread to sop it up. The small plates have been largely the same since I first came here 10 years ago, the entrees change out periodically. Don't be surprised if you opt for a dinner of multiple sides and forego an entree. 

Cocktails as always are on point. Gumbo and crab soup are also great choices. 

You can probably pass on dessert if you even have space for it. The baba au rhum is an interesting one, it's heavy on the rum and basically a rum cake with bananas in the middle - do yourself a favor and focus your stomach real estate on the food! 

I strongly recommend reservations here as dinners get full up and walk ins typically have longer waits.

On our first trip to New Orleans, we stopped here based on many recommendations. They did not disappoint! The staff was exceptional and had great recommendations. We had the alligator, Mac and cheese, and oysters. Everything tasted fresh and was seasoned perfectly! We had to wait until the second day we were there because they didn't have any available reservations until then. But definitely make a reservation early because the food is well worth it! We will definitely be going back if we ever are back in New Orleans!

Wow!  Well with the wait, but it is best to have a reservation.  We sat at the bar next to the kitchen as it was the only available spot at 9pm. I have to say I kind of loved it as you got to see the magic unfold before your eyes.  Each meal that came out looked better than the next.  
Some of our favorites were the 
wood-fired oysters with chili garlic butter, 
smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle, 
Louisiana cochon with cabbage, cracklins & pickled turnips and the Mac and cheese.  My husband and I have had a lot of ribs in our day, but these are by far some of our favorites.  

The cocktails are also extremely creative.  So, belly up to the bar and order some drinks while you wait for your table.

Stopped in for brunch/light meal as we had lot of places to visit this day.  Since we wanted to order few item just to taste, after reviewing the menu, we went with the following items:

- Fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise
- macaroni & cheese casserole
- Catfish Courtbouillon

Our favorite was the mac and cheese!  If you visit, this dish is a must!!! It's a side item, so order one per person :)  

Our second favorite was the bread!  It's oven to table, so its very warm and delicious!!!  

Fried Alligator - the sauce was nice, but I wasn't a fan of the alligator... maybe I was missing something.

Catfish - it was just ok.

If you have a chance, try their hot sauce, it's a must!  We liked it because it was close to our hotel as well!

Great find.  The smells in here are amazing. Food was great.  Service was ok. 

Would visit again and try some new options. Everything we had was awesome.  

Ribs with pickled watermelon is a must try.

If you want a place that knocks your Culinary socks off, off the beaten path in NoLA, go no further than Cochon. This place made me fall in love with meats and season I didn't usually care for! The ribs were out of this world: perfectly cooked and moist and maintained crispy on the edges. The Mac n cheese was good but forgettable. I got the pork dish, which is out of my comfort zone and it came with crispy pork skins on top like sprinkles. The dish itself was flavorful, mature, and the texture was unexpected. We had the oysters as recommended to us as an appetizer and regret nothing. The sauce was great and the oysters were grilled to perfection. The change came when we ordered a dessert and rather than the sauce there was a vinegar sauce on our banana cream pie dish. I couldn't get the taste out of my mouth for an hour, they apologized for the mistake, but I didn't expect a restaurant that good and refined to make one that big. All servers were great about it too.
Very, very good food. We went to the more informal sandwich side which is around the corner from the restaurant. If you are thinking about going here--do it!

Long over due! My husband and I went here back in April when I was in New Orleans for a business conference. It was the first place we stopped at after a long day of travel. It definitely set the bars high for the rest of the trip. We LOVED it!! Great atmosphere and fun environment!! The Wood Fire Oysters are TOO DIE for! The service was great and the drinks were scrumptious. Hopefully we get to come back again someday!

This was a last minute stop and unfortunately we got the location mixed up with the sister location which is more casual.  Needless to say,  the service was absolutely horrible.  We sat for over 20 minutes before we got bread and was rushed to order.  
Place an order to eat in and a salad to go which was another disappointment.  The food had flavor but looked like brown poo. Nothing worth the money the items costed.  The salad was brought to us covered in dressing and when I asked the gentleman if we could have dressing on the side he quickly snatched the salad from the table and said I'll ask the manager.  Just rude. I wouldn't go back for free...

My first NOLA restaurant! I started with their version if a mule and then we enjoyed small plates of alligator, pork ribs  with watermelon relish and wood-fired oysters. I can't not mention the rolls! The oysters were my favorite part, especially dipping the roll in the garlic butter from the oysters; but all was delicious.

In a word - amazing!  From the smell walking up to the front door, to the service to the food and drinks.  Broiled oysters were tasty with a hint of spice - and the shells were perfect for dipping the bread in, too!  Chocolate mousse for dessert was the smooth and creamy!

Thankfully we came at 4pm where it wasn't busy.

Since my friend and I want to try everything, we ordered a lot during meal here. We also missed lunch due to a tour, so we were STARVING! 

We ordered for the two of us:
wood-fired oysters with chili garlic butter- definitely the best out of everything we ordered!!!
fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise- this was good, BUT the sauce was way too spicy for me!
louisiana cochon with cabbage, cracklins & pickled turnips- this one was okay as well
pork cheek sauce piquant with hominy grit cake-this one was okay
PINEAPPLE UPSIDE-DOWN CAKE- delicious!

Overall, we really enjoyed the oysters!! It was so good! Fried alligator was delicious, but the other two dishes were just average.

It was great to try this place once, though with so many other great food places, I'm not sure this will be a place I'll return!

the service however was GREAT!
Too pricey, not much food, poor flavor. After reading the reviews I went in with high hopes and was severely disappointed.

This place gets really busy so if you get a seat anywhere, grab it because the food is fantastic!

What we loved- the fried alligator, pork cheeks, charbroiled oysters (Amazing!) and pork ribs! All were done extremely well but my favorite was the alligator. There was also an excellent chocolate mousse for dessert. The food we didn't quite think was up to snuff was the gumbo. It was watery without many pieces. The drinks are strong and the service is great. We were seated at the bar and so as the evening moved on, there was literally a mob of people behind us. Little inconvenient, but oh well, everyone wants to enjoy good food!

Wonderful lunch here! We came early, 11:30, knowing it would fill up! Based on other reviews, we started with the char-grilled oysters and alligator - both in excellent marinades - and we ate up those sauces with the hot fresh bread. My husband had the fried chicken thigh sandwich, spicy like he prefers - he loved it. I got the catfish which was excellent. Service was excellent, even when they filled up. I would definitely go back!!!!

This has to be one of my favorite restaurants in the world. Thanks to Anthony Bourdain, I came across Cochon and now I've eaten here on every trip to New Orleans. 

The rabbit and dumplings is excellent. Tender and flavorful. The fried alligator is PACKED with flavor and has  a nice little touch of heat. 

Even their bread was extraordinary! 

Service is always fantastic.

Do yourself a favor and eat at Cochon. Great local, fresh, inspired food. I love small plates and there were many great options to choose from. Gator never tasted so good. Great wait staff, good beer and bourbon choices. 

I always ask myself "Would a local eat here"?  And yup...they would.

Cochon has done a tremendous job at identifying itself as a pork connoisseur and creative restauranteur. We started with the alligator appetizer that was perfectly fried with a spicy creole sauce balanced with fresh shaved fennel bulb - sounds crazy - but it was spectacular. We each ordered the oyster and bacon sandwich for dinner. Think of the best BLT you've ever had with fried oysters added to the deliciousness. Eating the  bacon on this sandwich is almost a religious experience - smoky, crunchy, salty; perfection. The combination of this sandwich is genius pulling together southern pork and a po' boy sandwich. The vibe in the restaurant is hip and modern with loud music lots of beer drinking bearded guys with dark rimmed glasses and skinny jeans. But there's a mix of couples, large parties and locals - it attracts them all and I bet it's the bacon that keeps 'em coming!
A fantastic meal!  The charbroiled oysters with garlic and chili butter are out of this world.  I had the rabbit and dumplings which were great.

Do not leave New Orleans without eating at Cochon and Cochon Butcher, both owned by James Beard Award winning chefs Donald Link and his business partner Stephen Stryjewski. They also own Peche Seafood Grill where we dined twice in a week. No matter what these two put on the menu, it's incredibly fresh, intensely flavorful and amazing to eat. 

We went bonkers over their fried alligator dish (they choose the tender part of the gator not the tail which makes is softer, chewy and delicious!), smoked ribs which were out of this world and the famous fire grilled oysters. Everything was fantastic, I loved the house-made root beer too.

To top it all off, Guy Fieri from the Food Network's Diners, Dive-Ins and Drives, walked into Cochon's bar and had a blast with his film crew! 

We will definitely be back next time we're in NOLA, there's no way I'm missing out. Cheers Cochon!

It's all about those chili butter oysters here. Ive been eating em for lunch and dinner. Those oysters are so orgasmic. Before you squeeze lemon in it, taste them first for what they are. Mmmm hot damn

This place is hands down my favorite food experience in New Orleans. Granted, I've only been twice BUT ITS SO GOOD.

Service & atmosphere: the space is more mod than most of the classic NOLA eateries with sleek wood paneling everywhere and dim lighting. Service was fast, informative, and friendly.

Food & drink: the cocktails are amazing and after forcing my friends to let try some of theirs I can attest that you can't go wrong with the whole cocktail menu. Food wise, I had the fried alligator, wood fired oysters, pork cheek, and short ribs. The apps had amazing sauces that really elevated the flavors without masking the alligator and oysters. The cheek and short ribs were super tender, fall off the bone, and solidly flavorful. 

I can't wait to come back and have the rest of the menu!
Ate here and the food was fabulous! The red bean and rice meat pie was just the right size and just the right kick. The rabbit and dumplings was well seasoned and humor the spot.

Food was very good if a bit pricey. Had the rabbit and dumplings and was not disappointed. Portions are a bit small, but I expected that. Daytime service was a little underwhelming but not bad, just a bit distracted. Good date spot if you plan on spending a bit of money.

We visited Cochon on our first night in NoLa. We had reservations at 9:30 and the place was slammed. We crammed our group of 8 into the bar area to wait for our table to be ready. When we checked a bit later, the hostess wasn't too friendly, letting us know she would find us. We were just making sure she knew where we were, but I understand how stressful a busy night can be. That being said, it didn't dampen our spirits. We got a table at the back of the main room which was out of the main thoroughfare and not too loud. Our server was helpful and nice. 
We all shared the oysters and fried alligator. Both were delicious! Keep in mind, this is the first time I'd tried oysters (I don't like the chewy texture) but the sauce they were in was amazing. And fried alligator is great, don't be shy with this!
I had the chicken and andouille gumbo with a side of mac and cheese and my husband had the rabbit and dumplings. I would eat that gumbo and mac and cheese every day, they were so dang good! The rabbit and dumplings looks like a potpie, so it's not as much a dumpling I think. But it was very flavorful, but it is a heavy dish, my husband wasn't able to finish it.
Everything here is melt in your mouth good. Service is outstanding. The drinks are also super delicious.

We were disappointed with the food here but the service was great so I gave it an extra star for that. We started with the fried alligator. It was so tough that we only ate half. I mentioned the toughness of the meat to the waiter who said that's just the nature of alligator. If that's the case, why serve it? Serving something practically inedible just because it's unusual doesn't seem like a wise decision for a classy joint. 

We had a broccoli salad with nice flavor though the broccoli was a little too soft. The gumbo, pan roasted red fish and smoked ribs we had were all just average on flavor. 

Unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend this pla

Amazing food! The crispy fish was to do for. Extremely packed had to wait an hour past our reservation but the food was great. Also got the Kobe beef appetizer was good, but would have liked to explore something else. Definitely a hipster neighborhood

The atmosphere at Cochon is very inviting and comfortable, and on the more modern side for a NOLA restaurant. I came in with high expectations, considering how I've been told that the main chefs here are well known.

We ordered the fried alligator as well as the pork ribs and Louisiana cochon. Like they all say, alligator really does taste like chicken, but with a slightly chewier texture. The sauce on it was great with just the right amount of kick. The pork ribs were mediocre. While the barbeque sauce they were drowned in was good, the meat did not cleanly fall off the bone and was a bit dry at times. It was nothing to rave about. The Louisiana cochon was alright as well - the pulled pork was also drier than I would've liked, but the surrounding sauce was decent.

I enjoyed my food, but not at the expense of my wallet. If I were to pay $65 for a meal (split between two people), I'd expect higher quality dishes coming out of the kitchen.
Really enjoyable place for lunch. Ribs were tangy and delicious (not drop off the bone tender though). Tasty cocktails and good service.

My visit to New Orleans this time pushed me off the local strip to Cochon. I made reservations over a week ago just in case. The open kitchen and front bar was the first thing I noticed. They sat me down immediately. Great start already. 

I ordered the spare ribs and oysters as an appetizer. Followed that with Cat Fish in a gumbo and Mac and cheese and a twice baked potato! All very good.

Stopped here with friends and there was a bit of a wait but we sat outside. We all shared plates and were all satisfied with our meals (watermelon + ribs!). The employees were nice and accommodating, parking was a bit challenging, but it was a Saturday night.

Loved this place

Charcuterie board top notch! We loved all of the Drinks, Entrees and desserts.

Great atmosphere, a definite stop!

This was our favorite meal in New Orleans! They were super busy so you probably want reservations but service was fast and friendly once we were seated. This place had the best oysters from our whole trip. 

Here's our highlights (we were a group of 8 so there was lots of sharing):
Oysters- Must Have!
Oyster Sandwich (BLT + Oysters)
Fried Alligator
Chicken and Sausage Gumbo
Mac and Cheese
Decent, but overpriced.  You're paying for the ambiance more than the actual food.  Appropriate for business meals on an expense tab, but for authenticity and value, look elsewhere.

By far my favorite Restaurant inNew Orleans. Nice walk from tourist area. Pork is theirthing and they do it well! 
Wood fired Oysters are Amazing as well. Everybody I take there raves about it.

Surprised to find a 2014 Brooklyn Chocolate Stout at the bar :).  Ordered the Fried Alligator, Wood-fired oysters, Boucherie plate and 2lb pork neck roast; all of which are delicious and highly recommend.  Topping that off was just fantastic service and friendly staff!

This place is everything the reviews say. 
Awesome local cuisine with their own unique interpretation of NOLA inspired cooking. 
The signature dish Louisiana Cochon was not just a pulled pork dish it was an explosion of awesome tastes. Do not miss this dish. 
Service was spot on.

This place is good: roasted broccoli salad & the fire grilled oysters were good, drinks were solid without being overly sugary, service was just fine (nothing overly memorable). Probably not somewhere to where I'd return...not with so many other options in this city.
Excellent restaurant.  The. Louisiana Cochon is a must.  No reservation needed. Very large upscale with impeccable service.  Child friendly
Was referred to this place by an Uber driver. I was a little sketch when I seen the menu specially being from Los Angles. But I will come back here ANY DAY for the alligator! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
Food was off the hook good. Servers we outstanding very attentive to our needs. Great atmosphere.
Took my hubby here when he first moved to NOLA.  He loved it can't wait to take him again.

I would first like to thank our waiter team duo, the true superstars of the night, Brooklyn and Terry. They were on top of their game and I think, the only servers in my life to say "Thank You for coming in and dining with us today". They were speedy, provided eating tips to elevate our Cochon experience, hooked me up with all the hot dinner rolls I could have ever wanted, checked up on us often, and even offered to roll me out if I was stuffed (haha... because I ordered quite a bit for 2 people).

Most if not all of Cochon's dishes are served tapas/family style. Everything we ordered was exceptional. The dinner rolls they served were fresh from the oven warm and fluffy like a Hawaiian roll, minus the soft exterior and sweetness. Read on for more details!

FRIED ALLIGATOR WITH CHILI GARLIC MAYO - if you've never had alligator before, it tastes like white chicken meat. The chili garlic mayo was reminiscent of Sriracha mayo and when completely coated over each cube of alligator meat, it reminded me of Chinese prawn and walnuts, minus the shrimp and honeyed walnuts.

FRIED LIVERS WITH PEPPER JELLY TOAST - I love fried internals and fried livers is no exception. This one tasted like fluffed up foie gras! The "pepper jelly" was just a fancy way of saying Asian sweet & spicy chili sauce, but slightly thicker.

WOOD-FIRED OYSTERS WITH CHILI GARLIC BUTTER - of all the ways oysters are served, wood-firing them might be my favorite. The sweet juices are all collected at the base of the shell and fused with chili garlic butter. PRO TIP: ask for more buns so you can soak up that oyster chili garlic butter sauce. You won't be disappointed. 

RABBIT & DUMPLINGS - this dish is basically a deconstructed, not-quite-but-pretty-much-is a pot pie. The dumplings were just empty dough pockets but oh damn, that soup was thick, hearty, and warmed my soul. The rabbit was soft and not dry at all. PRO TIP: also dip your buns here.

I may be biased because I'm an employee but this should be a staple of New Orleans already! From the small plates to wine selection, this is Cajun done right with an amazing flair. Try the shrimp on toast and oysters for a much needed zing of flavor to your pallet

Oh my. It's been over a year since I visited. I dream about their roast pork, I can taste it, I can smell it. I've tried to replicate it at home, I've not come close. I would travel for hours to get here to indulge here

Let me say this is one of the best places in NOLA. If you're looking for great food- something different, contemporary, hip and accompanied by some great service- go to this spot!

Top of my list: gator bites, charbroiled oysters, short rib, Mac & cheese, salad and their deserts OMG!!! Their bread is delicious. I swear I had to stop or I'd be full before the meal. 
Must try!
The food was excellent. I had the catfish, Mac and cheese and Lima beans. I would definitely recommend Cochon.

Highly recommended next to the convention center. I met up with another conference attended and we decided to see what was near the event. We found this restaurant in maps and were surprised it was not completely full at lunchtime. We were immediately seated and the service and food were both amazing. We shared the fried alligator with spicy mayo sauce and it was delish. Chewy, but tasty (yes, like chicken). I had the fried oyster BLT ($20) but yum. We also tried the brussel sprout salad (roasted) and smothered greens ($7), a perfect balance to all the deep fried fare. 

I think it as an anomaly that the place was not full -- some of the prices were a bit high for lunch (a short rib sandwich which was touted as "falling off the bone" was $20 and full roast beef with sides was $30 on the specials menu. The rabbit and dumplings also looked great! 

Highly recommended and I think reservations are a good idea.

Highly rated and heavily visited....family has been to the neighboring "butcher" sandwich shop and raves so we dove in for dinner during a December long weekend trip. Decent meal in what is a noisy, casual and very busy and crowded dining room. The place is bigger than you can imagine and service was aligned with many people eating and leaving. A bit more noisy than I would have liked. We ended up having BBQ oysters (we usually like our oysters raw but these were delish) and the star was the fried chicken livers ! Seriously worth a try and damn good. We had the short ribs and rabbit w dumplings as mains and a few glasses of house white and beers for me. The short ribs could have been more flavorful and tender and the accompanying side was just meh. Overall: Good meal - We've had better and we were surprised that for a place that is a temple for pork that there were so few options in the swine category. Noisy but solid food. Felt a little rushed and opted to pass on dessert - we ate it later at another place. Good meal but not the star of our trip and quite honestly we went back and had Sammie's at Butcher a few days later and the Cubano and Pork belly Sammie's were a better highlight. We'd come back to get Sammie's next door.

Amazing food. Get the oysters with buns and the jambalaya!  But, Service was unpleasant. We had four different servers and both food and drinks took way to long. We were there during lunch hours when it wasn't too crowded. Can't imagine what the dinner service is like. 
Overall, based on the poor service I would say skip. There is so much great food in NOLA, you better have good service to back it up.

I had dinner here with a friend on a recent visit to NOLA. Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful! Service was great, and everything -- I mean everything -- we were served was first-rater. This fussy customer was completely satisfied, which is saying something.

Came in early on a Saturday night (around 4:30-5) and were told there was no seating available even though there were at least 7 open tables in the front room. The hostesses (there were about 4 of them) were pretty rude. Only one of them acknowledged us, but she didn't sound like she knew what was going on. We were told to try sitting at the bar, but it was already full so we stood awkwardly to the side.

We were still able to order some drinks and the fried oysters from the bar. The drinks were very refreshing, and I loved the flavor of satsuma in my drink. The purple rain was also good, and a vivid shade of purple. The oysters were charbroiled to perfection and very flavorful. But after standing for over an hour (and watching those tables remain empty), we bounced and headed to another place for dinner. 

Would try this place again, but the service was so inadequate that I don't feel compelled to return, even for those delicious oysters.

We came for the wood-fired oysters and they did not disappoint! Garlicky and spicy deliciousness 
And yes, like everyone else said- you'll definitely want some bread to soak up the sauce. 

We went for lunch so it wasn't very busy. Although we made a reservation we just sat up at the bar (we're bar people, what can I say?). Bartender was great, very friendly and helpful. We started with the oysters and also had the pork cheek and andouille jambalaya. The pork cheek was not my thing, but the andouille was really good. It was smokey and a little spicy. 

They have a large whiskey selection so we did a whiskey flight as well.

I was alone on business--ate back at bar at the chef's window, I'd say cooler than the bar up front--and this place is great. It's my second time here, the first being years ago. 
I would go ahead and say this is the best restaurant I've eaten at in New Orleans. And the thing is, it's only $$ not $$$$. But it could totally be charging at least a third more for its level of food and service. 
I'd say if you're coming to this town to eat, this should be on the list without a second thought. 
I had the Alligator and the Cochon. Then the kitchen gave me and the single customer next to me both our own hash brown and cheese experiment, as a free taste test (a benefit of sitting at the chef's counter). All were great, especially the alligator which coulda felt like fried junk food at another restaurant, but here feels like a delicacy. I really like this place.

So glad I made reservations for this place the day before because even for a Monday night, this place was packed! Got there and the waitstaff was very friendly and offering suggestions on which dishes to get. Started with the famous fried gator bites and honestly, I didn't love them! I wasn't a fan of the spicy mayo sauce and I feel like I've had something like it before and didn't like it. The gator meat itself was tender, softer than chicken, kind of had a consistency of shrimp. I know everyone loves the gator but don't feel pressured to get it, there are plenty of other good dishes! I was actually in love with the grits! Slathered in butter and so good, I devoured the whole plate. My friend ordered the pork ribs with pickled watermelon rinds and it was so tasty! The ribs had a nice smoky, savory flavor and the rinds were sweet and bitter and just full of flavor. I got the grilled teres major with pureed cauliflower and it was delicious! The subtle puree added a nice contrast to the heavy steak which was grilled to perfection. The restaurant had a fun atmosphere and glad I got to experience what everyone raves about!

I was at Cochon again this week after dining here several years ago.  It was as good as I had remembered it.   I dined during the change of shift and could tell that those getting off work for the day didn't really care about our experience.   Their service was extremely poor.  The waiters we had who were starting their shift were better but there were some hang ups in the kitchen that made our food take an unacceptable amount of time to reach our table.   Nevertheless the food was great.
I recommend the alligator fried and rabbit dumplin at this place with the rum. Good ambiance and crowd.

I had a 10:30 reservation. Arrived a bit early but was seated immediately. The restaurant has a very casual, comfortable vibe. My waitress (whom I'm embarrassed to say I don't remember her name) was friendly and professional...and very good at her job. I started off with the wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter....Phenomenal!! So good, I could have made a meal of them alone! Next, the rabbit and dumplings. Basically a twist on chicken pot pie. Very good but I wanted to go back to the oysters! Recommended!
Nothing spectacular. Good place to eat, but not sure it's worth the price. The alligator appetizer is pretty good, but doesn't really offer any surprises. Entrees are good, but similarly bland.

This place has a cool vibe and some rich food so get in here and try it. We started with chili butter roasted oysters and a Brussels sprout salads special. Enjoyed both but found the amount of cheese and dressing on the salad to be a lot! that said,  the Brussel sprouts were cooked perfectly. I was so happy with my entree, a fall off the bone smoked ham hock with just the right amount of hoppin John (I love  Lima bean). My husband got the rabbit dumplings which arrived in a mini cast iron and topped with biscuits. Not only was it piping hot and filled with the best fatty flavor, but the Veges (especially the carrots) were perfectly al dente- bravo! 


Our server didn't bat an eye when I poured their proprietary hot sauce on my bread plate to dip my bread at the start of the meal. I love hot sauce and this was too GOOD not to try!

I came to this restaurant with a group (7+ people) for a business dinner and I am a vegan. So I cannot have meat or dairy and the chef hand made from scratch a 4-course vegan meal for me! The food and service were absolutely divine and I'd highly recommended this place!!

I absolutely love this place. I'm so sad that I didn't get to try everything on the menu. We came here for a late lunch and we had an early dinner planned so we could only try a few things.

We had the fried alligator, the oysters, the crab claws, and the Mac and cheese.

My favorite was the Mac and cheese. Super cheesy and well flavored. The texture was perfect.

The crab claws were also very good. The hint of parsley really set the dish.

The oysters were also very good. I don't usually like cooked oysters, but this was one of my favorites.

The alligator was surprisingly really good. It really just tastes like chicken, but a little tougher. The meat was super tender and really flavorful. I really enjoyed it. 

I loved this place and will definitely be back next time I'm in NOLA

Food was amazing and service was great too!! Our first meal in New Orleans. 
Definitely would recommend the Alligator bites and the Oysters. The rice balls and jambalaya were also really good.

One of our favorite restaurants in Williamsburg! Great food, wonderful ambiance (love the fireplace in Moody's Room). The fried oyster salad is a must-try, as is the BBQ pork (cooked in a Big Green Egg).

We came here with a party of twelve for a business dinner.  Fabulous menu and food.  Many of the mixed drinks were not made correctly.  We had only one server for 12 people, which made things pretty slow.  Overall, everyone had a good time because the food was what we would expect from a great New Orleans restaurant.

Our Uber driver recommended this place to us. He was like... "if you like pork, you will then have to try out this place. The experience will be like out of this world." Oh boy he was absolutely right on that. 

When the Cochon was presented, I was honestly a bit underwhelmed by the dish. I thought it was a little bit on the boring side -- looking just a giant seared meatball on a bed of unrecognizable side vegetables. Upon first bite, I knew I was so wrong about that.

It was like a mission impossible for me trying to figure out how it was made, or to describe how it actually tasted like. But-- try to imagine a combination of pulled pork and meatloaf. You could get to see shreds of pork, while it was so moist and tender in the meantime. 

We loved everything we ordered and finished every plate. It was for sure an exceptional experience for us.
The Mac and cheese is bomb.com, also the shrimp grits. Really great atmosphere and music. Great service

I would say this is more like a $$ 1/2 priced restaurant but worth every penny. We ordered the fried alligator (delicious! kind of tastes like a mix between frog and chicken), woodfire oysters, Louisiana Cochon, pork cheek jambalaya and a side of Mac and Cheese (a nice surprise). Everything was great but the Cochon was really unique and a dish you wouldn't get elsewhere in NOLA. Service was nice too and we were seated immediately even though we were 30 min early for our reservation.

Tried this restaurant with friends and family around Christmas. The staff is very nice. We ordered shrimp and grits and grilled oysters. It was okay but not over the top. Seasonings could have been heavier. This place is definitely a hot spot for tourists but;if you like spicier more authentic, I suggest you try elsewhere.
Absolutely delicious food and great service. As much as everything we ordered was amazing, the show stopper was the Mac n Cheese!

I've eaten here two times previously, and enjoyed it both times.  But tonight the food was overly salty.  We noticed it first with the soup of the day.  Then the red fish, and the brussels sprouts, and the turtle neck soup.  Just about every dish we sampled other than the salads had been ruined with too much salt.  The manager was nice, and apologized, and 'comped' two of the soups.  He explained, somewhat patronizing, that cajon food is heavily spiced.  We countered that we love the cajon spices - just not the salt - and reminded him that there is a reason the every table has a salt shaker for those customers that enjoy it. 

On a positive note, the service was very good.  The wait staff was attentive and helpful.  I will probably try Cochon again, but I fear that others in our party will not.

Great food and drinks but our service was not the best. Our food arrived before our drinks came. We were also given 2 different bills (the amounts were the same. Our menu was different from what is posted on line so they must change it daily.
Service was quick and caring, and the food was amazing.  It has a modern-industrial feel, and the atmosphere is quite welcoming.  Overall, a wonderful experience. Appropriately priced.

For Cajun and New Orleans style cuisine this is the place! Their recommended dishes include the fried alligator, the jambalaya, the signature Cochon, and the Brussels sprouts. Be prepared for spice. I also heard the drink smoke over water was quite strong. Toward the end, the meal was a bit too spicy for me and I requested some bread, which never arrived? How is that? Hence the downgrade of 3 stars.

If you're visiting NOLA, I would definitely give this place a try. It's one of those hipster/trying to be authentic to the area's cuisine type of place. Think of a toned down rustic/fancy restaurant like Hell's Kitchen, but WAYYY more affordable. It has that vibe.

I'm knocking off one star because it took at least 15 minutes for someone to notice us to take our order after we were seated. We kept trying to make eye contact with various servers but it seemed like they were purposely trying to avoid us--not sure. Low key some of the servers seem to have somewhat of an arrogant vibe; the kind of vibe only hipsters can have (trust me). So that was slightly disappointing.

They have a short menu with appetizers, entrees, soups/salads, etc. They're known for the way they cook their pork (or couchon) and fried alligator. I would recommend getting the friend alligator for sure--it's one of those things you should try in NOLA and trust me, it tastes like chicken. Or it tasted like chicken to me and my wife claimed it tasted like a "tough" chicken. It's glazed in this sriracha/spicy mayo -- had a great kick to it and low key reminded me of the Asian American-style popcorn chicken I used to eat as a kid.

I also recommend you get some kind of pork dish (if you eat pork). We had the bbq pork ribs w/ watermelon pickle. I could do without the watermelon pickle--it's a side garnish, so you can just take it off. The ribs themselves were delicious - very smoky and you can tell the BBQ glaze was homemade. It had a more sour and tangy taste - LOVED IT!

We also had the mac and cheese casserole. If you like cheesy, stringy, and melty mac and cheese, go for this. My wife liked it a lot, and I just liked it alright because 1. I'm lactose intolerant so I could only have a little bit and 2. It was a bit too gooey for me. But if you love this type of mac, trust me... you'll like this one.

Give this place a shot - it won't disappoint!

What a fantastic treat! Cochon was recommended to us by a few people and it absolutely lived up to the hype. 

The oysters are not to be missed, save some bread for soaking up the sauce. We also ordered the ribs and the shrimp and grits. Both outstanding.

My daughter is a vegetarian and the chef came up with a beautiful, healthy, and very tasty dish for her that was as good as our dishes.

The vibe in Cochon is like smooth Jazz. I'd have to say that the open kitchen and wooden decor is very nice on the eyes. Big windows and seeing the old New Orleans Dixie Machine Welding & Metal Works was a visual Plus. Seeing new construction is normally a knock on the eyes but not for this location. 

Now let's speak on the service. Very friendly, fun, and nice m. From the moment you walk in you see a diversity of people collectively working together. 

The FOOD! I truly enjoyed the oven-roasted "gulf fish". Very flavorful. The grits are a must have with the fish. The macaroni and cheese was just ok, in comparison to the food mentioned. Desert was good, I had the apple pie with vanilla ice cream. The only kick back was the small amount of ice cream provided with the apple pie. I had to order additional ice cream to complete my apple pie. 

Overall I would come back and I would definitely recommend this place.

As a first timer in NOLA, I did my research on great restaurants prior to visiting, and Cochon was on my go to list. Let's just say the recommended reviews did not let me down. The decor was nice, the atmosphere was warm, and the vibe was welcoming. The food, oooo the food did not let my taste buds down. The oysters were a must, I ended up placing 2 orders for oysters! The gator tail was made with a nice sauce. The pineapple upside down cake and sorbet was GREAT!!  The service was prompt and waitresses were attentive (thanks Lauren and Bri). For potential diners, I would highly recommend making reservations as you may be asked to wait 2 hours without reservations. I will definitely be back on my next trip.

My favorite restaurant in NOLA. The food is amazing, the service is friendly and warm, and the space is cool. The bread they give you is to die for. Share with friends so that you can try more dishes. I loved the butcherie board, and you must try Louisiana Couchon.
Excellent selection of meats. Classic Louisiana cuisine. Service was attentive and informed. Most impressed with the oysters which were out of this world.

Definitely a great place to dine! They serve the food quite quickly and the waiters were friendly. The food itself was delicious and we ended up ordering more food. Overall, I'll say this restaurant deserves a 5 star rating.

I think that the portions were relatively small. We were a group of 6, two adults and four children. We ordered 8 dishes.

Stout Cá Phe is great. Love the fried alligator. 
Also you don't wanna miss the Red Ryder.

The heavenly smells and the vaguely hipsterish clientele promised a good meal, but past experience (with hipster havens) has made me a bit apprehensive about the service.  Our waiter brightly informed us that lucky us, we were going to have two waiters that evening, which I suspect meant one was a trainee.  Everyone needs to train one time or another, no problem.  The food was delicious.  But the service left much to be desired.  They weren't surly; just painfully slow.  Advice to restaurants; people will overlook a lot if the cocktail order is quickly taken and brought. One becomes exasperated if not only are the drinks are slow in coming, not only if we see fellow diners who came after us have their orders taken and their cocktails brought, but the capper was that the cocktails didn't come until after our meals came.  Restaurants make a lot of money from cocktail service.  The drinks were delightful.  But it would be wise to not have them take quite so long.

Must get:
- this bread (omg it melts in your mouth and sooo fluffy)
- wood fired oysters (use the aforementioned bread to dip in the butter of the oysters)
- fried alligator (honestly it tasted like chicken to me but still good to try)
Wait, I just realize I didn't try pork dish here even though the name is Cochon (which means pig in francais). OH well, that means I will have to come back and try next time!

This was by far my favorite NO meal.

Now, I'm not going to say it was classic New Orleans but they do a fine job of some of the classics.

I feel like there's attention to the food and the overall experience. 

Everything was delicious.
Disappointing and way overpriced. Everything is. $7 sides. Thought they were going to be shareable. Ribs were dry and then drowned in sauce.
I like everything here. Food quality is much better than those overrated shop in attraction area.

Dined here with a party of 6 because most Other Cajun restaurants are closed on Sundays in the area. Our server was not attentive, this is why I rated the restaurant low. We ordered several starters and the alligator was delicious. The special of the day was red fish and it was undercooked and supposedly the fish had a big blood line so we had to get a new one ordered. The food itself isn't amazing and I felt most items were over priced for the quality of flavor and ingredients. Nothing spectacular. Of my 5 day visit in New Orleans this restaurant is definitely our least favorite.
Delicious, special, creative. My favorite one was greens - simple but amazing. Everything was great and we are happy we came

Holy cow this place is amazing. We ordered way too much food just so we could try as much as possible and each dish was better than the last.
Highly recommend the rabbit and dumplings, the ribs are the best we've ever had and don't skip dessert: the pineapple upside down cake was the perfect compliment.
We also had the alligator, obviously the Cochon, and their charcuterie board. You can't go wrong here.
Big hearts to chef Stephen. Next time we're in NOLA we'll be sure to stop in here again!!

Couchon is one of those places where it is great to go with a group, order a number of items and share.
All of the food selections seem great.
We enjoyed this spot...good food, romantic and well located. I would return with no hesitation and recommend

We had our first dinner here while visiting NOLA. The atmosphere was great and service was excellent. Our favorite dishes were the wood fried oysters, alligator bites, smothered greens and baby-back ribs. Grilled fish and Mac'n cheese were decent. Louisiana cochon with cabbage & cracklins was skippable.

I don't normally leave reviews but the experience here was so stellar I would be remiss not to. From the moment we sat down, our experience was top notch! The service was spectacular, the food was some of the best, I've ever had, and the atmosphere was warm and comfortable. There was a 5 course fixed menu for New Year's Eve and every bite was an explosion of well thought out and executed flavor. If you are in New Orleans, you MUST try Cochon.

Can't believe I haven't reviewed Cochon considering it is my favorite restaurant in New Orleans. This is the place to go if you are a meat lover. There are many great dishes to choose from but for me there is nothing in the city better than the Rabbit & Dumplings. Start there and you can't go wrong.
It usually is busy but not overly loud. Service has always been great from my experience as well.
I can't recommend this place enough.

First, the service was top-notch. Not too cloying, but definitely on top of things. Except for the bread I read about everywhere. It seems every other table got it but us, which I realized 3/4 the way through our meal. By then, I felt awkward asking about it. 

They were out of fried alligator, which was disappointing, so we started with the mac n' cheese, wood-fired oysters with chili garlic butter, jambalaya and andouille dish,  and smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle. The mac n' cheese was fantastic. The pasta was cooked well and the blend of cheeses was just right -- not too much, not too little. The oysters were tasty but didn't blow our socks off. The pork ribs had a vinegary BBQ sauce which no one in our party much cared for. The jambalaya and sausage were crunchy without much flavor. 

We then moved on to the smoked hamhock with hoppin' john and rabbit & dumplings. The hamhock was too rich. The hoppin' john was tasty but didn't balance the forward flavor of the hamhock.
