Great food, great atmosphere and definitely recommend coming here if you're in New orleans!!

This restaurant was wonderful! From the staff to the food and drinks, this place is a must when visiting New Orleans.  While each of us ordered different entrees, we tried each other's food and liked everything we tasted.  If we had any questions about the menu (as there was plenty of language on there I did not understand like 'hoppin john'), the staff was there to help us. I would definitely go back!
Great place and solid drinks. The Scarlett letter is on point. Very rich and flavorful gumbo and unique gator bites with a really good sauce drizzled over them

Despite being full, we were able to sit right away at our reservation time. Friendly staff. Great service. Totally appreciated the server marking out gluten free items on the menu (I messaged ahead).  Awesome food!!  The cochon was very delicious. I would highly recommend this place.

Food is delicious, drinks are amazing. Really liked the atmosphere and the decor. The wait staff were prompt and friendly. The oysters were my favorite. It's away from the hustle of the French Quarter so it's nice to slow down a bit. Come on by

Came here last week for a birthday dinner and had a nice time. The food is pretty good - nothing i'm dying to come back for, but would be happy to eat here again! Service is great (though when I called they said the first available reservation was 10 pm, which was later than we wanted, and when we arrived the place was more than 1/2 empty). 

As for the food - the rabbit & dumplings were pretty good; the pork ribs were delicious; the mac & cheese is great; and the signature cochon dish is memorable! If you're in the area, it's a great option!

Made a reservation for six at 8pm on a Thursday night, and they accommodated us even though we were 15 minutes late with two still on their way from the airport. The place was bustling, and there were many parties waiting, so make a res!

Our waiter was super attentive and respectful (very Southern of him.) Only pitfall was our drinks were kind of slow to come out. One girl ordered a second cocktail, and it came maybe 20 minutes later.

Food was amazing, for the most part:
Cucumbers & herbs in vinegar - B (not bad but nothing special)
Boucherie plate - A
Wood-fired oysters - A+
Fried alligator - A+
Rabbit & dumplings - A-
Louisiana Cochon - B- (basically pulled pork but dry. The cabbage saved the dish)
Fried boudin - A-
Over-roasted gulf fish - A

Desserts:
Rice pudding - B
Pineapple upside down cake - A- (warm!)

Best place we ate in New Orleans. Service excellent. Food creative take on cajun and creole traditions. Large group of us ordered many small plates and shared. Great experience. Will go back next time.

Let me just start off by saying....COCHON IS OFFICIALLY ONE OF MY NEW FAVORITE RESTAURANTS! If you find yourself in NOLA, please please stop by this place. 

My boyfriend and i came to New Orleans for a quick anniversary get away and we're told by a friend of a co worker to check out a number of restaurants, including Cochon, and we are so glad we chose to go. 

We stopped in around 9pm and sat down at a table. The vibe is super cool, kind of hipster, reminded me of a restaurant in NY. I ordered the "gimme the beet" vodka based drink - LOVED it. Obviously, if you don't like beets, you're not gonna like this drink, lol. 

We started off with the oysters (best I've ever had. Loved that they had a kick to them) and the chicken livers (that my boyfriend fell in love with). 

For entrees, we split the Cochon, jambalaya, and rabbit and dumplings. GET THEM ALL! i thought the rabbit and dumplings was my favorite - super tender and the DUMPLINGS!!!!! i am drooling as i write. We didn't get dessert because we were so full....However, we did come back the next day for lunch LOL. 

Sat at the bar this time. I of course had the beet cocktail again, we ordered the livers again. But we tried the shrimp and grits and their boucherie plate. The plate wasn't my favorite but the shrimp and grits were delicious. 

Bartenders were all male, super friendly and so were the hostesses. One with pink hair like me 8) very nice girls.

We will ABSOLUTELY be back to Cochon next time we are in NOLA. Thanks guys!

We had a fabulous meal here! We tried the ham hock, braised beef (special menu item), and red snapper. Each of the entrees were delicious and unique! We also had the yummy mac and cheese as a side. The wine menu is very limited but adequate. For desert we tried the meyer lemon pie and the out-of-this-world butterscotch pudding. I don't even like butterscotch pudding and I loved this desert! The waitstaff was knowledgeable and efficient. The only downside was that it was extremely noisy. There were two large groups eating near us in the back room and the noise really echoed. I recommend sitting in the front room if at all possible. The food was the best we had in Nola this trip!

Cochon was absolutely superb. The service made the whole experience even more pleasant and enjoyable. Our party started off with the chili and garlic buttered oysters which were amazing, some of the best in my opinion in all of New Orleans. We then ordered the boucherie plate which was composed of some of the most delicious house made meats along with savory house pickles. Definitely recommend this stellar restaurants if you're ever in New Orleans!

The food was tasty, but the service unbelievably slow. We had s reservation and were seated at 6:30. We ordered 10 minutes later and then waited 45 minutes for 1 appetizer and another 20 minutes for our mains. More than an hour and no follow up from the wait staff. The food was not worth that wait.

I enjoyed our lunch today. We were lucky enough to get a table without a reservation. The restaurant is beautiful and the service was awesome. The 4 stars is in regards to my lunch special. It was tasty but I felt overpriced for a seafood salad on a croissant. I also didn't enjoy the salt and vinegar chips that accompanied the sandwich. I will definitely give it another try.

Visiting from Houston, my friends and I ordered a bunch of appetizers, small plates, and sides everything was delicious and I am a PICKY eater, okay?! Didn't have any complaints on food. Waitress was great and recommended a bunch items that did not disappoint. Only thing is I didn't like my cocktail too much but food and service was awesome.
Went there for the famous fried alligator. I think it's overrated since it's just like really tough chicken. The flavor was just ok. The meat itself was kind of plain.

Nice ambiance. The waiter was very helpful with suggestions which was great because there were a lot of interesting dishes. I went with the alligator and the gumbo. They were delicious. The beef ribs were perfectly done and the bread was great.

I had really high expectations coming in, but I think Cochon was just okay. New Orleans has lots of great food! Maybe we didn't order that well? 
- got the Cochon (kinda like pulled pork, it was fine)
- boudin bites (this was good, like arancini)
- gator bites (ordered for novelty, not really worth seeking out)
- gumbo (I don't love gumbo so can't really compare)
- shrimp grits (the highlight, delicious grits)
- mac & cheese side

Nothing was bad or anything, I just didn't really think it was so much better than eating more char-grilled oysters or soft shell crab or crawfish or poboys anywhere else. The starter bread rolls that they give you were perfect though.
This place has awesome alligator!! Definitely enjoyed it. Very southern, very fried. But if that's what you're looking for this place is excellent.

I ordered 2 small plates and a dessert. The small plate of gumbo was well seasoned and rice was cooked well. The small plate of ribs was sticky, hot and sweet and delicious. For dessert I ordered chocolate mousse was was delicious, creamy and the texture was sooo smooth. All the food was delicious and the quantity was more than enough for 1 person. The ambience was fun and I want to say semi formal. The wait staff was attentive and polite. I was just visiting new Orleans but would definitely come back here when visiting again.

Rabbit dumplings!! Yum!!!
I was with a group of 9, and we shared appetizers, but honestly, I go there for the rabbit dumplings. One of these days, maybe I'll try something else, because the plates around the table looked amazing, but so far, I'm satisfied with my favorite...

Everything I tried was delicious!

This place is pricey but super tasty. It's not far from the WWII museum so if the weather is good, it's just a short walk.

Was in NOLA 3.5 days and ate here 2x. Shrimp grits with toast and peach hot sauce was on point. Friend alligator and the fried boudin balls are killer. Butterscotch pudding and strawberry mousse desserts were both delicious. Only thing I wasn't CRAZY about was the jambalaya. The rice was extra crispy and a bit dry. Oh...and try the beet cocktail, bonus points for looking like a goblet of blood.

Came to this place @ 5:40 for a 6 o'clock reservation.      Party of 6, but only 2 were here.   Asked to be seated to order drinks and appetizers and hostess wouldn't seat us.   Said our whole party had to be here.   I pointed out the near empty seating area and we wanted to start spending money.   " I'm sorry...it's our policy...".    

I guess I understand why it's empty....

Poor customer experience in a very competitive market.   Suggest going somewhere that cares about service.

A couple friends back home in Charlotte recommended we try this place. 

It was a quick walk from the WWII museum so made for a nice mid day break from the carnage and death. 

We stopped just for a few drinks and a quick snack. The crawfish pie was ok; a little to much pie instead of crawfish filling. The gumbo was good as well as their house made hot sauce. 

This one gets three stars purely based on the service. Our bartender didn't seem to want to be bothered and had that I-am-doing-you-a-favor attitude when "serving" us.

My fiancée asked if the mojito was good. A simple yes or no would have sufficed, heck, lie to us and move on. But instead she said "I mean I make a proper mojito"... mmmmm ok. What does that even mean?? 

We probably won't be back.
This restaurant is the best! Wonderful food. You must visit. Great food! If your here in NOLA  please stop in here. Great customer service. Everyone is friendly.

Popular spot recommended by Uber driver. Walked up and immediately noticed that there was a line out the door. I was greeted by the hostess and she ensured that the wait time would not be more than 15 minutes. Sure enough the long line quickly disappeared and my husband and I were seated. A great waiter came and took his time explaining the menu and what was suggested. We had time to browse the menu while waiting so we immediately placed our order. We had the alligator bites and macaroni casserole. Everything was delicious and we enjoyed our experience.

Rather underwhelming.  We grabbed some light fare and drinks to test the waters a bit.  It was less than 24 hours ago and it's lost anything memorable about the experience.  Oh, except that it was spendy (& I'm very willing to spend on good dining).  Far, FAR better options in this foodie market of NOLA!

Close to 10pm. Dropped in at the bar. Excellent service, drinks, and meal. The wood-fired oysters with chili butter were perfect. I also ordered a side of greens which were outstanding. Of course I'll be back.
Was an ok bar, not too great. The oysters were ok, had better. The drinks were good, ask if they have anything off the menu.

Lmao at the experience I am currently having at Cochon. Couldn't event wait to review. They ran out of the chef's special entree at 8:20 pm on a Friday night. There is literally nothing else notable on the menu that you can't find at every other "New Orleans style" restaurant. Mediocre attention from waitstaff, mediocre by the glass wine selection... the rolls don't taste nearly as good as they look. Everything here is aesthetic/ experience.... quality and taste be damned. Tourists will continue to flock. Locals spend your money elsewhere.

We weren't there are a normal meal time, so we were seated right away and service was fast and friendly; gave good recommendations. We tried a variety of dishes and enjoyed them all. I saw someone complain about prices; they seemed fair to me, but I'm from out of town so maybe different perspective.

Quick walk from the WW2 Museum. Definitely worth getting away from the mad crowds to eat here instead.
Had lunch and had a hard time deciding. Could of had one of all the small plates and sides. Loved the crawfish green tomato cassoulet.

If I could do it over again, I would go to Cochin Butcher (the less fancy, more food for less money sister operation of Cochon) but the food at Cochon was still good. The fried bouchin, oysters in chili sauce and Mac n cheese were all good and the service was fast and friendly but I would recommend just going next store and skipping the more formal option!

Oh lawd. This place was worth the wait. We had the ham hock w/ hopping john & fisherman's fish, just lovely. The sides of fired oysters, Mac & cheese, collard greens, cucumber salad and gator bites where pretty good. I left saying baybe with every sentence.

I was in New Orleans for an American Counseling Association conference and a dear friend and I wanted to go to a great restaurant to sit and talk and eat good food. I had heard of Cochon on previous excursions to N.O., but had never been, so it was truly time. We made reservations weeks in advance and arrived on time and were taken to our table immediately in a full and bustling dining room. Good selection of gins for martinis, made perfectly. And a staff that is there to meet your needs and enhance the food and dining experience.

The menu is divided into small plates (like fried alligator with chili garlic mayo, yum btw), boucherie (like pork cheek and andouille jambalaya), soup and salad (simple stuff), entrees & wood-buring oven (like rabbit & dumplings), and sides (like macaroni & cheese casserole).

So first they brought these amazing yeast rolls to us, just like our lunchroom ladies made for us from elementary school through high school in my little hometown school in southeast Missouri. The smell, the soft pillowiness, the fresh homemade hot rolls with butter on the side. I was rocked by these rolls.

Then I could have lived in the "boucherie" part of the menu - from the old French, from bouchier meaning "butcher." Only three hot selections: smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle, fried boudin with pickled peppers, and pork cheek (so good) & andouille jambalaya. And a cold plate of meats etc. This was my first "fried boudin" - a pork and rice sausage ball (the size of big walnuts fyi) rolled in flour, dipped in egg wash, and rolled in fine bread crumbs, and deep fried. Crisp exterior, soft tasty interior, heaven. I could have eaten a dozen of them or more. Great finger food. That level of quality permeated the other options in this menu section.

Each section had exceptional selections that were, many times, down home favorites but different, better, amazingly delicious.

So I ended with the butterscotch pudding from the dessert menu. Calling it a pudding does a disservice to the term. Cochon takes this humble child's dessert and elevates it to new heights. It is not soft and so very creamy. It is instead a denser, more pure butterscotch dessert. When you put your fork into it, the fork stands up all by its self. Not hard, just densely packed with flavor. I wish my Mom had been alive to experience this. Sigh. A great dessert, taken to the next level.

And that was what I found with each item that we tasted. Each were consistently taken to the next and higher level ... of taste, of creativity, of deliciousness. The logo for the restaurant was that of a pig, and what an exquisite pig it was. Thank you for this total treat.
Cochon is hands down one of my favorites. You can't go wrong with anything you order!! I highly recommend the boudin balls and oysters to start though.
my. favorite. restaurant. in. the. united. states. Every time in N.O. The one absolute must.

Here's the thing: When you're trying to eat all New Orleans has to offer but your traveling companion is a vegan, there are going to be some times you have to make compromises. I did want to eat alligator, though, and to eat it not just for the sake of eating it but to eat alligator that was prepared well. The reviews on this site gave me the impression that Cochon would be willing to prepare a special vegan meal so we went ahead and made a reservation and requested the meal. 

Our reservation was for 5:30, but we ended up asking if we could move it to 5:00 because I was exhausted and needed a nap. They seemed a little put out by that over the phone, though when we got there, the restaurant was empty enough that it didn't seem like it was a big deal.

We ate outside because this is a meaty-smelling restaurant and because it was in the high 70s. I think the waiter was somewhat disappointed that neither one of us ordered a cocktail, but sometimes you just don't feel like having a cocktail. He also brought out share plates for the appetizer, which maybe was a reflex but we were very clear about the veganosity and alligator is not remotely vegan. For those who want to know, the alligator was very well sauced and delicious, as was the catfish I had as my entree. However. It is not a false statement to say that they prepared a vegan dish, but I wouldn't call it a meal. My heart kind of sank when I saw it, because we'd been walking around all day and I'd ordered an appetizer and a main knowing I needed the calories, but he only ordered his prerequested meal, which is pictured below. It's like 2 knobs of cauliflower, 3 carrots, and 17 decorative beans. Just. Not enough food to call a meal. He said it was a very delicious snack. (I didn't taste it at all because he needed the calories too!) Honestly all they needed to do was slap half a cup of rice under it and it would have seemed much more like a meal. So. The moral of the story is ask more questions about the special meal you request and will pay a little extra for (and I don't object to that; I think if you're ordering off-menu you should pay more, but it should be worth what you're paying).

Final note: I'm not sure we were offered dessert. Always offer dessert! I'm more likely to want that than a cocktail.

!!MY FAVORITE MEAL IN NOLA!!

Obviously all the foods in this town are fantastic. But Cochon gave me eye-rolling to the back of my head, whispering "ohmygod" to myself while praying this moment will never end moment that I've been longing for during this trip. Our group decided to eat family style bc we wanted to try everything. And I'm so glad we did. 

In order of my favorite to my least favorite (but really they're all my favorites) -

Wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter: We ordered oysters at every restaurant prepared in every different way but this was my absolute favorite! The chili garlic butter had a very slight hint of Asian flavor which was something we didn't get at any other spot. The oysters were plump and juicy and I want to dip everything in that garlic butter sauce. We ordered another round of this bc they were that good. 

Pork Cheek and Andouille Sausage Jambalaya: The best jambalaya I had while in NOLA. It's basically crispy cajun fried rice and the flavors were on-freakin-point. I was upset about having to share this dish with others so I ordered another. 

Oven roasted gulf fish: Our server told us this was his favorite dish in the restaurant and it did not disappoint. Super flavorful, crispy on the outside moist on the inside. 

Catfish courtbouillon: This dish was delicious but not what I expected. It had Asian flavors as well and comes on top of rice. 

Shrimp grits with Peach hot sauce: This isn't Shrimp AND Grits, but it's Shrimp Grits. They mash the shrimp and fold it into the grits so you get the seafoody flavors in what looks like plain grits. Ugh. So good. 

Mac and Cheese casserole: Every table had one. Get one. 

Louisiana cochon with cabbage cracklings & pickled turnips: Pulled pork dish with a side of fried pig skin. Yum. 

Boucherie Plate: Charcuterie. Can't go wrong. 

Fried alligator: Okay we got this just to say we ate alligator on thurs trip. I think if I didn't know what it was, I may have thought it was white meat chicken nuggets bc the texture is slightly tough but it was prepared nicely and the chili garlic mayo was delicious

Aside from the deliciousness of everything,  service was fantastic. We had two servers dedicated to us, Kyle and Sean and they were spectacular. Thank you for a great experience

Cochon, please open a location in Southern California!!

Late lunch at Cochon. Short walk from convention center hotels. Laid back atmosphere. I sat at the bar; the bartender was very attentive and helpful. Food was delicious.  I chose the catfish courtbouillon... highly recommended!

My friends and I came here after a ghost tour. We were very surprised and very grateful that they took a reservation for 10pm on a weekday! They served complimentary buns, which were warm and a waist killer given how hard they were to resist. The boucherie plates with different types of cured meat, pate, and pickled vegetables were delicious and a must! 

My chargrilled oysters did not quite taste like their description. It almost tasted like they were doused with hot sauce and without any garlic at all. I would not recommend them. I also got the vegetable special of the day, which was broccoli. The dish was too vinegary for me, and I have a pretty high tolerance for the taste!
Really great flavors. Yummy drinks that complemented the food and really friendly service!

I chose to have ribs from here and it's probably the worst ribs I've ever had. I ended up eating the complimentary bread they served. I tried some of others food as well and I would not recommend this place if you like flavor in your food.

Hands down my favorite restaurant in New Orleans!! The service was great, they seemed sincere as well like they actually care about your experience. The food was amazing and the prices were fair. I had so many "this is the best ..... I've ever had" 

The mac and cheese casserole is a MUST it is the BEST MAC AND CHEESE you will ever eat

The catfish courtbouillon is also a MUST the flavors are so unique and the fish was cooked perfectly

The wood fired oysters are the BEST OYSTERS I'be ever had I am serious please get them

The fried alligator is the only alligator I ever tried and it was pretty darn good so I guess it's also the best alligator I've ever eaten 

The German chocolate cake was also amazing it honestly was the best German chocolate cake I ever did eat

Heck even their bread is one of the best complimentary breads I've ever had

Please do yourself a favor and go here you will not regret it. If you don't want to wait and didn't make a reservation go around 11 am before the lunch rush!

I loved this place. I started with the Wood fired Oysters they were excellent, loved them. I had the Red Fish which was excellent as well cooked perfected, seasoned perfect. Really nice wine list. I cant wait to go back.
Definitely try the oysters, which were amazing. Shrimp sandwich was also good. A little bit far away from the place where we stayed, but Uber solved the problem.

Bring lots of money when you visit because this place isn't cheap but the food is wonderful! I had the short rib ... fork tender and delicious. My husband ordered the fried oyster and bacon sandwich which was large enough to feed an army. We had a side a greens and a fabulous piece of Meyer lemon chess pie for dessert. We sat outside, on the street corner, but there wasn't enough traffic to be a distraction and the service was friendly.

I've been here a few times, and I've always enjoyed it (especially the rabbit livers), but on our last visit there was a hair in our food, and when we pointed it out to the server she just said "oh" and took away the plate and wasn't very sympathetic. I almost felt like she had the attitude of, "we're doing great business anyway, so it's not like one person not coming back is gonna affect that." For that reason, I doubt I'll ever go back.

If I could give the food 6 stars I totally would! Simply mind blowing. The pork cheeks jambalaya, the wood fired oysters, the porchetta and everything else we've tried was amazing. Our server took a while to take the order but this place is huge and packed so I guess it's normal. However the food came super fast. The people in the kitchen are just machines. For sure I would recommend this place to everyone and will be back when I'm at NOLA again.

Ambiance: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Food: 5/5

This place was great! It was pretty full when we went and there was music playing in the background but it was still easy to hear and have a conversation. There were only two of us but there's room for larger parties. The atmosphere was casual but still had a classy vibe. 

You can make reservations online but they were able to seat us fairly quickly when we arrived without one (it was around 9pm on a Saturday night). Our waiters were really friendly and attentive. They gave recommendations and checked in on us throughout the night to make sure we were doing okay without making us feel rushed.

The food was delicious! We tried the fried alligator, pork cheek & andouille jambalaya (my favorite), and the Louisiana cochon. Our plates were enough food for us to share but if you're really hungry I'd recommend getting an entree and splitting one of the smaller plates or a side. 

I'd definitely go again and would love to try out more things on the menu!

My daughter and I were in NOLA visiting Tulane and she suggested Cochon.  We came in with no reservation and were seated at the bar within 10 minutes. I ordered a Rum in the Mules and my daughter had fentimen's rose lemonade. The Rum in the Mules was delicious! The we ordered a series of small plates which included the woof fired oysters. TBH being from New England and loving oysters I was not sure about wood fired oysters, but they were amazing. We shared the Lemon Chess pie for dessert and it was amazing! There was thin layer of lemon zest between the delicious crust and lemon curd filling!

I'm a fan. I would for sure come back here when I come back to New Orleans. My friend was the one that actually recommended this place and I had to put it in my bookmarks. The ambience is awesome - perfect for a date night especially if your date is the adventurous type and willing to try something different (and delicious). 

My boyfriend and I ordered two (YES TWO) orders of the garlic chili oysters, fried alligator appetizer, and the house mac and cheese. The serving sizes for this place is kinda small so it's nice to just order a bunch of things and just share everything. Except the oysters...everyone should have their own order of the oysters.

Oysters- phenomenal! Soaked in their chili and garlic sauce and so tender. I personally love oysters even when they're raw, but this is perfect for someone who wants to try oysters but is iffy about eating it the traditional "raw" way. 

House mac and cheese- this was a side dish, and I'm so glad we decided to order it. It was so ooey and gooey and cheesy just like a mac and cheese should be. Probably one of the best I have ever had!

Alligator tails- I was pleasantly surprised by dish. I love food, but when it comes to meat that not many people really eat especially in Cali, I get kinda hesitant. However, I'm so glad I tried these. I would order it again. It was really crispy and reminded me of like a calamari karage lol. 

Overall, this would be on my list of places to go back to when I do find myself in New Orleans once again!

Came here for lunch after the WW2 museum.  (Walking distance 2-blocks due east of museum) Came at 11:30am no wait, in fact, fairly empty.  But don't expect that to be the norm. 

We ordered:
Louisiana Cochon 10/10 this was the perfect dish! I'm not a heavy eater, but the portion size was just right.  Pulled pork shoulder pan fried into a patty on top of smothered cabbage.  It was really tender, had great flavor, and was great! I'd order it again! 

Braised short ribs 9/10.  Husband ordered this and he really likes how tender the ribs were.  Only downfall was the potato's were over salted. 

Smoked pork sandwich (daily special) 8/10 over salted, that's why it was such a low score.  My dad puts extra salt on everything....and these potato chips were wayyyy over salted where even he thought it was too much. He gave chips 4/10, but overall the 8/10 was his final score since his burger was pretty decent.

Pan seared drum (daily special) 9/10 pretty good.  Did have a slight fishy taste to it...but that might have been the type of fish.  It was well seasoned, fish was moist and sat on top of grits.

Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the area.  I'm sure the heavy salt hand was a one-off.

Overall, I enjoyed Cochon. But there were a few mostly "service" issues that occurred. 1. It took a very long time to order. 2. My partner waited at least 15 minutes for his beer. In fact, I ordered my wine after him (yet received it before him). We asked where it was twice before it was delivered. I suspect they forgot about it, but that was not acknowledged. 3. We received our bread (for the first time) after asking for the dessert menu. Off timing. 

In terms of food, the oysters were good. But nothing that I will crave afterwards. The Mac and cheese was delicious, and the Brussels sprouts were delicious too.

We planned ahead and made reservations for this highly-recommended restaurant months in advance. Soooo very disappointed. The bar area is super-small and overly crowded so no place to stand and wait for your table. Once we gave our name to the host, we were seated quite rapidly (thank you!) Our table was hidden almost under a staircase just in front of stored dry goods, and quite out of the way - the last table in the restaurant. Mind you, there were many other tables available for four people. Service was interesting. Spotty, dis-interested, curt, confusing, and unable to answer our questions about ingredients and dietary restrictions. I understand that menus cannot be changed, and would never ask for that. But I do need to know if there is shellfish/dairy in any of the broths, soups, sauces, etc for allergy purposes. Our cocktails were overly sweet, our waters went un-filled. Bowls of soup/appetizers came with dinner, not ahead of dinner. We felt rushed and for no good reason. My favorite thing was the fried chicken livers - I have to say that those were delicious. But in our party of four - the ham hock was dry as a bone and lukewarm; the beef short ribs were so salty that I felt as parched as a desert dweller. The lima beans were squishy and bland, and also lukewarm. The fresh fish was not too bad actually - you could go with that. Dessert was never even offered. I almost cried with disappointment upon leaving the restaurant. There are so many other choices in New Orleans and we sampled plenty with better food, manners, and service.

Amazing speedy service! Was in and out for a quick bite within 20-30 minutes after a visit to WW2 museum. They sat us immediately at the bar around 5:30 pm on a Saturday, got two apps fried alligator and jambalaya. Jambalaya was not impressive but loved the alligator and the free bread which came out hot fluffy and fresh. Would definitely come here again for dinner

Amazing spot. We ordered the short ribs and a side of Mac & cheese. It was the perfect combo. Love the cocktail as well. Service was in point! Check in our if you're in NOLA!

P:s- get the oysters too!

Had a delicious lunch here leaving town that was easily some of the best food we had all of our trip! We tried the alligator (eat with the mint), gumbo cup, wood fired oysters, and short ribs with pickled watermelon. Everything was so good, but the oysters and ribs are a must try!! So good!
Unbelievable. Fantastic. A faux pas brought us a chucterie platter "Gratis". Food was beyond real.

We made a last minute reservation for lunch on the same day and they were able to accommodate us. The food here is amazing! Super delicious in every way!! Lots of great appetizers to pick from and the entreés are so amazing. The restaurant is very spacious and they have an excellent customer service! Try our the drinks coz they mix up some awesome cocktails!

I've been to the butcher before, but never here.  The decor was interesting.  I loved the paintings hanging up in the restaurant.  The ambience was relaxed. 
The service was attentive and friendly.  
I absolutely appreciated the various suggestions of what to order from our servers.  
We ordered the Wood-fired Oysters with a Chilli Garlic Butter.  They were really yummy! I definitely could have ordered another.  
I was not totally impressed with the Pork Cheek and Andouille Jambalaya.  The pork cheek had a great flavor, but the jambalaya was hard and a little burnt on the edges. 
The Shrimp and Deviled Egg Gumbo was good.  The gumbo had a darker roux then what I'm used too. It tasted fine. I did enjoy the deviled egg the most. 
Besides the oysters, my other favorite dish was the Crawfish and Green Tomato Casserole. Wow!  Amazingly delicious.

Without a doubt this place is 5 stars. The food is incredible. We had to sit at the bar and they were very accommodating to me and my bud and we were brought out place settings and silverware as we ordered drinks with appetizers. We decided not to wait for our table to eat which was a great decision as it was a 1 hour wait. Very popular establishment and with good reason. The bartenders were all very good, great customer service and fast. The appetizers we had were out of this world: Cajun gator bites, smoked ribs, and pork cheeks all had so much flavor. Our beers were on draft and locally brewed and were all great. A definite great experience!

This was our last meal on our trip in NOLA, and I am SO glad. This is a big and airy place with lots of seating and lots of space. We weren't very hungry, but they had small plates that were just perfect! We got the alligator, which was not overly fried and had a slight kick. The pork cheek was so tender, and the rice it came with was perfect. Our favorite was the crawfish pie. It is more like an empanada, but an empanada that has been otherwise impossibly stuffed! It was so good, it is easily on the list of top ten most memorable foods in my life. 
Given the chance, I would absolutely come back here, and I would suggest all my friends visit this place too!

First - this review is based on a group of us who did a fixed price meal, served family style. About 14 of us sat around a large table.  If you have a small group and need to order just a few dishes, please read the other reviews.  Okay, that out of the way...

Holy cow.  Or should I say holy pig.  Both the quality and quantity of food was amazing.  Let's just say we pretty much hurt ourselves, and even though the desserts were delicious, there was no way we could finish them.

Our server (Levin sp?) was a total pro - the right combination of humor and efficiency.  He kept the food and drinks flowing without interruption.  The ambiance and art work are really fun.

We had other versions of the same dishes (like boudin, cracklin's, etc.) around New Orleans during our stay, but they always came up short when compared to Cochon.

If you have a big, fun group of hungry people - or a hungry, fun group of big people - do yourself a favor and eat at Cochon.

Wow!! Come hungry and order as you go.

We were lucky to get in on a Friday night without  limited wait of 30 minutes

Huge bourbon and American whiskey collection. Nicely curated and sectioned by lead mash Grain

My brother and I had two old forester (statesman and 1910) as well the Uncle Nearest which was great.

We shared the Fried Oysters (please even if you hate oysters you will love these). Alligator as well as the pork ribs. Four to an order and so so good. They also serve complimentary corn bread that is out of this word delicious.

I'd say plan on sharing items as you get to sample
More amazing food.

Loved Cochon! Didn't have reservations so we sat at the bar. They have a great bourbon and whiskey selection, among other drinks. This is a place for foodies! The elevated and different food flavors are on point. You really can't go wrong with anything you order. The oysters are a must!

It's freezing in this restaurant! Bring a jacket!!! I was so cold I wore my fur jacket and I saw lots of people shivering as well 

Food was delicious. Charbroiled oysters were soooo big and juicy. Servers were all delightful.

Okay so this place was one of the best restaurants I tried in NOLA and is very high on my list of all restaurants I been to recently! 

We came here on a Wednesday at 9pm.. and the place was still very crowded. We waited about 10 minutes at the bar and then were promptly seated.

Cocktails: all of their cocktails are amazing! The ingredients create a unique test! Have to get at least one! 

Food: I not even know where to begin. Everything starting from bread and ending with dessert was spectacular! We got grilled oyster for apps and short ribs with rabbit & dumplings for mains! Unbelievable and definitely recommend both!

Vibe: the place was loud, but not overwhelming. The chatter added to the poppin atmosphere! 

Staff was great!

I came for the pork, but was blown away by the wood fired oysters in chili garlic butter.  The rich chili garlic butter sauce is plentiful and begs to be soaked up by the pre dinner rolls.  I also had the Louisiana cochon with cabbage, cracklin, and pickled turnips.  I enjoyed this too, but would probably try something else next time.  Oh, and I had a side of smothered greens.  Also very good!

my friends and I went here in honor of Anthony Bourdain's visit for our last meal before our Mardi Gras trip came to a close. we were not disappointed. a complete dining experience. we got several small plates as well as entree's and basically just shared it all. impeccable. classic favorites with modern unique twists. my favorite was the boucherie plate! will be back next time I am in LA!

The absolute best dinner experience in NOLA. First class everything. Service & food was top notch. 
Had the oven-roasted gulf fish "fisherman's style" as well as Mac and cheese, short ribs - with a great seat at the "kitchen bar" - best seat in the house with a view and audio experience of the open kitchen.

A happening place with an eclectic menu.  Each time I'm here I get the feeling that patrons are more attracted to the hype than to the food or service.

The service was very...professional, not necessarily personable.

The food selection is very trendy, not necessarily Cajun.  

If a plate of rabbit or ham-hock is something you come to New Orleans for, you will be satisfactorily rewarded.

I have to remind myself that there are certainly locals (and some visitors) who don't want to eat Cajun fare every night of their life.  

If that's you and you want something on the cutting edge, this place is for you.

Enjoy!
Freezing inside. Fried alligator was yummy. Everything else was soooooo salty! If you want to preserve your insides....

It is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in NOLA. Very well mixed southern and general america style food and literally I want to try everything on the menu. Highly recommend the grilled oyster and smoke pork ribs. The other table ordered the pork chop and it was AMAZING!

I just got back from my first NOLA adventure, complete with all the must-do's I listed before I went & BY FAR this was the best food we had all week. We shared a bunch of plates including the Oysters, which will be my last meal request if that's ever a thing. The alligator was also AMAZING complete with a spicy aioli & mint....SOOOOO GOOD. Oh but let me go back to the oysters for a minute. I back in SD & I would fly there tonight just for another bite. 

And honestly, if that wasn't enough, the service was EXCELLENT!! We had two waiters who catered to us & made us feel so well attended to. 

But if that's not enough, of all the places we ate, we had more food at Cochon than any other restaurant & spent less money!!!! 

I wish I could describe the food in a way that did it justice. You just Have. To. Go! An absolute must if you're in The Crescent City!!!

Had a great lunch here after visiting the WWII museum. Had the soup of the day (not pictured) the boudin balls (as suggested by the waiter) and the butterscotch pudding. The food was flavorful and the service was friendly. Great place!

Cochon is one of those places I go to every time I'm in New Orleans, no matter how hard I try to stay away. It's just that good. Cochon achieves that rare feat: high-level takes on down-home cooking with legitimately unpretentious but top-notch service and a vibe that's equal parts classy and backyard banger. 

Since I can't seem to stay away from Cochon, I at least try to mix up my meal every time. Fish, the cochon itself, rabbit and dumplings - no matter what I get, it's reliably delicious and always portioned just right. 

No matter how many times I come here, charbroiled oysters are a must, and the boudin balls and gator bites are worth feeling a little too full.  Don't worry, you'll still have room for a decadent southern dessert. 

Great cocktails and a fun, low-key wine list with good by-the-glass selections.

Cochon's theme music isn't New Orleans Jazz. It's BB King's "The Thrill is Gone." Scale is a problem, and a bigger dining room isn't better for Cochon.  Out? Great cuisine on artful, thoughtful platings. In? Volume sloppiness and overcooked, carelessness.

They've expanded the dining room, with a huge new annex, but they haven't figured out how to make the kitchen keep up with it. 

My deviled egg gumbo? The gumbo was cold, and the deviled egg plopped into the middle of it was more half-drowned garnish, also cold, that looked like an afterthought. The gumbo was 90% okra, and doesn't hold a candle to Emeril's, even when hot. 

The so-called "1.5 lb pork chop was almost a pound of fat. I get marbling, but this cut shouldn't have made the cut for service, especially at a lofty $42 price tag. It comes with overcooked green beans, slathered in fat. When fat fat and more fat is all you can do, you've run out of culinary ideas, which is what put this place on the map. 

A guy near me orders a dish with a broth, and the runner slops it around as he walks asking where it goes, coating the soup bowl edges with grease that looks disgusting. He hasn't  been trained properly in its handling, but no one cares because the cash keeps coming. 

Pineapple upside down cake is the recommend from the waiter for dessert? Steaming on the outside, It comes out COLD in the center.  

Short me once, shame on me. I said something. He took a bit off. Appreciated, but this is not the Cochon of old.

Water glass used to always be full. Not now. The manager swoops in and asks how your food is with your mouth full. Old trick. The line cooks at the wood oven are machines. Slapping soullessly dishes into the wood oven with fish slipping off platters and just sitting there on the ashen deck, over-cooking. Drone 2, the tall one, slaps wood into the back to stoke the oven and pollutes every dish in there with ash and wood bits in the oysters!! 

The bourbon at the bar is priced by Ray Charles. High dollar for the ridiculously bad Baby Book, and a huge bargain, $38 for Kentucky Owl Bourbon, which they make in unique bottlings of around 9,000 per uniquely labeled batches, each their own expression. Most restaurants charge $65 to $124 a shot for them because of how hard it is to get them at all, and they are both AMAZING. Unlike Pappy Van Winkle, which is a bogus bottling of far cheaper Weller, that's a real-deal steal! 

I've been to this place other than a year or two off, since it opened. It is struggling with profit over quality. I hope that its chef-owners opt for the authenticity that made this the best restaurant in New Orleans for a time.

Unless the kitchen can get the scale right, this place is growing Golden Arches....

The food was good. It's super busy so we had a wait, which was fine. The waiter was nice but he forgot a few of our items. He ended up taking off the price of the wine, after we pointed out it was never served to us, and he gave us a glass of wine for the road. Overall, nice place for dinner
Awesome!! Hanna is the best Hostess!! Great food. Cool urban industrial setting...Excellent service.

After scrambling to make reservations on a Saturday night, we arrived to an almost empty restaurant. Our greeting was less than cordial and this cold attitude proceeded throughout the entire meal. 

Cochon was our first New Orleans taste of woodfired oysters, and also the only good bite of the night, if I were to grade on a curve.  The fried alligator had no crunch on the batter and needed seasoning. Fried livers were overcooked. The ribs, albeit tasty, were undercooked and tough. Nothing stood out for any good reason for the exception of the chocolate cake, which was amazing! But one chocolate cake, rude service and mediocre food a great experience does not make.

Wow! Superb! Stellar. The flavor and the taste as so great that I would add another star if I could. 

The staff are great and courteous and the wait is well worth it. The dishes taste as great as they smell.

The oven-roasted gulf fish "fisherman's style" at Cochon is one of the dreamiest dishes that I've had all year.

I know Cochon is known more for their stellar "meatier"dishes - but trust me on this one - get the fish. 

The portion is massive and the fish is so tender, fresh, and moist. My dish was seasoned with so much love - that I never wanted the meal to end.

Cochon is particularly nice - early on in the evening when big occasions are manifesting in the rest of the city. Around dusk - there is rarely a wait and the service is always friendly and helpful.

Trust.

This was a really great experience. The food was excellent and the ​service was very good too. Nice, upscale, casual​ environment. If you're going at 7:00 or afterward you might need a reservation. The place is huge but fills up fast.

I had the ribs and crawfish/green tomato casserole. The casserole was delicious but was served very hot and stayed hot for a long time...I'm talking "lava" hot. So watch out for​ that! The ribs were really tasty. I cut off pieces and made sliders with the dinner rolls. They gave me some hot towels to wipe my fingers off, which was nice.

My friend had the Ham Hock entree which he said was very good. 

The server recommended a few beers to go with what I was eating which was much appreciated. I wish I knew the server's name. He did a great job understanding that there was a lot to process when we first sat down. He came back several times before he took our order without making us feel like we were being indecisive.

Around the corner at the Cochon Butcher, you order at the counter. It's more of a pub atmosphere. We'll try that next time. It was considerably louder than the larger restaurant.

Everything was delicious and our server was great! Started with the alligator and it was probably the best we've ever had! For dinner I had the rabbit and dumplings and my fiance had the catfish, we both loved our meals and I cant reccomend the rabbit enough! We will definitely be back next time we are in the area!

I travel to New Orleans a few times throughout the year and everything I make it a point to find at Cochon's.
The food, staff, atmosphere and drinks make for an incredible experience.

A casual chic restaurant with a lovely, woody interior and a convenient location downtown houses a fantastic kitchen that serves startlingly good food based on BBQ and Louisiana classics. You can order an entree, but at least one special of "Country ribs" we saw looked disgustingly big (really, WAY too big, people). Besides, it works just as well to sequentially order fast-arriving small plates until you just can't anymore.

Usually an afterthought, the big surprise of the evening were the vegetables. One dish of summer squash, Mexican queso and something called "mustard frill" was especially delightful. The wood-fired oysters were delicious, lightly baked with chile oil in a cast iron dimpled pan like big escargot. Fortunately, the dish came with soft rolls for sopping up the scrumptious juices. A plate of ribs with watermelon pickle was rather overwhelmed by its tangy sauce, but still tolerably delicious. A shrimp cake was just too salty.

The bar offers a wide selection of whiskeys and local beers, along with a deep wine list that includes a strangely excellent selection of roses from both the Languedoc and Province in the south of France.

The one almost disappointment was dessert. Though decent, the lemon tart didn't really offer anything to blow my socks off. Fortunately, the madeira was good!

Honestly this was terrible for my entire party I was with. I went out with a couple co workers and two higher ups (which is why I have no photos of my meals). First problem was my boss wanted the ribs on the specials menu as a meal but the waiter said it was only a small
Plate.. which was a lie.. it was huge! We ended up getting that as part of our appetizers, the cucumber dish, and the meat charcuterie. Apps were average, nothing to rave about. The best part was probably the free bread they serve you. 

Then, as we are only half way through our apps they serve dinner! The waiter knew it was messed up because he apologized about it. They all had the same fish dish and none of my party enjoyed it, they said it was dry. I got the vegetable salad. It had potential but the scary prickly lettuce was disgusting. It was like eating spinach flavored seaweed. Their veggie options are lacking, I know it's a meat restaurant but they should have more than side dishes as an option. The Mac and cheese was straight fire though. 

Later my boss ordered a wine for himself but the check came before the wine, by then we were ready to go and although he could've taken it to go- that wasn't the point. Overall we were unhappy and definitely would not return. We were all laughing the next day about how comically bad it was.

Oh great food went for a late lunch cause we were leaving next morning very early had great crawfish and green tomatoes casserole was filled with succulent tails good Mac and cheese bouchée plate great rabbit and dumplings very tasty home cooking will return

Was at the WWII Museum and looking for a place to eat. Called Cochon, spoke with Mari. She said walk-ins were welcome, they had a few tables available and can accommodate a party of 2. This restaurant is 800 feet from the museum, yet when we arrived only four minutes after the call, we were placed on a 20 minute wait by the Hostess. As the Hostess was not Mari, I called again to speak with her to ask what changed in the four minutes since our call. She explained that things changed. Very strange. However, after waiting 20 minutes, we decided to leave. It would have been so much easier to just provide an accurate wait time on our first call rather than lie in order to get customers through the door. Very disappointed.

Quality has gone downhill. Now it just feels like an overpriced tourist trap. Portions are smaller than before and they seem to have replaced there good food with overlyseasoned crap. Same with the service. The only thing that seems to be the same is the atmosphere and cleanliness of the bathroom.
This is my second visit to New Orleans, and this, I definitely returned to Cochon. Everything continues to be fresh and flavorful and on point. Highly recommended.

My daughters and son in law made reservations here for Mother's day today and Cochon did not disappoint! Everything was perfect! The space, the ambience, the service and staff were all just wonderful! And the food! Lawd have mercy! I was expecting some fancy frou-frou dishes...I couldn't have been more wrong! The food was awesome! The ribs..pork and beef, absolutely succulent! And those greens!! Good god!! The small plates were delicious and the crawfish pie will make you get up and dance! I will definitely be back!

Stopped here for Sunday dinner after a day at the WWII Museum.  We were early for our reservations, but they happily seated us, no problems.  Nice atmosphere.  Had the oven-roasted gulf fish "fisherman's style" - very tasty.  Attentive wait staff, owner came up to talk to us, ask about our experience.  All-in-all a great selection during our NOLA trip.

Don't really understand the hype with this place. Everything on the menu seemed like something you would order in the winter. We asked what two different entrees were and all we received were "it's like a stew" and no other descriptions. Service seemed off, made a great impression at first but we didn't even a receive a "thanks for dining with us" which seems like the right thing to say after cracking $100.  

The baked potato was dry. Burnt too. The menu is inconsistent with what dishes they choose to tell you what's in it and other dishes will just say two words.

This meal was perfect from start to finish.  We brought my mom here for an early Mother's Day celebration and we all enjoyed the experience.  For starters we shared the pork cheek and the crawfish pie.  The pork cheek was tasty, though a little chewy for my liking.  The crawfish pie, though, was delicious!  The crust was perfectly fried--not at all greasy.  The filling was pure comfort food--lots of delicious gravy and tender, flavorful crawfish.  

For our meals we ordered a bunch of dishes and shared all around.  The standouts were the mac and cheese, the lima beans, and the rabbit dumplings.  I loved that the dumplings had turnips--the flavor of the carrots and turnips combined for a rich, savory broth that warmed my soul.  Everything on the table was a little spicy, but thoughtfully so.  The service was friendly and efficient without being cloying, and I thoroughly appreciated everything about this meal!

Words cannot describe my experience at Cochon. I had an amazing experience not only with the food, but the staff. My favorite part of the meal was the wood fired oysters. We also had the macaroni and cheese casserole and ribs which were the best in NOLA I've tried thus far. Beyond that, we tried the gumbo which sadly wasn't the best I've had but I enjoyed a bite or two lol. Moreover I appreciated the staff. We sat in front of the wood burning oven, it reminded me of a chefs table because we chatted with one of the chefs and he was so proud of what he was doing. Anyhoo, this was my best NOLA experience; I am excited to try the other restaurants the server recommended, as well as the others within the company. Cheers !!!!!!!

Well.........I didn't hate it.  However it wasn't close to special.  Cocktails were decent but not special.  Menu limited.  I had two apps...boudin was tasty and spareribs were average.  She had the beef short ribs and thought they were a salt bomb couldn't eat it.  Someone else at our table had them also and it was horribly salty as well.  Only saving grace of the meal was the gumbo.  In a city with so many great restaurants and such a high price point I think they should do better.

DAMN! I'll just start off with that. Having eaten at several of the top spots in the Quarter, I have to say the food here easily rivals them! I liked that this place was within walking distance, but away from the "hoodrattery" found closer to the Quarter. It's modern, contemporary, avant-garde, but with strong Creole roots. It's elevated, but not dress-code upscale. 

The hostesses were a bit jaded and cold, but our waitress more than made up for it. You could tell that she truly loved the food where she worked  based on the way she spoke about it. The menu is limited, but dynamic and fresh. We went with the Chargrilled Oysters, Spring Vegetable Salad, Mac N Cheese, Crawfish Courtbouillon, and Crawfish & Green Tomato Casserole. AND EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING. Surprisingly, even the salad was legitimately the best salad I've ever had. My favorite, however, ended up being the Courtbouillon because it was delectably non-traditional. If you come to New Orleans, do yourself a favor and check this place out!

This is my first time in NOLA. I went with my husband and a couple of friends (both of them executive chefs). We didn't have reservations so we stayed at the bar waiting for our table. Then we told the host we were having an extra guest. So then one of the host, Brianna, came to us and said "we can't seat 5 until 9 pm (it was 7 pm), we are a busy restaurant". So we took our drinks, got out of there, and we hit "Willa Jean" ( 
611 O'Keefe Ave). No regrets!

You must try the crispy pork cheek! It is to die for!! It is super juicy and just melts in your mouth! Cochon was one of the fancier places we dined in NOLA. Food is on the pricier side but still worth it. There is a wait, so make sure you make reservations!!

Nice looking room and friendly professional staff. I thought the entree portions were a bit small and a little overpriced but the alligator appetizer was a good portion. Food was delicious though and i recommend.

This place is a culinary experience. My friend and I ordered a little bit of everything among the appetizers: fried squash blossoms, oysters, boudin balls, and the shrimp cake. It was all extremely delicious, but the oysters won. They were unbelievable, especially if you like a little kick! Our waiter was very friendly and attentive--he basically helped us pick out what we wanted to order. The atmosphere was really warm. Awesome restaurant.

One of the best in town. Airy space in the warehouse district, great cocktails, fine meats, friendly and efficient service. The food was excellent but only four stars out of five. None of our dishes were truly memorable: the smoked ribs (two in a portion) were tasty but not special, the cochon and cracklings didn't crackle (disappointing since I expected this to be the signature dish). Nonetheless, a very nice evening.

The restaurant provides a casual atmosphere, friendly service, and great food. I ordered the boudin and the macaroni & cheese side dish. The boudin tasted wonderful, and the mac and cheese was crispy on the top but cheesy and creamy on the inside. My partner ordered the short ribs that had a sweet bbq glaze on them. They were very tender, with the meat almost sliding off the bone. His twice-baked potato was very good, too. (We sampled each other's dishes.) The homemade lemonade was tart but not too sugary--a great complement to the meal.

We would definitely eat here again on our next visit.

This place absolutely blew my socks off. Coming from a chef this place is worth every moment and penny. Do yourselves a favor, when you're in NOLA, stop here. You will not regret it. From the service to the food, platinum standard.

Had high expectations for Cochon based on the reviews.  We ate here on May 17th mid afternoon which may explain some of the disappointment.  We ordered wood fired oysters, gumbo, crawfish pie  and lemon chess pie for dessert.  The oysters were not the same as seen in most pictures.  They were not served on the half shell but served swimming in a cast iron pan. They were good but had no wood fired flavor as we were expecting due to swimming in the chili sauce.  Onto the gumbo.  We ordered two, waiter asked if we'd like cup or bowl.  We said bowl expecting two bowls but instead we are served from one large bowl with two spoons. What restaurant does this? It was ridiculous. Gumbo was  just ok. Thin consistently and light on fillings.  Crawfish  pie was really good, a redeeming moment.  Lemon pie was excellent as well. Service was ok.  Your mileage may vary here or perhaps this was an off day. Our most expensive and disappointing meal during our trip.  Edit - We also had the fried alligator which was delicious.  The chili mayo and fresh basil leaves really made the dish pop.

Couldn't have asked for a better dinner out our first night in New Orleans. Great food, great space, and absolutely excellent service, our waiter was so friendly and helpful and didn't make us feel like stupid tourists for asking questions. We had the cochon (had to ask what that was, were not made to feel stupid even though it's the name of the restaurant), it was amazing as were the pork ribs and Mac and cheese. And the bill was so reasonable. Such a win to be exploring on vacation and stumble on a place with great food and a great vibe and not overpriced. And the service was just flawless.

By far the best meal I had in New Orleans. This isn't a slight on any of the restaurants we visited - Cochon was simply that good.

The ambiance and the service was top notch, and the food was next level. I was never really much of a fan of oysters, grits, or boudin but this place definitely made me a believer. Dare I say it's the best I've ever had?

Can't wait to visit the Big Easy again so I can check out their sister restaurant!
Over rated place. Had the short ribs and they tasted like pot roast. Not what I expected at all. Got dirty plates.

Definitely one of the most tasty restaurants! Service is so-so. The fried alligator is a must. The gulf fish - yes. The rabbit was eh (super heavy sauce). The cheesecake - don't think twice, just order it! Old fashioned - yes!!!

The place was very clean and nice. Had two stories, two bars, and the service was fast and efficient. A lot if wine selection and interesting mixed drinks. For beginners I would recommend the alligator and oysters. Both were amazing. I had the Beef Short Rib, the meat was very soft and the potatoes were delicious.

LOVE Cochon!! This was our second visit. I highly recommend a reservation if planning to dine during peak hours. They accommodated our large group. The staff were all so pleasant, wearing smiles the entire time, and willing to accommodate all our requests. The food was amazing! I highly recommend the short ribs. Other members of our group had the gulf fish and enjoyed it. The restaurant is large, clean, well-lit. Overall a great vibe. Can't wait to return.

Excellent fresh food with a new, clean atmosphere. Had the mushroom casserole and it was delicious. Red fish was beautifully prepared and fresh. Rabbit stew was delicious as well. Grits and crawfish good also. This was lunch and it was really really good.

Great food, and I would recommend it to anyone.

My wife and I were visiting New Orleans for the first time and were really looking forward to having some great cuisine.

We were really, really, really disappointed with the Commander's Palace -- but thank goodness someone recommended Cochon because it certainly righted the wrong.

We went for brunch and started with the fried alligator.  I added hot sauce and it was great. Chewy but great.  Then we shared the enormous Deep Fried Oyster sandwich.  It's like a BLT but with deep fried oysters. Huge and delicious.  I had to try the ribs and I loved them. Among my favorites that I've had.  The smoke em on site! And the sweet tea, yum. I hate iced tea, but this was real good.

AND -- the staff is so friendly, a great, delicious, experience.

Came to a busy Cochon in a Wednesday night.  Really like the look and aesthetic of this restaurant.  Service is outstanding, very attentive and friendly.

We opted for the crispy pork cheek as an appetizer.  Rich crispy pork cheeks with acidic cherry tomatoes, green goddess dressing and fresh mint and onions.  I liked the contrast of the acidity in the tomato and sauce with the cheek, and the fresh onion.  The mint was a bit too overpowering so I opted to leave that out after the first bite.  Fresh rolls and butter were also handed out, light, hot and delicious.

For our mains we went with the rabbit and dumplings.  My main criticism here is the lack of rabbit, it's shredded with a few larger chunks, but it mostly a composition of carrots, parsnips and potatoes.  The gravy was rich and herbaceous, couldn't put my finger on the spices.  The dumplings were delicious and light as air, wish I could make them that light, just wish the ratio of protein to starchy vegetable was better.

Hubby had the smoked pork hock with hoppin John.  His was salty and delicious.  The rice and beans appeared to be cooked in the braising liquid maybe, very flavorful.  We also added a side of Mac and cheese that was creamy and delicious, very rich.

All in all a solid meal.

cochon, oh how we will miss you. fantastic food, setting, and service. we stopped in for lunch (wait was about 15 minutes on a saturday) and enjoyed fried alligator, crazy delicious wood-fired oysters, gumbo and catfish courtbouillon. try their tasty homemade lemonade too, especially on a hot day. everything was amazing and we definitely be back some day!

Sat near the kitchen at chefs table for lunch . Great to see the food come out and helped decide what to order from menu ... everything looked great . Got the wood fired oysters , ribs and gumbo. Blown away by the gumbo and the ribs and would order those all day long .

Great meal!  Great service!  We shared a bunch of dishes and everything was memorable.  The wood-fired oysters were so good we had to order seconds.  The rabbit and dumplings and short rib were also amazing.  We Also enjoyed the selection of local beers.
Great atmosphere but very slow service, two hours for dinner.  Had Cochon which was very salty.  Fisherman Catch was really good, Redfish.  Everything is a la carte.

Good food good ambience. Pork cheeks are good. And the oyesters were just about all right. Way too salty. Many better tastier, cheapest alts.

No need to come all the way. If you happen to be around and you have tons of cash go for it. Meal for two with drinks 90.

The rabbit and dumplings is to die for! I can't recommend this place enough because everything was high quality. The smoked hamhock, the gulf fish, the macaroni and cheese, the grits, the German chocolate cake, the strawberry mousse all so amazing

This was an interesting place.  The food was tasty, the service so so and the music way too loud.  I don't know that I would go back because of the service.  We had two people taking care of the table and they acted like we were a real inconvenience and were very uppity.  

The food was very tasty so I have no complaints there.  Maybe we just had caught our servers on an off night.

So glad we got out of the French Quarter to visit this place. Make a reservation, one of the few places that allow that in advance. Definitely get the wood-fired oysters with chili garlic butter. My table loved them so much we got them for an appetizer... and added another order during dinner. Was a little disappointed with the fried gator, it was a something I was looking forward to trying but it seemed a little tough. Service was good, local atmosphere was good, drinks were good. Enjoyed my visit.

Mmm mmmm mmmmmm. These folks know how to run a restaurant and they certainly know more about then most. Beautiful pork cheeks, charcuterie boards, the pork loin wrapped in belly (order this) all amazing. The alligator was tough and chewy but it is typical (jacaranda big night help). The butterscotch pudding was great. This is a fun night of food adventures-fairly priced. GO before they run out of pork loin porchetta.

If you're reading this because you're headed to NOLA and someone you know said "you have to go to Cochon!", listen to them. This place lives up to ALL the hype. Almost everyone I know who has been to NOLA knows this spot. I've been a couple times now and can't say anything bad. The service is amazing, the staff is great and the food is even better. Their grilled oysters are amazing! On my last visit, I had their salt braised pork  tenderloin, which was easily one of the best pieces of meat I've ever had. My first visit, some friends and I shared the special which was an enormous dry-aged rib eye, cooked to absolute perfection.

My friends and I were completely blown away by our entire experience here. Everything, from the table bread, to apps, to entrees was exceptional! We stumbled upon Cochon while roaming the art district and I've since recommended it to several people. The sausage and onion sandwich will exceed any expectations you may have. Completely new spin on what I would've imagined. Can't say enough great things about this place! Ohh, and the oysters! Don't skip them! They're phenomenal!! I wanted to tilt the skillet up and drink the sauce.
Incredible meal and service! I have adventurous children, so they enjoyed the food at Cochon. I would definitely not take picky children or adults to this restaurant.
I have to say this is a great place for appetizers, you won't go wrong for any of them! I also got the entree of rabbit, an interesting dish , but was way too salty! Otherwise, everything was great

We went to Cochon for a dinner out for a bachelorette party. The food was absolutely incredible and the service matched the amazing food. We couldn't have asked for a more enjoyable evening out! I'd highly recommend the alligator (everyone at the table loved this dish) and the wood fired oysters!! Highly recommend to anyone visiting New Orleans and particularly those with large groups. Note, because our party was 12 people, we did have to use a fixed price menu, but it was worth every penny. We got an incredible amount of food and got to try so many of the Cochon classics! Cochon is a New Orleans staple for a reason. Definitely don't miss out!

Got the oysters with chili oil and fried alligator bites. Didn't get any entrees because none of them sounded really appealing but the two small plates we got were pretty good. Good place for small plates and good drinks!

In NOLA for a long weekend we were aware of Cochon from prior visits and could not wait to introduce the restaurant to our family.  We had a reservation for 4 at 7:00 and arrived on time. At reservation I asked about vegan options. I was told that there was only one option on the menu that was vegan but the chef would be more than happy to accommodate me. 

The service was fantastic, friendly, quick, informative and timely. Our appetizers were alligator bites and baby eggplant (both not vegan) and cucumbers and herb salad. The cucumber and herb salad was very light, fresh, and flavorful with herbs, mint, and parsley. Very good!  

For dinner the chef made me an amazing vegan meal. Pea purée, baby eggplant, greens, shaved squash and parsley with a delightful herb sauce. It was better than expected and so delicious. The other three guests had Louisiana cochon with cabbage, cracking, and pickled peaches, the rabbit and dumplings and the grilled amberjack. Everyone said the food was layered with flavors, unique, and overall superb. 

One final note on the alligator bites.  Our waiter forgot to enter them. When we brought it up they were brought to our table immediately and the floor manager and 2nd manager came out to apologize. They also comped the dish. We did not ask for them to comp the appetizer, they just did. That's the kind of service one would expect from a restaurant of this caliber. 

We were Trilly impressed by the entire experience and recommend this restaurant the the dining experience to anyone in NOLA. Thank you Donald
Link.

A must-try when visiting the city. We asked our waiter to suggest dishes that were special to the area and something that would be unmatched anywhere else and he helped us create the perfect menu of small plates to share and chose entrees that were out of this world. Definitely try the baked oysters. And the ribs. And the butterscotch dessert. The drinks are incredible to boot. Shout out to Mike for making us feel at home!
This place is excellent. They have a seperate menu for people allergic to gluten (me) which makes ordering so much easier. Delicious farm to table food, and great ambience

Prime example of a restaurant that is attempting dishes beyond the reach of it's daily chef's skillset. The Cochon dish was dry pulled pork in a dog food dish shaped pile with sorry cabbage, puny pineapple chunks and some only mildly interesting pork rinds. Rabbit and dumplings should have been named dumplings with a rabbit garnish.

A good spot to grab some lunch! Not a whole lot of menu options. If you're vegetarian, not many choices here. They created a vegetarian plate for a friend of mine and it was $24. They don't split checks so we had to calculate our own tab of three pairs . 

Plenty of beer and wine options. Cocktails as well.  Food was good but nothing amazingly blow your mind for the prices .

We originally were told it would be a 45 minute wait get in, but received a call less than 15 minutes later to return for our table. What a phenomenal restaurant! I had the bbq pork ribs and was blown away by how good they were. Coming from Kansas City, I had very low expectations for the bbq, but could not have been more surprised at how good they were. On the side I had the Mac n cheese casserole which was hands down the best Mac n cheese I've had in my entire life. The service at this restaurant was also the single best service I have received at a restaurant. There was constantly someone coming to refill our drinks and checking on how we were doing. Furthermore, they were friendly and personable. 

You have a great group of employees and fantastic food. Cochon, keep doing exactly what you're doing!

We stopped in for a bite. Ordered the oysters & fried alligator appetizers. The oysters were so delicious. We also dipped the bread in the oyster sauce & that was great too. The fried alligator was good, the taste was there but the crunch lacked because of the mayo sauce poured on top. Service could've been better, waitress had an "over it" attitude.

Decided to try Cochon after reviewing some great yelp reviews. Had a reservation for 7pm and was promptly seated. Atmosphere is very cool and lively.
The MOST AMAZING bread came out and was moist, buttery, and delicious; I could eat just this bread forever!
Apps came out quickly and were FANTASTIC. The wood fired oysters were awesome; sweet with a nice sauce, and fresh garlic flavor (needed a little salt).
The shrimp cake was good, fried nicely but a little too much breading in my opinion; very tasty tbough.
Food came out and looks so delicious!
My order of the braised short rib was unbelievably amazing; tender, flavorful, crispy smashed potato, and delicious sauce. 
A friend got the Cochon dish and raved about it; looked amazing. 
Another got the smoked ham shank and could not say enough about the flavors.
Smothered greens were really delicate and flavorful.
For dessert, the banana pudding looked great on yelp reviews and was a must try despite being so full and satisfied from this amazing meal.
Was Soooooooo looking forward to ordering the banana pudding but apparently its seasonal and they didn't have it. So ordered the blueberry cheesecake which was outstanding! Came out looking awesome, like a cannoli with a beautiful blueberry compote and fresh whipped cream. It was good but shell seemed a bit over cooked and really didn't have anything that tasted like a cheesecake component. 
Others got the pineapple upside down cake which i tasted and was really good.
Overall, this place is a true 5 stars and a must visit!

Unfortunately, Cochon fell a little flat for me. The vibe just felt a little cold and unwelcoming. 

We had a few non-foodies with us who were definitely not familiar with many of the options on the menu. Our waitress didn't seem interested in answering many questions or really educating us on the concept/specialties of the restaurant.  

Catfish Courtbouillon was just okay. The dinner rolls were super. The two real stand outs for me were the fried livers with pepper jelly & toast and the wood-fired oysters. 

I might go back, but I'd do a little research and make different choices.

Good food. A little "fancy" but very good. 

The Louisiana cochon plate includes cracklins that need need another couple of minutes in the fryer (they were a little too white and too soft - not quite crunchy). The cochon itself was very good (a but like a crab-cake style pork patty - no breading, just pork) with good cabbage and sweet pickled peaches. Very good combination.  A shot of house hot sauce is a perfect addition. 

The boucherie platter is a great appetizer- good head cheese, salami, house pickles, and a pork based spread (can't remember the actual name). All very good. 

All paired with a local Irish Channel stout made for a great experience.
No take out, "Especially not dessert". Stupid place, I walked in ready to spend $50 on dessert ordering one of everything and they refused. With a smile

Exceptional all around. The aggregate rating should be higher. A standout among fierce competition.
If you didn't enjoy this place, you probably don't care for southern Cajun cuisine in general. 
Bacon fried oyster sandwich is always a good choice.
Loved the grilled oysters. Done in an escargot pan with butter and hot sauce (best I could tell). Delicious.

Food was absolutely amazing.  If I rated just the food 5 stars. 

However, was recommended this place for a business meeting, which was a bad idea in my opinion. Just too loud to hear the person on the other side of the table. Our server was somewhat rude...giving weird looks and acting annoyed when we had to repeat our orders because even he couldn't hear us.

Was in NOLA for a conference and had to stop at this place for lunch twice in my short stay! The wood fire grilled oyster was to die for! Each time we had 2 orders of that goodness for just 2 and 3 people, respectively. The spicy oily broth the oysters were swimming in were so good, we ended up dipping everything in there. They should bottle that stuff and sell it for take away.

First stop on NOLA, and it was perfect! Tried wood-fires oysters, which are now my favorite and I'll have to return for them! Fried alligators were little flavorless, and it was the first time trying it, so didn't have much expectations for the meat. The aioli was great though, made up for the meat. Also tried the crawfish pie, crust was not too thick, with lots of flavors! 

The restaurant is spacious and very clean, with comfortable seating. 

Jeremy, one of the servers was super attentive and made our first experience at this place extra special! 

Definitely will be returning and recommending this place!

We made an early reservation for Saturday and glad we did, the place really filled up. The restaurant is off the main drag, but the food is worth the detour. We had about half the menu between us. Pricey, but everything, including the cocktails, was delicious. I would definitely go again.

I live in Nashville and would drive back to New Orleans simply for Cochon alone. I got the pork cheek and rabbit stew at the restaurant, and returned the next day to buy deer sausage and boudin from the butcher. All 5 star food. I recommended it to several people in New Orleans and have recommended it to people in the area to try when they visit.

Cochon has long been a favorite of mine and this latest experience was a nice reminder of why. Each dish is so well thought out with touches you wouldn't expect. Tonight i tried seasonal peach glazed country ribs. They were delicious. The glaze and the grilled peaches were a perfect summer dish.
