The fried boudin is one of the best you will taste, nice flavor and depth. As nice surprise dish was brought to the table of blistered Shishito peppers on a creamy cheese. These were light and delicious between courses. Don't count out desert here either. The Meyer lemon chess pie was a home run for me. 
Our servers were really pros too!  Atticus and Fran kept the evening moving and light, despite a minor glitch with our food. They were able to make the night a pleasant dining experience anyway. 
Can't wait to go back.

We came during a random Monday afternoon for some snacks and were not disappointed.

The gator appetizer was delicious, although fried it was light and not oily nor chewy. The salmon was also delicious. And last but not least the gumbo had great flavor and right level of spiciness.

And they have a fabulous selection of whiskeys/bourbon.

Visited this place while on vacation in NOLA a couple of weeks ago. The place was completely packed and unfortunately we didn't have a reservation -luckily we were able to sit at the bar. We started off with the fried alligator which was delicious. The sauce is was battered in was phenomenal. The catfish entree was also well seasoned and very filling. I highly recommend this place

With a place called "Cochon," it'll be expected that you'll be eating pork. However, the food options are not limited to swine. You'll find the dishes we're all familiar with in New Orleans with a twist. The chef changes the menu and you won't find the same specials that you indulged in last time. I appreciate the food, the vibe and the price. The staff is excellent as well. I couldn't think of a better place to eat outside of the tourist bustle of the French Quarter.

Excellent food and worth the drive for Fried Alligator Balls and Crawfish Empanada Pie.  We also tried the Catfish CourtBouillon which has lots of basil (which I love and which tastes a lot like a Vietnamese dish).  The Butterscotch Creme with Shortcake cookies was to die for.  Careful ... it's diabetes waiting to happen so all 4 of us shared the one dessert .  Loved everything !!!!

The food here is excellent and the staff is great.   We came for a late lunch and started with wood fired oysters and alligator bites.  Both were fanatic and the oysters were light and spicy.   I cannot say enough about the catfish courtboullion which had a bright flavorful tomato sauce that was different with each bite.  Go and enjoy!

Go here. Super friendly staff. Awesome drinks. Definitely not expensive for the quality. 

I sat at the bar, was greeted immediately, bartenders all serviced me. But god, the drinks!!!! The butcher next door is the same owners. Could eat all 3 meals a day here. I would have a heart attack by next Tuesday.
Great place, not bad prices. One of the more fun places to go, the staff is wicked cool and the place is built differently than a normal restaurant. Lots of cool decor. Would return for sure.
Food was tasty and well put together, first time there so we went of yelp recommendations and we were not disappointed looking forward to stopping by on our next trip.

This was my fine dining pick while I am in NOLA. I only went there once so I can't really give out all five stars if I didn't try anything else. But for my short experience there it was pleasant. It got there just as the lunch stars so it's not crowded. I asked my waitress Katherine to recommend food since I will only be there once. She recommended me their famous wood fired oyster and the fried boudin as well as the blackberry cake. Food did not disappoint. Keep in mind. It's fine dining. Small plates and not cheap but overall great experience.

Last night was possibly one of the top moments in my life for dining experiences...the food, the bourbon, the chef and my new friends I met at the chefs table all made it an amazing bday evening! The wood fired oysters may have been my favorite thing!!
Mac and Cheese is killer!!!! Hot sauce has good flavor not too hot. They give Wicky sticks for kids. Staff is super friendly. Not far from the WW2 museum. Highly recommended

First night in New Orleans and my girlfriends and I decided to have a taste of New Orleans! 

Scrolling through Yelp, we all saw this place which is conveniently close to our place The Quisby (I'll also leave another Yelp review regarding this hip place). 

We went there at 9pm on a hot Tuesday. There was no wait but it is preferred if you call ahead of time to see if they are busy or not. 

The place was relaxing. The aroma of the food was as overwhelming and we stood there eagerly waiting to devour the food that we are about to order. 

So onto the food. We ordered the Fried Alligator, Shrimp Cake, Wood Fired Oysters and Mac n Cheese. I like all of them. Fried Alligator was tasty. To be honest, it tastes like chicken but there was something with the seasoning that they used that made it really special. The skin was so crunchy and the size of each one is just right. The plate was good for 2 unless you are like my friends who eat super little and then you can consider sharing to to 2 more. Shrimp Cake here has an interesting flavor to it. Make sure to eat it with the sliced cucumbers that comes with it. I didn't expect anything great from that little pooch of crab meat. It is a must try. The OYSTERS are the bomb. It is a MUST try for me. There were 6 oysters in total and all tasted magnificently. I kinda want to eat it with rice cause rice is life but unfortunately they don't serve rice. Mac n Cheese was okay. Nothing too special. And for dessert, we had blueberry cheesecake!!! It was a good treat!! Not too sweet and the crispy outer layer of it was unexpected. They were able to serve a traditional cheesecake in an extraordinary way but was able to preserve its charming taste.

Customer service was superb. We had Steven and Peter who helped us with our choices. They were funny and very helpful. 

Will go back here if I get the chance!!

This place was amazing! I sat at the chefs table and had the best night ever. The catfish dish, cucumber pickles everything that came out of the kitchen was high quality. All the good is smoking hot and they really have good communication on the kitchen staff. I would give this 6 stars if I could !!
Words can not describe how good my meal was there! One of the top five meals of my life! Next time I visit NOLA, I'm planning on going to Cohon Butcher and I'm sure it will not disappoint!

Heard about Cochon through friends who've previously visited NOLA and really wanted to check it out. Now that I think about it.. it honestly could've been either Cochon or Cochon Butcher that they were referring to, but I'm really glad I got to try it.

First off, decor. It was nice, inviting, and warm. The walls were wood paneled with a bar by the entrance, and open kitchen in the back. Big enough to host large groups, but intimate enough for a perfect date night.

I wasn't sure if the restaurant would be packed on Thursday night so I made reservations ahead of time. It was busy, but not super busy where you would have to wait for a while. The service was fine. Our drinks were always refilled and the waitress was informative, and efficient. 

We ordered the wood fried oysters, fried alligator, and ham hock.. all to share.

The oysters: oh baby. This is something to get here. I've never had oysters like this before. I was somewhat hesitant to order oysters but it seemed like a NOLA staple I had to try and it was the right choice. I mean the oyster itself was fine, but it was the SAUCE that made it over the top. It was savory, buttery with a slight tang from the lemon but all in all a perfect combo.

fried alligator: this was .. ok in my opinion. I don't think they did anything special by frying it, and adding some basil (?) and what seemed like a Sriracha mayo sauce. I think it makes it palatable for people who've never tried it before, but it doesn't highlight the meat at all. Sub it for tator tots and you got a diner dish

Ham hock: this was great, just wasn't a personal favorite. Tasted similar to corned beef- salty rich and perfectly tender. The broth that it came in was good, but again didn't fully compliment the meat - but balanced it in a way that didn't make it so heavy which was nice.

Overall, I really enjoyed Cochon - I just wouldn't add it to my must go to list if I'm ever back in NOLA

We had dinner there Saturday night a recommendation from my niece. Well I ordered the oyster bacon sandwich and twice baked potato. The wife ordered catfish coubion and Lima beans. 
My sandwich was big but couldn't taste the oysters because of the dressing on the sandwich plus the bread fell apart. The twice baked potato was really good. The wife's fish dish was not any good. I make coubion and that was not it. All this was , was canned tomato sauce rice and fish with zataran spice on it. The Lima beans were ok. The wife liked them more then me. 
Would not go back plus pricey for what you get.

Heard about this place from a friend who visited here before. Nice atmosphere and pretty decent food. I wasn't really hungry so I didn't get much to eat. I decided to get the Alligator Bites (good, but chewy) and the Macaroni and Cheese (which was soooo delicious).

OMG this place is amazing. We walked in without a reservation. Friendly  welcoming atmosphere... Service was great. We ordered the fried alligator to start... ITS a must try!!!! I've never had alligator before happy this was my first place to try it. We followed up by getting the ribs that are topped with watermelon (best ribs I've had out yet....) flavor bomb in your mouth. We ordered a side of Mac n cheese, collard greens,creamy grits! Did everything to share was the perfect amount. We ended our meal with the pound cake topped with peach ice cream.... it was insane.... great way to end dinner. Prices were more then reasonable. In New Orleans it's easy to go somewhere based on reviews and walk away with feeling unsatisfied this place is not one of them ! Go!

The service here was the best I've had anywhere. The food was interesting and delicious. We tried several dishes as everything was so appealing. The oysters were delicious. The desserts were amazing! We tried the butterscotch pudding and blackberry cake. Both were unique and tasty.

Spectacular. Came here alone and received some of the best service. Ate at the bar and was welcomed and patiently served all night. Took it course by course and everything was delicious. From the crawfish pie, to the gumbo, to the oysters. Everything was amazing. Hard to pick a favorite.... actually it's the andouille sausage in the gumbo. Amazing, could eat it all day. It wasn't just the food that makes Cochon so great. It's the whole dinning experiences. The wait staff was kind in recommending dishes, checking in to see if I needed anything and just genuine.  Can't wait to return.

We like eating here. The food was good. We considered it to be $$$ money signs when you consider the portion to dish price. All of the food was tasty and good. We were visiting and wanted not to fall into a tourist trap. We did want a creol Cajun option, this was definitely not the case. The waiter was great and the place was super clean. We enjoyed our visit just wished it would not have been as expensive since we did not leave feeling full.

Truly the worst service experience I've ever had at a restaurant. I will preface this by saying I give credit where credit is due. I often will give a good restaurant 5 stars for a great experience. I think this is my only 1 star review ever. Unacceptable service especially due to the price. We were seated and it took at least 15 minutes for someone to come by and even greet us even though they were walking by to adjacent tables over and over again. Once the waitress finally came by, she asked what we wanted. We were in town visiting and never eaten at Cochon so we nicely asked what she thought (aka what is good on the menu, what is popular, how it works since there were many sections to the menu- figured this would be obvious especially given the question she just asked us) and very rudely she says, "about what?!" And we're like... uhmm.. what is good? what do people like? She spouted off one thing (the most expensive thing on the menu) and then walked away. We didn't see her the rest of the time we were there. Another waiter finally came by maybe 20 minutes later. We just gave him a list of things from each section that we would share so we could try a few things. The food took a while and was mehh. Mac and cheese tasted like Stouffers with some chipotle powder. The ribeye pie was fine- like an empanada. The oyster and bacon sandwich was okay as well. Nothing special about the food at all. After our food was delivered, we did not see another waiter the ENTIRE TIME WE WERE THERE (other than to pick up our plates and give us our check). Not once were we asked how things were, if we would like anything else, NOTHING. And no, it was not because they were busy because the people that were waiting on us (could not tell you who was our actual waiter or waitress since they each only came by once) were sitting around, leaning on the bar and having conversations with each other. I was livid by the time we left. We would've ordered more because we ended up eating elsewhere after we left but we could not bring ourselves to order anything else here due to the awful service. I truly have never gotten worse service- even from a sport's bars. We don't live in New Orleans but I can promise you, when we do visit, we would NEVER eat at Cochon again. There are far too many better places to eat.

Awesome, everything we ordered was fantastic.
You must get the oysters, MAC N Cheese, and
The smoked ham hock was quite a surprise, the rice and beans with it was so delicious.

Perfect if you don't mind waiting!

Please have you wallet ready to enjoy a good meal at a very hip and chic restaurant. Of course parking was not the best but the Gator Bites and Mac and cheese made up for it! It was my first trip to Nola but Definitely not my last!

My friends and I had brunch on Sunday around 12pm and the place was empty. The interior was very spacious. The service and food was okay. 

- Wood-fired Oysters: $14 is quite expensive for 6 small pieces. It was really oily, sour and fishy in taste. Not pleasant at all. And I'm not sure why ours didn't come shelled? 

- Fried Chicken Liver: Not so memorable. The liver was very crunchy and pungent. It was paired with slightly sweet pepper jelly and refreshing onions topped on white toast. 
 
- Rabbit & Dumplings: My FAVORITE dish out of all. It reminded me of pot pie, simply delicious and comforting. The rabbit meat was super tender ptobablyand the best I've had up to date. There were a nice balance of soft vegetables. The dumplings were huge and doughy. 

- Smoked Ribs: Very saucy, sweet and slightly smokey. We enjoyed the flavors but it was poorly cooked. The meat was not "fall off the bone" but rather tough and chewy. I wouldn't get it again. 

- Cochon: Huge disappointment. The pork was extremely dry and salty. There were too much flavors/textures going on with the cabbage, pickled peaches and cracklins. All of which we felt just didn't work together.
Must try! Everything was delicious. So glad I got to visit this place especially right after Bourdain's passing

One of our favorite for our visit to the Big Easy. It is walking distance from the convention center.  The modern vibe, all wood decor is pleasant but not stuffy.  We love the spin on the traditional cajun dishes that makes it unexpected and fun.  Small bits portion was great for sharing like tapas.  Will go again next time I am in town.

This review is primarily for our service.

After mentioning to out waiter that he removed ti drink menu before I could order an item? It appeared that he completely forgot and never returned to take me order. I received all of my food in a timely manner but after that, the waiter completely disappeared. Would come again but request a different waiter.

This was my first experience and the food was great, especially the ribeye pie! Unfortunately, our servers had too many other tables and there was a severe lack of attention to us. I don't expect them to be checking in every second but each interval from initial greet to drink order to food had very long breaks in between. There was no check in on the meal and after our waters, we were ignored for at least 15 minutes. We easily could have turned over the table much quicker but there simply wasn't any way they could with how many tables they had to manage. An out entrees were warm, at best. Try and fix this because the flavors were great.

Cochon is excellent. I walked in during a convention Sunday without a reservation. Wait for one was about an hour, but I was able to get a seatt at the bar in less than ten minutes, so I ate at the bar.

I started with the Smoke on the Water, a mezcal based cocktail with smoked salt. It wasn't as smoky as I had hoped, but it was refreshing, and strong. I ordered the cochon as my main, with a side of greens. It was a tough choice, as the rabbit and dumplings was super appealing and I love a good courtbouillon. But I figured that I needed to order the namesake dish.

They start you with a soft bread and creamy butter that is out of this world. I could've eaten that and died happy. The cochon is huge, smoky, and flavorful. The cracklins and cabbage provide a delicious textural contrast. And the greens are perfectly tender. I ordered the German chocolate cake to-go and that was underwhelming. It was bad, but just compared to how amazing everything else was, I would order an appetizer instead of dessert when I return. 

I would also definitely make a reservation to sit at a table. The bartenders were fine, but a packed bar, with most patrons eating dinner, is tough on service. But they were friendly enough, my order was correct, and my drink was great.  

When in New Orleans, Cochon is not to be missed.

Very loud place but nice experience and good food.  We had two guys waiting on us; only Aaron told us his name and he was wonderful.  I hope the other one shared our tip with him as it seems he did most everything.  Scallops, court bouillon and oyster-bacon sandwich.

The worst.  Took 10-15 minutes after being seated to be acknowledged.  Ribs were tough.  Mac and cheese had some funky flavoring and was too burnt on top.  Bloody Mary's tasted like straight tomato juice.  Crab claws had hardly any meat.  The boudin balls were the only decent thing.  I think we meant to go to the butcher shop/deli?  The place on the hard corner missed it by a long shot.  I was fooled when we sat down because the place looked so nice and I can tell the spent the extra money money on the finishes.  Definitely not a kid menu friendly place.  I hate writing bad reviews but all the stars and positive reviews were way way off in my honest opinion.

We selected this restaurant because of the high reviews for the alligator appetizer.   I never had alligator before, so i wanted to make sure it would taste good.   The fried alligator was delicious and spicy.  We also ordered philly cheese steak,  mac n cheese, gumbo, and catfish courtbouillan which each person said was really gre eat and had the perfect amount of spice.

Wonderful dinning experience. The restaurant is very nice and food is wonderful. I had the chicken & andouille gumbo. It is a small serving but the flavor is so rich that I could not eat a bigger portion of it. Creamy grits are very good as well. I also ordered the Ham with peach and fresh cheese, absolutely fantastic. The service was great, the bread and butter as so yummy! I was so pleased with my dinner.

Stopped in for the gator selection and was pleasantly surprised.  Each of the five of us had different tastes in mind but the menu met our desires.   The food was rich, well seasoned, plentiful, and quite reasonably priced.  None of us left dissatisfied.  Waitress was well knowledgeable on menu items, including drinks. She patiently assisted those of us with questions on specific items, informed us of the manner of cooking,seasoning, and approximate portions.  The ambience was quiet, relaxing, and sunny.  A dessert menu was offered after our meal but we were quite full by then.  Next time I return maybe the dessert menu will be my main course!

Wow !! Where do I begin , the food is amazing in every way . The layers of flavor in the food takes your breath away . I had the fisherman fish and my boyfriend had the short ribs . Each bite he closed his eye because he wanted savor each taste . I was laughing each bite . Atmosphere perfect , great vibe and an open inclusive environment. Just come and see for yourself ! Best birthday dinner and thank you chef !

Fried alligator.
Pork ribs
Mac n' cheese.
Smothered greens.
Catfish.
Oyster sandwich.
Blueberry cheesecake dessert.

All amazing.

My group got treated to a hosted dinner all done family style so an array of food just kept coming our way. I didn't know what exactly everything was, BUT everything I put in my mouth was AMAZING. 

Few stand outs for me were:
The gator bits. Tastes like chicken, but like the best exotic chicken with some yummy aioli type sauce? Idk but I was fighting to keep that one close. 

The pork cracklins . Basically the best salty little bite of pork rinds you've ever tried. How they made something so simple that yummy? Idk but kudos. 

Mushrooms. It was literally just a bowl of mushrooms swimming in this mouthwatering white sauce. I had to stop myself from drinking it. 

So much else came out and it all was delicious. I was in foodie heaven. 

The restaurant itself was super cute with cool artwork and the amazing wood paneling throughout the dining room. Have to come back one day and try the rest of the menu.

Cochon is just simply amazing. Me and my friend went here for lunch and we had the best experience. The food brings delicacy by each bites.

We ordered 4 items (fried boudin, fried alligators, the specials of the day, and the grilled beef short ribs), which was a little too much for 2 person. Our favorite was the fried alligators and the specials of the day, which was crispy pork belly.

The fried alligators was a bit spicy which was perfect for my taste. It kind a tastes like chicken but a little tougher. 


The pork belly was just perfectly cooked as the outer part was very crispy yet flavorful. They added white "sauce" which tastes a bit sweet, so the pork itself was salty but the sauce is sweet. Perfect combination! My mouth is already watery just from thinking of it!

The place also has really nice vibe and it is very bright. Love the ambiance and the food!

3 couples. We all ordered differently.  All dishes were amazing.  Spare ribs- excellent.  Grits were best I've had in Nola.  Mac cheese was great. All entrees ordered were spot on.  We also ordered every desert except sherbet.  Again all were amazing.
Great place. Outside the french quarter but definitely worth the ride out. Food was delicious!!! We sampled a couple of dishes and they were all top. Service was good as well. Definitely recommended.

Everything was delicious here. 
My highlights were the pork rinds that we dip in molasses syrup (off menu), oysters, and I know this may sound weird but their dinner rolls! I want to go off talking about their dinner rolls because it's not something you get that delicious in California.

We had a great dinner at Coquette. The wood fired oysters where definitely a highlight. All of the entrees were delicious. The bread that comes for the table is also out of this world. There will be a wait, but it is worth it!
Been there a number of times and food and staff always superb.  Delicious but with a side of fun.
Neighborhood gem close to, but not in the middle of, the typical tourist path. Wonderful food, nice vibe, good wine.
I have no complaints! I just can say that I dare you go and give them a try(NOLA voice...Sum Play). I sure will return. ‍

OMG... there just aren't words.  I travel for a living and I have to say, soooo yummy.  Ask for Levin.  He will walk you through the mini in such detail you will want to order everything.  

You won't be disappointed! The food and Levin... A.MAZING.

The food here was sooo delicious and we
We're so glad to find this restaurant among all of the creole/southern restaurants!! I wish we could have eaten at Donald 
links' BBQ/butchery joint too. Yes this food is a little high prices for the south, but the freshness, quality, innovation, and presentation of food was worth it. The cocktails to go a long with it was yummy. Best of all was Donald links' homemade sauces. The man knows what he is doing. The service was top shelf and this place was never short on southern hospitality!!

Spectacular. Came here alone and received some of the best service. Ate at the bar and was welcomed and patiently served all night. Took it course by course and everything was delicious. From the crawfish pie, to the gumbo, to the oysters. Everything was amazing. Hard to pick a favorite.... actually it's the andouille sausage in the gumbo. Amazing, could eat it all day. It wasn't just the food that makes Cochon so great. It's the whole dinning experiences. The wait staff was kind in recommending dishes, checking in to see if I needed anything and just genuine.  Can't wait to return

Had the Ribeye Pie and the fried livers along with the smothered greens. Delicious. Talked to several patrons and they said "just point at the menu and order, you can't go wrong". They are correct. Great atmosphere and very friendly and attentive service.

Cochon was highly recommend to us as we are from Las a Vegas and were seeking a true Cajun meal. We walked a long way as we were sight seeing. Hot, tired, hungry and thirsty we arrived expecting a great experience. The restaurant was not busy and a table was given to us immediately, after that we waited and waited and waited, no one came or even acknowledged our presence. Several wait staff came near to clear tables and pick up tips and tabs. We decided to give the staff extra time since we thought perhaps the area might be a bit more relaxed, but then we saw several other guests sit down and immediately receive service. We decided at that point we were not going to be waited on. We walked out letting the reception staff how we felt; they seemed concerned but their excuses were frankly lame and oblivious and lacking any spirit of a sincere apology. We then left but had to return a few minutes later because we left something on our in waited table that we had purchased earlier, only to find they threw our purchase in the garbage. We discussed the issue with the manager and once again were given lame excuses. I do not plan on returning to this establishment again even though we may visit New Orleans again.

The ambience, the waiter and the food is great!! I ordered  Boudin as an appetizer and the catfish courtbouillon as entree and it was to die for. The waiter was very helpful and attentive to our table. Food and customer service made this experience unique.

Food was perfect. Service & ambience was ok. We didn't receive the bread service we noticed on the way out on the other tables. Wine pours were small. I still think it's worth trying if you have an extra day. It felt like southern bbq to me. It was my 3rd choice next to Peche & Galliano. Our tab was over $100 for 2 so I think service should be better.
Sat at the bar. Bartender was kind and patient. The fish entree was a little overpriced but the staff is fabulous.

Cochon was a last minute rezzie we made when we decided we were hungry and would eat dinner after a larger lunch left us super full earlier in the day. 

We arrived after 8p and were quickly sat. This place is pretty massive. I ordered a spicy marg type cocktail which seems to be my go to lately. 

We shared an order of the wood fired oysters which really weren't so spectacular but pull apart the bread rolls and dip into the garlic butter and you've got some immediate redemption, although we are no longer talking oysters at all. 

We definitely didn't want to over order so we shared the rabbit and dumplings which we were told was the most popular menu item after asking and I wanted to try the macaroni & cheese casserole which was pretty good but much better with hot sauce atop. 

The dumplings were yummy, tasted like a fall comfort dish and were sort of a nice toss up against a lot of the more traditional southern food items I'd been ordering elsewhere. I wouldn't say they were blow your mind, must order or even come here to try but they served their purpose. 

Service was ok, but not over the type friendly. Someone who worked there was really sweet when I got up to use the restroom and paid me such warm compliments on a top I was wearing, always very sweet but our server seemed a bit lackluster. 

I don't think I'd return or recommend Cochon unless you're staying nearby and just sort of need to grab a bite to eat and don't want to think about it too much. 

I don't think it's far fetched to say this was probably my least fav meal of our dining experiences in New Orleans although I'd heard a thing or two about this place. 

Maybe it's the type of place that's living on reputation... unless we just ordered the wrong things.
Yeah, it's that good. Classical New Orleans flavor in an open, casual and lively setting. The food is taken very seriously and is expertly prepared by a staff that is all in. Bring an appetite....

Wow wow wow. I can here at the recommendation of the late Mr. Bourdain, and I was beyond amazed at the food. We made a reservation same day for that night and it was easy to come in and be seated. I loved the decoration, very modern and warm. 

The food was truly spectacular. The rabbit pot pie was so comforting and warming, tasted like your grandmother made it. The star though was the beef- wowwww. I'm a big beef advocate and I was blown away. The sauce, the potatoes, all magic in your mouth. Even the start dinner rolls they serve you were amazing! This is the one restaurant I could eat at daily and not get bored. Do yourself a favor and go eat here- ASAP!

Ok, wow. This place is amazing! My only regret is that I wasn't hungry enough to eat more! 
After a long day at the WWII museum my friend and I were starving and luckily Yelp led us here. Every aspect of our experience here was perfection and I wouldn't hesitate to come back. 
Our waiter was very efficient and knowledgeable. I wasn't familiar with most of the things on the menu and he explained it all perfectly. 
The cocktails are phenomenal. I forget what my drink was called but it was refreshing and wonderful. They all sounded so good and it was not an easy decision! 
My friend ordered ribs which she really enjoyed. We shared macaroni and cheese which was the best I've ever had in my life! That was a recommendation from the waiter and it ended up being one of the highlights of my trip/life. 
I fancy myself a bit of an oyster connoisseur and the oysters here were amazeballs. They were baked in this little skillet thing and the chili garlic sauce they were submerged in was so delicious. The yummy little biscuits on the side were the perfect accompaniment.
I can't recommend this place enough and I can't wait to go back!

First time visiting this restaurant on 8/16/19 Ordered the fried liver with pepper jelly toast appetizer and it was nothing to write home about. Liver was fried good but lacked seasoning. The pepper jelly was weak in "pepper". Ordered the pulled pork sandwiches (Friday) special and almost lost a tooth on a piece of bone. Subsequently my wife had a piece of pork shoulder bone in her sandwich too. 3 stars because of the service. Probably a one and done for us. Rumor has it that the adjoining sister restaurant The Butcher has much more to offer , what a bummer.

Yooooo this place was wonderful! The service was expedient and friendly. The food was incredible. Well balanced plates that reflected a clear vision from the kitchen. The braised beef was tender and rich. The Cochon was a medley of flavors!! Make reservations though. Also, great wine, bourbon and beer selections.

Made dinner reservations and showed up ontime. We were seated immediately in a nice area in the back next to windows. We had 2 servers (both from Jacksonville, FL) who were very attentive to our needs. The excellent service is their secret ingredient to a nice meal - very difficult to improve on an already well - trained staff. Kudos to Cochon for their first rate servers.
Started out with 3 appetizers with the alligator being the best. The others were just average, not bad, but average. We also ordered 2 bottles of wine that were corked and served perfectly. For entrees, two of us ordered the Fish, one the Pork Chop, and one the Short Rib. The fish was good, but did taste a little too "fishy". The Pork Chop was good, but average, and I've had better. The star of the meal was the Short Rib, was was smoked (their specialty) and was delicious. An additional rib for the price would have been nice (and eaten).

All in all, an above average meal with Extremely Above Average service. Yes, I would recommend Cochon to anyone wanting a nice dinner with excellent customer service.

This place was delicious and fun!

They have a wonderful Chefs bar that looks into the kitchen.

I was lucky enough they had a new person, so I got to hear the experienced butcher and chef explaining how my meal should be prepared. Very tasty learning experience!
Scrumptious! A must while visiting New Orleans as you ramshackle the streets like Ignatius Jacques Reilly. A dunce shall not understand the delight, allure, and taste dribbling off the fork.

We got fried oyster, roasted shrimp, tomato salad, Braised beef and side of baked potato. Food were very New Orleans. Very very good comfort food. The seasonal tomato salad was very refreshing. Even the side of baked potato is very well made with spices. 
The suggestion for how much food we should order got us confused tho. Server keep saying the portion size is big, 2 appetizers might fill us up. But we end up getting 3 appetizers, 1 entree and 1 side. Me and my friend might have huge appetite but still..

Me and my girlfriend had to wait 1hour+ for our food . We waited as all tables around us came and went, we saw our own meals delivered to other tables. Our waiter didn't check in on us...very disappointing, food was okay. xoxo

The service is great here. Loved the gumbo. It was probably the best one I've had in New Orleans. The flavor had more depth than the other ones I tried. It was perfect. Bummed that they were out of the chargrilled oysters because that was what I came for. The ribs could have been a smidge more tender because it didn't fall off the bone, but the marinade was good. The peach cake with the peach ice cream was also a hit.
We ordered a bunch of apps and small plates and they were all so good.  Smoked pork ribs and boudin were favorites.  Desserts were elegant and delish.

The best meal we had all trip. 

Service was spectacular - everyone knew the menu inside & out, with excellent suggestions.

Best items we got were shrimp small plate and pork cheeks. Cannoli-style cheesecake dessert was top notch as we're cocktail selections.

Cochon did not disappoint! Absolutely loved each dish that were well paired together. My wife and I ordered the alligator bites, country ham with peaches and cheese, and the boucherie plate. I LOVE an amazing boucherie plate - the best thing on this plate was the pork rillettes. I am a very picky eater and do not like trying new things that I'm not quite sure what it is however I'm beyond happy that I stepped out of my comfort zone because had I not - I would have greatly missed out. The country ham with peaches and cheese was refreshing, light and eel paired together - they age their cheese for 3 years. The cheese is a spreadable cheese like ricotta. My wife loved this selection - she's not a huge meat eater so that speaks volumes for this dish! The alligator bites had good flavor and lightly breaded topped with a delicious sauce - only complaint was from the wife about texture. If you've never had alligator before then the texture might be the one thing that throws you off - its a white meat that is tougher (chewier) than what most are used to eating. I've been wanting to try Cochon for awhile so glad we finally made it in for a meal!

Decided to try Cochon after reviewing some great yelp reviews. Had a reservation for 7pm and was promptly seated. Atmosphere is very cool and lively.
The MOST AMAZING bread came out and was moist, buttery, and delicious; I could eat just this bread forever!
Apps came out quickly and were FANTASTIC. The wood fired oysters were awesome; sweet with a nice sauce, and fresh garlic flavor (needed a little salt).
The shrimp cake was good, fried nicely but a little too much breading in my opinion; very tasty tbough.
Food came out and looks so delicious!
My order of the braised short rib was unbelievably amazing; tender, flavorful, crispy smashed potato, and delicious sauce. 
A friend got the Cochon dish and raved about it; looked amazing. 
Another got the smoked ham shank and could not say enough about the flavors.
Smothered greens were really delicate and flavorful.
For dessert, the banana pudding looked great on yelp reviews and was a must try despite being so full and satisfied from this amazing meal.
Was Soooooooo looking forward to ordering the banana pudding but apparently its seasonal and they didn't have it. So ordered the blueberry cheesecake which was outstanding! Came out looking awesome, like a cannoli with a beautiful blueberry compote and fresh whipped cream. It was good but shell seemed a bit over cooked and really didn't have anything that tasted like a cheesecake component. 
Others got the pineapple upside down cake which i tasted and was really good.
Overallhis place is a true 5 stars and a must visit!
Great pork shank when its on the specials.   All food is great.  Make a reservation.  This place fills up.

Great place to try local cuisine. The only reason I won't give it five stars in because the service could have been better. We had two servers throughout our time there and it was a bit confusing.
The atmosphere is trendy with rustic farmhouse style tables. 
We ordered the ham, peaches, and cheese salad which was tasty. The ham was an aged ham kind of like prosciutto the went over some sliced peaches with a ricotta-like cheese smear. All of the flavours complimented one another.
We also did the charcuterie board which was meat only. They do not have any mixed meat and cheese boards. Our favourite on the charcuterie board was the pork rillette. My partner, a big meat eater, was very satisfied with the whole board.
We tried the fried alligator which had great flavour but for us the texture wasn't something we could get behind. We expected it to be tough meat since it's quite lean, but it was even tougher than expected. I ate more than I expected of it though because I loved the seasoning/glaze over it.
All in all, we are glad we stopped in and heard great things about this place.

Great place - great service - prices ok - Cuban sandwich had great texture, but lacked flavor - I don't think I'm going back for another Cuban sandwich - I will go back because the place is great and the service was fantastic

Stopped by for lunch while touring the WWII museum which is a short walk away. Really awesome food and atmosphere with no wait during lunchtime. The Mac n cheese, ribs, fried alligator and gumbo really hit the spot.

Wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter, fried alligator, mac & cheese.... Need I say more??? 

Upon arriving, we walked past the smoker and boy did it smell absolutely AMAZING. We began our meal with the incredibly soft, warm, and buttery bread, probably one of the best breads I've ever had (pro tip: save some to dip in the leftover oyster sauce, because why wouldnt you order the oysters??)

The wood-fired oysters is everything I've ever dreamed of. The oysters itself are fat, juicy, and plump, coated in delicious chili garlic sauce. My mouth is watering as im writing this. 

Being from the west coast, Alligator is not a typical part of our diet so we felt obligated to try the Fried Alligator. If you've never had it, our waitress described it as "if a chicken and a clam had a baby," and that's exactly it! The taste is very similar to chicken but its texture is chewy like a clam. I quite liked it!

The mac and cheese is so creamy and good. We also ordered the Smoked Ribs with Pickled Watermelon Rind. The meat is tender and glazed with a delicious bbq sauce. 

I also need to add: their staff is so wonderful, such a nice and accommodating group of people. Food and atmosphere are amazing. I dont see how anything could go wrong here at Cochon.

Came here on a "let's wander randomly and see what lunch appears" walk, and was not disappointed. I'm a wimp about spicy, so I ended up scraping the breading off the fried alligator (alligator! fascinating! sort of like a cross between chicken and squid) after the first couple bites, but it was tasty as long as I could tolerate it. The cucumber salad was not for me (I think it maybe had cilantro on it?), but the oysters were spectacular and more than made up for it. I don't think I've ever had better. The sauce added warmth and seasoning without overshadowing the seafood, and the oysters themselves were perfectly cooked, buttery and flavorful without being mushy or rubbery. 

Added special mention for the bread, which apparently comes from a local bakery - I had several rolls, and I usually can hardly get through one before I'm bored of the concept of bread, but I had like, three.

We had just gone to the WWII museum and were looking for a place for a late lunch. Saw good reviews for here and stopped in. The food was incredible--we had the shrimp, ribs, seasonal cantaloupe soup and eggplant and it was all excellent. Do not skip the desert menu either! Everything on it looked amazing but we decided on the brown butter peach pound cake with peaches and ice cream and it was incredible. Highly recommend this place.

During my last day in Nola I wanted to try something different and saw this place pop up on Yelp. I ordered a hurricane (because I'm in NoLa duh!) and the Le Pig Mac with mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was delicious it was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Now let's get to the main course, the Le Pig Mac. After my first bite, my brain was confused because the flavors were reminding me of the Big Mac but this was actually delicious and it was with ground pork. In addition to the amazing food and drinks, the service was also wonderful. If you're in the area you should definitely add this to your foodie list.

The food is overpriced in my opinion. The food was kind of bland and not all that amazing. My friends and I tired the fried alligator which really had no flavor at all. 

I had the catfish dish and really didn't like it. The fish was bathing in sauce and rice. Again not much flavor and I finished it mostly because it was $19 dollars. 

If anything the rambling rose drink I had was probably the best thing.

Alligator v. Boudin - Boudin wins (Alligator was tough, too much sauce)
Sweet tea is perfect, not too sweet
Yeast dinner rolls are top 5 - just like my mother in law used to make.
Cochon with peach and cabbage - definitely, huge portion, enough to share.
Mixed greens had to be the perfect balance of sweet, vinegar and smokey bacon goodness - you are missing out if you don't get this
Pork ribs huge flavor, but a bit over-sauced.   Service is good (but average) 
We had a reservation but probably could have walked in, place is huge.

I wanted to give this restaurant more than 3 stars given the hype from reviews, both personally and on yelp, but I can't. 

Started off with the ribs (holy s***, 5/5 wow), the pork belly (4.5/5, very good), and the cucumbers and herbs in vinegar (1/5, forgot the vinegar and had to ask for lemons to dress them myself). The bread was a standout as well. 

The main that I shared with my girlfriend was the cochon namesake dish with stewed vegetables and cracklings (2/5). Cracklings were as expected, stewed vegetables were good but subtle, and the cochon itself was bland and dry. We were both surprised, and couldn't eat more than half of it between the two of us before deciding it wasn't worth it. 

Good point on service - they comped is dessert after we told them about the cochon. Blueberry cheesecake was good (3/5), interestingly presented and not overly sweet.

Negative point on service - coffee took a really long time... like long enough for us to go back to hotel and get coffee... and our check was brought to us before the coffee arrived.

Finally - there was a pipe that was dripping on us/the table which started toward the end of our meal but continued to get worse throughout. 

Given the amount of close friends who sang this place's praises, I guess we expected more, but I hope that this showing was not representative of the norm.

Excellent value. We had an exceptional waitress who seemed truly invested in us enjoying our meal. She helped make it a wonderful evening when she delivered incredible cornbread to us!
The pork with cracklings was outstanding as was the Mac and cheese- the best we have ever had. Charcuterie plate fab as was gumbo. Best meal in NOLa thank you
They have good food but can be pricey.  Their companion sandwich chop Cochin Butcher makes an excellent smoked pork sandwich that is a good value for the price.

It has been 3 years since I made it back to Cochon.  The food was as delicious then as it was tonight.  The service is top notch. The only complaint was that it was too noisy.  When we requested to turn the music down before the restaurant got crowded,  they kindly lowered it. But once the restaurant got crowded,  we found ourselves speaking louder just to hear our conversation.

Referred here by a local while on vacation. Service was great and food was good quality fresh ingredients. Would definitely go back. Their rabbit and dumpling were amazing and I'm not a dumpling person. The ribs were phenomenal.

Restaurant came recommended and well worth seeking it out. A really neat place. Good Service and knowledgeable in food differences as well as various drink options. We tried the gator and it was one of the best recipes that I have tried anywhere. Main dish was short ribs as well as Rabbit and dumplings. Sides were Creme Grits and Mac n Cheese. Food was absolutely delicious and freshly prepared. Give this place a try and you won't be disappointed.

Had my first meal here with a coworker while traveling. I was fortunate enough to know someone and get us seats at the chef's counter! What an amazing experience! The whole experience was amazing and the food was exceptional! We tried several things and were impressed with every single one! We will be back in 2 weeks and will definitely make this a must go to for dinner! Outstanding food and service!!! I highly recommend this amazing restaurant!!
Fantastic meal. Started with fried alligator which was amazing. Added the ham hock entree that was very good as well, wish I could have eaten more on the menu.

This seems to be a very popular place to dine. It has a wonderful ambiance with dim lighting. The drinks are delicious and unique. To start we ordered  The butter dipped oysters and fried alligator. Both were well balanced with flavor and accompanied by the house made dinner rolls which are perfect for dipping in the sauce of both dishes. I had the Catfish which seem to be light but tasty. And to finish off the evening I had the butterscotch pudding for dessert. Definitely a yes for anyone visiting the area. After tagging a photo on social media I found its popular among some friends on the West Coast as well.

This was my first time here being a former resident who got transplanted to Tx. It was Labor Day evening and we made reservations for an early dinner at 6:30. We were the first of our party of 10 to arrive so naturally we waited for more of our party to arrive prior to getting seated. 

They have a big section in the back that has more seating and accommodations for bigger parties. 

After getting a few drinks, We needed a few more minutes to pick out our food. But instead it was a LOT of couple of minutes before our waiter came back. We ordered a mixture of appetizers and entrees, but they brought everything out at the same time. Luckily they had bread, so we weren't starving...especially my poor 2 yr old who just got full from bread. 

We got a mixture of the La Cochon , Mac and cheese , pork ribs, fried alligator, grilled oysters , gumbo, chicken liver, catfish, pork cheek, eggplant, crawfish pie. There were some things better than others, but the only thing that stood out was the pork.

The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't the greatest either. It's not good enough for me to come back, but then again maybe I just got too full from the bread and I didn't get a chance to try everything.

Delicious and just down the street from the WWII museum. My husband had rabbit stew and dumpling.  I had a wonderful shaved pork sandwich on some of the flakiest French bread capped off by provolone cheese and a Dijon mustard. The rolls to start were lighter than air and slightly buttery; glad we didn't fill up on those!

I love Cochon Butcher, so we decided to try Cochon.  I fully expected my dining experience to be elevated to the next level, only to be left in a free fall of a culinary experience that left me falling to the ground, flat...  we started with the crispy pork cheek from the Boucherie menu.  I was expecting flavorful and succulent.  Instead I got chewy, tough, and dry.  Next we had oven roasted gulf fish served "fisherman style."  It's basically a deboned filet of redfish that had the skin and scales left on.  The filet tasted very salty with what tasted like Leary's seasoning salt.  The skin was initially crispy, but soon became fishy and gross.  We also had the smoked beef short rib.  This too was very salty and the meager 2 to 3 ounces of meat was hardly worth it if this were classified as an appetizer.  Alas, they considered the dish an entree.  The service was slow and the servers apologetic.  Skip the restaurant and head to the Cochon Butcher next door!
Holy smokes this place is fantastic. I got the fish which was seasoned and cooked to perfection. The service was really good and had a really cool atmosphere. Highly recommended.

The food here was amazing. Even down to the free french bread that you get had my tastebuds saying OMG. Just don't even question it....just go. I had the ham hock which the meat literally fell off the meat. Super smoked. My fiance had the ribs with the pickled watermelon. We also had the mac and cheese. Everything was so good. Like I said, just go.

My first time here. The front entrance is so nondescript as to disappear. It wasn't really obvious that it was the main entrance, and I might not have pulled on the door if it hadn't been the only door near the corner. But inside it was quite attractive, and larger than it appeared. The staff was friendly and inviting. 

I admit to being slightly disappointed compared to the reviews that brought me here, but in the end, great service bumped it up to 4 stars. The food alone might have been slightly lower. The alligator was very tender and delicious, and the roast pork was very good but not great. The Lima beans and Mac and cheese were great, though.

Beyond the food, the service was very attentive and prompt. The vibe was very hipster, and my "older" group didn't seem typical of the customers. The beer list was minimal. The sound level was quite loud, although maybe if I drank more I wouldn't have noticed. I'd not hesitate to come here again, but admit I wouldn't travel far to come here. In my normal rating system, that would reduce the rating to 3 stars, but the service and some of the food should be higher, so I arrived at 4.

Decided to try this restaurant out after seeing they were known for the fried alligator. BIG MISTAKE. I'm not one to write reviews but after the service we were given so disappointing. Came on trip from the west coast with friends only to be given rude service by our waitress Ashley. When we asked questions about the menu were given the attitude of not wanting to help us. We wanted to leave but one of my friends really wanted to try the alligator. I got the pulled pork and it was nothing exciting. I've had better! then tried the fried alligator it would've been better if it didn't have the candy on top it threw the whole flavor off. I work in the food industry so when i was thinking about not leaving a tip says a lot. I only left a tip for the bus boy. As we left my friend went to go use the bathroom as we waited outside for her. She came out more annoyed because the waitress had said something under her breathe as she held the door for her. I understand the hipster vibe but the overall service and price for their wannabe different food menu was not it. Plenty of different restaurants around that area i would rather check out.

I've been to the smaller side so tried the full restaurant side this night with my cousin. We were seated immediately, given glasses of water... but it took a minute to be acknowledged by wait staff and it wasn't even our server. Another server recognizing our impatience growing. The server was in training so that was excuse. She was pleasant but next time we will sit at the bar. Food was fresh and tasty. My cousin had the rib appetizer and for $14 it was small but good flavor. I'd go for the full portion next time to see bigger size. I had the catfish courtbouillon and it was delicious. Cousin had the gumbo and it was hearty with deep flavor. We brought some back for Grandmom to enjoy as well.

Great atmosphere and efficient service. Decent selection on the menu, so there is something for everyone. Mac and cheese side is a must! My husband had the pasta special and it was well seasoned and the perfect portion. Will definitely keep it in our rotation for Nola

WOW
Amazing Oyster and the other dishes as well ..
Must try .....
Desert very good as well

My last meal in Nola .  I just finished up a few bites at their sister restaurant Pesche but was told I needed to try this place too...sooo last day, had to do it!  And I'm so glad I did.

I sat at the bar for a quick lunch for my party of 1.  Started off with the beer special blackberry sour (I'm a fan of sours especially after a 15 min walk in the hot humid Louisiana heat) this was nice and refreshing as I fanned myself like a church lady in heat.  

Since I just ate and wasn't stuffed, I just ordered a few bites which included the soup of the day (ham hawk and greens, the wood fire oysters with chili garlic butter, fried alligator with chili garlic mayo and the ice cream special (peanut cream cheese) 

I got the soup first which came with fresh bread rolls, I'm a big soup person but man this soup and bread was freakin delicious and I wasn't even hungry!  I knew the rest of my meal would be great.

I got the fried alligator and oysters next and man...again soo delicious.  This was the 2 time during my trip that I had alligator, but the way the gator was cooked and the sauce it was served with really put this one over the top.  

Then the oysters...this was my 4th time ordering the wood fire oysters but these were cooked differently than any of the others.  These oysters were not served on the half shell but in their own platter where they sat in a bath of chili garlic butter...man just typing it brings back so many fond memories.  Save the bread and dip dip dip in that goodness, do not let that good stuff go to waste. Soo good again! 

Ended the meal with 2 scoops of the peanut cream cheese ice cream, which wasn't anything special but I did like the little pig shaped sugar cookie that it was served with.

If you can make it this way, do it!
An excellent rotating menu with a great mix of low country and creole food. One of the better bourbon selections in the city.
Great place and wonderful service. The food was carefully prepared, unique and spot on.

O M G!!! You MUST come here when visiting NOLA. The oysters are to die for and you need to dip the bread in the sauce after.  We also had the alligator which was amazing. We ordered the catfish and Cochon - also AMAZING. Nothing disappointing here - service and food the best ever. I would visit NOLA again just for this place!!

Went here with a bachelorette and after an entire weekend, most agreed this was their favorite.  Nothing unapproachable with the ambiance.  The food was delicious!

We ordered a bunch of entrees/apps and shared.  The lamb and dumplings were a hit.

This is going to sound weird, but one of the table's favorite items was the wedge.  I made fun of the girl who ordered it, like who goes to this type of place and orders a wedge?  But, it was beyond.  The fresh herbs made it differently delicious.  

Service was attentive and fun, never had an empty glass of water or wine.  Would definitely recommend coming back.

One thing to know for groups: you can't split the check more than 4 ways.  Plan on paying solo and working out the details separately.  This isn't an uncommon practice in NOLA, so not a big deal, just important to know.

Had the Louisiana Cochon and the Wood fired oysters! I must say, the oysters were GREAT! Caution though, they are a bit spicy! But that's the kicker! Get extra bread to sop up the delicious juice! 
The Cochon (pulled pork) was very lean and served in like a mound. Very interesting presentation! Delicious!
The help was amazing! Francesca the server was amazing! Knew her stuff very helpful! I recommend this place!

Highly recommend this restaurant! Everything we ordered below was delicious. Wish the appetizers' portion were larger for the price they charged. Wood-fired oysters were one of their signature dishes. They were very juicy, and we also ate the bread with the oyster sauce. It was my first time having fried alligator. The texture was kinda similar to the calamari. The roasted pork belly was also juicy, and outside was very crispy. The apple slaw helped balance the oily flavor. The entree size was pretty big. Oyster bacon sandwich was another signature dish, and it was huge and delicious! Their house made bacon was crispy and well seasoned. The Cochon entree exceeded my expectations. The flavors for meat with cabbages and pickled peaches were well-balanced. But the top crispy part was too salty and hard. The beef short ribs' texture was so soft and well cooked. The mushroom was so flavorful. Both desserts were so tasty as well. I enjoyed butterscotch pudding a lot! Overall, it was a great experience! We made reservation in advance, and it definitely got much busier later at night.

EXTREMELY SALTY FOOD HERE 3.5 STARS

I wanted to like this place but the soups that we got was crazy salty like inedible. It was a pork soup and then we returned it and got the gumbo which was also salty. 

The braised beef dish was really good and well seasoned. The eggplant side with yogurt and buttery grits was fabulous. The glazed pork belly was yummy (a bit too sweet for those on Keto) but my gf was raving about it. 

Avoid the soups. Order the rest. Oh yea and the free dinner rolls were AMAZING.

Ridiculously good food. Everything we had was superb - macaroni and cheese, oysters, empanada, bread pudding, gumbo...all of it. We also received great service - friendly and attentive without being intrusive. It's a fun aesthetic and environment. I highly recommend!

We went for lunch, started with the wedge of iceberg lettuce- normally something I never order but this was surprisingly good-bacon lardon with a tangy blue cheese vinaigrette. The bread was hot and delicious.
My wife had the Cochon with cracklings, I had the smoky ham hock, just like an osso bucco. We both liked the Cochon a tad better.
Everything was delicious, the service was great, what every restaurant should strive to attain but so many fall short

Delicious guilty foods and fast service! I love the honey butter buns that are on the house - super fluffy and buttery. The ribs are really delicious with a lot of nice bbq flavor and soft meat on the bone; smoked watermelon on the side. I surprisingly loved the fried alligator with the little herbs on the side - so yummy!!!!! This was my fave! And who can say no to wood-fired oysters?!

1) Ribs and cured watermelon cubes 4.5/5
2) Fried alligator in chili garlic mayo 5/5
3) Wood-fired oysters in chili garlic butter 4.5/5
4) Honey butter buns on the house 4.5/5

Such a great atmosphere. When you walk in you can get a great smell of bbq. I had the Cajun Pepper Oysters, gator, short ribs and simply greens. I could tell you which I like more, they were all delicious.
My favourite restaurant in town! Food is to die for. The meats are always delectable.
Great food and atmosphere. I had the gumbo and smoked short...both were excellent. Great service and great show sitting at the Chef's counter.

This is my favorite place to test authentic flavors of Cajun country.
Boucherie is my favorite smoked pork ribs

Cochon: Noun- Pig/Hog; Adjective- Dirty/Filthy
A porky filled dinner is what we expected and it's definitely what we got. Rich and flavorful and for sure, dirty in the sense of guilty pleasure foods. We ordered Fried alligator, wood-fired oysters, braised pork cheeks, grilled short ribs, Mac and cheese casserole, smothered greens, and to wash it all down, a slice of their German chocolate cake. 

Service was absolutely attentive with our dishes taken away and our water glasses always filled and our alcoholic drinks topped off. 

The food came out quickly and every dish the more delicious. The sauce for the wood-fired oysters should come with a "highly addictive" label because that was like crack sauce. We used our bread and soaked up every last drop. The meat from the pork cheeks and ribs were soft and tender and fall off the bone. 

All of our food was amazingly delicious. We made reservations one month in advance, which is probably excessive, but we were from California and knew this is a popular restaurant. The place is huge and we sat upstairs where it was more intimate and quiet. When we got there, the restaurant was half full which made us question whether or not we needed reservations, but surely, it filled up quick! Definitely make reservations when you go. 

When we go back to NOLA, we will eat here again, two thumbs up!

Eek, so very un-impressed with the food here . . . considering all the reviews and even the Lyft driver recommended this place, saying the food would be "so good you'll slap your mama". Ummm, not good. Service and ambiance is A++ though.

Woodfired Oysters W/ Chili Garlic Butter ($14): there's complimentary bread that you should save to dip into this chili garlic butter sauce (as recommended by our waiter). Sauce wise, nothing new, and it was more oily than flavorful. Oysters were like, abnormally large and plump (there's two osyers in each slot, a giant oyster with a baby oyster), to the point that I almost couldn't eat it because it was filled with sooo much "meat" of the oyster. My friend couldn't stomach the fishiness (which is true), so I basically ate all dozen, and after this, I can't look at cooked oysters again. Or oysters in general. SKIP. 

Fried Alligator W/ Chili Garlic Mayo ($12): first time trying alligator, and it's definitely not as tough as I thought it would be! It does taste like a harder version of chicken tenders, but there's definitely this aftertaste that you'll know you're not eating chicken. Would I eat alligator again? No. But to try, these crispy bites were decent, especially with the spicy mayo (think Japanese spicy mayo slathered on top of some rolls)

Louisiana Cochon ($24): cochon means "pig" in French, and since it's the restaurant's namesake, we decided to order this. Well, it's just a shredded braised pork formed into a fat burger patty, with a hint of Chinese flavors (if you've had vinegar pig trotters for a baby's 100 day celebration, that's what I'm talking about). Not bad, per se. But didn't blow me away in terms of flavors, because it was something I already recognized. Liked the cabbage, hated the peaches (in fairness, I just hate cooked fruits in general), and didn't care much for the meat itself. SKIP. 

Sadly, extremely overhyped for me, from the dishes ordered.

My fiancé and I came here this past Saturday with a group of 15 people for a joint bachelorette/bachelor party and it was the best eating experience we had on our trip. Since we were a large group we were givin a tasting menu for a fixed price where we were able to enjoy a bunch of food on the menu. The service was awesome, our drinks were never empty, and the food just kept coming. Additionally everything tasted amazing and orginal. We left feeling full and stasified, and we definitely would not hesitate to come back on a future trip!
Excellent appetizers. This was the first time I had alligator, and I enjoyed it! The entrees were not quite as flavorful and well cooked as the appetizers, but the ambience and service were great!
Went with a group of 5. Pork was savory, redfish was delightful, and drinks were fun and complex. Highly recommend the grilled oyster app.

Absolutely amazing!  Best meal ever in NoLa.  Had the Neck of a pig and red fish.  Waiter was top notch and recommended everything.

Avoid Dickie Brennan's - just bad management and customer service!

I've now been to Cochon a few times and honestly it was always a 4 star experience but last night's experience turned it into 5's 5's 5's across the board. This restaurant tends to be my go-to whenever folks are visiting from out of town or wanting a nicer dining environment without having to dress up, etc.

What's great about Cochon is there is so much space and they can easily accomaddate not only large parties but long tables for seating without having to obstruct their day to day operations.

If you're having a special occassion of some sort you should totally check out the upstairs which overlooks the whole restaurant.

As for the food some of my go-to plates are the alligator bites (you can ask for the aioli on the side), the mac and cheese casserole (so damn good you'll lick the plate until you're told by your friends that people are staring. I've always wanted to do this but instead I use their fresh bread rolls to be civil in public), and some variation of a bbq meat.

Well yesterday those BBQ ribs made my heart flutter, skip a beat, flatlined, pronounced me dead, and brought me back to life. I couldn't get over the flavor and how tender the meat was. It was not only falling off the bone but the pickled watermelon was f*$*ing genius. How has this not been thought of at other places. The sauce was so good that I'm kinda drooling typing this out the following morning just thinking of that smoky sauce with a kick. I asked if I could buy a bottle but unlike their other sauces available for purchase at Cochon Butcher next door it wasn't available.

My paloma was one of the best ones I've had in this city but for all y'all fellow whiskey drinks their selection is quite impressive.

Service was spectacular and I got treated just the same in shorts as the table next to us in business attire.

I'll definitely be back!

Visiting Nola for work I went to Cochon for a solo dinner. Say at the bar and the staff were so nice! I got the da carter cocktails which was a whiskey based drink it was delicious. For dinner I naturally had to have the alligator which was seasoned so well. If was crunchy with a little bit of kick in spice. The restaurant is cute with wooden tables and just a fun low key vibe.

Sat at the chefs station which i feel is totally worth it. You get to see how hard the chef and cooks all work to make our food. They def put in alot of work. Wait staff is all super cool and knowledgeable too. Thanks Desmond, Chef Link for the convo and everyone else. Our food was daaa bombbbb. Ill send bill for the weight i need to lose.

The Mac n cheese was absolutely fire- perfect texture and super flavorful, with the broiled cheese on top. I wasn't a huge fan of the fried alligator- the texture is a little chewy, but I think that's just how alligator is. The sauce it's in is really good though, so if youre into alligator already, I say go for it. 

The bread here is absolutely incredible- it's those roadhouse semi sweet buns. So. Damn. Good.

Love this place. Great place to bring first time visitors to Nola. Food is great service is spot on. 
Great times.
Perfectly seasoned everything! Great atmosphere! Stay at the bar, was hot but if you like wood fired grill it will be worth it to watch the chefs cook your food.

Don't think about it. Just go. 

The food? Outstanding. The service? Phenomenal. The atmosphere? Laid back and relaxing. It was like fine dining without the pretentious fellow diners. 

Our drinks never got close to being empty, and every single bit of attention to detail was attended to.
We went to Dickie Brennan's the night before and if it were possible, we would go back in time and eat here two nights in a row.

My biggest complaint about this place was that I didn't eat here sooner. 

For reference, we had the marinated crab (on special), the boucherie plate, rabbit and dumplings, macaroni and cheese, and smothered greens. It was all SMACK YOUR MAMA GOOD!!!

The menu is upscale Cajun/Creole food. The food is good but is more expensive than it is worth. The staff are quite friendly and attentive. I had a small bowl of chicken and sausage gumbo for $8 that would have gone for about $4 or $5 at most other Cajun restaurants.

Celebrated 50th Birthday in New Orleans, I was destined to have Alligator Nuggets at the suggestion of waitress at Crescent City Restuarant. We arrived at Cochon's love the ambiance beautiful intimate setting. We ordered our Alligator Nuggets and Mac/Cheese. The gator was delicious and the Mac/Cheese was Devine...

On my next return trip, I'm definitely coming back to sample the rest of menu.

Six of us enjoyed our dinner in this sprawling meatery.  The cucumbers & herbs in vinegar $6 was good and the fried boudin with pickled peppers $9 was also good, but special for those of us not from the region.  The smoked beef short rib with tomato butter & mushrooms $32 was the consensus favorite.  The louisiana cochon with cabbage, cracklins & pickled peaches $24 was a bit dry, but I was perfectly happy with my small, tasty pork belly and my smothered greens.  Cocktails were good.  Corkage was $25.  Pre-tip tab was $304.

Arrived at the restaurant on a Tuesday around 6:30 PM with two coworkers without reservations. We were seated immediately, greeted by informed staff and treated to three different entrées that were all excellent. Great food great service!

5 star dining experience.    After eating at Cochon Butcher (Same group) a few nights earlier, the bar was set  high.   Co worker and I sat at the open kitchen and had a two-person, all-star service team.   We got front row seats of the wood fired oven, and even tips from the chef.   We ordered and shared about half a dozen small plates.    The stars were the Boudin Balls, the pork ribs, and the gator bites.    The oysters flavor was over the top, but I didn't love the texture (God's fault, not the chef's).

We tried a few other things too.   All good.

My co-worked wanted to go to the Commanders Palace, but I convinced him this was better.   He was reluctant at first, but was blown away.    I've dined all around the world, and this was a world class meal.  Great food, great service (+++) and great atmosphere.    

I highly recommend Cochon to anyone who likes to explore the world through the lens of good food.

Awesome dinner of small plates.  They do their own charcuterie so make sure you check out what is special that night. Pork shoulder pate and their version of soprasetta was great.   Boudin balls were excellent.

It was my second time here, and I was excited to return after a great first experience. We had a reservation and were seated immediately. Unfortunately, after placing our orders, our drinks never arrived, and we waited a good hour before our server returned to our table to inform us that the kitchen had "screwed up" and lost our orders...including our drink orders. We had to re-order our food, which then arrived promptly. Kinda bummed that we weren't comped anything for the screw-up, but them's the breaks, I suppose. As for the food, we stuck to a bunch of small plates which all impressed. Highlights include the anchovy cheese & whey, and the pork cheeks. The wine list was also creative and varied. Overall, great meal, but disappointing service.

If I can give this place more than 5 stars I would. My husband and I split a turkey sandwich. Sounds so simple but it was so tasty. Greens, avocado, aioli on thick toast. Side of spicy pickles. Heavenly combo.

Food was amazing and service was great. Relaxed atmosphere. I wouldn't wear gym clothes but nice jeans or casual but nice shorts would be fine. We tried the alligator for starters. I had a rabbit fish that reminded me of a biscuit pot pie. It was very flavorful. For dessert we tried the tart and German chocolate cake. Both were lovely but the cake was our favorite.

The food here was very good but there are other issues that would keep us from coming back. First is the noise level. This place is insanely loud. We practically had to yell to each other to talk. The other issue is the service. The staff is very attentive but it is obvious that the objective is to turn tables over as quickly as possible. For example, our appetizers came out even before our drinks came out. We had no time to enjoy them. If you are ok with all that, enjoy because the food is good.

It's still good, but not the amazing that it was in its heyday. Some items are still excellent -- love their spicy alligator bites (though I wish they were not pre-drowned in sauce) and the pork ribs are fall off the bone delicious. Sadly, the very best thing on the menu, the char-grilled oysters, are a mere shadow of their former selves. These used to be bivalves on the half shell, swimming in brine-butter-hotsauce, served in a beautiful bed of rock salt. Now they sit sadly on an escargot plate, naked. (And no parmesan melted atop them!!!) Cocktails are kind of meh -- hard to detect the flavors of unusual ingredients, e.g. the alleged pink peppercorn. 

Nothing bad, but this didn't sing the way their cooking used to. The price of fame?
Steven was a great server! Helped walk us through the menu and gave us great recommendations. The food is good and the ambience is beautiful! - Your friends in burgundy

My husband took me here for lunch on my birthday and the experience was amazing. The atmosphere is rustic and they have a brick oven in the back of the restaurant that you can see from your table. It's beautiful in there. The drink menu offers a pretty wide variety of house made cocktails (my thing) and beer selections (for the hubs). Let me just tell you, the garnishes on the drinks were the reason I selected the ones I did. #notsorry :) We ended up splitting the boucherie plate to start and the smoked beef short ribs for our entree. The boucherie was comprised of a fantastic selection of meats from the butcher and the dressings that were paired made the plate so much more savory. My husband and I were blown away with the beef short ribs. It comes topped with a house-made tomato butter that makes the meat melt in your mouth. The only downside to getting this plate is that I loved it so much, it'll probably be the only thing I ever request! I highly recommend this restaurant for a well rounded dining experience. And it's good for larger groups as well!

First time visit here, I usually go next door to the Cochon butcher. Inside vibe was great. Food was killer. I ordered rabbit dumplings. Wife ordered the smoke pork ribs. Server could of used a personality and the bathrooms need some love. Like the whole vibe of the restaurant is killer than you walk into these uninspired bathrooms.
Fantastic. The food, the drinks were all great. Looking forward to going back to New Orleans and back to Cochon.
Absolutely amazing!! The rabbit and gator tail out of this world. A lot of leftovers, but simply divine!

This is the typical place that I guess gets good reviews because of the tourism of the city.
We had an appetizer, entree, side dish, and a small plate.
The alligator taste like a typical buffalo wild wing, so best case scenario not bad but nothing special.
The pork ribs, you can get way better quality in any decent bbq place.
The mac and cheese was overcooked and the flavor no better that a kraft dinner.
I would not come back to this restaurant.

Saw this recommended on Yelp and was in New Orleans for a conference so decided to try it out.  Came in for dinner by myself so was able to get a seat right away at the bar.  They also offered me a seat right along a bar facing the kitchen but I opted for closer access to the beer.

I started with the Parish Bloom Hazy IPA.  Not as bitter for an IPA and really refreshing in the heat and humidity of the city.  Great way to begin my dinner.

The bartender recommended that I start with the wood-fired oysters with chili garlic butter.  So so tasty.  The butter sauce was slightly spicy and thank goodness they provided some fresh slightly toasted dinner rolls that soaked up that butter sauce.  Not sure it was good for my cholesterol but definitely worth it.

I then had what was described as the house special - rabbit and dumplings.  Slightly sweet, rich and so full of flavor.  I hate to say it but the rabbit tasted like chicken.  But it was regardless succulent and tender.  The dumplings were slightly crusty and helped soak up that wonderful sauce.

I took a look at the desserts but was so full that I had to pass.  Definitely a place to check out if you are in New Orleans and the prices are more than reasonable.  Super nice staff as well.

My wife and I came here and were really disappointed. In a city known for food, everyone told us Cochon was THE new school restaurant to go to, and we thought it was pretty solidly medicore. The gumbo and boudin balls were decent. The fried alligator had a really strong, almost overpowering spicy mustard flavor. The wood fired oysters were just oysters in butter. Finally, the ribs were super sweet with a hint of spice. The waitress was great and the atmosphere was good but I didn't get the hype.

Excellent. Dined today for lunch. Service, ambiance and food top notch. Ordered Boucherie Plate and chicken & andouille gumbo. Hand crafted food at its best. Would eat here every day if I lived here. Highly recommended.

This restaurant came highly recommended by a friend and I was excited to come try it. The restaurant is lovely and the staff was great. As for the food, I had the rabbit and dumpling and shared a side of mac and cheese with the husband. Both were overly peppery. The rabbit and dumplings had so much pepper in it I couldn't really finish the dish or even enjoy it. I suppose it better than having too much salt but it was still overwhelming. Same was true for the mac n cheese. Way way to much pepper seasoning.
best restaurant in nola in my book-d. link is a master of boudin, and the butcher is all about fresh !!!
