This place was truly amazing and they had a wonderful use of spice and the person serving us ( Levin) was a nice person who always was joking around with us and gave the best suggestions so we could always get good food. If you don't like this place you're pretty much a picky eater.

I have lived here for years and can't believe I waited so long try Cochon! It was amazing. 

Staff: The staff was attentive and continuously checked in on us. I need had to ask for a refill or wait long for service. The hostess was prompt to check us in for our reservation and get us seated. 5/5

Reservation: I had a little difficulty making a reservation with resy. I've used it before so it could have been a glitch. I was able to call and quickly be accommodated. However, I suggest calling several days in advance as they book up fast and likely won't have space for anyone who walks in. 4/5

Food: the food was soooooo good. I loved the chicken livers and boudin. The oyster were ok and didn't look anything like the pictures I had seen. Perhaps we got a different type of oyster or the menu has changed but they weren't on the half shell and I probably wouldn't order it again. The rabbit is delicious but the Cochon easily steals the show. The pork was tender, the cabbage was well seasoned, and the peaches were a great touch. The cracklings were fresh and crispy. I feel like the chef took his time to make that meal just for me. Almost as if he knew everything I liked and made it perfect for me. The specialty drinks were great. 5/5

Overall, I don't know what could possibly happen to keep me from coming back. It was that good. I'd you are visiting or if you live here please add this to your must-go list of restaurants. I should have taken pictures but the way the food so delicious I couldn't wait to eat it to get a picture.

solid solid experience top to bottom. 1 minor exceptions: them trying to turn tables aka be slightly pushy in rushing us.

alligator - fantastic. tastes like chicken and texture is slightly different.

ribs - fantastic but not the best ive ever had aka texas bbq

cochon - can't go wrong with this dish. a mound of pulled pork with cabbage underneath that reminded me of kimchee without the spice.

greens were fantastic

mac and cheese was superb

fried apple pie was amazing

poundcake was great too

other than the fact they try to rush peopel slightly, saw this happen at another table i could over hear as well, its a great safe choice. the wait was 2 hours so you def need  a reservation.

curious why it didn't make the eater to 38 for nola but then again brennans didn't either so who knows

JEANS: OK by far
ORDER: wait staff

Cochon was a wonderful and solid experience in New Orleans. Came here for a conference as recommended by a local, and it did not disappoint! Like others said, great rustic feel with indoor and outdoor seating. Service was great! They came at great times to keep my water filled and I did not feel like I was bothered too often. The food is the main deal. They start you off with fresh dinner rolls at the start. I had the Fried Alligator, Mac & Cheese, and the gumbo, which were full of flavor and deliciousness. They do have a drink menu as well with a full bar, like most restaurants in the area. Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant as a place to go if you're visiting the city!

I'm writing this review cause my experience here wasn't great. It was barely good. It took just about an hour to actually get our food. Three people had gotten theirs first before us, and one of the couples out of the three actually finished their meal and paid for it, before we got ours. 
    While you can tell a lot of thought goes into their dishes, I feel the flavors weren't that complex. Had the fried green tomato version of a BLT. It was slathered with mayonnaise and was really greasy. Like when the fryer oil isn't hot enough kind of greasy, and ends up just saturating the food item. I feel like they are just selling the idea for an organic/sophisticated restaurant, when it's basic but seems fancy. 

The service was nice. The hosts were very courteous, and one of the two servers we had was friendly and nice. The other was creepy and weird. Hope this helps.

Loved Cochon! It's in a very cute walkable neighborhood and there was already a line outside when we arrived at 10:50 on a Sunday. I would definitely recommend making reservations. They were super accommodating when I told them I was gluten free. They brought over an entirely separate menu for me, and even asked if I was ok with the rest of the table having bread, or if it was a no go. The server was attentive and very helpful in deciding what to order. I had the louisiana cochon with cabbage, cracklins & pickled peaches. It was delicious. Lots of flavor. My friends had the pancake brunch plate and the non gluten free cochon. We will definitely be back next time we're in town.

Went in with a group of 9, very accommodating. Everything we ate was delicious. The shrimp was very good and the pork ribs were great. I ordered the beef short ribs as my entree and the meat came off the bone quite nicely.
The food is killer. Authentic cajun food, with a gourmet fine dining presentation. The meat selection in general is great, and pork cheeks are to die for. Highly recommend the rabbit dumplings.

The food was amazing, the drinks were fantastic and the atmosphere was great! We had a few minutes to wait while we were expecting other guests and we were able to drink outside in the perfect weather. If I ever get back to New Orleans, I will return and explore their whiskey flights!

Arrived around 8 and were seated really fast without a reservation. This was awesome! Ordered three things: Mac and cheese casserole - this was delicious. The wood-fired shrimp with chili garlic is a must! So delicious! Also the smoked pork ribs with watermelon are a must! This was enough for 2 people to be satisfied.

Ok. I love this place. Nice and informal. One of the best rib dishes ever. Great apps. Nice boudin balls. Excellent seafood dishes. They do it all well. Drinks are great from the Bloody Mary to the old fashions. The sandwiches. Salads are wonderful.

I came here with a group of 9 and ordered most of the menu. I will say that their apps are all delicious. The entrees were very heavy. I like the vibe of the restaurant which was lively and decorated modern rustic. I was hoping to try cochon butcher which is located next door, but I will have to save it for next time!

Very disappointing. This restaurant gets a lot of good reviews but my wife and I couldn't have been more disappointed. First, we were going there for the wood fired oysters. That is what they are known for. I arrived and there are none on the menu despite what their online menu shows. I asked why? They said there was a shortage. Shocking as I have had oysters every day the entire week at average and upper end restaurants. Made no sense plus they should let people know before they get there. Second, I asked if they could make some tweaks to the menu as I was experiencing some GI issues. Response for EVERY item was no - that it was pre-made. Again, I have been in many higher end restaurants in my life and never received a response like this. Even the twice baked potatoes are pre made I was told. Basically, you get what is in the menu and that's that. Also, my wife asked for an after dinner drink. She asked what two of the drinks were and what they tasted like. The second server - they have more than one to serve you - said he had no idea. He came back with two glasses - one that had a small taste and the other that my wife ordered. I thought it was nice that he brought a second for her to taste but when my wife asked about the dessert menu he forgot to bring, he said he was sorry but "it was hard to score the second drink." I thought that was very odd to smash - almost like he was putting in a plug for a bigger tip. My wife got a fish dish and she ate one piece and said it was awful. She wound up just eating the side dish of grits. Oh yes, I forgot they also didn't bring her macaroni and cheese side dish but I wasn't careful enough to see if I was charged. Utterly disappointing in every category.
Top notch!  Food was exquisite and there was no wait when we arrived.  Love New Orleans cuisine.

We only ate items from the small plates and boucherie because everything looked so good, and we wanted to try as many things as possible. The alligator was delicious. The jowl-wrapped shrimp were delicious. Everything, everything was so good. The waitstaff was attentive and helpful.

This place did not disappoint! From the atmosphere which was fun, clean, and modern, yet subtle enough that it wasn't in your face or overwhelming for the senses. They were playing the Guardians of the Galaxy vol 1 which was a win in my book!
I sat at the bar and had a friendly woman serve me (Wish I had captured her name for credit because she was really wonderful).

She offered recommendations which I accepted and explained to me why oysters were no longer currently on the menu, due to changes in the gulf which have effected the oyster supply but assured me the similarly crafted replacement chilli garlic butter shrimp would deliver and boy did they. Fantasy flavor, spice without completely overpowering the shrimp flavors. Make sure you get some extra rolls to dip on the extra sauce because it is truly fantastic! Mine came with 5 very good sized shrimp but I believe this may vary by size. 

Her recommendation for the boudin was also fantastic. I loved the flavors and even though it was fried it didn't feel super heavy because of the balanced flavors and textures that the sausage provides. It came with three.

Even their homemade lemonade was absolutely delicious, not overly sweet with just a snap of tartness and full of flavors which is something I find many lemonade lack and overcompensate with too much sugar. If o had 3 more days in NOLA I would spend them exploring every inch of their menu offerings it was THAT good! I hope to return one day.

I was at a conference in NOLA and some colleagues and I decided to eat here because it was in close proximity to where the conference was at.

I had the garlic shrimp small plate with the Mac and cheese. The shrimp were  good. They remind me of BBQ shrimp. They were served in a hot skillet in the sauce with the head on. The Mac and cheese was ok but it could use some salt.

I tried my colleagues greens and they were sooooo good. I wish I had ordered that.

The menu wasn't that impressive to me. If I were in a group setting I would go but it's not something I have to have again 

Service was great
Great evening. First time here. Waiter was fantastic. Drinks well mixed. The rabbit and dumplings hit the spot. Looked small in the pan but I couldn't finish it. We will be back!

This place left a lot to be desired. I ordered mac and cheese and a smoked pork rib plate that came with potatoes.  I also wanted a wedge salad but apparently they only do blue cheese and I wanted ranch so I decided against it. The reason I'm taking away 2 stars is the following. My food came out within 3 minutes of ordering......why??? My rib plate was luke warm, not even hot,  and some of the mushrooms it came with had the tip cold. I feel like if I'm paying $30 for a small plate it should at least be hot. Also, my server brought me a huckleberry soda that I DID NOT order and then charged me for it. I paid for it but also felt ripped off because I didn't order the soda. All in all probably not a place I would go back to. I feel like someone changed their mind about their plate and since I ordered the same thing they gave me a left over plate that was sitting there for a while. Waste of money. I was totally ripped off here.

Living up to its esteemed reputation around town, our dinner party of 8 sampled over half the menu and loved nearly every bite.

Bar program has it together. The Rub and Papa Legba were both superbly balanced. 

Social plates were simply outstanding. Each hitting the perfect blend of elevating flavors and textures that are familiar and comforting, our favorites were the mushroom salad, ribs with pickled watermelon, Boucherie Board, and broiled chili garlic oysters.

We tried 5 entrees, all of which had everyone eagerly digging the forks back in for second and third "first bites." 

I think this place has earned its stellar rep and I can't wait to go back.

Had to eat at the bar because I tried to go to its partner Cochon Butcher and it was closed early for a block party. The bar is open seating though so that worked out. 

Ordered the Ramblin rose and it was a pretty ruby colored drink. Vodka and hibiscus tea and it was great. I love hibiscus so maybe a little biased there. It was a bit frothy on the top though.

The bread here. Oh my God. Most amazing rolls I've ever had I think. I don't usually like bread and I ate every one of these fluffy clouds. It's how I wish every bread roll tasted : thin crispy glazed top with soft fluffy middle. 

Ordered the roasted duck and hot sausage gumbo. It's apparently a new addition, and leans on the cajun style of gumbo according to the manager who spoke to me. He was very friendly. It came with okra which surprised me, don't know if that's typical. It did make the gumbo a bit stickier though.The hot sausage really gave it a nice spicy kick. Unfortunately there weren't as many duck pieces as I'd hoped, but the few that I got were delicious and tender.

Also ordered the alligator with chili garlic mayo. Made with tenderloin instead of tail which makes it less gamey apparently. And it did basically taste like a spicy mayo karaage. It was a bit heavy with the sauce for my liking but still an awesome experience. Good portion too. Unfortunate it was just me. 

Wish I came back for a full meal or with more people to try multiple tapas.

4/5 for food. 

Came once with no reservations but saw many open tables and was told there was an hour wait. Made reservations for the next night and was seated promptly. Server introduced himself and advised us that a colleague would be assisting as well. Sadly, two people didn't give us the complimentary bread and were terrible at service. 

Presentation of the interior and dishes were beautiful and flavors were great. However, the service was awful that it docks a star. Customer service makes or breaks the experience and we were utterly disappointed. We had two servers and they both forgot about us that we assumed they ended their shift. 

Ordered the fried alligator which was nicely breaded. It had great heat with sliced onions and sprinkled with mint. The fried chicken livers were topped on a little crostini with a spicy pepper jelly that complimented it on well. The smoked duck and hot sausage gumbo was seasoned but a little salty. Lastly, we ordered the braised pork cheek which was tender and almost decadent.

For dessert, they offered fried apple pie. It's very misleading..it was really a empanada! It was decent but not worthy that we made a trip to get beignets after dinner. If you offer pie, make a pie!!!
Go alone, sit at the counter facing the kitchen, order their hush puppies!

Wanted to love this place after hearing rave reviews but I wasn't very impressed. The garlic pepper shrimp appetizer was a highlight. However, the short ribs were just ok ( and served at room temp), the gulf fish was solid but just ok. Both dishes lacked thelayers of flavor I would expect.

The biggest knock would be the service, which I found inattentive and curt. Im from NY, don't need alot of hand holding, but 35 mins for entrees with no explanation or check in isn't great given the quality of establishment. Tables around us were experiencing the same treatment and began talking.

It may have been my order. The famous oysters were out of stock due to a local shortage (cudos for local sourcing) but what I did have wasn't memorable.

I came here for lunch and just got a wedge salad and the gumbo. The wedge salad was great. It's a very well done salad. It's a salad though :) the real treat was the gumbo! I had gumbo at a couple places on my trip and this was the best by far. Spicy, rich flavor and quality meat. I'd come back just to eat this. It's really good.
Wow, just simply amazing the best dining experience I've ever had. Fair play to the owners, and to every single member on the serving staff! Such a unique and unforgettable experience!

Lots of 5 star experiences lately and Cochon in NOLA was another. The food and service here were spectacular! The restaurant itself is super modern inside and very cool. I attached a pic of the bar area to give an idea.  Our experience started off great right when you walk in. Upon being seated our waiter came over immediately with again a great smile. I stress this because this doesn't happen all the time in restaurants. 

We came on our 1st stop on a small food tour our friend had planned.  So we left the ordering up to her. For food we had fried boudin which is hard to describe but what was most memorable were these little fried balls of rice, cheese and corned beef.  OMG! So delicious...we also had some fried alligator in chili garlic mayo. I have never had alligator before and I loved it. Then we finished off our meal with a cup of the their roasted duck and spicy sausage gumbo and all I can say is wow and wow! Our friend said you know its good gumbo when the okra is cooked perfectly and according to her it was. This gumbo was so good and we don't have anything like this out west that I have eaten. It was a true treat. If you are in NOLA this is a must on your list.

Can not give this restaurant enough praise... From the amazing alligator to the rabbit and dumplings... This place was sheer joy with each bite... I'll dream of their food for years to come... It was modern yet rustic yet industrial... However so romantic and highly highly recommend

1. The smell as soon as you walk in!
2. The happy staff! 
3. The open kitchen with bar seating to watch!
4. Andy. Andy's incredible nails and beard. Andy's awesome demeanor. 
5. The drinks. 
6. The starters. 
7. The mains. Oh my...the mains. 
8. The drinks. 
9. The desserts. 
10. Andy. 

Everything from start to finish was amazing. My brother, sister and I had the best meal of our lives here today. Andy took amazing care of us. Seriously, their nails were beautiful! 

Drinks: the Carter, Scarlet Letter, Rum the Mules, and Playin' in the Sand. 

Food: pork belly confit, pork cheek, duck & sausage gumbo, rabbit & dumplings, short rib, mac & cheese, greens, and roasted sweet potatoes. 

Desserts: butterscotch pudding and pineapple upside down cake. 

The food was "sold your soul to the devil" good. Remember the scene in Ratatouille where Remy has a food-gasm? That's what eating this food is like.

Super good dinner.  Good, but not great atmosphere.  They could use better flow around the bar and waiting area.  Had the gumbo, a salad and blackened grouper.  All were great.  Staff went out of their way to help me find a single spot at the bar.  Cochon is more known for their pork and beef dishes.  The short ribs, bbq ribs, macaroni, grits and most all other sides looked delicious observing people nearby.  I would highly recommend going here.

I heard about Cochon from one of Anthony Bourdain's New Orleans episodes and I was really excited to visit during my first trip to New Orleans. We arrived a little before the dinner rush and had seats by the kitchen. The smells and sounds coming from the other side of the bar were so interesting that I was excited to try a couple things. My party ordered the fried alligator which was tossed in an amazing mayo-based sauce. The pieces were meticulously fried to perfection but it's best to enjoy it as soon as possible since the sauce makes the batter soggy over time.

The service during our visit was amazing. Our server was so helpful and checked up on us frequently. During our meal, our server brought out a couple bites courtesy of the kitchen. We had these bites of toast topped with head cheese and a pickle slice. The flavors were so interesting and overall was amazing. 

We had such an amazing time here and would highly recommend making a stop at Cochon!

Loved this place!!! Such amazing food, the appetizers are bomb like the Ribs!! To die for! I actually am allergic to Seafood, so I couldn't eat much so for me to say that this place is a 5 star means everything! I was even tempted to eat the seafood dishes!

What a great place. It's a little unusual and definitely not traditional New Orleans cuisine. They took the best parts of it. Super attentive wait staff very friendly extremely knowledgeable. If you don't know what you're doing they really help you along and they make the meal fit what you're doing. Things like splitting a bowl of gumbo is an appetizer, they have great ideas.

The food and ambience was great!  Original waiter seemed a little confused and disappeared during our service.  His disappearance caused some problems with our order and that would usually turn you off. But their wonderful management and staff  pitched in and we were able to finish our dining experience on a high note!  I will definitely not allow him(first waiter)to jaundice my view of this establishment.  Will definitely mark them down as a restaurant I will return to and tell other to visit!!
Creative menu - great variety of dish combos. Service a little snobbish - I'd prob try different places before returning here.

Very cute restaurant, we had alligator in a chili sauce (why don't I eat more alligator??) fried boudin (deep fried balls like falafel and so good), greens (a little too salty), and Mac and cheese. We have kids, and the restaurant was friendly at 5:30ish on a Monday, but I could see it being very busy and loud later in the week--it's a sleek spot, with good food, and "tha Carter" was a delicious drink. Definitely a recommend.
Will definitely eat there every time I go to New Orleans until everything on the menu is try desserts phenomenal drinks atmosphere and music

Excellent food! I had the wood-grilled shrimp, and it was fantastic. The spicy garlicky sauce that the shrimp is marinated in is truly mouth-watering-- I devoured it with the tableside rolls (complimentary, and also delicious in its own right). The alligator bites were also a must try, and the kiddos loved the mac and cheese. The service was wonderful, and there was a lot of seating at this restaurant. I'd definitely check it out again!

This place was EXACTLY was I was hoping for in New Orleans!  My wife and I came here a few years ago and ran into some of the Raiders football team the evening before their game against the Saints.  The staff was extremely thoughtful and kind to our 1-yr old son and helped us entertain him throughout dinner.  I don't know if words could describe how soft and fluffy the meats were and how they would simply melt in your mouth like butter.  We're looking forward to the next time we can make it out here!
Fantastic food, service, and environment.  Very comfortable atmosphere.  Did I say the food was fantastic?  Definitely worth a repeat.  The bar  is a bit small however.

The duck breast gumbo was tasty, the pork ribs and pork chop had an excellent smoker taste that I had never had before. The deep fried chicken gizzards on toast with spicy jelly mint and mint were very unique so was the pork face.  The butterscotch pudding was the best.  I was satisfied with every dish, a really good dining experience.

If you're going to pick one place, it's here! Cochon had amazing wood-fire shrimp, the Mac-n-cheese side was extraordinarily cheeseyyyy! And OMG the braised beef  with potatoes and mushrooms was phenomenal! Our server was super sweet, bringing us bread rolls almost immediately, and always do attentive! It was worth the wait & worth the $$$

My wife and I recently had a wonderful dinner at Cochon. We started with an order of the Fried Alligator with Chili Garlic Mayonnaise. This was some of the best gator I have tried: tender and crisp with a spicy creamy mayonnaise sauce and a hint of basil. Yep, it tasted just like chicken. For my entrée I had the Rabbit & Dumplings. This dish was creamy, peppery and filled with starchy dumplings, carrots, and tender gamey rabbit meat. It was very similar to a Pot Pie. My wife ordered the Oven-Roasted Gulf Fish "Fisherman's Style". The fish was nicely flaky and seasoned. We also ordered a side of Macaroni & Cheese Casserole which was super cheesy, creamy and filled with soft noodles. Finally for dessert we had the Fried Apple Pie. The pie was more like an empanada filled with warm sweet soft apples and paired with cool creamy ice cream. Overall, Cochon is a fantastic spot for a quality dinner.
Absolute go-to for a great bite to eat. All items ordered were finished without hesitation. Visit Cochon Butcher next door for a casual take on a modern meat market.

This was such an amazing restaurant!!!
We went one of our nights in New Orleans for Mardi Gras March 2019. Even with tons of people flooding in and out of the restaurant they were so nice to us and accommodating our very small party of 2. We got to sit at a hi-top right in front of the chef- we were able to chat with them, ask questions, and just take in the great aromas of everything being made behind the heat lamps. 

We ordered so much greatness and they also gave us a small little appetizer to try during the "show"

We had high expectations for our visit, as one should when you are in NOLA and at a Donald Link restaurant. Unfortunately, and I have possibly never said this in NOLA in 30+ dining experiences, it failed us. First, I don't find it acceptable to bring me a glass of sparkling wine, that is flat as flat can be. It was clearly more than 4 days old, and did not have a single bubble (which should be super obvious when you pour it!!! - and you pour it in a wine glass and not a flute?? Your people in beverages should know this, and should manage their wine better! When I asked for a new glass from a new bottle, it took 11 minutes to replace it. Seriously - 11 minutes? After you make a mistake like that - have some ownership and get it done in at least 5 minutes (it wasn't that busy). Second, the wine list was a major fail - sorry - it just was. When someone in our group made a lot of requests on their food order, you don't roll your eyes. Look, I get it, I want to roll my eyes sitting with them, but I'm not the server, so show some professionalism. "Server" means serve the customer, not serve the kitchen. Otherwise, give me a counter to order from! The kitchen executed everything on the menu we ordered very well - no complaints (there were 6 of us, and we ordered maybe 10 dishes), but, the menu was nothing to get excited about. My thought was if we were in some run of the mill city, maybe it would be a really nice meal. But in NOLA, with the options you have - that menu does not remotely bring me back.

The food was amazing.  If this review was simply about the food, they would get a "5+".  I had the rabbit and dumplings, while my husband had the catfish courtbullion.  However, the service was only a "-1"...I had to go find someone just to get drinks - I found a manager since the waiters did not even acknowledge us.  Eventually they did but even after that, the good took a long time to come out - people around us were getting their food before is and had ordered the same dishes.

This place is incredible. From the food to the service... you will love this restaurant. Got the Boudin Balls, beef short rib, and amazing hand crafted cocktail. All was delicious! So glad I walked to this restaurant from my hotel!

So much meat! There's some fish though .... I did not love it here, I felt a bit out of place being a pescatarian. The ambience is OK. The drinks are delicious! Sitting at the bar is a good idea! $$$$

When we were in town for a bachelor party back in October, this was our one "nicer" meal, and it did not let us down. We came in around 9pm (having calmed at 6pm to secure the table), and started out with some fried gator and cocktails. We had to. We could have started with beer, but the cocktail names were on-point and funny. Everyone loved their mains and dessert too.

A friend from Dallas recommended this place and we were not disappointed! The alligator to start was great and could have been a meal in itself. I had the rabbit dumplings and my partner had the Gulf Fish dish. I would highly recommend this great restaurant! I really want to go back and try the chicken livers, they looked really yummy too! Go try this one!

Unfortunately, not many things for us vegetarians, but loved the ambience, and all of my partners from work loved those play so much that we went back twice! Needed to throw out a review for their fantastic service, the ambience, etc !
I believe we had a little of everything on the menu.  The service was great and the food was excellent.   We had six in the group and everyone was satisfied.

the alligator bites and the rabbit & dumplings are sooooooo in believably good! don't waste your time going to the french quarter to try and find food bc this place has it all. you will not be disappointed. our bartender andrea was awesome and we had the best mule  please please come!!

We came here for dinner and were underwhelmed by the menu so we decided to leave. Mind you, we had waited an hour for a table, so we were committed. When we said we changed our min the waiter couldn't have been ruder. Setting was cool but service was snarky. Hard pass and have no desire to come back. Even if folks aren't into the seasonal menu, there's no reason to be rude to people. 

As I said, setting was cool and ambiance was nice, so 2 stars for that.
This place had  the best gumbo! Just the right amount of spice, and so fresh. Loved it!

We sat at chef's table area overlooking kitchen. 

My wife went all appetizer - braised pork cheeks were insanely good. Smoked ribs messy, nothing stood out, but good. Boudin balls were good. I got seafood gumbo, best I've had on the visit which is now 6 cups/bowls at different spots. It was perfect. The Cochon entree was very good, maybe not as "Cajun" as I hoped, but very good. 100% would return.

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60864-d2638031-r731240286-Cochon-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html#

Was in a convenient area after our WWII museum visit, nice place was crowded, we tried a lot of things with our party of 6 for lunch. Was a bit pricey  in the end but everyone enjoyed the food & atmosphere, good friendly service. Try the Gator, & the oyster sandwich was pretty good!
The best restaurant I've ever  been to in the world , period. Everything on the menu is superb. If in New Orleans a must go.

The vibe here is great. The restaurant feels modern, clean, and lively. The shrimp appetizer was so good I had to order another order of it. The table tried many main courses but I think the best one was the simple fish filet.
I was very confused by the price and size of their gumbo. I didn't try their other menu items but the quality of the gumbo was definitely not worth the price.

The food was fantastic! But the service brings my overall rating down dramatically. 

I contacted the restaurant a month in advance for my large party (11) reservation. At that time I shared that I would need two accommodations - one vegetarian and one severe peanut allergy. The restaurant assured me that there were special menus for both accommodations and they could serve my entire party. Several hours before my reservation, my party size changed to 12 at the last minute. I contacted the restaurant and asked if they could serve my party of 12 and they said yes- yahoo! I also took this opportunity to remind them that there was one vegetarian and one severe peanut allergy in the party of 12. I was again reassured that those two guests could be accommodated. 

We arrived to the restaurant and were seated after about 5 minutes despite it being a really busy night.

A kitchen staffer consulted with the vegetarian guest and the peanut allergy guest before dinner service started. The guest with the peanut allergy was told at that time that the kitchen doesn't use any practices to avoid cross contamination and since they do use peanuts in the kitchen, it was best not for this person to eat. As luck would have it, I was seated at the opposite end of the long table from my guest with a peanut allergy so I missed this conversation. At one point, maybe at the 2nd out of 4 courses, I noticed my guest with a peanut allergy missing from the table and I eventually find her outside. My guest was getting some air because she wanted to be cautious of the peanut contaminated food that the rest of the party was eating. That's when she told me about the kitchen staffers insight on the lack of kitchen practices to avoid peanut cross contamination. Before this point, a waitress would check in with me to see how the party was enjoying the dinner service. So, I found it odd that the waitress nor the manager nor anyone else with the restaurant came and spoke with me when the restaurant realized they couldn't serve my guest, as promised. After speaking with my guest outside, I went to the hostess stand and explained the above while she looked at me kind of in shock. I suppose it was a manager that walked up as I was detailing the issue and he interjected something to the effect that yes, they weren't able to serve my peanut allergy guest and they wouldn't charge me for her prix fixe plate or the cucumber salad she was served (literally the only thing she could safely eat)- so gracious! The restaurant was only able to serve this particular guest cucumber salad while the rest of the party (vegetarian included) enjoyed a variety of delicious food. Had the restaurant been honest with me from the onset, I would have made reservations elsewhere. 

I feel lied to and do not appreciate it especially since I did my due diligence well in advance. I would rather patronize businesses that are candid in their ability to accommodate special dietary needs. With the amount of food and drink my party of 12 consumed, I would have wanted to spend that amount of money elsewhere.  

I would not recommend this restaurant if you or anyone else in your party has a severe peanut allergy.
Best beef ribs I've ever had was at this pork restaurant. And, the salad had deep-fried bits of beef jerky on top. Delicious and creative. Highly recommended.

My party of two visited Cochon on a weekday evening and had no problems getting a table. The service was A+. I started with Da Carter to drink and unfortunately was not wow'd by it. We had such a hard time deciding what to order, so we ordered a bunch of stuff (fried alligator, fried boudin, smoked pork ribs, duck/hot sausage gumbo, macaroni & cheese, and smothered greens). In my opinion, the gumbo and smothered greens were the highlight of the meal...delicious! The fried boudin was okay but not sure I'd order it again. The mac & cheese and ribs could have been warmer in my opinion. They also tasted much better after I took them home and reheated them. Either way, I'd definitely order again but will press the issue of ensuring they've been heated enough. The fried alligator was a bit tough and I've had better elsewhere. For dessert, we shared the lemon chess pie. The pie was great...amazing actually! BUT it was not a chess pie and should have been called something else. Overall, we were impressed and will definitely return.

So this place was a recommendation from our Lyft driver who was driving us to our hotel from the airport. When we asked where to go for good alligator meat, he insisted Cochon. This place was a bit out of our way to get to, but it was fine because we got a chance to explore around Magazine Street and see other areas of New Orleans except French Quarters. 

We got there pretty hungrish, but really didn't want to get anything else but the alligator so we each got the small plate of alligator bites. The dish is bite size alligator pieces battered, fried, and smothered in some buffalo sauce like sauce topped with onions and cilantro. It was bit too fried and rich for me to so I put some of their chili infused vinegar. I was more into the vinegar than the alligator meat for some reason... I may start sticking chili peppers into my vinegar when i get home. Really just white vinegar with some dried chili peppers. WOW! 

My friend loved this place. She liked how tender it was and she was a fan of their buttered buns. I didn't have any of the bread, but she said it was good so who am I to really say anything (since I didn't have any). Personally, I was not blown off by this dish and the texture was not as good as other alligators I've had in the past. However, if you haven't tried alligator before (like my friend), it is a good way get acquainted.
Best meal!!!  The pork confit was AHHHmazing.  Everything we ordered was fabulous along with terrific service.

The food is good but did not love every dish and we had subpar service from a few people so dropping down to 3 stars. We wanted to love this place since this was recommended from a foodie friend, but it didn't quite meet the mark for us. We ordered the fried alligator, duck gumbo, gulf fish, rabbit and dumplings, cucumber salad and Mac and cheese. The fried alligator was good but slightly too much sauce so if you don't eat it right away it can get soggy. The gumbo was different but not my favorite in the city. The gulf fish was by far the best dish we had perfectly cooked light and nicely seasoned. But it didn't come with any starch so the waiter recommended the Mac and cheese and that was a mistake. Way too salty for Mac and cheese and im usually a die hard fan for a good Mac and cheese! That was disappointing. The cucumber salad was refreshing very light to help balance the rabbit and dumpling dish. It's a very hearty dish I would describe it as a rabbit stew with biscuits. 
Service: we had 3 servers through out the night and the only one that really stood out and saved us for the night was Gael so shout out to him he knows what he is doing and really turned it around for us. Our main server seemed to forget us after giving us the drinks...the table that sat down after us got served their bread and apps before he remembered to offer us the bread...he actually asked us if we wanted a refill when we didn't get any bread yet! Then the Mac and cheese order was not placed and so came at the end of the meal. The second server asked my husband if he wanted a change in utensils and so we said sure but then he never came back with any utensils....why even ask then? Finally Gael came to our rescue he was super attentive and gave us recommendations on the local whiskey and when we were looking for our main server he came instead to help us with our check and box our food. If service was like his then the restaurant is in good hands. Koodos to him.
Decided to try based on high positive reviews but food was so so.  Service and setting were excellent.

I wanted to go to Cochon for dinner, but I didn't make a reservation.  Instead, I went for a light lunch and it was packed.  I could only get a seat at the chefs table, which made it a lot of fun watching the food being prepared.  It made me want to try so many different things.  
I tried to order the special; however, they were out of it, so I ordered the Fried Alligator and other small plates.  The service was good and Cochon had a great atmosphere.

When I come back, I'll come here for dinner, just so I can try more of their delicious food.

So so good can't say more better stuff about this place. Had the a platter with pork, fried alligator, Cochon pork entree, and pork ribs everything was very good. Ribs fall of bone. The fried alligator was very good

Make sure you come here really hungry. We had a feast, and ordered smoked beef short rib with tomato butter & mushrooms; wood-fired shrimp with chili garlic butter; fried alligator with chili garlic mayonnaise; pork belly confit with sweet apple relish; smoked pork ribs with watermelon pickle; and a sandwich my friend hoarded but whatever it was, iI remember the bite was heavenly. The gator was extremely chewy. No one in our party of four had tried gator before, so we have no other gator preparation to compare it to. If you don't like tough meat (and I mean this was tougher than the most chain restaurant preparation of calamari that I've ever had, as a comparison), I don't recommend. That said EVERY OTHER DISH WAS FANTASTIC! The flavors were layered and complex. Sauces were mind blowing. Meat was melt in your mouth tender. The restaurant location is a great escape from the tourists areas. Highly recommend!
The wait was long but so worth it! The fried alligator was my favorite. The staff was friendly and attentive! Great experience with great food!

First visit and have to say it's a solid 3 star. Service was ok. This was for lunch at 1:30 pm. Food is tasty. However, we were told that most of the items on the daily menu were already gone and they ran out of bread.

Dined with my husband and son. Not our first visit and we always had good food and good service. But, for some reason, service was not up to the usual standard this time. It took a while to get our iced teas and Coke. Had to remind our server twice to bring sweeteners for the iced tea. Then bread was served without butter. Our server was pretty scarce so my husband had to get up and ask the bartender to have someone bring us some butter. When the people at the next table left, the person sweeping up kept bumping our table but didn't even apologize. Thank goodness the food was as good as ever  or the evening would have been a total dud. This is the only reason I am rating the visit 4 stars. IMHO, the staff needs more training.

1. Smoked ham hock, braised shell peas, pancetta, squash.
2. Pork braised pork cheeks with pumpkin puree, pistachios.
3. Wood fired shrimp with chili garlic butter and lemon. 
4. Smoked beef short rib with tomato butter and mushroom. 
5. 28 oz grass fed cote de boeuf.
6. Fried boudin with pickled peppers.
Al good! The cote de boeuf was probably my least favorite but still good. My favorite was the pork cheeks and smoked beef short rib! Everything was good and I would come back.

Hands down my favorite dining experience during our trip to New Orleans. We enjoyed the food so much that we stopped by the butchery in back and grabbed sandwiches on our way out of town. 

The whole concept is well thought out and executed. Even though the place was packed on a Wednesday night, it never felt like this effected service or the timing of the courses. You can tell they are a well oiled machine. 

We ordered items from all over the menu and everything was as equally delicious as the course before. I wish we had been here long enough to go back for another meal. If you are looking for something more casual/fast, the butchery is equally delicious and still holds the same level of service.

The food was a solid 3/5. Service 5/5. 
The alligator wasn't particularly well flavored. If you've never trued gator then it's worth trying. Otherwise, skip it. The duck and sausage gumbo was simply okay. Nothing spectacular. The rabbit & dumpling dish was DELISH. Best thing on the menu.

Really good smoky barbecue spot, some hidden bourbon treats, and friendly staff!

Killer Apps:
Smoked pork ribs w pickle watermelon - sweet, spicy, tender, smoky and made in heaven (pickled watermelon was a nice touch to differentiate)

Duck and sausage gumbo - smoky, spicy and yummy 

Fried boudin (basically a pork shredded croquet) - okay, but okay to pass

Mains:
Rabbit and dumpling- rabbit and vegetables were really good, dumplings were okay


Louisiana cochon with cabbage - pork was a little too salty

Bonus: some nice hard to find bourbons at good prices (others a bit pricey).

Also Lima beans side was packed w smoky pork goodness.

Salty and spotty. Everything I ate here was too salty for my tasting: Mac and cheese and blackened gulf fish. Fried alligator was much better. Service was also very spotty, really depends on the waiter/waitress. Our main server disappeared but Gael, I believe was his name, really saved the night. I could hear other tables around us complaining about the service too. It's a popular restaurant, reservations are a must.

I ordered Smoked pork ribs, smoked ham hock, grilled beef short rib and grilled gulf fish. All of them are the best food in New Orleans and in great flavor only except gulf fish which is very disappointed. Gulf fish is $32 and there is no much flavor on it. I have to say the chef isn't good at seafood. But for other meat (pork and beef) they did really great job on it! They deserve 5 stars!! 
Regarding to the dessert I ordered upside down pineapple cake which is also very disappointed because they put pineapple sauce on a muffin which I thought it should be some homemade cake! 
But I still want to say the chefs in Cochon are the best in New Orleans!

By far the best food in NOLA! Everything we ordered was so delicious and flavorful! Fried alligator and wood fired shrimp are to die for! Bread on the house was warm and delicious! Drink were strong and yummy! Our waitress answered all our questions so patiently. Her description and explanation of all the dishes were so detailed! 
Both our kids (aged 3 and 1.5yrs) got straight away busy with the wiki sticks the waitress gave (something different than the usual paper n crayons! Have never seen any restaurant giving them before. So brilliant!)
Desserts were so so good too! All in all an amazing restaurant for food and service!! 
The surroundings of the restaurant was not so good but we are from Boston where everything is pretty all around so we have our standards set high :)

We went there for a girls' weekend a couple of weeks ago.  My third visit.  It's always amazing, fabulous...  Our waiter, Chris, was wonderful.

Been to the casual place 3-4 times and had the same experience -- amazing.  Bought several of their smoked meats, stuffed meats, sausages.  Hard to find adequate words to describe this place.

GO THERE!  Both places: I promise you will not be disappointed.

Really liked the vibe here, the staff were nice, and the food was flavorful. But nothing (drinks or food) just blew me away. We got the fried alligator, braised pork cheeks with pumpkin puree, catfish courtbouillon, louisiana cochon with cracklins, and fried apple pie. Of those dishes, I would only order the braised pork cheeks again--it really did melt in your mouth. The rest of the main dishes were just "fine" and the fried apple pie was actually disappointing--it was like something you could buy at the "fried" cart at the fair. For drinks, I got the Scarlet Letter, which I was happy with, but wouldn't go out of my way to track down again. I'm happy we tried this place--it was on a good friend's "must try" list--but probably wouldn't prioritize going back.

Simplement délicieux. Ce resto est un cadeau pour les sens. On paie un peu cher, mais ça vaut la peine. On a commandé plusieurs plats pour partager, et je les ai tous aimés. Les crevettes grillées étaient servies avec une sauce piquante très goûteuse. La salade avec lardons et fromage aussi était sagement assortie. Et les pommes grillées étaient un vrai délice. Expérience à répéter.

We had a party of 5 so we ordered a smattering of things. The best were the pork dishes - the pork belly confit and the braised pork cheeks. The fried alligator with chili had a little too much sauce in my opinion. The beef short rib was pretty good but it had a bit of a pot roast type texture which wasn't what I was expecting so it let me down a little. My rum the mules cocktail was great though.

We made a reservation since we were in town for a big game. They were timely with the reservation time but the dining process was longer than we expected. Make sure you plan to be there eating for two hours, we did drinks, appetizers, and a meal. The food was good. Between the seven of us we ordered a little of almost everything on the menu. Our favorites were the pork rib, fried boudin, and alligator.

Along with the butchery, Cochon offers an upscale menu that doesn't break the bank. We were greeted by Sarah who gave us a beautiful run down of the evenings specials and drinks. She was great! Amazing service. 

The food was even better! We had the amberjack with broccoli and the ramblin' rose. We have been here before and enjoyed the boudin balls and their bread rolls  Definitely check this place out!!

Wow! Such a fantastic restaurant after all these years!  Form the cocktails to the dishes, I'm completely impressed!! The cured tuna appetizer of the day was amazing with marcona almonds!  I then went in the sample the boucherie plate, fantastic!! 
And finally onto the rabbit & dumplings, omg! What a fantastic flavor combination!  He smothered greens were a great side dish too!! 
And don't forget the phenomenal bar tender, Andrea, who created the out of this world drink: Winter's a beach!!  I could drink 50!!!! Yummy all a

Probably our favorite restaurant in New Orleans! Definitely make a reservation in advance. The food was very well prepared and many dishes felt special, including the roasted leg of lamb, rabbit and dumplings, and short rib. Big selection of whiskeys. The service was also top notch with a team of like 5 people that had great recommendations and were super on top of taking care of us. For 3 people we got a few drinks, appetizers, and an entree each and it came out to about $100/person including tax and tip. Totally worth it! Highly recommend.

When I say I love Cochon, I really mean I LOVE Cochon! Last weekend I was in New Orleans celebrating my girlfriend's 40th birthday and when she asked for suggestions on where we should do dinner one of the nights, of course I said Cochon. 

The last 4 times I've been to New Orleans I've made a point to make reservations there and it never disappoints.

This time I started off with the port braised pork cheeks. This appetizer is a must and will leave you longing for more. For my entree I had the Catfish courtbouillon and it was truly a blessing to my soul. Just thinking about it is making my mouth water, I really need that recipe. They had Brussels sprouts as a special and I ordered it to go along with my meal. It was a sizable portion and had huge chunks of bacon and a touch of heat. Never had spicy Brussels sprouts before but it was a welcome addition to a classic. Since we were going for cocktails and cake after dinner I had to pass on dessert. Maybe one day I'll actually have room for dessert.

The service was great and our waiter was attentive to our group of 6. When he was busy he made sure one of his colleagues was there to assist.

I highly recommend Cochon and it's definitely a must when you visit New Orleans.

I've been wanting to come here for years now, ever since seeing the restaurant profiled on Anthony Bourdain's show.  I made reservations well in advance, and I'm glad I did since there was a wait at the door.  We arrived early and were seated promptly.  The server, I think Adam was his name, did a very comprehensive job about recommending drinks even to the point of assuring me that if I did not like the drink I ordered he would definitely drink it for me and get me another.  We had a wedge salad that eats like an entree and split an order of the short rib which was very tender with a mushroom-based broth and potatoes.  Accompanying all this was a side of macaroni and cheese, which the only word I could use to describe it would be "addictive".  On top of all that, Cochon also makes their own bread which was also very good; I do insist on getting more of it when offered.  My favorite dish, however, was the duck and sausage gumbo.  The best gumbo I had during my stay in the city.  I was very pleasantly surprised.  The desserts were just "OK", although I felt I didn't pick the strongest on the menu (i choose the butterscotch pudding).  I misread it and for some reason though bread pudding. But still, that was my fault, not theirs.  It was definitely worth the wait coming to eat here, and the next time I come into town, I will definitely be back.

My family and I had dinner at Cochon a few days after Christmas in 2019. Overall, we felt that the restaurant had very unique offerings. All foodies should strongly consider paying a visit!! 
For our appetizers, we ordered the "Wood Fried Shrimp with Chili Garlic Butter & Lemon" as well as the "Pork Belly Confit with Sweet Apple Relish." The shrimp was juicy and well-seasoned, but we had all but forgotten about it after tasting the pork belly. The latter had an incredible kind of light, sweet flavor that perfectly complemented the inherent richness of pork belly. It was definitely the more impressive of the two appetizers we ordered. 
For our entrees, we ordered the "Rabbit & Dumplings" as well as the "Louisiana Cochon with Cabbage, Cracklins & Pickled Turnips." The former was like a rich stew, prepared in a way that greatly enhanced the flavor of rabbit meat, which is usually lean. The cochon reminded us of tender pulled-pork, except with a spicy Cajun flavor. Both entrees were tasty and exceptionally unique. 

The desserts we got were the hummingbird cake was so so, kind of just a regular carrot cake and the butterscotch pudding which was super delicious and soo creamy!! Would definitely come back to try more. Also service was wonderful!

The items here seemed to be hit or miss. The fried alligator and cheeks were absolutely delicious, but the Cochon was pretty horrible.  It was bland. I would absolutely avoid that item which seems ridiculous as their name would suggest it should be a speciality.  It was so bad that we added on two extra items after tasting it because we knew we couldnt stomach it ( the mac and cheese and shrimp).    This place would be a 4 or 5 star restaurant, but was really turned off by the Cochon.
It's alright. The food is pretty good- the service was so strange. I felt like my waiters were stoned.

I came in just for the fried alligator and the oysters. Unfortunately they didn't have oysters on the menu but I was able to try the alligator appetizer. Cochons alligator put the ones I ate elsewhere yesterday to shame. They are amazing! The spicy garlic sauce was amazing and I almost didn't leave any for my husband. Usually I hate mint and never go near it. However I was surprised that the green in my appetizer was mint. This is the first mint I have enjoyed my entire life thanks to the sauce and alligator. Also, their bread was fluffy and yum. Also my waiter was so pleasant! 

I left this place with the thought of the fried alligator burned into my brain and it really left an impression on me.
Hands down best meal we had in Nola! Nothing was bad and the staff was accommodating and friendly! Place was packed so make a reservation for sure. I could die in a pool of their Mac and cheese!!

Have been here several times. First time we have had poor service. Alex was sadly lacking, inattentive. Sat at the chefs table. Couples on both sides of us finished their meals complete with dessert, dont know why we lagged behind in service. Never asked if we wanted dessert. Will return cause we love the food.

We enjoyed our dinner with a group of 8. Service was perfect and deserves 5 stars. Food was also very solid. Why not 5 stars? Good question maybe the pricing is a bit on the higher end especially the bottled wines. Cheapest bottle at $50 open end to the top. Overall it was a very solid outing but missing the little special touch to receive 5 stars. The wait staff's recommendations were top notch though. Bummer that they ran out of many of the specials for an 8 o clock reservation

We went here after a show because one of our friends recommended it and it didn't disappoint. I had the Fried Livers for an appetizer which is something I normally wouldn't get but someone said we had to and it was amazing!!! I can't compliment the chef here enough, I had the Beef Short Rib for dinner and it was perfect! Keep up the good work Cochon and we'll definitely be back!

We were visiting New Orleans for Christmas and we ate here at the beginning of our trip. We wish we ate here one more time if we had the time. Anyway - Amazing food and ambiance. Definitely try the shrimp & pork pie with basil, smoked beef short rib with tomato butter & mushrooms with the side of the macaroni & cheese casserole - you will thank me later!! They also make great dirty martinis - my husband and I still talk about our experience till this day. We will definitely be back!

Gumbo is some of the best in Nola.  The rabbit stew with dumplings was fantastic.  The two dinner companions devoured their ham hock and catfish courtboullion. Excellent service. Portions are small for a Nola restaurant - not necessarily a bad thing.  Highly recommended.

I went here for the first time, and my experience was so lovely! 

Food: ordered the alligator tails, oysters, an  entree but I don't remember, and a blondie brownie with ice cream. Everything was delicious!! I highly recommend all of them! 

Service: Our server was also great and really sweet. He  described all the wines and  recommended which wine paired with which dish. I remember he said that one of the wine flavors had a "buttery smoked wood taste," and I couldn't stop laughing. 

Atmosphere/environment: this place is a perfect date night location. The lights are dim, so it seems a bit more romantic. 

Price: It is on the pricey side!
Delicious meal and great atmosphere! This was one of my best meals in New Orleans and one of the top meals I have had in my life. We will be back next time we are in NOLA!

Specialty cocktails are premixed. Both I tried were weak and bland. Sent 2nd back. Wedge Salad was very good.  Two entrees were heavy and bland overall. Like they are afraid to season anything. Fried apple pie was devoid of apples and flavor. Also sent back. No clue how this place was ever recognized by James Beard. Server tried too hard to be personable.

Fried boudin ($9) smoked beef short rib with tomato butter & mushrooms for $30

Boudin is made fresh and the ingredients inside were soft, moist and tasty. Then the crunch of the fried outside was a game changer to add complexity to the food. The mustard was strong but not overpowering.

Smoked beef short ribs were to DIE for! The meat just falls off the bone with a little effort and the juices from the beef and veggies made a powerful tasty broth that just blew me away. 

Highly recommend here and will come back

We came here for some appetizers and drinks so we sat at the bar. Good selection of local beers which is always a major plus. We ordered the Wood Fire Shrimp and wow! Easily the best shrimp dish I've had to date. Mega savory with huge flavors and top notch quality seafood. We were so impressed that we just kept ordering more servings of this dish so maybe not the most well rounded review but damn, that shrimp is that good!

Small place, away from the loud crowd of the French Quarter, with a) solid, eclectic food b) pretty good drink selection (whenever tthey have  a gruener, I am happy), c) and super friendly bartenders. Split the crab claws, gumbo and pork cheeks and went home very happy. Not huge portions, but best food I've had on this trip, and nice, chill vibe.

Cochon was one of my favorite places we visited during our trip to NoLa. They offer amazing comfort food and every single dish we tried hit the spot.
We ordered fried alligator, smoked pork ribs, Mac and cheese casserole and the gulf fish. Everything was exceptional but my favorites weekend definitely the ribs and alligator. 
The staff was amazing!! They gave us so many recommendations of what to try on the menu and other places to go in NoLa. Also, it was my birthday that day and they brought a butterscotch dessert with candles. 
100% would come back here!!!
Went back again, and STILL AWESOME. Added a few more photos for this review. Must try. The food is still amazing, and the atmosphere and staff are fantastic.

Staying a few blocks away and this along with Butcher have been my  go-to. Fantastic food and drink and the people are friendly. I haven't Haas a bad dish yet and I have tried almost everything on both menus.

My friend suggested this place and I am so happy I went! I do suggest to not go over board with appetizers before your entree because you can get full fast. We started out with the braised pork cheeks and smoked pork ribs. The meats are so tender and flavorful. As for my entree I had the rabbit and dumplings, the ginger in the dish really enhanced the flavors! Deff put Cochon on your list when visiting New Orleans.

Chicken Liver Toast with Pepper Jelly--yes. 
Fried alligator tail with aioli--yes. 

The menu isn't huge here but the selection is unique and thoughtfully thought out. Seems to be a staple of the Warehouse District so expect it to be busy. I'd recommend a reservation.

This was recommended by multiple friends and had great ratings, so of course we had to make time to go. We shared gumbo, butcherie board, and fried alligator and all were delicious! I was also happy that we went in the early afternoon so it wasn't super busy and the service was great.

We enjoyed a nice meal here recently. Perhaps I had built it up so much in my mind that I was expecting much more. The food was good, I would return, but it wasn't phenomenal like I was expecting. We tried a variety of dishes, shared several of them, including dessert. For such a great meal, the hummingbird cake was downright disappointing.

Had dinner here while in town for a conference.  Got a seat at the bar after 5 min.  Great cocktails!  Tried the Scarlett Letter and the Rambling Rose.  The bartenders were very attentive. 

Foodwise, the fried alligator was delicious but the short rib was a little tough, fatty, and had too much tendon.  I was hoping for melt-in-your-mouth braised short rib that is super lean.

It was fun to people-watch, especially the old men buying drinks for young ladies...very entertaining.

Lee was our waiter and he made our whole night. Extremely personable and kept us hyped for the food and drinks. Our group was drooling during the whole meal. We ordered the "Fisherman's" style fish, Duck & Sausage Gumbo, Short Ribs,  Catfish courtbouillon, Golf Shrimp, and Fried Alligator. All of the dishes were incredible but the golf shrimp small plate was out kf this world.

Food here was delicious! I was a bit scared since my experience at Peche was not as good, but after taking a first bite of food, all fears were gone. The fried alligator was quite tasty, and the pork ribs as well. For the main, we had the smoked beef and fish. Again, both were cooked well and tasted great as well. Mac n cheese side was good, I would skip the cucumbers.

Would definitely recommend Cochon to anyone visiting NOLA.

Dinner was lovely!


Service was smooth!


Best part was dripping the rolls in the sauce from the shrimps!!!!!!   Can't saY enough.
This place is phenomenal. Fried alligator bites, the gumbo, and carrot cake toffee pudding is simply amazing.

Me and my friends were recommended this place from the newly renovated HI Hostel New Orleans. I'm so glad we made the decision to check it out.

When you come in, it's more of a rustic feel, from the art decor to the furniture. 

FOOD: 

wood-fired shrimp with chili garlic butter $17
The shrimp was full of flavor. Very rich and hearty. It's highly possible that it was marinated prior to being broiled.

SALAD

wedge salad, lardons, butternut squash, pumpkin seeds, blue cheese $10
The salad came with a picked vinegar dressing ghat paired well with the blue cheese and pickled onions.

We went for lunch and were seated right away.  We were seated at a large banquet with 2 top tables.  It was snug against other diners.  Really, there were empty tables so it seemed off that everyone was lined up along one wall.  The service was good.  Bread was great.  I had the beef tip special.  Portion was small and some of the meat was fatty.

Genuinely shocked at the reviews at this place. It was crazy overpriced for the lack of flavors and portion size being so weak. Actually that's the best way to describe this place; weakkkkk. My soup was literally like half a ladles worth of soup, and honestly lubys does a better job with the cucumber salad. Most assuredly not worth returning.

Came here for lunch and when we got there it wasn't too busy shortly after 11 am on a Friday, but it picked up pretty quickly after that.  I was worried walking in the place about being underdressed because I was basically wearing workout clothes, but it was fine.  We had the fried alligator bites and the shrimp with a spicy garlic buttery sauce.  A server brought us some bread and he told us to make sure to soak the bread up in that shrimp sauce.  He was right.  Another server tried to take our empty dish when we got the shrimp out and I almost tapped her hand when I said no because there was still more sauce in there.  ha.  I didn't waste a single drip.

Pretty good lunch spot, but definitely more expensive than I expected. 4 ribs was such a small portion for the price. Waitress wasn't very friendly or helpful with it being our first time there. There are so many restaurants to choose from, might be the last time we come to this one. Menu didn't have much to choose from.

Saw this place on an episode of Somebody Feed Phil and it looked bomb so I decided I needed to go when visiting New Orleans. Really glad I did. We didn't want to get too full so we just ordered some apps/sides. We had the alligator... delicious, greens....well done, and gumbo...tasty. I can only imagine that their main courses are just as good if not better.

Went after running a half marathon because we'd heard good things about it and it was close to the hotel. Everything on the table was delicious. I had the crawfish pie and my boyfriend had the catch of day gulf fish. Both amazing, we also had Mac and cheese casserole and twice baked potato. It was all so good. The service was just as great!

We ordered smoked pork ribs and catfish with soup of the day and fried alligators as appetizers. Fried alligators were good especially with their special spicy vinegar. Soup of the day was ham with some veggies which was pretty good. Entrees weren't as good as starters. The pork ribs were too saucy for me personally and it was hard to eat around. Steak knife was not helpful enough. You would have to use your bare hands. They did provide hand wipes a while after they served the dish. It would be better if they served the wipes earlier. The catfish dish was fried catfish with rice. The scallions in the dish was too much. And the catfish tasted very fishy. Service was ok.

We really enjoyed our dinner at Cochon! Fanatasic, friendly service! Incredible cocktaIls. We tried several dishes including alligator, sweet bread, cucumber salad, Mac n cheese and sausage. The atmosphere was great and I'd recommend eating here!

Me and my boyfriend sat at the chefs counter enjoying the view of the cooks while having a fabulous service. The carter cocktail was very great. Also enjoyed the shrimp and double baked potato both cooked perfectly.

Learned about this place in a Pod Cast by JJ Redick. I was not disappointed. Walking back from WW 2 Museum and stopped for dinner on a Monday night. Ate outside. Very attentive staff. I had the Cochon patty on a tasty bed of, I'm not sure what, but it complemented the pork extremely well. My wIfe has the pork cheeks that she raved over. I look forward to going back.

Lived up to the hype.

Cochon has been "famous" for a number of years, and I was finally able to go. I walked in on a Tuesday night and just sat at the bar, which was free. I would suggest to make a reservation otherwise. The bartender was great, and made 3-4 suggestions. I took him up on it and got a bourbon cocktail and the crawfish pie and skillet Mac and cheese.

Heavenly. I am so glad I ordered what I did, even though it was a side and an appetizer. I am sure the entrees are very good, but I was very happy with my selections.

The crawfish pie is basically a huge empanada filled will big pieces of crawfish, the Cajun trinity, rice, and seasonings. It was such a new take on great New Orleans food. And the Mac and cheese was perfect. Not too rich, extremely cheesey, and bubbling hot. Next time you are in NOLA, go sit at the bar, and enjoy a fantastic meal.
Just Sensational. Great atmosphere and a create culinary experience of Creole. Cochon is a must if you come to new Orleans
Food was good, The shrimp and a fry and alligator were good, with exception of the soup, it  was salty. The server could be a little more friendly.
New Orleans has the best flavor food everywhere you go for cheap less than 15 most places for meals, I loved this place was nice cozy and great home cooked food, I had the rabbit stew

A good place for date night. It gave me the semi-fancy type of restaurant vibe. They have a good wine list and will let you sample a couple until you find the right wine. I had shared the catfish courtbuillon and tried the fried alligator appetizer. Overall, food was good and tasty.

When planning my first trip to New Orleans, I asked for recommendations from my Facebook fam and several people mentioned Cochon's. It became the first NOLA restaurant we would visit. Just a short walk from our hotel, down bricked avenues, we were greeted by friendly staff and offered a seat at the bar while we waited for our reservation time. We had a drink, and let me say, it was the BEST old fashioned I have ever had!  It was as if Ryan Gosling lovingly and meticulously crafted it, himself (name that movie). We were taken into the dining room and seated at a small two top to look over our dinner options and were presented with a couple of off menu options as well. We started with the alligator tail and it was deliciously flavored and lightly fried. My boyfriend had the rabbit dumplings and I highly recommend it!  Tender rabbit in a rich, creamy stew with moist, melt in your mouth dumplings. I chose the pork ribs with pickled watermelon. It was fall off the bone tender and the watermelon added an interesting tang to the dish. The macaroni and cheese was the ultimate comfort food on this chilly evening. We left sated and eager to try this place again.

Unfortunately I had too high of an expectation. Coming from SF and having our fair share of great eateries, Cochon was up against a very discerning palette. Sadly, the food was just ok. The service was meh. Only highlight of the meal was the location. It just happens to be where all the Mardi Gras floats end up. Our timing was perfect. A few of the Uptown parades ended there and unloaded all their participants. They were still giving out beads and stuff.
Saturday before Mardi Gras. Food is excellent, Pork Belly sandwich and my fiancee had the cubano. Drinks are strong and very tasty. Service is also quick and friendly.
Delicious food quick seating, chef's table in front of kitchen is great, love the craft

When people talk about how amazing food is in New Orleans they're talking about this restaurant. Innovative creative delicious pleasantly served incredible food. It's so wonderful to find a place that goes above and beyond regular ingredients to a truly spectacular dining out experience.Eat here have fun thank me later.
Great food and service! I would def go back. Had the veggie options and it was the best I've had in nola :)

Cochon lived up to its reputation. I made a reservation about a month before my trip and was not disappointed. The atmosphere is great and the food was delicious. Service was great and the staff made great recommendations. 

Portions were just right and the flavors were balanced. I was solo and wished I could have ordered more off the menu. I was so eager to try dessert after my starter and entree that I took a bite before I got a picture! 

To me the shining moments of the meal were the details. The pepper jelly and short rib sauce took the dish to the next level. 

Am looking forward to returning on my next trip to New Orleans.

Did not have a reservation so we put our names down and waited about an hour. Once we got the text to come back, we did and we're seated right away. It was very busy and I didn't realize how bing the space actually is. 

We shared the fried gator, which was YUMMMAAAAAAY! I had the shrimp with a side of grits which was also really good, I just wish I didn't have to work so hard to eat it lol

Fantastic food. The pork cheeks, Mac & cheese, pork ribs, crawfish pie, and basically any beef dish were all fan favorites. The margaritas were also great. 

Service was a bit slow to put in our orders, but when they came out, they came out all at once, which was great. It might've been because our party was seated in the loft. Another bit that annoyed us was that we wanted to order 3 pork chops for the table but the restaurant only said that had 1 left. Then we tried to order the lamb, but then they came back and said they were out of those. I wish they could just tell us which dishes they ran out of to begin with, since it took a while to get a waiter to take our order.

NOLA is known for amazing food and culture!  This gem is part of that amazement!  Service was exceptional and drinks are on spot!  The food menu wasn't huge but it's definitely NOLA style and that means seasoning and flavor is huge!  I got the deviled egg and shrimp gumbo and the catfish court-bouillon!  Both were excellent and full of flavor!  Fresh food and a piece of that culture is showing here!  

To see more pictures of this place and others go to Kam Finds Food page on Facebook and Instagram and join the foodie community! Yes we love new foodies who share their passion for food with pictures!

Cochon is on every list online of places you need to eat in NO. Then I heard about it on JJ Redick's Podcast. I respect his food opinions so that was the clincher. He recommended the wood grilled oysters. Unfortunately, they didn't have them this weekend due to flooding in the oyster beds. The wood grilled shrimp was a good replacement. We pretty much got all small dishes and everything was great. I'm looking forward to going back to try more of the menu. We had the cucumbers, the fried gator, and the pork cheeks. Cochon definitely met our expectations. They were very flexible as far as the reservations go too. I called to change the time and they were cool about it. They deserve a spot on the list of the top restaurants in NO. Maybe next time they'll have the wood grilled oysters.

Probably didnt need to add to the slew of reviews but it was outstanding.  Especially considering other parts of New Orleans are less appealing. Had the short ribs, and mac n cheese (top 3 mac and cheese in the country I've had) followed by carrot cake desert was unreal.  Glad we came through, and checked in for our friends to hit up. Enjoy!!

Visiting New Orleans for the nth time, I decided to listen to locals instead of looking through the usual lists of recommendations and it did not disappoint.
Service is prompt and courteous, food was beyond delicious. Started with Wood fired Shrimp and was actually a bit embarrassed as not only did I finish the dish in 10 seconds, ok maybe 20, but I also practically licked the plate clean. I then moved on to the Catfish Court-bouillon, again I was blown away. Definitely one of my best meal in the many trips I've taken to the crescent city. Highly recommended!

Ambience =1 ( was eating outside but inside looks good)
Food = 0.5 ( red snapper was good, winter's beach was not)
Gentry = 1 (nice and sophisticated people)
Server =1 ( polite and helpful)
Value for money = 0 ( $55 for that experience is expensive )

The fried alligator was AMAZING. Must try! I loved this place. It was my first time going but it has been on my list for a few years now. All the dishes that I had were so good I am upset that I wasn't hungrier to try more things, like dessert. Reservations can be tough, but my experience wasn't terrible. We were able to change same day to a later time slot. The restaurant is lively and conversational so I had a good time in a Saturday night. The food came out pretty fast, but I ordered a lot of appetizers. They were so good I didn't make it to the entrées. Service was good, the waiters helped us pick out a few items that they thought we would like best based on what we were looking for. I would certainly go again next time I am in New Orleans.

Above average forsure so like 3.5 stars but I didnt get the hype. It's good but not great. Alligator was ok. Ham hock was filling and good but nothing to write home about as well as the cochon. Pretty pricey as well.

Everything else was great. Staff, interior, presentation, ambiance. But the food was, again, above average but not by much. Unique forsure considering they were dishes I probably wouldnt be able to get elsewhere but I dont know. I dont get the hype

Such a cool vibe and right downtown! This was my second trip to New Orleans, so I was on a culinary mission. The first on my hit list, and the closest at 9PM, I crossed my fingers hoping they would be as good as the dishes looked and they were! A warm industrial vibe, with a menu mixed with southern comfort and new twists on old classics. I ordered the rabbit and dumplings and my mom ordered a cup of gumbo and wood-fired shrimp with chili garlic butter. The gumbo had a dark rue, deep flavor and a kick she loved. My dish was tinder and rich with some of the best dumplings I ever had. We'll definitely make this a go to for trips to come.

Great service and best BREAD!!!! Love it here. Our first meal in NOLA definitely made an awesome start of our trip down here . 

P.S.; One of our waiters is really cute!!!!

We went with a large group and used the pre-set menu so we got a little bit of everything. All starters... boucherie platter, cracklins, boudin, alligator and shrimp were good to very good. Whole pig for dinner was next level. This is something I've had countless times, and this one takes the cake. Skin perfectly crispy, and the meat moist and well flavored. Whiskey menu isn't so shabby either. 10/10 would go every time I visit the city

Food was okay, not 5 stars worthy.  We had the rabbit and dumplings, pork cheek, gator, and the shrimp in garlic butter (the best item IMO) and the kids catfish and chips . Overall, the food just okay but I will say The staff, were all great and are more than  5 stars worthy!

Absolutely love Cochon and come here any chance we get! Always order the ribs with pickled watermelon which have become a too spicy lately but are still delicious. The brussel sprouts are delicious and the gumbo is too, but any of their slow cooked short rib dishes has been the star of the night! Love the atmosphere too. Would definitely recommend reservations well in advance and ask to be seated near the open kitchen for a fun environment.

Went with a coworker and two business partners.  The food was amazing, probably our best meal while in NOLA for that past 6 days (out of about 12 places).  The place was empty when we arrived (early 5:30), but there was a line out the door when we left.  I chose not to order too much as I was unaware that there was a Cochon restaurant and a Butcher that both carry different menus.  I had may heart set on one of the dishes from the Butcher, which was right next door.  I did however taste every plate that my guests had and ate some appetizers.
