I usually go from best food to worst, but the 3 mains were all pretty much tied at #1.  The most unique plate that caused the most eyes to roll back was the Rabbit and Dumplings.  It was a rich and thick stew with no wild taste.  The rabbit just melted in your mouth.  The dumplings were not too doughy and did a good job soaking up the gravy.  The Smoked Beef Short Rib was next and it was fall off the bone delicious.  My friend stated that it was the best rib he's ever had.  The other person had the Oyster/Bacon Sandwich.  I wasn't able to try this due to allergies, but he stated it was amazing.  Huge oysters were falling off and he still had no shortage in the sandwich.  Great value for money.  The sides were a little on the weak side.  The fried alligator was good, but would have been better with a little more sauce.  There were also a few pieces overcooked and dry.  The Fried Boudin was decent, but I've had better.  I gave 5 stars as the setting was cool and the service was spot on and friendly - but most of all the mains delivered.
Just had a bunch of apps and small plates. This place is awesome. Everything left me wanting more.

I'm only giving this place 1 star for the dinner rolls and the man who took our plates away. We ordered several dishes -every dish was mediocre. What made it worse was the HORRIBLE service we received from the waitress. I wish I got her name, she was rolling her eyes and mocking our table. We still left a fair tip for the man who took our dishes away he was so kind and made sure our table was ok. I would not go back. All the waitress at the restaurant seem to mock the customers. 

If you are looking for a place to eat near the convention center walk five mins away from this place and eat somewhere else.

Everything we ordered was amazing. It was our first night in NOLA and we have 3 elementary aged kids- it was fine for them (if you're wondering about bringing kids). They give each table these amazing homemade rolls, so the kids were happy. We tried like 5 different entrees and several sides. All of the combos and flavors were on point. Would love to come back and will definitely recommend!

This is one expensive restaurant in New Orleans, is not really authentic if you don't have Gumbo. The service was ok but nothing great. 
Won't be back anytime soon, but may give it a second chance just to confirm or for them to redeem themselves.

I read about it. People I respect liked it so much that I already liked it. I wanted to love it. Was ready like a girl in her prom dress... then... he threw up on me. Alligator bites tough as frozen nails. Pork cheeks sad meatballs out of the back of a swedish freezer. Rabbit and dumplings had tasty gravy and savory biscuits but meat was cooked to death road kill... May be a great spot, but today, did not live up. At all.
Great small plates that can be shared between 2 people generously. Outside seating is first come , first serve and is so nice when the weather is cooperative.
Cochon and butcher good to go...food and atmosphere are both fantastic. Easy location in upper cbd. Walk back to FQ when your done.

Well worth the hike! Classic smoke based flavors in a modern interior with a hip and knowledgeable serving crew. Grilled shrimp and red fish were excellent as were the smoked seed ribs. Of course it was 5 o'clock somewhere at noon so I partook of the Da Carter featuring Sazerac rye and tawny port whoosh was excellent
Just sat at the bar and had a few snacks but all 3 apps we had were very good and the bartender was great too. Would love to Come back and have a real meal here next time in town.

There are so many wonderful things to say about Cochon from Anshante at the hostess stand to the food.  But let's be fair there are numerous exceptional dining experiences in NOLA.  It is rare to put something as a must eat when visiting the city.  But Cochon is now on my list.  The places was packed and the staff was friendly and accommodating.  My colleague and I did not have reservations but we were not treated with "how dare you come here without a reservation attitude".  We had drinks at the bar and quickly moved to the chef's table. 

I started with the livers and pepper jelly.  Freaking off the chart good.  I could make this an entree to was so good.  My did choose the rabbit dumplings for my entree.  We also split the Mac and cheese.  The no carb diet was not being followed on this trip.  The rabbit was perfect.  But sitting at the chef's table was torture.  I now want to try everything on their menu.  Truly an wonderful experience.  I gave a standing ovation to the kitchen before I departed.

I checked out Cochon for brunch on a Saturday with a large group, I'm talking 20 people or so. Since we had such a large group, we called ahead of time and made a reservation. Cochon is one of New Orleans' most famous restaurants so it was completely packed when we arrived. It's a large restaurant too.

Taking care of such a large group is a challenge but the waiters did a great job. We had several courses including passed appetizers, entrees, and desserts. Plus, some complimentary bread and butter so get things going. There were so many dishes that we shared so I won't touch on them all but I'll highlight some of my favorites. 

Gator appetizer: You can't say no to some gator when you're in New Orleans. This one was marinated in some sort of tangy sauce with a kick which was to die for. My favorite app out of the bunch!

Pork chop entree: thick-cut and seasoned well, the pork chop was juicy and oozing with flavor. 

The desserts weren't as big of a hit in my book and the weird thing was that it took the longest for our table to receive desserts. Longer than it took for the appetizers and also for the entrees. Cochon may be a bit overpriced but the food is high up there.

A great spot for brunch! The restaurant is spacious and welcoming. A nice spot to dine with family and friends. 

The menu selection is awesome! So much to pick from and they all sound delicious. Well, they are delicious! For the class Mac and cheese, to the crispy pork cheeks. A whole lotta southern comfort food with a modern twist. Make sure you order a few dishes to sample. They're not too big and big enough to share. You won't regret it!

Alright, I will be giving it five stars but not because it was perfect. I will be giving it five stars solely on the fact that the shrimp was the best shrimp I've ever tasted. Adding lemon to it is the way to go. The flavor really transforms when it hits your tastebuds. The rest of the stuff was over priced and nasty!! I got a piece of meat(pork) and potatoes. With like a teaspoon of barbecue sauce and water mixed together as the seasoning. That bad boy was like $40 for the plate. My girlfriend got fish thinking she was gonna get a full fried fish but she got like two pieces of fish that was beaded terrible. But, if you do make sure to only order shrimp and bread. Dip the bread in the sauce that the shrimp comes in. Trust me on this one. Pls.
This is as good as it gets in New Orleans.  My last meal in NOLa will be at Cochon, hands down.   Service is blah.....but the food rocks, decor is fine....but tell chef he's crushing it.   Much love.
Cochon is the future of NOLA dining.   We always sit at the bar because the bartenders are so friendly.  Rabbit stew is To Die For , Grilled Oysters , hands down, best I've ever had.

This place is outstanding!  All of the dishes I tried were really good, but my favorite dish on the menu was the boudin balls!  OMG boudin is so delicious and these little balls are really good!  The people who work here are super nice and the patrons were all so different.  Some people on a date night, others with kids, big groups for dinners, etc.  The restaurant was also kid friendly in my opinion since it is a big open space with high ceilings and it is somewhat loud inside so I would totally bring my kids here next time.  The pork selections are all very fresh and delicious too.  Great cocktails also.  A must try if you are in this City.

Came in one busy night about 10 months ago on my last night in New Orleans. Was sat right away at the bar and had excellent service. Being so long ago I can't remember what I got, only recall being blown away by how delicious everything was. Absolutely recommend!
We had our wedding rehearsal dinner here and it was amazing. We did the prefixed 3 course meal - the food was phenomenal and it was more than what we could all eat. Definitely recommend!

I was lucky enough to visit Cochon for its first opening day after the lockdown for Covid-19, and it was wonderful! We sat outside, but I noticed others going into the dining room, and all were extremely well spaced out. My friend and I both had the gumbo, which I have been dreaming about for WEEKS. I had the cochon daily special that came with blistered shishido peppers, and my friend had the fried catfish, we shared the decadent and rich macaroni and cheese. It was amazing to finally be sitting in a restaurant again, and the service was lovely - several employees came out and thanked us for being there. Thank you, Cochon, for being open and giving us all a reason to celebrate again, and thanks to Chef Link for all he's done for the restaurant community. We will get through this! #yelplove #thankyouthursday

Cochon is open again! With the food just as delicious and memorable as before the covid closure, but with the new dining experience having tables a lot more spaced out and the staff wearing all the appropriate protection gear. It is advised to make a reservation ahead of your visit (you can do so right through their website), but our lunch reservation got us the dining room pretty much all to ourselves (additional tables are set up outside). I guess not everyone was as excited as we were for the opportunity to dine in (It will take time, I get it. But we appreciated the opportunity and the measures taken to make that opportunity possible.). Food wise, the fried Boudin and Fried Alligator were a must! And while every Cochon Daily Special is different, the Shishido Peppers that came with my neck/shoulder meat, were out of this world delicious (the restaurant is doing what they can to feature and utilize every part of the pig so there is no wasted protein)! The Mac and Cheese is not pictured, but also a recommended must, saving room for either the Blueberry Buckle or the decadent Chocolate Cake!

Came here with the lady because we are tired of takeout and we want the restaurants in New Orleans to get back to normal!

We made reservations for lunch, which honestly we didn't have to due to it being empty. However, I was glad it was because we got spoiled y'all! Every wish and desire was taken care of by our waitress. She was really great. Everybody in the restaurant came to check on us to see how we were doing. Felt good to be back and dare I say I'm going to miss all the attention when everything goes back to normal.

Anyway, the food was delicious! We had the boudin balls, fried alligator and our entrees. The boudin balls were the highlight! Soo good. I had the prime rib which was great but that chocolate cake put me over the top. 

Everyone, go back to Cochon! Give them your business and let's bring everyone out of this mess.

I'm going to give this place 5 starts just because it's damn good food and service, but I'm going to take this opportunity to share a story from the last time we dined there.  

My wife and I had a rare night out away from the kids and sat outside.  The table behind us is approached by the server and they begin asking questions about what Vegan options they have because two of the four are Vegan.  

Why the F*CK would you pick a place called "COCHON" to take your annoying Vegan proclivities?   I don't go to a damn Vegan restaurant and ask about "What Meat options do you have because I only eat meat?", so why would you do this?

Then these dummies had the audacity to balk when the server mentioned that the chef would throw together an unknown variety of what vegetables they had on hand, trying to say that they should have more vegan options.

YOU WENT TO A PLACE CALLED "COCHON" - Not only is it named for a Pig, the sign is also a Pig.  Everything about this place screams this is literally the last place your meek vegan a** should step foot!

C'mon folks, it's ok if you only want to eat the food that real food eats, but please please please don't annoy everyone else around you about it.

Early evening meal with friends at Cochon.  Cocktails here are creative and tasty.   Recommend the Scarlett Letter.

Although Cochon is known for pork chops, all four of us opted for the fish dishes.  They were very good choices.  The fried catfish was excellent, not sure how exactly they prepared the catch fish but it was not greasy.  The cat fish was cooked to perfection, along with the catch if the day called Red Fish, a local sumptuous white fish with excellent fat content. 

 The gumbo was quite good too. 

We also returned the following day to the Cochon Butcher for a muffuletta sandwich.   The sandwich is huge, enough for two people.  It was quite good.

You must call to make your reservation.   Heard positive reviews and my son and I decided to try it out. We are so glad we did. The ambiance was very nice. Excellent customer service, lovely decor and great food

We started with the cucumber salad topped with an amazing vinegarette dressing and fresh mint. That mint woke that salad up.  My son with the mask on studied the menu for a minute before taking our very nice server advice on the rabbit and dumpling.  The rabbit was shredded but not too much. You were able to savor the rabbit taste. The stew itself made you want to cuddle in a blanket. Good thing they keep it 60 degree in the restaurant. I ordered the catfish and it was just as good. The batter was very light. My son and I decided to share our meals because we both liked each other's meal. Oh those sweet potatoes were naturally sweet with a nice topping. 

When we left we were quite stuffed and pleased.   Will be back

Something different in NOLA. Had a business dinner here last week after several locals recommended it. It didn't disappoint. A nice bar and the cocktails are spot on with a strong beer selection. We started with the alligator and deviled oysters as appetizers. I highly recommend both. I had the red fish entree and it was legit. By far the best thing I had was the macaroni and cheese. Best I've ever had, it is a must. If this is your first trip to NOLA I recommend a more traditional restaurant. However, if you are looking for something different and unique outside of the French Quarter I highly recommend Cochan.
Amazing food! Had to eat here 2 times. Drinks are so worth it. Had amaretto sour with egg whites.

This was my second visit here and was not disappointed! We shared the roasted pork porterhouse with garlic confit & mushroom jus and it was absolutely perfectly prepared. Service was great, they were very busy as it was Friday  night prime time. Highly recommend!

For my first meal on my trip. This meal was amazing. My group shared three entrees, desserts, and also had drinks. The entree flavors were each unique and packed with flavor. We also tried rabbit for the first time which was very cool. They have a great menu for adventurous eaters. The drinks were fabulous and the flavors were really robust, but they were a little too strong for lunch (unless you're into that). We left very happy

I was recommended this restaurant by a friend. The atmosphere is very warm and relaxed. A very clean, somewhat fancy place. Not many people were in due to the pandemic. Our waiter did not seem very enthusiastic to be working and didn't check on us much. Still a good waiter nonetheless. I ordered the shrimp étouffée which was absolutely delicious. The flavor was something that can't be replicated elsewhere. I seriously ate all of it in less than five minutes--I never finish meals at restaurants! The hostess was very sweet and I believe the owner came by once or twice to see how we were doing which made our experience enjoyable. I highly recommend Cochon! It's worth the higher prices. We will be returning when we're back in New Orleans!

Food was outstanding. 
Among those at our table we had the fried alligator, fried catfish, shrimp etouffee, and the rib eye.  The price point was a little higher than we expected but the food was delicious. Service was outstanding. They prefer reservations. We didn't have one but they were terrific to add us to the book since they had room.   Waitstaff was very friendly.

Right on the Warehouse District and a few blocks east of The National WWII Museum found and amazing place that sells the famous "Boudin".

When I was in town I had a list of all the authentic things New Orleans had to offer and I struggled a little finding a good place for this until I called and this place had it.

Really nice place, with great attitude to serve. They provide masks if you didn't bring one.

Waiting time was like 5 minutes on a Sunday afternoon.

About the boudin it's a sausage stuffed with pork, rice and cajun spices it is super tasty and we had as an appetizer.

The sandwiches were good and I was almost dragged to have a burger which is huge and juicy the Cuban sandwich has the first place on the menu it was a delicious taste in my mouth.

This place also is a butchery so you will find a nice selection of meats and sausages.

Give it a try!
Cochon is doing it right during these difficult times!! All regulations being followed. We relaxed and enjoyed delicious food, outstanding service and good times were had by all. Thank you Cochon!!!

We went to this restaurant due to our first choice being closed and it was a great atmosphere and the appetizers that we shared were amazing. We ordered the sliced pork and had to send it back because it was extremely salty. One of the other people at our table ordered the steak and she mentioned it was delicious.  Based on the main dish named after the restaurant and the overall experience I would have to say this restaurant is a three.

My work orders lunch daily from local restaurants and this has been one of the places from where they most frequently order. I have tried several different items, and they have all only been ok.  

I will try one more time though, because I am always in search of a good redfish meal. I think my issue is that when places try to be to "fancy", sometimes the attempt at fanciness becomes more important than the taste or mixture of flavors. But I do wonder if I would enjoy it more if I were born and raised here. Will update when I finally try the redfish.

Wow!! This place veas amazing their grilled oysters and fried alligator was so delicious. If your looking for a place to eat and your from out of town I definitely suggest this place. All the food was delicious.
This is a very lovely restaurant with some good creole and cajun or New Orleans cuisine.  The small plates are tasty and the ham and biscuits are good.

It pains my heart to write this review because the food is good. But the waitress Nicole G needs a class in hospitality. She is rude, unfriendly and unhappy.  The first time I visited New Orleans I came here for brunch with my husband. Nicole G was our waitress, she was nasty then but I gave her a pass because we all have our days. Besides the food was really good. Fast forward to this weekend we came back with friends and of course we couldn't wait to visit Cochon because their biscuits and catfish are amazing. We were greeted by a very friendly host who sat us at our table.  Then guess who we got as our waitress? You guessed it, grumpy Nicole G. Again, her tone was nasty and  she was very short and curt.  She didn't even tell us what the chef's special of the day was. When we asked questions she would answer as if she is in a hurry, even though we were the only ones in the restaurant. Because of Nicole G's behavior on both occasions. I will never patronize Cochon again. Good job at losing customers Nicole!

I was very happy that this space is still open right now. I had a hard time deciding on what to order so we just ordered multiple items and kind of made our own mini-buffet. We order the wood fired oysters, the crispy pork trotter, redfish, rabbit and dumplings, and a side of sautéed zucchini. You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. The staff was also super friendly. I most definitely will be going back soon.

Amazing restaurant! The food, atmosphere, and cleanliness were all perfect! 

They accommodated my complicated food allergies and I had the fried catfish which was delicious and the chef made me special sides for my allergies. My husband had the wood fire grilled oysters which he said were incredible. 

Our waitress was so helpful and lovely as well!

If you are not hungry, when you walk in and smell the aroma you will be!  We started with the crawfish pie...Authentic and delicious.. nicely proportioned! With a belly full I moved to the rabbit and dumplings!! AMAZINGLY prepared (Cheers to the kitchen)! Excellent staff and service!!

Woof. I'm a New Yorker who literally couldn't find a non-touristy restaurant until I visited Conchon. The Covid-19 atmosphere feels safe and the aroma is rustic and inviting. Staff all in masks and tables amply spaced. The maitre d was quick to seat me without a reservation which seems to be the preference of the restaurant. The food came out quickly. The fried catfish is everything you could want. The craft cocktails were skillfully made but not pretentious. I literally NEVER order desert but this place had me sold so I went for the Peach Galante. Also Fantastic. For y'all not use to oppressive sun in September...the AC in here was on point.

Wow. Amazing and unique food. The chocolate cake was so good I snuck a piece home to Florida and man did it taste amazing. We enjoyed 2 bowls of their gumbo to start, and holy flavor! Next we got their shishito peppers topped in cheese, very unique and tasty dish. I ordered the rabbit dumping which were all I have thought about since our visit. Amazing restaurant that should not be missed!

Very happy we stopped in.
Great oyster appetizers, alligator bites were well spiced with mint garnish, 
Pork chop was excellent - good wine great service :) 
Happy

I'm disappointed in myself for forgetting to write this place a review, I spent so much time on yelp absolutely trashing n GW Fins that i forgot to praise this place! Alright. Look, i was in NO for 5 days and I ate here twice it's so good. I'm a grump,  petty, pay way too much attention to detail kind of guy... I'm military, I'm big on the small things. So the first night i was in NO we arrived late and weren't sure about the covid culture of NO so we stayed in the hotel only to find out the hotel room service was closed due to covid. Instead we signed up for some weird website to order delivery from Cochon because quite frankly, Yelp. I ordered some starters, sides, but the reason I'm here writing is because of the Rabbit and dumplings. Holy f-(:&): @&&-:!!!!!! First of all they make this with magical bunnies that come from some fairytale land cause I've quite frankly never had a stew that made me stomp my foot and tingle with sensations of sheer pleasure before. I've traveled to 35 countries, I've eaten at some of the best restaurants in the world, Michelin stars and more, but this hands down is the best flavor I have ever had. It would be my last supper. It makes you feel warm and think about family and friends and a fire place and Christmas and being hugged by momma. It's gastronomic comfort. You forget your daily stresses for the 20mins or so (5min in my case) that you eat it. God dammit now I'm craving it. I'm done here. Not sure the name of the chef but Bra-Fn-vo!

Amazing food!

Cochon was right down the street from our hotel so we decided to give it a try. Casual atmosphere with tables spread apart. They also have an open kitchen. 

The waitress brought us fresh bread and butter similar to Hawaiian rolls. They were tasty. We decided to try a sampler of food. 

Fried Boudin - I liked these as their breading isn't too thick and it's a little like eating a Boudin in a meat ball. They pair it with banana peppers and some nice dijion mustard. 4/5

Chargrilled Oysters in garlic butter - really hankering for some oysters, so ordered these. They come in an interesting plate and you get 6 total. The first one I bit into was really sour (too much lemon), but the rest turned out delicious. The waitress also recommended to dip our bread in the sauce which was heavenly. 5/5

Fried catfish with sweet potatoes and cole slaw - we split this dish and it was perfect. The cat fish was so fresh and the breading was fried perfectly. The best part was the candied bacon tomato bbq sauce. So flavorful and way better than ketchup 5/5

With so many amazing dishes, we had to get dessert. We ordered the merengue chocolate moose pie. Thick crust with very light chocolate. A wonderful way to end the meal. 

Definetely want to come back and try more food on the menu. Service was great too (everyone is in masks).

I am still dreaming of every plate from this amazing restaurant. Jake was our server and although this restaurant has an upscale feel. The service was truly 5-star. Jake was kind, attentive and knowledgeable. We started with the crawfish pie which was hot, toasted to perfection, and the beef trotter which was crispy and decadent with a beautiful presentation over lime beans. Our main reason for stopping in didn't disappoint as the chicken and andouille gumbo warmed my soul with it's smoky flavor and tender meat. We finished with the rabbit and dumplings, monkfish and a side of mac and cheese that was all just as delicious as the first courses. Also the cocktails were mixed to perfection, my favorite being the cleverly named This was Bound to Happen. Thanks again Jake for your exceptional service! Definitely plan to recommend to anyone in the area!

Cochon was highly recommended to get a feel for the flavors of Louisiana, and definitely delivered! They definitely place a more modern twist on the typical fare, and it was all so delicious. We stopped by for lunch and decided to split a few small plates, which was perfect for a mini tasting menu. Fried alligator on its own is kind of blah, but theirs came with a garlicky sauce and a fresh mint/parsley salad that helped offset the richness.  The fried pig tails had a really good flavor and were my mom's favorite dish. The crawfish pie -OMG- so good. The filling was so flavorful, such huge chunks of crawfish, within a perfect flaky buttery crust. The Mac and cheese casserole was decadent and I loved the extra layer of crunchy baked cheese on top. Cochon was definitely a little pricey for lunch, but the service and quality of food was aces!

This place amazes me EVERY Time I visit!  I eat here EVERY TIME I'm in New Orleans and always get something different.  This time, I had the Pork Shoulder which was unbelievably delicious.  We also had an oyster appetizer (see pix) and numerous appetizers.
What a great dining experience...again!!
Sorry, forgot what everyone else got but I know that they were all happy!
I will definitely be back next time in the Big Easy!
A wonderful local staple. Every time I go I'm thrilled I did. There are so many options in New Orleans and this is reliably very delicious. The drinks are spectacular to boot!

Pros: The staff was kind and accommodating, even in a pandemic. It was our anniversary dinner and we were visiting New Orleans for a few days. Our waitress was very personable and quick with our drinks. Our plates were beautiful and appealing to the eye. 

Cons: our food was bland, and unseasoned. Neither of us ate lore than 2 bites and ended up stopping in the French Quarter getting a hot sausage po-boy instead. 

I wanted to like Cochin, but it was a major disappointment.

First time customers! Good service, casual atmosphere with great appetizers. The oysters were worth it! Unfortunately, I was so disappointed by the catfish. The breading had no flavor and the fish was bland. Even with such great apps, I'd be hesitant to come back for a second round.

Great combination of traditional, fusion, and downhome.

Very good service.

In the top ten, and is a place I would return to without hesitation.

Cochon was a delicious culinary pit stop on our tour of New Orleans, and we were glad we ended up coming by!

As far as atmosphere goes, I found this place slightly lacking, though they made up for it in delicious food. Picnic bench-style tables and chairs greet you to create a more upscale barbecue feel (they are actual tables and chairs, just made out of the same material and slat width as a picnic table would be). Service is friendly and prompt, and the kitchen is viewable from the dining room, which is always a really nice touch. This restaurant is on a street that looks really up-and-coming, and reminded me a lot of the trendier areas of our hometown, Denver.

We started with the pork belly, the wedge salad, and the fried alligator. All were absolutely phenomenal. Looking at the menu I don't see a wedge salad so I could be incorrect, but I think it was something to that effect (haha). Pork belly is my favorite, and it was delicious here. Alligator is weirdly good as well, and I was so happy this restaurant offered their version of it. As an entree we shared the large plate and macaroni and cheese casserole, and I've attached a photo. It was a LOT of food, and plenty for the three of us to share. 

Overall, we definitely loved the appetizers here, and I would have loved to have sampled some additional entrees versus ordering the large plate for our first time. I would recommend it as a sharable, though. We left talking about what a wonderful dinner we had, and if you're in the area I highly recommend making a reservation. Definitely get the pork belly and fried alligator!

Absolutely delicious unique cuisine.  The Rabbit & dumpling dish was outstanding, oysters, Mac n' cheese, craft cocktails ... All great!
A Lemon Drop Shot was my friend's 'Best Ever'!!

Overall good experience. The service and attitudes of the staff could not have been better. Our waiter knew the menu very well. I was impressed. The weakness for us was a seemingly  limited menu. Also I ordered the pork porterhouse and the sauce for my taste was bland. I wish it had elevated the flavor of the pork. 

I wish them well. They really care about their patrons' experience. Sadly I was somewhat disappointed by my meal.

Cochon was recommended to us as one of the best restaurants in New Orleans by our local friends and we had to check it out! So SO worth it! Very nice quiet place, unique menu, absolutely wonderful customer service and delicious food! I LOVE LOVE LOVE their bread haha, I ate two baskets lol. Mack and cheese was one if my favorites too!

This restaurant came with a ton of recommendations and the experience was great. The service was great with their attention to detail. The pork belly appetizer is a must! Also the fried boudin. We ordered the wood fired oysters that had a great sauce to it with a nice spice. The Cochon which in my opinion was a bit salty but I put the brisket juice on it. The brisket was tender and delicious. Probably the best brisket I ever had. I didn't try the horseradish salad but it was the one was left the most. The Mac and Cheese was pretty good. For our desserts we tried their brown butter pound cake and their cookies and cream mousse both were good but unnecessary. Overall the meal was a good experience.

Cochon Butcher was recommended to us by friends and several articles that we read, and we are so glad we tried it while in town! Juan, our server, was fantastic and took great care of us. The cocktails were high quality. The food was diverse, tasty, and surprising! There are lots of restaurants that are good that I'll never go back to, but this restaurant we will visit everytime we are in town. Ask for Juan as your server and try things out of your comfort zone!

Larry Dembrun 
What a magical meal and night!

Thanks everyone

This restaurant served up fast and delicious down home southern food.

The rabbit and dumplings was amazing. I highly recommend it.

They also have an awesome kids catfish dinner.

OMG Yum. Just as good as I remember. 

The food here is top notch. While there were some hiccups with service, they were quickly forgiven once food was on the table. 

The chargrilled oysters with chili butter are a must. 

Gumbo here is definitely legit. The portion is generous enough to be a meal if you just want something small. BUT it's honestly very hard to not leave this place completely stuffed.  You have to order almost everything!!!

My favorites: oysters, gumbo, fried boudin balls, And of course the Louisiana cochon.  

This is some of the best food in all of NOLA.

Took my parents out for Dinner about a month ago. Drinks were wonderful. Oysters and Boudin Balls were excellent. The Jalapeno cheese thing was to die for. The pork dishes could've been better. Overall a great place with lovely atmosphere!

Although we absolutely loved Cochon Butcher, Cochon wasn't an equivalent experience. The service was slow; the food felt very mysterious and left lackluster flavors; and the dining chairs just weren't that comfortable. The decor was pleasant to see (ie, the artwork and overall aesthetic), and the environment is clean and welcoming. However, if you have $50 to spend, go crazy at the Butcher Shop! Lol.
This spot is amazing. 10/10 would recommend. Alan the server was incredible. All of his recommendations were great. The food was incredible.

Visiting on a business trip and followed the reviews, so glad we did. The gator bites and boudin were delicious small plates. We then went with the salad and crawfish pie to wrap up our meal. Sat outside, next time I would like to experience the atmosphere inside.

The food was phenomenal. The oysters melted in my mouth and the sauce was incredible. The complimentary rolls come warm and were so good that I finished my friend's. I highly recommend the alligator bites and the shrimp remoulade was just as good. Will definitely come back!

What do you do when your furry friend has a meltdown in the hotel when you are in New Orleans? You hope you are at Cochon.  The manager was super accommodating when we had to regroup with our doggo.  David brought out water for everyone (props for the pup bowl) to start and was super chill through our meal.  Highly recommend the Brown Sugar Pound Cake for dessert.
Server was attentive and knowledgeable, and the food was exceptional. Have wanted to try Cochon for some time and it didn't disappoint. Shrimp remoulade and pork chop were delicious!

Friends recommended this place so we gave it a try. I ordered the cabbage salad and the gumbo. Both order added up to $20. The cabbage salad was not tasty at all and was tough to chew. The gumbo was mediocre. 

Hubby ordered the red wine braised short ribs and the price wasn't cheap. It was again mediocre and the amount was very small.

We also ordered the catfish stew. It wasn't that good either because of the overall texture and taste.

Don't recommend this place. 

Hostess was rude but our waitress was excellent. She made our night a positive experience.

I'm visiting from out of town and i'm all about the pig.  Naturally I had to try Cochon.  I had reservations for 12:30 but finished my morning plans an hour earlier than predicted.  Even though I arrived at 11:30 I was seated with no hassle.  I was disappointed that there was no pork belly on the menu, but I got over it.  I considered the wood fired oysters, but after hearing them described I passed.  they sound great, but I confess I don't do spicy and was afraid they'd be too much for me.  

Instead I got the cucumber salad.  It was delicious, but dang--it comes with a bit of chili or chili oil.  Again, it was very tasty but too much for me.  To be clear the issue wasn't the salad, but my wimpy palate.  Even so, I ate more than half before I gave up, panting and weepy.  

The cochon of the day was a smoked pork chop.  I really wanted to order a side to go with it, but after hearing how big the pork chop was, I doubted I'd have room for anything else.  I was right.  That was a big ol' chop.  It was bone in, served with the jus and  some greens.  

It was cooked perfectly.  Smoky, tender, moist, with just the right amount of fat.  I don't know how often the cochon of the day changes, or what the different selections are, but I'm sad that my stay here isn't long enough for me to find out.  

My server made sure that my glass was never empty.  He answered all my questions, even the ones I asked more than once, with confidence and friendliness.  Too often servers seem to resent diners, but this guy seemed to genuinely be glad to be there and to take care of his customers.  I wish I knew his name so that I could  properly give him the credit he's due.

There's no doubt this is a good place to eat. Obviously a lot of flavor in each bite. And I saw this on "somebody feed Phil" on Netflix and was STOKED to eat here. Maybe I hyped it up too much. But I was disappointed with portions, and my wife wasn't ecstatic about her food. She wouldn't tell me cause I was so excited to eat here but I could see it. And if we aren't leaving smiling about it then it ain't 5 stars. But I'd def recommend it. And awesome people providing service.
Amazing food and service. The oysters were to die for. Drinks were amazing too and the server was super attentive and knowledgeable.
Had a really great dinner. Very original menu. The red fish I had might have been the best I ever had. The gumbo was solid! The service was top notch.

Delicious. Had a little bit of everything, and it was all amazing, as was the service. COVID protocols were in place and it was very comfortable. Highly recommend. Daughter's favorite dish was red fish. Son's was alligator. Husband's was mac and cheese. Mine was daily cochon special. So good.

Awful service, and the food was just... I do not understand how you can deep fry 6oz of Amberjack and charge $42... everything was overpriced. The drinks were also trash. The worst part was the wait staff- inclusive to everyone who passed out table- never gave eye contact when we clearly wanted something. We'd say "excuse me" as they passed, and they just kept passing. I will say, the only reason for one star was the Mac and cheese. $300 later though... don't come here if you're a tourist. Absolutely overpriced for the same food you'd get at the local diner that's housed out of a double-wide in a busted ass parking lot.

Cool vibe and the waitstaff was very nice and friendly. We made reservations and were seated immediately even a few minutes earlier than our reservation. We stated with drinks and our waiter brought us bread. I got the lions mane and it was amazing. My husband got the Paloma and said it was very good. We started off with the fire wood chili oysters. Oh my. We could have just ordered these and been happy. They were perfectly cooked. Then for dinner I got the redfish and my husband got the fried oyster BLT. The redfish was good but needed a bit more flavor in my opinion. My husband said his sandwich was unlike anything he has ever had before. "A wonderful Cajun twist on an American classic" were his exact words. We also got the Mac n cheese casserole - YUM! We then ended our meal with the brown sugar pound cake. It was fantastic.
Cochon is so delicious. Go with a group, order a lot, and share. Cause trust me, you're going to want a bite of everything!

Absolutely love Cochon and have been coming here for years! I have rarely had anything that wasn't amazing, and just love how their menu continues to offer new dishes, but also continues to offer the favorites. The ambiance is warm and refined yet comfortable which matches their food.. think quality, yet simple ingredients, just cooked and seasoned to perfection! I don't usually eat bread at restaurants but seem to always ask for more here.. it's warm, soft and buttery with a crunchy top which melts in your mouth, so do yourself a favor and eat it as soon as they put it down! Service is also wonderful, personable and friendly without much "fluff".. Cochon will always be my favorite and I hope it'll be yours too!

The food was okay, I got the boudin balls and they smelled and tasted pretty weird. Or waiter seemed semi out of it or just tired. Which is understandable, but I wouldn't recommend the food for the price. 

The bread was good though. But that was about it. The menu also had very limited options. Like a printer paper size worth of options. And on just one size. 

I had to pair the bread with the boudin balls to make it edible. It tasted like potted meat was mixed in there.

New Year's Day 2021 dinner. We ended up at Cochon completely by chance because the place that we had intended to go for dinner was closed (why why why does Turkey and the Wolf do such a shitty job of posting/updating their hours?). We managed to snag the last available table, which happily for us was outside.

One of us got the black pearl drink, and while it was tasty, she did not appreciate seeing the word "plantation" used as an adjective to describe the pineapple rum. It's officially 2021 and your restaurant is in New Orleans: have some goddam respect and get rid of that stupid and offensive word. The cherry gose was good. For apps, we started with the fried alligator (because NOLA YOLO!) and the gumbo. The gator was way too chewy and "exotic" for one of us but the other one happily ate it. The gumbo was perfection: salty, smoky, rich, spicy. We couldn't get enough of it and it was probably our favorite dish of the night. For dinner we split the rabbit and dumplings, and we have to say that it was kind of lame. The rabbit got lost in the rich roux and the whole thing just ended up tasting like your average chicken-and dumplings dish--not bad, per se, but we expected better. Kiddo was happy with her side of mac-n-cheese. The strawberry mousse pie was also unimpressive since the crust was way too thick and hard towards the back and thereby impossible to eat, and the mousse was too airy so the whole thing didn't really work well as a unit.

Service was to the point but not particularly warm. We're glad that we tried this place since it's on the NOLA bucket list, but we have no desire to be back again. We would be willing to try their butcher spinoff, though, another time. 3.5 stars, rounding up.

Friendly service and well designed interior. Outdoor seating is available. Nice and large beer selection, as the most important, the food was amazing. I tasted 3 of 6 items from entrees of fish, pork chop and rabbit and appetizer plate. They were all delicious with quality
Head highly recommended and was not disappointed.  There wasn't anything on the menu that wasn't delicious.  The smoked pork dish was outstanding.   Banana ice cream dessert was superb.

Cochon is a restaurant that serves a traditional cajun southern fare and aims to locally source their produce, poultry, and seafood. Our server Charles informed us all their fried items were fried in peanut oil. That means no cracklins for me.

For drinks, I'd recommend the Red Ryder and Rum the Mules. The Red Ryder was a rye based cocktail with cranberry ginger shrub, pecan, and chichory while Rum the Mules was a rum based cocktail with lemon verbena, mint, and ginger beer. While we waited for our appetizers, Charles brought us a basket of parker house rolls with butter.

For appetizers, I'd recommend their cajun-style beef, wheatberry, and tomato soup (if they have it), Shrimp Cocktail (served with spicy cocktail sauce), Shaved Hearts of Palm with Lemon Vinaigrette, Cucumbers and Herbs in Vinegar, Blue Crab Salad (tossed in meyer lemon and tarragon mayonnaise), Wood-Fired Oysters with Chili Garlic Butter, 
Grilled Short Rib - parsley, pickled mustard seeds, shallots, and crushed herbs.

For dinner, we shared an order of Louisiana Cochon with Cabbage, Cracklins and Pickled Turnips and a side order of Smothered Greens (basically peppery collard greens) and Brussels Sprout Casserole. 

In my opinion, the desserts was the best course of the night. I'd recommend the Baba Au Rhum, Pineapple Upside Down Cake, and Chocolate Chip Cookie Doberge.  The Baba Au Rhum consisted of a rum cake soaked in rum sauce, served with banana pudding and whipped cream. The Pineapple Upside Down Cake was served with coconut lime sherbet and dulce de leche. The Chocolate Chip Cookie Doberge consisted of a cake slice with layers of vanilla buttercream and chocolate chip cookies crumbs.

I saw the reviews and I knew we gotta try it. We were looking for a modern, not too crowded, CLEAN, and spaced-out restaurant that serves the local New Orleans fare and this is a good place for it!

We came in on a Wednesday for a late lunch and the indoor dining was pretty empty. Reservations were not required at the time but they do collect your contact information for contact tracing. We sat outside and our server immediately assisted us. Customer service was phenomenal! Looking at the menus here, I'm assuming their menus rotate on a regular basis. Their main entrees took a little while so be prepared if you're tight on time. 

Alligator bites - perfectly breaded and fried bites, tossed in their amazing chili aioli, thinly-sliced onions and fresh parsley. My husband and I shared one order and it was so good we could've easily finished an order for each of us. 

Pork and Black-eyed Pea Gumbo - a smaller portion than I have anticipated but I ordered a side of white rice and that quickly satisfied my hunger. Also, not sure if it was because we were sitting outside but it was a little on the cold side. 

My son ordered Mac and cheese but I did not get to try it. 

Due to covid, this was our only New Orleans culinary stop and I am so glad we ended up here.
Visited Couchon for the first time and it was delicious!! Will definitely be back to try more of their menu items.

Cochon is hands down the best spot to indulge in yummy food! Not only is the food fresh, well prepared, and out of this world, the customer service is exceptional! This was such a delightful experience, I wish there was one back home. I wish there were more restaurants that were as intentional, and well executed as Conchon!

Cochon is located in the warehouse district and offers a very good lunch.  I ordered the oyster sandwich with bacon and lemon tatar sauce.  White any sandwich with bacon is likely to be tasty, the combination made for a very good sandwich.  The server staff were friendly and attentive.  Cochon has limited outside seating but the inside has good distance between tables.  I would recommend a visit to this area and this restaurant in particular.

Quite possibly one of the best meals I have ever eaten in New Orleans and I've tried many!  Cochon is simply on a different level.  Located on Tchoupitoulas Street in the Central Business District, the restaurant is relaxed and inviting and the food is absolutely delicious.  Our waitress was warm and friendly and the restaurant is lively and warm.  

We started with an order of the wood fired oysters.  They are topped with chili garlic butter and are perfect with warm bread.

Next we ordered the rabbit and dumplings and the flat iron steak with cheddar grits and oyster mushrooms.  The steak is flavorful and tender and perfectly paired with the grits.  The rabbit and dumplings are true comfort food and simply delicious on a cool winter evening.  Our son had the mac and cheese and said it was the best he has ever had.   

The standout though was the banoffee pie.  I didn't think I had room for dessert but after one taste, I made room!  It's a gorgeous banana pie served on a shortbread crust with a layer of dulce de leche and light and fluffy banana cream.  It tasted similar to an ice cream pie with layers of textures and loads of flavor.  A true indulgence that I will dream about!

Put this restaurant on your New Orleans list.  You will not be disappointed.

We parked on the side street of this restaurant and omg. As soon as you get off your car the smell of wood fire cooking hits. So the dining experience basically starts outside lol. We went around lunchtime so it was pretty empty. Place was very clean. From the tables you can see the kitchen which always a nice treat. Even though it smells like bacon cooking we did not leave smelling like food which I loved. I had the apple, onion, walnut salad. It was fresh and crispy; the perfect lunch salad. The wood fired oyster plate was fireee. They were a little spicy and one of the most delicious sauces I've ever had. If I'm ever in the city again I'd definitely come back for dinner.

Matt , the manager, was an incredible delight. He made sure we had an amazing experience, terry our server, helped recommend entrees and made sure everything came out fast and to our liking. 
GREAT experience. Thank you both!

Cochon does not disappoint. Have an idea of what you would like, then expect unexpected fresh & local ingredients to inspire chef creations. Pork, & more pork inspire many of the dishes. But for the non-pork lovers, try the baked mac's cheese, crawfish pie and one of the many creative salads... we had the braised cabbage wedge. Both the braised pork sholder & the crawfish pie were good.
Also, I recommend a terrific finish with the pineapple upside down cake with buttermilk chantilly. The staff is very polite, and the restaurant is beautiful, warm, and nice. It is a nice date restaurant. The music is there, not to loud and just nice.

This is my second time at Cochon and I think I love it more than the first time. We were seated promptly. They require masks and they're following the social distance standards. They've expanded since I was last here, which was about 3 years ago. 

Jake was our server and he was excellent. Very attentive without being too overbearing. We ordered the charbroiled oysters, which were delicious. That chili garlic butter they're in is to die for. Ask for more bread.  The hubs ordered the pork and black-eyed pea gumbo, and in his words, "that sh*t was good". ‍ I ordered the braised beef cheek, which came with sweet potato balls, and lightly dressed greens. Excellent! I never tasted a beef so tender. For dessert we shared the banoffee pie. Oh my, that thang was good! 

If you've never been to Cochon, do yourself a favor and go. You will not be disappointed. I promise you.

UNCLEAN/NOT SOCIALLY DISTANCED! Food was good, but the cleanliness was subpar. My husband and I asked to be socially distanced (they tried seating us in between two large parties), and the hostess was visibly upset at our request although the dining room was near-empty. Also, who seemed to be the manager dug his fingers in his ears and touched a diner's plate without cleaning his hands. Don't go here!

This my 2nd go to spot in NOLA. Everything about this place is superub from the service, to the atmosphere/vibes, to the drinks and food. On to the food: 

1) Fried Gator: Omg, the fried gator here is amazing. With most places, the gator tends to taste like chicken but here you can definitely tell its gator. It's a little more on the gamey side. They dress it with this citrus sauce and stir fried onion. So good. 

2) Wood Fire Oysters: I order oysters any chance that I get; whether it's raw or char-grilled. Let me tell you, these oysters were so good. They were very plump and that red sauce is to die for. There's for sure garlic, butter, and lemon. All that good stuff. 

3) Rabbit Dumplings: Also very good. Just the perfect amount of sauce and they were cooked perfectly.

4) Beef Cheek: So flavorful and tender. Everything you really need with any protein. 

I'll always come back to Cochon when I visit.

My favorite from the menu has to be the wood fired oysters with chili garlic butter with the BBBREAD! Omg the sauce!!!! The sauce is BOSSSSSSSS and dipped with bread (oh goodness, *chef's kiss*) !!!! And the dessert was incredible! I forgot the name of the dessert but it was like a banana cream pie + banana fosters hybrid. Elevated, decadent and delicious (and not overly sweet). My entre was the redfish and collard, both executed nicely but the standouts of my meal were the oysters and dessert!

I recently moved near Cochon and decided to give it a try for lunch today. Having never been to New Orleans, I really wanted to try some of the local food and got a great taste here. We were served by Mary, who was a great waitress that went above and beyond. We ordered the fried alligator, oyster and bacon sandwich, Mac and cheese casserole, and last but definitely not least we had the Louisiana Cochon. The Cochon had to be the highlight of the meal and they really earned their name. The meat came right off the bone and was so delicious. I personally also really liked the alligator as I had never had it before. It had this really tangy sauce that paired nicely with the mint. I would definitely come here again
My waiter was phenomenal, something very rare to get good customer service in New Orleans.

The wood fired oysters were my favorite! We also got the redfish entree along with the rabbit & dumplings. I give Cochon a ton of credit for thinking outside the box with their menu. I think the slaw that came with the redfish was a bit sour for my taste and the rabbit&dumplings were okay but had competing textures I couldn't quite put my finger on. But I did like the flavor and cozy feeling - it was like a chicken pot pie but with rabbit and biscuits. Service was just alright, especially for the price point I just couldn't justify giving it a full 5/5. Glad to see that they are taking masking and social distancing seriously! I do recommend trying the oysters.
Fantastic atmosphere, outstanding service combined with an inventive and beautifully executed menu! Shout out to Houston's Chris Shepherd for the recommendation!
Great spot, comfort high end food. Steak was flavorful and delicious. Sweet potatoes were on point.

We had the terrine, the kohlrabi and mizuna salad, the King Mackerel, the daily cochon pork special of Kassler Style pork chop, and the bacon braised field peas.  Everything was amazing and we had to go talk to the kitchen afterwards because we were so happy.  20 years in the Chicago hospitality scene didn't prepare me for this kind of execution, just fantastic.  I am sad because I don't live here.

Great atmosphere and very creative menu that foodies will love!  It would be 5 stars no question without the terrible service I received.  My server was in the weeds all night.  He had a huge table and clearly had no time for me.  I spent a lot of $ and would have appreciated service that matched the price I paid. I specifically called the restaurant to ask if it was an ok place for solo diners and they assured me it would be.  I was prejudged before I even arrived basically considered a table that doesn't matter because there was no $ in it for the server.  I would have ordered more and spent even more if I wasn't such an afterthought.
The wedge salad was excellent and so flavorful. The service here was extremely fast and attentive. This place is definitely worth the hype.

We stopped in for dinner after receiving a recommendation from a chef friend of mine. It did not disappoint. The wood fired oysters were served in a lovely buttery hot sauce. Wonderful. We split the redfish, Mac n cheese, beef cheek, grilled cabbage and collard greens among three of us. It was all great. Fish was fresh and seasoned wonderfully. The pickled carrots that accompanied the fish were  a zesty and well paired side. The greens were delicious and kind of a surprise hit. The beef cheek was fall apart tender and the onion jam paired well with the richness of the beef. The cabbage was a bit under grilled - but the dressing and cured pork was wonderful. Our waiter was great - attentive, quick, and non intrusive.
Enjoyed our small plates- especially the boudin and alligator. It was a great stop before our scheduled time at the WWII museum.

Great little spot for a quick bite and drink. Food was excellent, very fresh and the chef obviously has a high attention to detail using fresh ingredients. Walked down from the WWII museum and was well worth the walk. The service was the only disappointing part of the visit, not attentive or friendly.

We are so happy we were able to try out Cochon for dinner.  The food was excellent and memorable.  Unfortunately the service was rather slow and unattentive.  But the food!  My husband started with the Country Terrine, and I had the Crawfish Pie.  The terrine was delicious, but the Crawfish Pie was amazing.  It was stuffed with crawfish and other yummy ingredients in a beautiful crust.  My husband's entree was the daily selection, which turned out to be a braised pork shoulder.  It was very good, but it paled in comparison to the Rabbit and Dumplings.  The rabbit and vegetables were cooked perfectly and tender, and the sauce was amazing.  It had a touch of sherry and was velvety and oh so delicious.  Dessert was Strawberry Shortcake.  It was good, but it could have used more strawberries.  Overall it was an exceptional meal in a nice, casual setting.

My second time visiting on two different trips and I would come back time and time again. Their food is exquisite. We ate everything up so I only snagged this one picture. Definitely recommend the rabbit and dumplings. It's not something I would normally eat, but it was so tender and soul warming.

This was a hard rating to give. I'm not desperate to go back, which is difficult because I heard such amazing things.

Pros: 
-whoever made my drink WOW I have finally found a cocktail that I like. I had three of them and it was strong with good flavors. I think it was a lavender spritz but I don't see it in the menu anymore. Either way I would go back just for drinks
-dessert was so delectable, the chocolate and peanut butter mousse balanced perfectly and the nuts added that extra layer 

Cons:
-I was there for two hours, even though I ordered within five minutes of sitting down. I went by myself and usually plan for maybe an hour or hour 15 due to restaurants during covid wanting to turnover tables. The reason I had so many drinks is because I was waiting for food 
-was not impressed with the oysters. $17 and most of mine were shriveled abs looked like they just threw them on the plate. Just added chili flakes to butter and called it flavor. Not really worth the money
-the rabbit and dumplings were also just eh. I heard reviews that it was really good but nothing "wow"d me and the biscuits were kind of dry
-I will admit that I'm not a huge fan of spicy food or heat on food just for pain. That being said, I felt like everything I asked the waitress about an app or even a salad, it all "had a kick to it" which made it really hard to decide what to get because I was looking for a well rounded meal. Looking at the menu, nothing really jumped out at me as a must have abs when I looked around, I didn't see anything that gave me plate envy

This place was delicious! 

We started with the oysters and alligator. Both were phenomenal. I also ordered gumbo but never got it. I didn't say anything because our main course came out shortly after so I didn't need it but I did want to try it (heard great things). We also got their rolls which were delicious! 

Boyfriend got the redfish and I got the pork roast. Both were very good. Redfish was a little plain and we weren't familiar with what "fisherman's style" was (we should have asked) and the scales were a little off putting. My pork was delicious but salty, but I still enjoyed it. 

I got the strawberry shortcake for dessert.
Honestly, this wasn't my favorite. Biscuit was kind of hard and dry and the whole dessert wasn't very flavorful. I liked that it wasn't overly sweet, I just think it needed more strawberry sauce or something to give a little more flavor. More sauce would have absorbed more in the biscuit too. 

Overall, we would come back, especially for those oysters!
Found Cochon from Yelp and very pleased. The cocktails were amazing and the food delicious!!

Zero! You had more than half of an empty restaurant including outside seating and wouldn't bother to allow us to sit for an appetizer at 4:30 pm bc you 'had so reservations coming later'. Seriously? 4:30 you were filling up. Interesting bc not one person stepped foot while I sat outside with my family and ate across the street at Rye and Pie. Keep your shitty food. The pizza place across the street was amazing.

Had plenty of recommendations from others to give Cochon a try and left very satisfied. The Mac and cheese was spot on. I had the pork chop was the daily Cochon and served over green lima beans with crispy collard greens on top, I thought it was very tasty. The beef short ribs were also very tender and very good, served over lentils. They provided rolls and butter as an appetizer, fresh and soft. Great craft drinks as well. Overall a great experience.

You have to go for their Chili garlic wood fire grilled oysters . Etouffe was good as well - I have had better and alligator bites was ok although their  sauce was fantastic.I will certainly go back just to have the oysters once more. Portion of the Etoufee could have been better .

What a way to start New Orleans and its food. great experience! Went in for appetizers and came out wanting to return for a full meal. The oysters with chili sauce are fantastic and go well paired with any whiskey. Make sure to dip the bread into the sauce! Besides oyster the Alligator nuggets were delicious

Beautiful surrounding and wonderful service.  The food was superb. Our table enjoyed the alligator appetizer as well as the rabbit stew. So delicious and worthy of the drive from out of the French Quarters!

I was underwhelmed with this place. It looks beautiful on the inside and was looking forward to a good meal. However I was fairly disappointed. The beet salad was good but the entrees were not anything special. I ordered the shrimp etouffee and it looked like enough to feed a small child. It was also very bland. My wife ordered a tuna dish and it was also nothing special. The best part of our meal was our kids grilled cheese sandwich. That was actually very good. With tip, my order came to 100 dollars and we drank water. I had high hopes for this place but I wish we had gone somewhere else. As a side note, the server was pleasant and truly accommodating.

Recommended for foodies who love charcuterie. I really enjoyed everything we had and I can see why this spot is so popular. The étouffée was a special and it was my favorite thing the night we ordered! I feel like this is a great spot for upscale Louisiana cuisine. I also really enjoyed the cocktails I ordered. If upscale is not your thing, there are definitely so many other options.

I was so looking forward to going here, but I must say it was a disappointment. First of all, our server really didn't want to be there (can't understand why that would be the case when he had a full restaurant in Covid times) and didn't know the menu and and did make you feel welcome. Not very "New Orleans" to me. 

The food was good, but not "wow" good, just "good". I was sad as everybody I talked to said you have to go. 

There is much better (service for sure) in NOLA. I'd give this one a pass.

Stopped in for dinner while visiting for work! Sat at the bar like usual and ordered a glass of Cab. To start off I had the Boudin balls which are absolutely a Bust of flavor in your mouth and definitely something unique to New Orleans! For the main course I had the Rabbit and Dumplings this came out extremely hot which is a plus. Think of chicken and dumplings swapped with Rabbit ( but rabbit tastes like chicken ) it was definitely good but I wouldn't get it again too much of the same flavor throughput the dish. All in all great experience and will be back !
We've been here a few times, always impressed. The one recommendation that I have is: Always try the special meal as it's always been great.
The chips and drinks drinks paired well with the oysters. The oysters seemed a little small but had good flavor. The crafty drinks we're rally good.

We called for a reservation with short notice and they were very accommodating and got us in. We were seated promptly and Terry was our waiter. Terry was great without being overbearing. My husband had the pork chop and said it was the best one he has ever had. My husband also ordered a side of creamy grits which were perfect. I had the beef short rib.I did not need the steak knife that they provided for it was so tender and delicious. It came served over grits. I forgot to mention the bread service was small homemade dinner rolls served warm.Very delicious. For dessert we had the strawberry shortcake and the pineapple upside down cake and they were both very very good. I also ordered a coffee with cream and it was perfectly brewed. They sanitize their tables between customers very thoroughly and the bathrooms were very well maintained.They are doing a great job here and we would definitely go back.
Wildly underwhelming. Do yourselves a favor and save yourself $80 a head and go elsewhere. Servers inattentive, food was a massive letdown.
The food was ok, not great, very small portions,  and not worth the high price tag. However, it's located in the heart of the French quarter.

Really enjoyed Cochon. The atmosphere, service and food were all top notch. The waiter also overheard us talking about Conchon Butcher which sounds even better after he filled us in. Didn't make it to the butcher but we will next time we're in town!
This place just seems to get better and better. Consistently good food, service, and a cool modern atmosphere that is a welcome change from other fine restaurants in town.

We only had one day in New Orleans and we found this place that has really good rating and is Southern food (Cajun) so we decided to stop by. 
The service was great, our server took the time to explain what's popular on the menu and told us to take our time to decide. However I feel that the food is overhyped.
We got the alligator bites, wood grill oyster, and the louisiana cochon. The alligator bites was very peppery and the meat itself was chewy (does not fit my palette). The oysters was not as fresh as it could be, there was a tiny slight aftertaste but the garlic butter sauce made up for it (our server suggested to dip the buns onto the sauce and it was pretty good, I appreciated that). The cochon was drier than I had expected, the meat was on the rougher side. 

Service 10/10 Food 6/10 Ambiance 7/10

I guess an off night but it seems to be a comedy of errors.

Order drinks. Took a few.  Brought out wrong drinks.  Not a big deal.  Went and got our drinks.  This took a few minutes. As they were bring our drinks they brought our apps.  Would have liked a minute but with the situation fine.  Before we half way done with apps. Our entrees show up.  The person who brought us our food just kind of looked at us like we were taking to long waiting for us to make room on the table.  

Food was fine just a weird experience.

Perfect first dining experience in New Orleans! 

Within 1.5hrs of landing we were seated outside of Cochon sipping a refreshing cocktail. We also ordered the oysters, alligator and the Mac and cheese for lunch. Everything we ate was great, but the star was the oysters. They were excellent! Probably the best I've ever had with a chili garlic sauce and set off with a squeeze of lemon. Our server, Alan, suggested dredging the bread in the sauce and he was spot-on. 
The alligator was also good, but my companion wasn't as much a fan of the Mayo-based sauce it was dressed with. The Mac and cheese was creamy and had a great crust on top. 

Alan was very attentive and pushed our dining experience higher. Will likely be back here again before we leave town, everything was great!

This traditional New Orleans is charming with good  food. 

I had the crawfish pie appetizer which was the best part of the dinner. I liked so much, I took one to go.  The first one they brought to the table was not hot inside. They gladly  took it back and gave us a fresh one right off the frying pan. It was amazing.

I have the catfish stew on a bed of collard greens, bacon and potatoes. The fish was a tad bland, bit the broth was delicious. Everything was fresh. 

My husband had the short ribs with grits. Not enough grits on the plate, but delicious.

We shared an upside down pineapple cake for desert. That was mediocre. 

Overall we will Go back. The service was great (Dez was our waiter).
The restaurant was loud and the service lousy.  The only reason to go is the food is quite good...but not enough to overcome serious deficiencies.

Cochon is always on my itinerary when I make it down to New Orleans. Ever since I tried their wood fired oysters a few yrs back, I've been hooked. 

Everything tasted great - lamb croquettes, and the pork shank were highlights for sure. Actually got my girl to try the alligator and she loved it - one of the better renditions I've had also. 

Service was great - our waitress was a blast - very informative and helpful with my gf's allergy. Even had a rec for a bar to head to after. 

Til next time. Salud.
Horribly salty food. Disappointed. Gumbo salty, cochon salty, sandwich salty. Sorry... but true. People were nice though

One of the best restaurants we tried when visiting NOLA. 
My favorite was the wood fire oysters, they were amazing and perfectly spiced. Everything else was absolutely delicious.
It has a casual upscale atmosphere which is perfect while touring the garden district.
The service is on point.
Highly recommend this restaurant!

Walked in with a reservation and got seated right away. However, it took 10-15 mins for anyone to even come by our table or offer us any water. Then we both got crawfish étouffées and the shrimp in chili butter to share. The shrimp was really delicious but the crawfish étouffées were not very flavorful. Once the stewardess got our orders, she pretty much rushed us through our meal. While we were eating our entrees, she came by and asked us about dessert. And just as soon as we were done eating she brought us our check. The experience wasn't very pleasant.

Can't really say anything other than that the food, drinks, and service was great. We ordered the Cochon, Mac and cheese, and rabbit and dumplings. All of them were good, but the rabbit was clearly the best.

WOW ! Best restaurant I've ever been in the US ! We loved the alligator bites with the spicy aioli, the wood fired oysters were DELICIOUS, the sauce was SO SO good, the bread (brioche like) too was amazing (I'm French and I'm rarely impressed by bread at the restaurant in the US). We got smoked pork, amazing and the dessert was very good too. Everything was perfect, our waiter was very kind! 
The only advice I would have is that if you really want to eat here, you have to book, they were fully booked the two nights we were in NOLA and we've been very lucky to find a spot for lunch ! 
Thanks to the team for this amazing culinary experience (from  and )

This place is overrated in my opinion, for starters service was very slow and server was quite forgetful. As for the food Alligator ok, the Brussel sprouts were barely cooked, Redfish is literally a glorified overpriced Tilapia that had no flavor even though the picture shows it looking very seasoned, unfortunately it was bland. macaroni and cheese was fresh & tasty, did not try short rib But the best of all we ordered was the wood fired oysters. Sauce was AMAZING! ... overall I was not dissatisfied with the food, I would just not return ... for the price of the food you could definitely do way better in flavor in New Orleans without paying such a big penny !!

I had one of the best meals I've ever had at Cochon. I didn't even know that fried crawfish pie was a thing but I'm glad I ordered it because it was perfect! Filled with super creamy crawfish and veggies with a crispy outside. I had some of my boyfriend's rabbit & dumplings and THAT dish deserves an award, we were both literally talking about it for the rest of the night! It had a gravy in it that took us to another world haha!

We sat on the patio out front and got to see the city in action while we enjoyed our meal; our waiter and the hostess were awesome and the experience overall was definitely a 10/10. We've already been telling our loved ones about this place.
An Uptown staple, quick, friendly service. The staff were all so cordial and nice. Perfect New Orleans Diner.

Delicious food and great service from our waiter Juan L. I ordered the Rabbit and Dumplings and could have eaten another serving. I had the chocolate pudding for dessert as well the Ramblin Rose and This Was Bound to Happen Cocktail, both were good but I preferred the Rose. Highly recommend a visit here and get a reservation!

Highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a place with menu that is a bit more more unique and formal and dining environment that is casual but not like too casual, crowded and noisy. 

Our server was super friendly and patient and took good care of us. The fried boudin is super crispy and flavorful and tastes great with the sauce and pickle on the side. Our wood fried whole pompano is perfectly seasoned, slightly crispy on the outside and very juicy and tender on the inside. The cherry tomatoes on side is so refreshing and add to the flavors to the entire dish. 

The Cochon, however, is a bit disappointing as the meat is a bit dry and under seasoned. I think that's  because the cut of meat is very lean. 

Overall, a great place for sitting down and enjoying good food.
Last week I went to the Big Easy and found the top 3 restaurant in New Orleans. Go and prove me wrong!
Eff Arby's arbitrary "meats"- this place has all of the meat in any way you can imagine. I haven't eaten pork in over a year and I think about this place once a week. Go here. Go often.

It was disappointing. I expected more from a restaurant that had decent reviews. 

First off, we were seated on the street about 6 inches from the curb. When we requested a table inside (there were clearly at least 3 tables empty) we were told that we could not switch tables. Those tables inside remained empty for the next hour while we got to 'enjoy' the sounds, honks, and exhaust from passing cars during our anniversary dinner. Disappointing. 

I ordered the porchetta and while it looked great and was tasty, it had an overwhelming amount of fat. To top it off, one half of it was just cold. The other half was warm. The only explanation I could think of was that it sat at the counter (despite us being told that it would take the longest to cook - didn't think it would also be the longest to sit/wait) in the freezing cold inside (something I did not discover until I stopped in the use the restroom). Again, disappointing. 

The only possibly redeeming moment was when someone roaming the streets began to harass us about sharing some food with them. Our waiter was gracious enough to move them along without causing a scene. That man should get a raise (seriously) since it did not seem like it would have been the first time he's had to deal with something like this.

My advice: (1) insist on a table inside, (2) bring a jacket, (3) do the calculus so that your dishes all come out at the same time and none of them are cold /sarcasm (seriously, you'd think that a restaurant like this would be able to time their dishes right so that they wouldn't have to sit for extended periods of time; if it didn't sit for long, then perhaps it was the arctic chill that cooled it down so quickly; regardless, keep that in mind).

Very few things to chose from the menu. Our chicken and sausage gumbo is nothing special and very salty. My son was still hungry after we ate.  $8 for a side maco cheese is a little bit pricy. We also ordered rabbit and dumpling and it tasted like normal chicken pie. Nothing special. The whole experience is we can cook the same food at home. Would not eat here again.

First, it's freezing in there! I was uncomfortably cold the whole time. As for the food, The recipes are still good but the execution isn't on point anymore. My rabbit and dumplings tasted good, but the rabbit was tough and the veggies in the stew were undercooked, almost raw. Our waiter wasn't great, left all our dishes on the table vs removing as things were finished. Didn't bring our bread until the end of the meal, and while the bread was tasty, it was over baked and hard on top. It almost seemed like frozen rolls. I think they're too touristy now and it seems like a chain restaurant instead of the quaint, local establishment it used to be.
I've been here a few times and they have a good ambience and an interesting menu that rotates every once in a while. The oysters are a must and super delicious!

Happened upon this place while looking for somewhere to eat near the WW2 museum and this place was great! They fit us in because a party never showed up for their reservation, which I appreciated them trying to work us in. Server was very friendly and made good recommendations. Oyster BLT was large and delicious on the toasted bread, although there was a slaw also on the side that I was confused about? Partner had the gumbo which was typical NOLA gumbo. Pretzel rolls were on point. I loved the ambience of the restaurant with the clean wooden tables/chairs/decoration, and seeing a fully stocked bar along with the kitchen from your table is a treat. Server also said that they change their menu regularly so would love to come back later to try more!

The food was really good, just not much bang for your buck. I got the seared tuna which was delicious, but could have been served on top of a salad or something. The rabbit and dumplings was delicious, but needed more duck.

We had a lovely time dining at Cochon. Unfortunately, it didn't start lovely. We arrived right at 7:15, our reservation time, and had to wait until 7:30 to be seated. According to the rude podium princess, they had to seat all the 7:00 reservation first. Since we were the only ones waiting, we didn't understand. We were finally seated at a table that sat empty the whole time we waited. I'm not sure I have ever been told this before, especially when the table is empty. We ordered the fried alligator, a dozen wood fired oysters for appetizers, and they didn't disappoint. Make sure to use the yummy bread in the chili garlic butter included with the oysters! Delicious! Next, we ordered the gumbo and the beet salad. Both were amazing and the golden beets were amazing. For our main course, we ordered the rabbit & dumplings, grilled tuna and the braised beef short rib. We loved all our entree's. Finished the meal sharing the pineapple upside down cake! Just like my grandmother made. Our server was fantastic, had a sense of humor and was very attentive. We couldn't have asked for a better meal.
Fantastic NOLA experience. Great curation of unique foods that are quintessentially southern, creole, and Cajun. Would recommend to any discerning foodies.

Great and friendly staff, overall the food was good, but missed somewhat. The special we had, the Cochon, we felt was just lacking something. The fried oyster BLT was good as was the smoked fish dip and Mac and cheese casserole. Was a good time for lunch. If you go, get a reservation.
